Name: College Avalon - Quebec City
Overview: Recognized by the Ministry of Education and Higher Education, College Avalon is a Quebec-based educational institute incorporated in 1995. Quebec City boasts of an outstanding educational system, and every year 50000 students opt to study in this city. Besides the Quebec City campus location, this institute also has a campus in Montreal. College Avalon offers a student-focused supportive environment along with flexible schedules. It also financially assists the residents of Quebec. The curriculum of College Avalon has undergone an expansion. It now covers an array of business programs. The various courses that students can opt for at College Avalon are divided into two categories – Ministerial Courses and Language Courses. Under the Languages Courses, this college offers two programs. The English as a Second Language (ESL) and French as a Second Language (FSL) courses at this institute take place at College Avalon Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The fees for the Ministerial Courses range from $11500 to $17000 for domestic candidates based on the programs. For international students, the fee amount lies in the range of $17000 to $24000. Additionally, this institute also extends a $1000 scholarship to all international candidates. The program fees of the ESL and FSL course for the Beginners, Elementary, Pre-intermediate is around $5300. For the Intermediate, High Intermediate, and Advanced levels, the fees for these programs is approximately $3400. College Avalon offers three programs under the Ministerial Courses. The 15 months Executive Assistant (AEC-LCE.00) program takes place at Quebec City and Montreal campuses. The 24 month International Business Management (AEC-LCA.FM) and Computerized Accounting & Financial Management (AEC-LCA.FN) programs take place at College Avalon Montreal. The upcoming intakes for all these programs will happen in January, May and September. The international students of College Avalon are eligible for PSWP opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: REQUIREMENT FOR ENGLISH:IELTS: 6.0 overall, with one 5.5 band acceptedPTE: 54 in total, with no module receiving less than 50 points.Accepted in Duolingo: 110***All qualifying applicants will get an offer letter within two business days.***After completing their studies, students are eligible for Post Graduate Work Permits.

Name: Fanshawe College - London
Overview: Fanshawe College of Applied Arts and Technology is named one of the best universities in Ontario. The college is Canada's largest university, with the London, Ontario campus often called "A city within a city." The college's mission is to educate and equip students with relevant information in today's world. The college provides courses in applied arts, business, health care, human services, hospitality, and technology, among other fields. There are over 200 degrees, diplomas, apprenticeships, and certification programs. The college is committed to providing a practical education tailored to the corporate world's needs. Many hospitality students, for example, have admitted that there is no better college for hospitality than Fanshawe because the institution has its restaurant where students can put their learning into action. The goal of such a comprehensive learning structure is to reach out to at least 43,000 students each year which the college does almost effortlessly. Among the 43,000 students, at least 7,700 are international students from different countries like China, India, Korea, Vietnam, Africa, Turkey, Russia, and Ukraine.Various employers trust Fanshawe's credibility to produce some of the best employees. The faculty teach from their many years of practical expertise. It also provides over 650 scholarships and bursaries to its students.
Eligibility Overview: The minimum prerequisites for Fanshawe College admission vary based on the course being pursued. For post-secondary programs, a high school diploma and some subject-level percentages are required. A college diploma, university degree, or equivalent, as well as two years of applied work experience for some courses, are required for post-graduate programs. International applicants for bachelor's degree programs must have a final grade point average of 65% based on their top six Grade 12 courses. ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY TESTS In addition to program-specific criteria, all international applicants (from non-English speaking countries) must demonstrate English competence by taking at least one English proficiency exam. Among them are the IELTS Academic exam, TOEFL, Pearson Test of English (Academic), and Duolingo English Test (DET.) This is mandatory as all the courses are taught in English. Below are the requirements for English language proficiency tests.  For post-secondary diploma, advanced diploma, or certificate programs:  For Graduate certificate and degree programs:

Placement: Fanshawe, like all Canadian institutions, does not offer direct placements. However, it does an excellent job of preparing you for the job hunt. The courses are well-thought-out and tailored to correspond to today's real-world scenarios. It also provides a large number of Co-op courses, which allow students to work while studying. This experience will be extremely valuable to your CV. Gaining relevant experience even before you have graduated makes you truly confident in the corporate world.  Fanshawe has excellent placement records, with 90.3% of its graduates finding work within 6 months of graduation. The graduate report for the year 2018-2019 states that Fanshawe’s KPI Graduate Employment rate is 85.8%, which is once again above the provincial average of 85.5%. This success is partially owed to the career services department in place that provides help to those looking for opportunities. Everything from resume to cover letters, preparing for interviews to upskilling is covered in these services. Workshops on job seeking, resume writing, and demo interviews, among other topics, are also held regularly. Fanshawe arranges job fairs where you can meet great businesses. Employers can also use the college portal for advertising job vacancies. If you are a hard-working student, lecturers will cover for you by giving a good recommendation or even a referral if the situation presents itself.  The average salary of a Fanshawe graduate ranges between $35,000-$45,000. According to the 2018- 2019 Graduate report by the institution, the Average salary for Advanced Communication for Professionals was $35,806. Applied Mechanical Design Graduates received $37,073 on average and Applied technology graduates received an average salary of $43,032.
Accommodation: The campus, as Fanshawe puts it, is your home away from home. Fanshawe is derived from fane and shaw, which mean "temple in the woods." The London campus certainly lives up to its name. The university has devised these accommodation choices after carefully considering students' comfort and safety. Students can choose from the following alternatives in general:  On-campus accommodation Off-campus accommodation  Fanshawe has two types of buildings under its on-campus facilities. The first is an apartment-style building with suites designed to accommodate 4 people in general. The three buildings, namely, Falcon, Peregrine, and Merlin house offer 415 apartment-style buildings, easily accommodate 1220 students. The building is monitored 24/7 and resident advisors are on each floor, so the safety of the students is indeed covered. The rooms are fully furnished and equipped with air conditioning and heating devices. Along with high-speed internet access, you also get free laundry services. You don’t have to worry about paying water and electricity bills either. If you are a resident of traditional apartment-style buildings, you must opt for a meal plan. The meal plan comes at the cost of $1,200 per term. There is also a townhouse-style residence. Kestrel Court is a 66-unit townhouse community that can accommodate 396 people. Each unit accommodates up to six students. All units are fully furnished and are located directly across from the college entrance. There is a residence office unit that is accessible 24/7. Parking is available but comes at an additional cost. High-speed internet in all the rooms, and you also get laundry services in apartment-style rooms. There are no bills to pay here as well, so don't worry. Below is the comparison between the two types of residence.   Though the university does not directly provide off-campus housing, it assists you with information to find one. You can go through the institution's online inventory of all the available rentals. The college also has a partnership with the Canada Homestay network, meaning you can be reassured that the college will help you find a homestay and adjust to it.

University Ranking: Fanshawe College is an institution of higher learning located in London, Ontario, Canada. It is one of the largest colleges in the province and offers a variety of degree, diploma, and certificate programs. The college has been consistently ranked among the best colleges in Canada. Its reputation for providing high-quality education and student experience has earned it a spot among the top 10 colleges in Ontario.  Fanshawe College has a long history of academic excellence and a commitment to providing students with various learning opportunities. The college offers different degree and diploma programs, including business, health sciences, engineering, media, and technology.  Regarding rankings, Fanshawe College consistently ranks among the top colleges in Canada. According to Maclean's Magazine's 2021 rankings, Fanshawe College was ranked fourth in the nation and first in Ontario. The college was also ranked first in student satisfaction, scoring 91.6%. Additionally, the college was ranked first in student services, scoring 89.3%. In addition to its impressive academic standing, Fanshawe College offers students various extracurricular activities and services.  Overall, Fanshawe College is a highly respected institution of higher learning that offers students a range of degree, diploma, and certificate programs. The college also provides various student services, such as career and job placement, academic advising, and health and wellness services. The college has a long history of academic excellence and a commitment to providing students with various learning opportunities. Its impressive rankings, vital student services, and vibrant student life make it one of the top colleges in Canada.

Name: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada - West Hastings
Overview: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada is a Vancouver, British Columbia-based public university that is renowned for offering diploma and certificate Co-op programmes in Web & Mobile App Development, Network & System Solutions Specialist, Digital Marketing Specialist, Hospitality Management, and English Language Training. The college has two campuses located close to each other, West Hastings and Cornerstone Tech. All the diploma programmes that the college offers, come with a co-operative work experience to make the students work-ready. Along with that, the specialized programmes are fabricated with the approval of professionals from various industries. The college provides flexibility in starting dates of the courses which opens up the scope for in-state as well as international students. Cornerstone International Community College of Canada allows international students from over 72 countries to get paid work experience during their academic term. The college attracts students with the opportunity of gaining practical work experience in a Canadian workplace and training them in relevant educational backgrounds. This helps build a multicultural environment at the campus. To support the student population, the college provides both on and off-campus residential accommodation. At Cornerstone International Community College of Canada, students can opt for online or in-class learning and specialize in areas with hands-on experience. It is ensured that 96% of the students will get a job in the first month of their Co-op. The financial needs of international students are also considered while devising scholarship opportunities that cover the tuition and accommodation costs. The college endeavors to provide high-quality studies and practical work. This ensures the students turn into a skilled and experienced individual to meet the requirements of today’s standards of a demanding industry.

To begin diploma programmes, students must meet all of the prerequisites.High school diploma or equivalent; or 18 years old.One of the following is required as a minimum level of English language proficiency:English 12 – a minimum final grade of "C" is required.English Literature 12 – a minimum grade of "C" is required.Communication 12 – a minimum final grade of "B" is required.English 12 First Peoples - a "C" is required as a minimum final grade.12 – minimum in technical and professional communicationsGrade "C" or Advanced Placement (AP) Minimum grade 3 in English Language or LiteratureMinimum grade 3 in IB English Language A (SL).TOEFL PBT – 513; CBT – 183; iBT – 65; TOEFL iBT – 65; TOEFL iBT – 65; TOEFL iBT – 65; TOACADEMIC IELTS 5.5 or the Cornerstone Placement Test - High Intermediate*

Name: Trinity Western University
Overview: Trinity Western University is a private Christian university for liberal arts located in British Columbia, Canada. Founded in 1962, the university has become one of Canada's most prominent liberal arts universities while becoming the country's largest privately-funded Christian university. The university has eight faculties offering 48 graduate degrees and 19 graduate degrees in various fields. The best programs at Trinity Western University include Master of Business Administration (MBA), Master of Science in Nursing (MSN), and Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA). The main campus of the university is located in Langley, British Columbia. Covering an area of 157 acres, it offers state-of-the-art facilities to help further the academic requirements of students. The main educational buildings on campus include the Norma Marion Alloway Library, Stanley Nelson Student Centre, and Learning Commons. The university also has satellite campuses in Bellingham, Richmond, and Ottawa, offering select programs in these locations.The student life on campus is vibrant, with over 100 student organizations and clubs giving them an outlet outside their academics. Notable alumni from Trinity Western University include Member of Parliament Mark Strahl, Olympian and volleyball player Chaim Schalk, and ice hockey player Ryan Walter.The average annual costs of studying at the university can range between CAD 22,000 and CAD 25,000, depending on the program chosen. The university focuses on helping students develop into leaders based on Christian morals as a Christian institution.

Name: Sheridan College
Overview: Sheridan College, founded in 1967, is a local college with 400 students. It has grown to become one of Ontario's leading postsecondary institutions, annually educating approximately 22,500 full-time and 18,500 continuing and part-time students on three campuses in three Ontario cities: Oakville, Brampton, and Mississauga.Sheridan College, an award-winning institution, draws students from around Canada and the world. In the arts, business, community service, health, technology, and skilled professions, Sheridan's 200,000+ graduates play a crucial role in molding the future of our society.Sheridan College offers world-class programs, and outstanding professors have propelled the college to the forefront of research in fields ranging from creative studies to digital innovation. Sheridan has 1908 students and approximately 150 academics and staff engaging in current research. There are 234 current research projects at the college that have been tracked. Sheridan offers five unique research centers dedicated to music theatre, elder research, advanced manufacturing and design technologies, mobile innovation, and screen industries research, as well as an entrepreneurship hub that promotes extraordinary research activities with over 400 business partners.Sheridan's apartments offer furnished units with shared kitchen and laundry facilities, modern, spotless facilities, and a secure, smoke-free environment. Sheridan has three relationships with Places4Students, Canada Homestay Network, and Canada Homeshare to offer students safe and inexpensive off-campus living choices. For overseas students, Sheridan University's tuition costs range from C$1,038 to C$3,800.

Name: BLI Canada - Montreal
Overview: Located in the centre of Old Montreal, BLI is primarily an international language school in Canada. This language school has maintained its reputation for four decades and consistently provides top-notch English and French programs for local and international students. This school exclusively offers personalised teaching programs for both international and local students. This international language school comprises two campuses- Montreal and Quebec City. Moreover, BLI has other sub-divisions that offer quality translations and corporate language training. This corporate language training programme is also conducted in Montreal and Quebec City. This language school specialises in International language programs and exam preparation training. It also organises regular summer and winter camps for students and provides accommodation services. The school helps perfect language in specific areas for both beginners and advanced students. The small batch sizes of the classes help build a relationship with fellow students and allow them to continuously practice and improve their language skills. The professional language experts use a dynamic, communicative and student-centric approach, further assisting them in becoming fluent and skilled in a particular language. Students can explore a wide range of language programs and choose one that suits their requirements. With various options and schedules, professionals can also take classes ranging from basic to advanced academic knowledge through dynamic and engaging lessons.Besides, this college also prepares students for the IELTS exam, where students need to be particularly skilled in English. This language college also conducts placement tests in both languages. Students can opt for this test and connect with any of the advisors to achieve their learning goals.

Name: DeGroote School of Business
Overview: DeGroote School of Business is one of the six faculties at McMaster University present in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada (between Toronto and Niagara Falls), with excellent academics and research facilities. It has various faculties like Marketing, Human Resource Management, Strategic Management, Accounting and Financial Management Services, Finance, and Business Economics. The school provides athletic facilities, including nine gyms, an Olympic-size pool, Ronald Joyce Stadium, Ivor Wynne Stadium, squash courts, dedicated libraries, computer labs, and study areas. Students meeting the minimum eligibility criteria in IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (86), and PTE (60) need to submit the yearly tuition charges of 28,600 CAD and 4,700 CAD for undergraduate and postgraduate courses, respectively, along with an admission fee of 100 CAD. It provides financial support like loans, scholarships, and bursaries to international students under programs like the DeGroote School of Business Scholarship (1,000 CAD each), DeGroote School of Management Information System Scholarship (1,900 CAD each), David Feather Family MBA Scholarship (5,000 CAD each), etc.  The career and Professional Development Team at DeGroote School of Business organizes workshops, networking events, industry training, and coaching sessions that help 97% of graduates get employment opportunities with an average package of 47,000 CAD.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsA competitive GPA in your undergraduate degree's final two yearsA competitive GMAT or GRE scoreTwo citations (including one from a current or former supervisor)Professional Resumé and/or CV
Placement: Join the oldest and largest co-op programme in Canada!Students who want to further their careers and build their resumes can enroll in this full-time programme. By combining formal education with up to 12 months of paid work experience (three work terms), you can explore career alternatives and expand your professional network while gaining useful experience.With the guidance of this programme, you will be able to graduate with the abilities, information, and experience needed to succeed in the workplace.
Accommodation: The main campus is spread across 300 acres with attractions such as UNESCO World Biosphere Reserve, Bruce trail, Cootes Paradise, Niagara Escarpment, and Royal Botanical Gardens. With 12 residence halls at McMaster University for 3,200 students, DeGroote School of Business provides both on-campus and off-campus (free shuttle service included) residential options with facilities like a kitchen, living area, free Wi-Fi, study space, game room, and laundry.On-CampusStudents who require accommodations for forthcoming tests and are registered with the Student Accessibility Services Office must fill out the special accommodations form and email it to askmba@mcmaster.ca at least 10 days before their exam.Please be aware that only students registered with Student Accessibility Services on the main campus will have their special requests fulfilled. Once the form is received, and the accommodations are planned, the university will contact you via your McMaster email address.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Port aux Basques
Overview: College of the North Atlantic is a public college for primary, secondary, and postsecondary education operating for the last 55 years. It has 17 campuses; out of that, College of the North Atlantic - Port aux Basques is one of the leading campuses. The environment, amenities, and other facilities of this location are praiseworthy. It is a sports center with all necessary setup and equipment under one roof, which has multicultural and multi-dimensional surroundings. Grand Bay West Beach adds to the exuberance of this place. College of the North Atlantic - Port aux Basques tuition fees per year is $8,507.00 CAD, and the cost of living is $12,960.00 CAD. The various streams of College of the North Atlantic - Port aux Basques courses are science, arts, business, technical training, etc. The duration of courses is different starting from 6 months to 2 years. It offers customized one-to-one training to students. Faculties are extremely student-friendly and are experts in making the students meet market demands. Recruiters prefer to select the College of the North Atlantic - Port aux Basques because of their training, skills, and knowledge.

Name: Atlantic Canada Language Academy
Overview: Atlantic Canada Language Academy is located in Lunenburg, Canada. The institution has several courses designed to focus on the English language. The academy offers several Academy courses through English language programs designed to develop and advance language proficiency. The institution also offers online courses to make distance learning possible for students worldwide. The programs enhance students' academic skills and prepare them for English proficiency tests. The courses also help achieve the level required by colleges and universities. Students can avail of the courses at quite a low cost, making the academy renowned for affordable language courses. The average tuition fee at this academy ranges from $9,000 to $10,000 annually. Also, the approximate cost of living per year is around $12,500 to $13,500. The institute also offers commendable Pathway Programs for eligible students. Some of the post-secondary partners of this institute include Acadia University, DaVinci College, St. Francis Xavier University, Mount Saint Vincent University, Canadian Business College, Success College and Maritime Business College. Atlantic Canada Language Academy diversifies the learning process for online courses by providing live experience through cooking classes, social activities, self-learning, group work, and private tutorials. The academy provides accommodation within its campus by providing upscale housing facilities and services.

Name: Algonquin College - Ottawa
Overview: Established in 1967, Algonquin College was formed as a part of the Ontario college system, and now it is a public-funded college situated in Ottawa. It is one of Canada's most popular and sought-after colleges for its higher education and advanced research activities. Algonquin College comprises three campuses, and the main campus in Ontario is featured with digital classrooms, libraries, an auditorium, etc. This institution is one of the first colleges to achieve approval from Co-operative Education and Work-Integrated Learning. Primarily, the educational programmes offered by this university earn accreditation from the Association of Community College Trustees. Among Algonquin College courses, some popular ones include nursing, design, tourism management, IT, etc. This institution offers 357 college programs on different campuses, including 19 apprenticeship programs and nearly 27 full-time online programs. Further, it offers 11 bachelor's degrees and has university partnerships to conduct different programmes in association with Carleton University and the University of Ottawa. This institution has a strong connection with employers and holds an excellent reputation for its placement purposes. Algonquin College's employment rate is 97%, and some of the top Canadian organisations employ students. The campus facilitates students with on-campus housing for approximately 1050 students. Upon completing each academic year, this college extends six international student scholarships and one leadership award to international students. These scholarships are entirely based on merits that showcase academic excellence and achievement.

Name: Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology
Overview: The Manitoba Institute of Trade and Technology (MITT) in Winnipeg, Manitoba, offers certificate, post-graduate, and diploma-level technical training for career-oriented post-secondary and secondary students in four specialization clusters: business and information technology, health care, human services, and skilled trades.The name of this institute was changed from Winnipeg Technical College to Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology on June 12, 2014. Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology is famous for its cutting-edge campuses and excellent educational programs in business and leadership. Hi-tech laboratories, computer labs, libraries, conference rooms, studios, and WiFi connectivity result in advanced learning systems on college campuses.Tuition and fees at this institute are calculated for each student on a program basis, not per course.Data Integrity and HSC are two famous recruiters that employ Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology graduates.

Placement: MITT has an exceptional placement record, with an average employment rate of 88 per cent among its graduates. MITT graduates are working in a variety of fields around the world, as well as contributing to Winnipeg's industry and economic growth.
Accommodation: Although MITT does not provide an on-campus student accommodation facility, there are numerous affordable individual and family accommodation alternatives within walking or busing distance of the campuses.
University Ranking: The Manitoba Institute of Trades and Technology (MITT) is a public post-secondary institution that provides education and training for various trades and technologies. Located in Winnipeg, it is the largest and oldest post-secondary institute of its kind in the province. With over 5,000 full-time students, it is also one of the fastest-growing institutes in the country. Established in 1959, the institute has achieved a remarkable ranking among the best post-secondary institutions in Canada. In 2016, it was ranked among the country's top ten Institutes of Technology. The institute has also been included in the top ten lists of post-secondary institutions in the Province of Manitoba. MITT offers a range of educational and training programs in the fields of business, engineering, and health care. The institute boasts a highly respected faculty and staff dedicated to providing an exceptional educational experience. With a strong focus on apprenticeship programs and trades, MITT enables students to gain valuable hands-on experience and a wide range of skills essential for workplace success. MITT also offers a variety of apprenticeship and certificate programs that can help students gain the necessary credentials to land a great job. The institute is dedicated to helping its students find the right career path and has been ranked among the top ten post-secondary institutions in the province for job placement rates. MITT is also known for its commitment to research and innovation. The institute is home to several research centres and is known for its innovative approach to teaching and learning. The institute has also been recognized for its commitment to sustainability, with a strong focus on renewable energy and green technology. With its unparalleled reputation for excellence, MITT is one of the province's most highly regarded post-secondary institutions. With its commitment to providing a quality education and training experience, MITT is the perfect choice for enhancing career prospects.

Name: Trebas Institute - Montreal
Overview: Trebas Institute is one of the reputed training centers in Canada for students who want to build careers in the entertainment industry. The institute was established in 1979 by David P. Leonard. Trebas Institute is affiliated with the National Association of Career Colleges (NACC), the Ontario Ministry of Training Colleges and Universities (MTCU), and the Quebec Ministry of Education (MES), among others. Trebas Institute is spread across two campuses—Montreal and Toronto. Trebas maintains a small class size (25:1 for theory and 12:1 for practical sessions) to facilitate better learning and rich interaction between students and teachers. The institution assists you in landing great internships to advance your practical education, one example being the well-known Cannes Film Festival student internship. You can interact with business leaders through these internships and gain first-hand knowledge.Many of the institute's alums have won notable awards, including Grammys. They have worked for some of the biggest names in music, including Virgin EMI Canada and Universal Music Group. At Trebas, students can pursue the best professional studies in the streams of music, film, business and technology, and management. Courses at Trebas are taught by instructors who are experts in their respective fields and are up-to-date with the latest industry trends. Apart from quality education, the institute offers numerous support services to its students, helping them thrive in their new environment. You can access their modern facilities, like audio labs and filmmaking equipment, to practically engage in your education.

Placement: Trebas Institute has a dedicated Career Services Department that offers students career counselling and other services. The institute has partnerships with various organisations and enterprises, offering internship opportunities to provide real-life industry exposure. These partnerships also give the institute insight into the ever-changing industry standards and can train their students better. The institute also keeps track of students seeking placement opportunities and helps them build professional networking with potential employers. 75.6% of Trebas graduates get jobs within six months of completing the course.
Accommodation: Trabas Institute does not offer on-campus accommodation. However, students can opt for comfortable and affordable off-campus accommodation. Dorm-style housing to single and shared room options are available for students in both cities. Average off-campus accommodation (in both cities) ranges from CAD 1,265/month for shared rooms, CAD 1,350–1,777/month for private rooms, and CAD 3,010/month for apartments

Name: SELC Career College Vancouver
Overview: SELC was established in 1985 in Sydney, Australia, solely offering vocational career and language training all over Vancouver. Later in 2012, SELC extended by opening a campus for SELC Vancouver, Canada, with its primary focus on providing education that will assist the aspirant towards a meaningful career.SELC Career College Vancouver is situated in Water Street, Vancouver, BC, Canada, and offers a career college program, ESL program, and BCIT Pathway. BCIT Pathway is designed for students who want to pursue their career in business, take up the role of an entrepreneur or be a manager in their respective career choice. SELC College and British Columbia Institute of Technology (BCIT), in partnership with each other, formed the SELC College-BCIT Pathway. It is a cross-institutional agreement facilitating SELC college graduates to move to BCIT's School of Business, helping them scale new heights in life. The college offers an FDU pathway along with giving ESL program facilities, a 4-week program, offering electives and workshops to students from various parts of the world to fine-tune their language level. SELC Career College Vancouver also hosts a Hospitality Management Diploma Program and certificate program in the Business Foundation, allowing the student to develop insight on service and operational issues, understand the hospitality industry's competitive edge, and cultivate business management skills.General English courses are also provided to students with a rudimentary grasp of the language, helping them use English frequently to communicate well in real-life situations. SELC Career College Vancouver Courses include Digital Marketing, Postgraduate Nursing, and many more. Apart from offering unique vocational training and academic support, SELC Career College Vancouver provides up-to-date classroom and co-op placement opportunities are preparing the students job-ready in this competitive era and a suitable environment for the overall development of the aspirants. Standard academic counseling sessions along with copious accommodation options are also available.

Name: University of Fredericton
Overview: Established in 2005, the University of Fredericton is a public institute spread across 142 acres in Fredericton, New Brunswick, Canada. The two primary campuses in Saint John and Fredecion and two satellite campuses in Bathurst and Moncton are fully equipped with hi-tech labs, libraries, art studios, computer centres, etc. The significant faculties of the university include the Faculty of Arts, Science, Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Kinesiology, Law, Nursing & Health Sciences, Leadership Studies, and Forestry & Environmental Management. Students can participate in 120 clubs and societies, including international competitions, exhibitions, debates, and workshops. The University of Fredericton offers 75 undergraduate and 28 graduate courses in Anthropology, Arts, Mathematics, Business administration, etc., to more than 7,300 students. With an acceptance rate of 75%, students can apply in Summer, Winter, and Fall intakes by meeting the eligibility criteria in IELTS (6.5 and above), and TOEFL (85 and above). The yearly tuition charges for undergraduate and postgraduate courses are averaged at 16,900 CAD respectively, along with an admission fee of 55 CAD. It also offers financial support of 500 CAD to 52,000 CAD to international students under merit-based programs like Entrance Scholarships, Schulich Leaders Scholarship, Beaverbrook Scholars Award, and many more. The on-campus residence halls like Aitken House, Bridges House, Joy Kidd House, Magee House, Lady Dunn Hall, Harrison House, and Tibbite Hall have single, double, suite, and shared room accommodation options at expenditure costs between 4,500 CAD to 5,400 CAD. The residence fee includes heating, high-speed internet, and dining facilities. With a 78% graduation rate, students from the University of Fredericton can easily acquire placements and internships due to various fairs and seminars held on the campus.

Name: Dalhousie University
Overview: Dalhousie University is a public research university in the Canadian province of Nova Scotia. Founded in 1818, it currently has campuses in three other cities. Dalhousie University has over 4,000 courses and approximately 180-degree programs in about 12 undergraduate, graduate, and professional degrees. Students can choose from the top majors like Biology and Biochemistry, Engineering, Business and Management, Computer Sciences, Material Sciences, Psychology/ Psychiatry, and Public, Environmental, and Occupational Health. Dalhousie's main campus is Studley Campus, located in Halifax, Nova Scotia. Carleton Campus, which is adjacent to Robie Street, and Sexton Campus, located in downtown Halifax, are the other two campuses of the university. The Agriculture Campus is located in Bible Hill, Truro, and the medical teaching facilities are in Saint John, New Brunswick. Dalhousie University's ideal student-faculty ratio is 20:1. Dalhousie University provides on-campus housing for students at its Halifax and Truro campuses, with eight resident halls and apartments housing 2,600 students. Students can choose between part-time on-campus employment, summer employment, co-operative education, pay-based internships, and placements after graduation. The Bissett Student Success Centre offers a variety of career and placement opportunities to students to provide practical learning and a sense of independence.The cost of attendance at DU for an international student pursuing undergraduate studies is 22671 CAD, and for graduates is 38366 CAD, excluding all other expenses. Scholarships are available to international and local students, ranging from 460 to 36808 CAD. Other financial aid options, such as bursaries, loans, and credit lines, are also available.
Eligibility Overview: Admission to Dalhousie University courses is strictly based on merit. Aspiring candidates should keep in mind that they must meet the university's admission requirements and the programme requirements.International students must have a minimum overall average of 70% or a GPA of 3.0 to be admitted to Dalhousie University. However, in the most recent academic year, first-year students' minimum average entering grade was 87.6%. English Proficiency Test Requirements: Students must demonstrate their English proficiency to gain admission to the university. If English is your first language, test scores to determine your English proficiency are not required.If English is not your first language, you must submit the results of any of the recognized tests listed below.

Off-campus students can also purchase meal plans. According to Times Higher Education, the University is between 401 and 500 for pursuing PG in Engineering and Technology.The university has been ranked between 301 and 400 by Times Higher Education for three years, 2019–2021, when pursuing PG Computers.

For five years in a row, from 2017 to 2021, Times Higher Education has placed the university in the range of 251 and 300. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%), followed by the Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. Check out Dalhousie University Admissions 2021.According to the US News & World Report's ranking system, which includes other factors such as the number of publications cited and global, regional, and local research reputations (12.5% each), the university is ranked 325 for 2021.

Name: Tamwood
Overview: Tamwood or Tamwood International College, founded in 1992, is a private career college and language school headquartered in British Columbia, Canada. Over 3,000 students enroll at Tamwood every year, and the college has had 72,354 graduates to date. It offers 43 programs across four areas (Business, Digital Skills, Hospitality & Tourism etc.) that deal with industry-relevant and professional skills. There are three Tamwood campuses, two in British Columbia and one in Ontario; Vancouver campus, Whistler campus and Toronto campus. The college also has several camps located across North America like Vancouver, Los Angeles, Boston and Montreal. Tamwood Work and Study programs allow students to develop industry-related skills by working and studying simultaneously; they will pursue industry designed programs taught by professionals. Programs offered are Digital Marketing, UX Design Professional, Web Development Professional etc. Tamwood offers International Camps for 7-17-year-olds that help them develop language, communication, leadership and creative thinking skills. Global Learner, Outdoor Leadership, Robotics and English+ Activity are some such camps. Tamwood Language Centers provide various English language programs to develop language competence for academic and professional purposes. Some of these include ESL Pathway, General English, International Business English and IELTS. The Tamwood Pathway Program comprising certificate/diploma courses and the ESL Pathway, is an excellent way to improve academic and English skills or prepare for post-secondary education. The average tuition fee for a Work + Study program begins at CAD 6,595. Tamwood provides homestay student housing with single/shared rooms and shared bathroom facilities. Students can also opt for hostels like Alpine Lodge, Whistler Lodge Hostel and Hostelling International Whistler, or stay with a host family. There are several recreational activities and tours to participate in and the Tamwood Ranger Program or Ambassador Program to join.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions Criteria Age: 18 Years (International Business & Management); Minimum 19 Years (Hospitality, Service, & Tourism) Minimum 18 Years (International Business & Management); Minimum 19 Years (Hospitality, Service, & Tourism) You have completed: The final year of general/secondary education. English Level: Intermediate to advanced skill level. Tamwood Pathway Program completion of EAP 192 for Business and EAP 193 for Hospitality, or a level comparable to IELTS 5.0 for Business and IELTS 5.5 for Hospitality, or a level equivalent to IELTS 5.0 for Business and IELTS 5.5 for Hospitality. You should be willing to learn in an intercultural setting and eager to communicate in English with your teachers and classmates. The only medium of teaching will be English, Staff personnel, on the other hand, are fluent in the majority of prevalent language. Documents: To visit or study in Canada, you must have a valid passport and be eligible to do so. We strongly advise you to apply for a study permit. Tamwood will send you a Letter of Acceptance (LOA) to provide with your visa application.
Placement: Working Part-Time To help with living expenses, earn money while enrolled in a career training programme. Regardless of the career training programme you are enrolled in, During the academic semester, your Canadian study visa allows you to work part-time (20 hours per week) and full-time (40 hours per week) during the term breaks. Tamwood Careers offers training, hiring fairs, and tools to help you find a job quickly, such as a Hot Jobs List. Most students find entry-level work in hospitality, retail, or tourism, earning between $12.45 and CAD 14.60 per hour (the minimum wage in Ontario is $12.45 and $14.60 in British Columbia).
Accommodation: It's as though you're staying in a home away from home! Enjoy a multicultural Canadian experience by staying with homestay families from all walks of life. Most students select this choice because it is more convenient, cost-effective, and safe, particularly those travelling to a foreign country unfamiliar with the locals.Friendly hosts who provide a secure and caring atmosphere are carefully screened and selected by our professional Accommodation Manager. Staying with a host will allow you to engage in international conversations while learning about Canadian traditions and culture. Two of the most critical considerations are cleanliness and safety. All of our homestays are located in secure areas. We want families who can provide at least a private furnished room with:There is a windowA bed with fresh linens, pillows, a pillowcase, a dresser, a desk, a chair, a lamp, and a closetHaving access to a bathroom and its amenitiesLaundry facilities, procedures, and soap are all available.Meals requested by the meal plan (entire board or half board)A key to the residence and instructions on using a security system if the family owns one. For More About Homestay

Name: Red River college
Overview: Red River College, established in 1938, is one of the oldest educational institutions in Canada. Located in the Manitoba Province, the college is renowned for applied learning and research studies and offers more than 200 degrees, diplomas, and certificate programs in the regular and distance learning mode. The institute has several campuses in Winnipeg, Selkirk, Steinbach, Southport, Winkler, and Portage la Prairie. It also has two of the biggest campuses in Canada, Notre Dame and the Exchange District of Winnipeg. The 2019-2020 rankings indicate that Red River College is among Canada's top ten research universities. The institute is famous for providing a well-curated culinary arts program and a high-class Aerospace faculty for students interested in studying aeronautics. Red River College provides students with the best facilities in applied research studies. The institution also offers various scholarships and awards, like the Technical Communication Faculty Scholarship, to reward deserving students.

Name: St Clair College - Downtown Campus
Overview: St. Clair College - Downtown Campus, established in 1966, is located in Windsor, Ontario. This is a public college and the first post-secondary institution to be opened downtown. As of November 20, 2021, St. Clair College is accredited by the Higher Learning Commission. The St. Clair College - Downtown Campus offers 18 different programs. Most courses at this institute are Journalism, Data Analytics for Business, Graphic Design, Border Services, Paralegal, Community and Justice Services, Human Resource Management, Public Relations, Event Management and others. The State-of-the-art Mediaplex at the Downtown Campus is only one of the three in the world that offers the course Journalism, Media Convergence and Public Relations, has three computer labs, with an open lab for students, and the heart of the newsroom: a learning lab for radio, television, print and online news filing experience. Recently, in One Riverside Drive, the campus added the Zekelman School of Business near St. Clair College Centre of the Arts. This new edition provides data analytics labs for International Business Management and Business. St. Clair College also offers online courses for its students. A few online courses are Fire Protection, Business Communication, Accounting, Statistical Concepts, Management Principles and others.Students pursuing a post-secondary course at St. Clair College are eligible for financial aid at the college. This aid comes from Awards, Scholarships, and Bursaries. The scholarships at the college are offered in February or March. Last year the college offered more than 750 scholarships worth more than $535,000.00. The fee at St. Clair College - Downtown Campus varies per course. For example, the course of Media Films of the duration of 2-3 years has a tuition fee of CAD 8,167, and for 1-3 year courses in Management, the fee is CAD 7,917. This college has a considerable employability rate. Matt Boismier, a famous art director, is an alumnus of this college.

Name: Western Town College
Overview: Western Town College is an English language school in Toronto, Canada. Established in September 1996, this institution has been offering a number of programs directly at ESL education for over 20 years. It is located 150 Eglinton Ave E #7F, Toronto, which is 2 blocks east of Yonge–Eglinton intersection. The school offers a range of classes to improve one’s English language ability. These programs are “General English”, “Let’s Talk”, “Power Talk Master, “IELTS Preparation Program”, “English Enhancement Training”, and “Camp Program”. This college campus includes an array of amenities, such as 20 classrooms, student computers, free Wi-Fi, and a student lounge. This campus also lies in proximity to a shopping centre, restaurant, library, subway, and movie theatre. Furthermore, it hosts free field trips and activity classes for students on a weekly basis. Every session, the Western Town College releases an activity calendar, which includes numerous types of activities and events. This college is home to students from all around the world, including Brazil, South Korea, Japan, Latin America, and China, among others. Western Town also offers a pathway program for students who wish to enter universities or colleges in Canada or the United States. This program enables students to summarise articles, write university essays, conduct academic research and presentations. After its completion, students can be accepted to affiliated colleges, namely Lakehead University, Acadia University, Algoma University, Confederation College, Cambrian College, Niagara College Canada, University of Prince Edward Island, University of Regina, and St. Lawrence College, among others. The Western Town College provides a diverse selection of courses that improve one’s English language ability by way of an enjoyable learning experience. This institution takes pride in its teachers, who proffer engaging and imaginative lessons.

Name: Saint Mary's University
Overview: Established in 1802, Saint Mary's University is a public university spread across 80 acres and is located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. It offers 44 undergraduate, 27 postgraduate, 9 certificates and diplomas, and 5 continuing education courses in various fields of Business and Accounting, Liberal Arts, Engineering, Science, Health, Psychology, and Environmental Studies. Some of the top courses offered by the university are M.B.A., M.Sc. in Computing and Data Analytics, M.Tech., M.I.M., B.Com., etc. The course fee for international students amounts approximately to CAD 1906 to 2,115. The university is affordable for international students willing to study in Canada and provides financial aid worth CAD 7.9 million annually. A few scholarships offered here are the Academic Achievement Scholarship worth CAD 1000 CAD to 3500, Accounting Achievement Award worth CAD 1000, Presidential International Baccalaureate Scholarships, Financial need-based bursaries, etc.The university has a career services centre that helps students in career counselling, resume building and job support, employment engagement, co-curricular record, cooperative education, and service-learning.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency For admission to St. Mary's University, all students must provide proof of English competence. If you studied in the United States, you may be able to meet the English proficiency criterion.  Options for submitting proof of English competence to St. Mary's are: English as a Foreign Language Exam (TOEFL). Full admission requires a minimum score of 80 on the Internet-based (IB) test (87 for admission to the Master of Business Administration programs/certificate).The International English Language Testing System (IELTS) is a system for (IELTS). A minimum band score of 6.0 is required for full admission (6.5 required for admission to the Master of Business Administration programs/certificate).Duolingo English Test (DET): A minimum score of 105 is required for full admission. Graduate programs may require a higher proficiency score for admission. Please check with the graduate admission department for specific requirements.
Placement: Career Placement St. Mary's College's Corporate Relationship Cell is an important aspect of the college. The cell is proactive, with the purpose of finding the greatest match placement and internship. It has a good working relationship with recruiting firms and corporations. The unit also coordinates Management Development Programs (MDP) and student training programmes. It also provides individual counselling to prepare prospective students for campus selections.Check here for more details: https://stmaryscollege.in/the-college/placements/
Accommodation: Housing At SMU Not all learning takes place in a classroom setting. Living on campus is an integral component of the collegiate experience. While living in the centre of the campus, you'll meet people from all over the world in a close-knit community. Our numerous home options allow you to customize your living arrangements to meet your specific requirements. Check out our "Housing Options" page to learn more about the various types of residences offered at Saint Mary's University! Check here: https://www.smu.ca/student-life/residences-and-housing.html

Name: University of Northern British Columbia
Overview: Columbia College has its location in the beautiful city of Vancouver in British Columbia, Canada. The college was established in 1936 as a private university-transfer college. The university has an acceptance rate of 90% and a student-faculty ratio of 6:1. The University Transfer Program, Associate Degree Program, High School Program and Academic ESC are some of the programs offered by the College. The Associate Degree programs are equivalent to I and II years of a 4-year undergraduate course. The two associate programs that the College provides are the Associate of Arts Degree and the Associate of Science Degree (Business Administration, Computer Science, Economics, Psychology, Mathematics, etc.). The College has two campuses set in an urban location: the Main Campus and the North Campus. The College also provides laboratories, libraries, student lounges, and many other facilities for students and faculty that give a vibrant feel of being in the College. Around 300 companies hire Columbia students every year. Since the College offers no on-campus accommodation facilities, students (especially international students) should make the necessary arrangements for their stay.The one-year tuition fee for the University Transfer program offered by the College is 16,050 CAD for 30 credits. The tuition fee is 32,100 CAD for 60 credits. Students can also apply for scholarships like Columbia College Entrance Scholarships, Outstanding Student Scholarships, Gary Swanson English Preparation Scholarships, John Idelm Memorial Scholarships, etc.
Eligibility Overview: With over 396 international students from over 40 countries enrolled, UNBC has a significant and active international student population. Admission will be considered for students who have completed their studies at a suitable high school and/or a recognised post-secondary institution. Each international application will be reviewed on its own merits.  Required English Language Proficiency Any of the following examinations may be used to demonstrate English language proficiency (UNBC's TOEFL code is 0320):

Name: Mohawk College - Fennell
Overview: Mohawk College was established in 1966 in a government-funded college in Canada. The Mohawk College Fennell Campus is the largest among its other campuses and is located in Hamilton, Ontario. Mohawk College is a member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada and is fully funded by the Ministry of Training Colleges and Universities. The Mohawk College faculty is dynamic and teaches 160 programs with specialities in technology, healthcare, skill trades, business, etc. It also offers graduate programs which include programs like Autism and Behavioral Science, Business Analysis, Cyber Security Analytics, Global Business Management, Public Relations, Supply Chain Management, Creative Arts Business and others. Mohawk College also offers programs on Continuing Education on Parental Support Worker and Cyber Security Analytics. Mohawk College has about 4,000 international students from 90 countries. Students can also apply for Mohawk College financial aid as scholarships, awards and bursaries. Apart from this, the Ontario Student Assistance Program or OSAP is a financial aid program for students and is a mix of grants and loans. Also, students can settle for External Donor Awards such as The Stantec Equity and Diversity Scholarship, S.M.A.R.T. Scholarship, Pink Pearl Foundation, Pain Care Clinics Medical Scholarship and others. Apart from on-campus courses, it also offers online courses for both national and international students. These programs are Advanced Diplomas, Diplomas, Certificates, Graduate Certificates, and Nursing. Among those, Diploma in Business, Diploma in Computer System Technician – Software Support and Advanced Diploma in Civil Engineering Technology – Transportation are full-time programs. Mohawk College Fennell also ranked No.1 continuously for 5 times in the graduate employability rate in the Hamilton and Greater Toronto Area. Some notable alumni include Gary Nelson, Ted Rakoczy, Joal Roshko and Luke Johns.

It offers more than 260 programs across seven specialized academic schools. The institute provides high-quality Canadian education that is employment-focused and hands-on. They keep you interested in today's business standards and prepare you to fulfil your ambition. The college is invested in your success and thereby wants to help you every step of the way. The college offers more than 50 co-op programmes in business, engineering technology and applied sciences, and transportation to enable this. Name: IBT College
Overview: Based in Toronto, Ontario, IBT is a Private Career College registered at the Ministry of Colleges and Universities under the Private Career Colleges Act, 2005. It is affiliated with the Career Colleges Ontario (CCO) and National Association of Career Colleges (NACC). IBT College is a Designated Learning Institution (DLI). It holds an affiliation with EduCanada and has the support of over 270 international education partners globally. Since 2001, this college has been a reference for students seeking 6 months or 1-year certificates and diploma programs in Flight Attendant, Information Technology, Business, Travel & Tourism, and Health Care. IBT was the first college in Ontario to provide an entirely Ministry-approved Flight Attendant Program. For their Travel & Tourism Diploma Program, IBT is recognized by the CITC (Canadian Institute of Travel Counselors; now part of ACTA - the Association of Canadian Travel Agencies). To name a few diploma programs, IBT College offers Business Administration Diploma, Programmer Analyst Diploma, Network Engineering Diploma, Health Office Administrator Diploma, Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer Diploma, etc. Some of this institute's English programs include Advanced Business English Program, The General English Program, Pathway program, and specific electives. The Community Health Worker Certificate is an employer-sponsored corporate training program. Being a Career College, IBT supports its graduates to develop a successful career after graduating. This college’s Career Services office provides one-on-one sessions to students for resume reviewing and workshops, guiding them through the job search basics. IBT College Canada has partnered with Places4Students Inc. lately, thereby providing students with an online collection of many housing options.

Name: Lambton College - Toronto

Lambton offers a career support department to assist its students, alumni, faculty, and even co-op employers with training, upskilling, and any other counselling needed. They are constantly there to help you through difficult situations and quickly resolve conflicts. At Lambton College, placements are an integral aspect of many programmes, particularly those in community services and health sciences. The institution conducts corporate training for businesses, so it is aware of market expectations and assists its students in meeting them. As for 2019-2020, Lambton has had an employment rate of 86.4% with a 100% employer satisfaction rate. This only goes on to prove how career-ready the graduates are.  6figr reports that graduates from Lambton College typically make between $51k and $180k annually, with an average salary of $108k.
Accommodation: Lambton is home to over 280 students who would all agree that living on-campus is a great way to build connections, and make friends. Lambton has many campus facilities, such as movie theatres, recreational centers, and restaurants. The official website enlists a checklist to make moving easy for you. The checklist lists things you should and should not bring while moving.  The residential building has an entrance off London Road and is situated on the northeastern border of the campus. The 140 shared rooms only include two double extra-long beds, two desks with chairs and desk lamps, and two armoires with shelving. A bathroom with a toilet, basin, and shower is accessible in each room, but two people must share it. A microwave and refrigerator are also provided in each room. There is a designated area used for cooking. There is also a courtyard space where you can relax with your friends. A meal plan is mandatory. Over 280 students live at the Lambton apartment on campus. It has a beautiful courtyard and a student lounge accessible to students round the clock. Lambton also offers an athletics & Fitness Complex that is free for its students. A virtual tour is available on the site for those interested.

Name: John Casablancas Institute
Overview: Established in 1978, John Casablancas Institute is a recognized industry leader offering job-oriented training in hair, fashion, aesthetics, and makeup. Located in Gastown, Vancouver's cultural and creative hub district, the uniquely designed coursework maintains industry trends. John Casablancas Institute is approved and registered with the Private Training Institutions and a member of Education Quality Assistance and received the "Seal of Quality" tag. The professionals and guest teachers in this institution are from different fields. So, they bring along their wisdom and expertise from their respective domains. The students are provided with necessary job-oriented training that encourages them for better performance in the industry.John Casablancas Institute is recognized for nurturing and well-disposed approaches to education and enhancing the quality of training. John Casablancas Institute emphasizes providing advanced, relevant training to strengthen students' foundation. In addition, the local and international connections of John Casablancas Institute offer access to hair, spa, makeup, and fashion opportunities. The employment rate of this institution after graduation is nearly 90%. At John Casablancas Institute, international and domestic candidates can apply for scholarships, especially domestic candidates who can avail of more than one scholarship. Students can enjoy co-operative education and placement opportunities at John Casablancas Institute. Besides providing top-notch education, this institution also paves the way for students to obtain the necessary skills to help them pursue their career paths. Theo Mohamed, Lauren McKnight, Krista Hann, and Mandy Dhaliwal are among the alums of John Casablancas Institute.

Name: Algonquin College - Pembroke
Overview: Pembroke, Algonquin College is a widely known institution in Canada for providing top-notch advanced degrees. With more than 4000 international students representing 13 countries, presently, this college has an overall student strength of approximately 19,957. This institution has three campuses, and one of them is located in Pembroke. It is a newly opened campus offering 16 full-time student programmes. The college offers approximately 357 college programmes along with 19 apprenticeships and 27 full-time online programmes. The educational programmes offered by this college earned accreditation from the Association of Community College Trustees and ranked amongst the top 50 research colleges in Canada. There are no residential facilities on the Pembroke campus for the students, but they can avail private residences rented out by local people. Being surrounded by rugged terrain provides the students with an opportunity for various outdoor activities. With an acceptance rate of nearly 60%, this college follows a strict admission procedure. It holds the 78th position in Canada, according to the list provided by the ranking web of universities, CSIC.  The Pembroke campus provides various health and community studies courses, outdoor training, business technology, etc. After the completion of each academic year, the college offers six international student scholarships and one leadership award to international students. These scholarships are awarded to students who have shown tremendous academic excellence and achievement. Further, this institution strongly connects with employers and is popular among students for its placement facility. The Algonquin College employment rate is 97%, and the students are employed with top-notch Canadian organisations. It offered 11 bachelor's degrees and partnered with universities to conduct programmes associated with Carleton University and the University of Ottawa.

Name: Acadia University
Overview: Acadia University, located in Nova Scotia, Canada, is a public liberal arts university that offers enrollment to over 3800 students yearly. Acadia University has about 200 programs in engineering, music, business, applied sciences, education, theology, theatre, gender studies, history, and economics. The 22 co-op programs offered by the university are one of the highest-ranked courses in the country.The university also offers various scholarship options and bursaries for international students. The university holds more national championships and conferences than any other university located in Atlantic Canada. A Work and Study program is also provided by the university, giving the students a chance to earn money while studying to manage their expenses better.  Acadia has a separate division for research and graduate studies that supervises the graduate and research programs. The Open Acadia division of the university offers correspondence and distance learning courses for working professionals with busy schedules.

Name: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College - Brampton
Overview: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College is the operating name for the Canadian Institute of Telecommunications (CIT). It was established in 1998 and is a registered Private Career College in the province of Ontario. Further, it is a member of the National Association of Career Colleges and the Ontario Association of Career Colleges. The college has campuses in some popular places, such as Toronto, Mississauga, Brampton, Scarborough, Hamilton etc. The Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College at Brampton offers several courses and programs for bachelor's, Master's, Diploma and Associate degrees. The course fees, as well as the living cost, are pretty affordable. The average tuition fee at this institute ranges from $12,000 to $12,200 per year. On the other hand, the cost of living per year is about $12,900 to $13,000. The college provides students with on-campus accommodation through housing facilities. The college also offers students several academic and non-academic services and facilities like a library, cafeteria, kitchen, laundry, television and WIFI with a 24x7 internet connection. Moreover, the college makes efforts to enhance and improve the students' professional skills to pursue their desired careers successfully. The college offers several diploma programs and certificate courses in Business, Trade, Law, Computer Networking, Telecommunication and Healthcare. The college has successfully guided, trained and educated regional and international students since the beginning. The Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College’s courses provide learning experiences that meet international standards and benchmarks. They provide the students with supportive staff and experienced faculty to train them in theoretical and practical aspects.

Name: Assiniboine Community College
Overview: Assiniboine Community College(ACC) is a Canadian public college in Manitoba, Canada. Established as the Brandon Vocational Training Centre in 1961, currently, it is an accredited college with Manitoba Council for post-secondary education. The college has seven schools, providing over 50 certification, diploma, and advanced diploma courses across five campuses. The college also offers a 2+2 program allowing students to combine the two years at this college with two years at any partner university with Assiniboine. Since 1969, Assiniboine Community College has been a designated learning institution by Refugee, Immigration, and Citizenship Canada. The college has the Students' Association Council, which acts as students' voice and represents them on college committees, and addresses the specific requirements of students, providing a social stress-free atmosphere.The college's excellent placement options prompt the students to hone their skills to perfection leading to a graduate employment rate of 91%.

Placement: The university offers co-operative work placements and practicums as an integral part of the course.The co-op work placements ensure internship and job opportunities for over 200 graduate students.Various students procure jobs in different departments on Employer Day, held annually.More than 91% of the graduates seek employment in a reputed organisation with an average gross salary of $49,000.
Accommodation: Assiniboine does not offer on-campus accommodation for international students. Hence, students need to make their arrangements. However, some private landlords provide suites and rooms to the students, and modern residences are available around the Victoria Avenue East campus. On average, monthly living costs may range from $800-1000.
University Ranking: Assiniboine Community College (ACC) is one of the leading post-secondary institutions in Manitoba, Canada. It is known for its quality education, excellent student services, and solid commitment to community engagement. ACC offers various certificate and diploma programs to degree and transfer programs. With its superb reputation, ACC is consistently ranked among the top post-secondary institutions in the province. ACC is ranked among the top 10 post-secondary institutions in Manitoba. It is ranked sixth in the area for its overall quality of education. It is also ranked in the top five for its student services, which include student support services, career services, and student life. ACC is also highly rated for its commitment to community engagement, which provides for its involvement in local initiatives and its support of local businesses. In terms of academic excellence, ACC is ranked in the top five for its overall academic performance. It is also ranked in the top five for its research and development capabilities. ACC is also highly rated for its graduate programs, which include master's and doctoral programs in various disciplines. ACC consistently ranks among Manitoba's top five post-secondary institutions regarding student satisfaction. It is ranked fourth in the province for its overall student satisfaction, and it is also ranked in the top five for its student services. ACC is also highly rated for its commitment to student success, supporting student clubs and organizations, career services, and student life. Overall, Assiniboine Community College is one of the leading post-secondary institutions in Manitoba. It is consistently ranked among the top post-secondary institutions in the province for its quality of education, student services, and commitment to community engagement. With its excellent reputation, ACC is a great choice for those looking for quality post-secondary education.

Name: New Brunswick Community College
Overview: New Brunswick Community College, located in New Brunswick, Canada, established in 1974, has six campuses throughout Moncton, Miramichi, Fredericton, St. Andrews, Woodstock, and Saint John. The College is a renowned institution that offers various degrees through part-time, full-time, mentor-based, online, and professional programs. The College has its functions organized into fourteen major subject areas: Administrative Professional, Applied and Media Arts, Building and Construction, Business Administration, Civil Engineering, Electrical and Electronics, Environment and Marine, Health, Hospitality, Information Technology, Mechanical, and Industrial, Metals Processing, Mobile Equipment Repair, and Social Sciences. The College offers semester-based courses while hosting vibrant campuses brimming with students from various professions and parts of the world. It also provides tutoring services for students who seek a little counseling. There are over 100 programs for you to select from while the student sets out on the journey to get their graduation, post-graduation, and diploma degrees. Some of the best programs at the College that reflect its academic brilliance and success are in the areas of civil engineering, social sciences, hospitality, and health. With a promising 89% placement rate, all six campuses provide well-equipped libraries, housing facilities, laboratories, and tutoring centers to ensure personal and professional triumphs for students.The College celebrates and nourishes the diversity of each of its students while nourishing their different opinions and understanding to ensure their development and evolution into critically aware world citizens.
