Name: Queens University - School of English
Overview: Founded in 1841, Queen’s University is one of the oldest universities in Canada. It is situated in the city of Kingston in Ontario, Canada. Students of Queens University - School of English get integrated into campus life having complete access to the university facilities. The various programs offered by Queen's University - School of English are Canadian Academic English Experience Program, Academic English Foundations, Canadian English Experience Program, English for Academic Purposes. The various in-class hours for every week that these programs demand range from 18 to 23. The program duration of these lies in the range of 3 weeks to 12 weeks. Besides these, this institute also extends a Queen's University Bridging Pathway (QBridge) program. There are Queens University - School of English scholarships available for eligible candidates. To name these, there is Golden Source International Award (CAD 1,700) and Marion Edith Dubin Memorial Scholarship in English (CAD 750). In order to be eligible for these scholarships, students must be a returning student or pay their tuition in full for the EAP program. Additionally, their age must be at least 18 years. Queen’s University ranked first in Canada and fifth globally in the Times Higher Education (THE) Impact Rankings in April 2021. This was in the global rankings of universities which are advancing the United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) within and beyond their local communities. Students joining the QSoE Volunteer Club get an opportunity to devote their time, expertise and knowledge to the Kingston community. There is also a QSoE Student Life Program that gives students a chance to organise and plan events, and also act as a voice for the student body. There are a number of options for accommodation options for QSoE students. This school is partnered with Canada Homestay Network (CHN). Besides these, the university provides other residence options and also offers a list of university and non-university-owned houses and other resources.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?For UG applicants, Queen's has country-specific entrance requirements. An All India Senior School Certificate (CBSE) or an Indian School Certificate is required for Indian applicants (CISCE). The grades needed for admission will differ depending on the programme. However, according to the Indian grading system, a minimum academic average of 75% is necessary. Individual students with outstanding Class XII results from state boards will be evaluated. For applicants already enrolled in secondary school, interim Class XII grades or pre-board exam scores are taken into account. Secondary school graduates are evaluated based on their final board test scores from class XII. In addition, one of the following English proficiency exam results is required:TOEFL iBT: Overall score of 88, with 24 points in Writing, 22 points in Speaking and Reading, and 20 points in Listening.IELTS: 6.5 overall, with no band lower than 6.0.Minimum score of 110 in Duolingo (DET).PTE: 60 in totalProficiency: C1: Advanced/C2: Proficiency: C1: Advanced/C2: Proficiency: C1: Overall, 175 points, with no component below 170.Requirements for a Master's DegreeA UG degree from an eligible institution, as defined by the Queen's University Policy on Admission for Advanced Study with a second class standing, is the minimum requirement for any master's programme. Applicants with a general bachelor's degree and one academic year of full-time study as a qualifying student with at least a B grade average may be deemed equivalent. Requirements for Doctoral ProgramsAny one of the following minimum credentials is required for admission to a PhD programme:Master's level qualificationPromotion to a PhD programme after completing a master's degreeDirect admission: Direct admission to a PhD programme may be considered for students with a demonstrably superior ranking in their honours bachelor's degree or equivalent.
Placement: Placements at Queen's UniversityWhat is the typical remuneration package? A Queen's graduate can expect to earn up to $52,500 USD after five years, which is more than the national average.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.The dorms of Queen's University are divided into two campuses: Main Campus and West Campus.Over 90% of first-year students live in residential halls (residence is guaranteed for first-years)Harkness Hall, Leggett Hall, Waldron Tower, Watts Hall, Victoria Hall, Morris Hall, Adelaide Hall (only for women), Leonard Hall (only for males), and many others are among the residence halls on campus.Each student has the following objects in their room: For each student, there is a bed with mattress, a dresser, a desk, a bulletin board, a bookshelf, a chair, a mirror, a telephone, and a data connection.Residence services are available to Queen's University students, allowing them to meet and become friends with students from all origins, experiences, viewpoints, values, and interests.On-campus housing information can be found here.http://residences.housing.queensu.ca/ Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus housing is available.The average monthly rent is 1050 CAD.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.All basic services such as power, water, and high-speed internet are included in the rent for the student homes.There is also a laundry facility on site.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://housinganywhere.com/s/Kingston--Canadahttps://www.rentboard.ca/https://www.kijiji.ca/b-house-rental/kingston-on/student/k0c43l1700183

Name: Vancouver Island University
Overview: Established in 1969, Vancouver Island University is a Canadian public university. Vancouver Island University offers 67 undergraduate programs, six postgraduate programs, and various diploma and certificate courses for graduate and undergraduate students.The university offers education in the fields of education, business, management, health sciences, technology, science, art, design & performing arts, humanities & social sciences, tourism, recreation and hospitality, co-operative education, etc. The top courses offered by the university are B.B.A., B.Sc., M.B.A., M.I.M., M.S., etc.The courses' per-year tuition fee ranges between CAD 11,892 and 23,125. The hostel and meal expenses per year are approximately CAD 5,117. TThe university provides financial aid to qualified international students through grants, scholarships, student jobs, and external aid. International students can apply for external financial aid that the university does not administer. Scholarships available at the university for International students are V.I.U. Worldwide Entrance Scholarships, V.I.U. International Undergraduate Regional Scholarship, International Baccalaureate Diploma Entrance Scholarship, etc. The university's career centre conducts career fairs annually for its students to connect with employers and provide work-integrated learning opportunities.

Name: Cegep de la Gaspesie et des Iles
Overview: Cegep de la Gaspesie et des Iles of Canada, also known as CEGEP college, was established in 1967 and is now affiliated under Association Generale des etudiants du Cegep de la Gaspesie et des Iles. Established by the Quebec Provincial Government, it is a public-funded institution and one of Quebec's largest. It has 3000+ student strengths and comprises five extensive campuses in five locations, namely Gaspe, Carleton, í_les-de-la-Madeleine, Montreal, and Grande Riviere. Regarded as one of the top 20 destinations in the world to visit by National Geographic, the institution offers pre-university programs, technical programs, secondary school vocational diploma in fields like business, computer science, technology, tourism, and healthcare. CEGEP offers Montreal-Gaspe Collaborative scholarships to deserving students for a smooth education process. CEGEP has the Marcel Bujold Sports Complex for healthy campus life to practice badminton, soccer, frisbee, volleyball, and other games. There is also a film club, library, music club,  Outdoor club, Gaspe Improvisation League, Ecological Groupe Univert, Le Chameau Theatre Company, etc. For students with mental health and learning impairment, CEGEP also offers adapted services to benefit the students. The cost of living, merit scholarship, tuition fees, and financial aid depends on the citizenship and place of residence of respective students.

Name: Douglas College
Overview: Douglas College is a public college established in 1970 and named after former British Governor of British Columbia, Sir James Douglas. The College is in a study-friendly environment in British Columbia, Canada. The College is affiliated with ACCC, CBIE and CUP. There are three major campuses in Metro Vancouver, two in New Westminster and one in Coquitlam. There is also a Training Centre campus in Surrey. The remarkable point of this College is that they provide a solid academic base with career-ready skills, making them ready for placements. The College offers 13 Bachelor's Degrees, arts and science courses, and other career programs in creative arts, human services, business and health care. Students can either choose to complete their programs part-time or full-time, self-paced and partially online. The tuition fee at Douglas College is around 13,200 - 13,500 USD. If students meet the criteria the College sets, they are also provided scholarships, bursaries, fee waivers, and work-study programs. Unfortunately, the College has no facilities to live on-campus students. However, with the help of First Choice International Placement, a homestay placement service for international students, they can explore the culture and lifestyle of the residents in the city. The Douglas Open Repository has a collection of research and creative assets of the College. Like how the College provides academic enrichment to the students, they also explore students' extracurricular skills through the Indigenous Collective program or the Pride Collective Program. Students also participate in various intercollegiate sports competitions.Some of the popular courses in this College are History, Sports Management, Human Resource Management, Sales and Marketing, Banking and Finance, Political and Social Sciences, Digital Communications and Multimedia, and Optical Science.

Name: Georgian College - Orangeville
Overview: The Georgian College, founded in 1967, is known for its educational services at the graduation level. The college is nationally recognized and accredited by the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE). The main campus is spread across 21,000 square kilometers and imparts its educational services across seven campuses. Georgian College's ranking shows its success, which is at about number three on the global level for academic assistance. The Orangeville Campus of the Georgian College is known for its corporate and academic up-gradation of students. The major courses offered on this campus mainly focus on business, management, healthcare and human services. The college aims at providing a transformative service to help the students connect education with employable skills. The students can avail themselves of online and offline courses based on their requirements and take help from the college regarding student loans and scholarships for their financial assistance. The Orangeville Campus offers an 11,000-square-feet learning space. Other campus features include a computer lab, a nursing lab with a six-bed facility, a video conferencing classroom, a student resource centre, and a student lounge. Georgian College has been instrumental in attracting more students, especially international students. Their acceptance rate of 81% has made it easier to select new applicants. The students receive more than 130 industry-specific training and educational programs in business, management, visual arts, hospitality, tourism, skilled trades. Often considered the commercial hub of Dufferin County, Orangeville offers a rich locality. The practical and industry-specific courses provided here are often helpful for employment. The college’s placement offices update the students regarding the latest job offers based on their training courses.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Must be 21 years of age or older by the first day of classesMust have no recent unfavourable academic performanceMust have demonstrated potential for success in degree studies through academic accomplishmentsThe admission requirement for degree programs is a high school diploma like Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) with 30 credits or equivalent, plus six courses at the 4U or 4M level. Some programs have specific course prerequisites. To meet Georgian's language competence standards, applicants must meet ONE of the following criteria: Three full years of secondary school (high school) English study in a country where English is the primary language (four years for BScN, Pharmacy Technician, and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention). Only Pharmacy Technicians can study in Canada.)A full year of study in a recognised postsecondary English programme in a country where English is the primary language is required (not applicable to BScN, Pharmacy Technician and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention)A public or Catholic school board must give an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (or Canadian provincial equivalent) and English credit (Grade 12 U, M, or C) (not applicable to BScN, Pharmacy Technician and Addictions: Treatment and Prevention)Provide proof of completion of one of Georgian College's approved partner school route programmes (not applicable to BScN or Pharmacy Technician)Must have completed three years of secondary schooling in an Ontario private school and achieved an Ontario Secondary School Diploma and English credit (Grade 12 U, M or C) Note: Here, C = College Level, M = College/University Level, U = University Level
Placement: In several of the Health, Wellness and Sciences, Human Services, and Community Safety programmes, the placement offices are responsible for arranging placement opportunities and managing the pre-placement requirements for students to satisfy the learning outcomes of their practical courses.  Health, Wellness and Sciences pre-placement preparation Georgian works with Synergy Gateway, a company that analyses and approves all of your pre-placement needs.Synergy Gateway will grant you access to "Verified," a software platform, via a secure login and password that will be emailed to you. "Verified" will be used to schedule your permit check, upload your paperwork and supporting documentation, and check your clinical placement eligibility status.There are certain steps to be followed: Step 1: Fill out your pre-placement paperwork The paperwork you must complete is your Clinical Preparedness Permit. The Clinical Preparedness Permit Information Package explains each need in detail, as well as any exceptions to the rules that are unique to your programme. Step 2: Make an appointment with Synergy Gateway to check your student permit online.  All medical and non-medical needs will be reviewed and validated. Prior to your permit check appointment, please upload all documentation to your Synergy Gateway profile. You are responsible for keeping this information current and secure at all times.  Forms and Placements requirements All data and papers requested by the programme area must be completed and submitted by the student. To assure your placement and participation in clinical and field placement facilities, documents must be submitted prior to the start of registration. The college takes no responsibility for these issues, and students should be aware that if they are denied entry to placement, they will not be refunded their money.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation If you live on campus, you'll have a lot of possibilities to participate in your college community. At Georgian's student dormitories in Barrie, Orillia, and Owen Sound, learn about the advantages of living on campus. On-campus living offers all you need to have a fun and safe college experience.Enjoy the comfort of living only a short distance from school and having everything you require right at your fingertips. Participate in residence life programmes while forming new lifelong friendships and getting to know your roommates. If you live on campus, you'll have a lot of possibilities to participate in your college community. You can take an active leadership position in your residence by doing the following: Applying to be a resident advisorRunning for a position on the residence student councilOrganizing or joining a clubParticipating in intramural sportsPlanning outings and more The on-campus residence options are: Barrie ResidenceOrillia ResidenceOwen Sound Residence For more information, visit: https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/campus-services/residence-housing/on-campus-residence/  Off-Campus Accommodation The university will assist you in getting started by highlighting several key considerations when deciding to live off-campus, such as housing rules and regulations, rental scams, roommates, insurance, transportation, and health, safety, and security.  Off-Campus housing options: Room rental Within a communal unit, a private room. It's vital to know whether the price is for just the room or includes access to other areas of the unit like the kitchen, bathroom, and shared living areas. When a room is advertised as a single room, landlords are unlikely to accept room sharing. Apartment rental A typical apartment has a living room, bedroom, and kitchen. These sections may be combined into a single room in a bachelor apartment. The bathroom must always be kept separate from the rest of the house and have a working door. House rental With a minimum of one floor, independent units with various bedrooms to accommodate roommates are common. Basement apartment Renting an apartment unit or a room that is half or fully below ground level. Basement units may be completely outfitted and contain the same facilities as those found above ground. Homestay Consider staying with a Homestay family, who will give you a private room, three meals a day, and internet access. It's a fantastic chance to immerse yourself in Canadian culture while spending time with your family. This housing choice provides numerous opportunities to practice and enhances your English. For more information, visit: https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/campus-services/residence-housing/off-campus-housing/  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/campus-services/residence-housing/

Name: York University - School of Continuing Studies
Overview: York University is a public research institution in Toronto, Canada. It ranks among the largest universities in Canada. The York University – School of Continuing Studies offers professional programs in high-demand career fields. It is situated at York University's Keele campus.Students need to produce an English proficiency test. IELTS, TOEFL, and PTE scores are among the ones accepted.York University – School of Continuing Studies also has a networking platform called Connections, an online community of alumni, students, instructors, and industry experts. This platform allows students to discover careers relevant to their area of study as well as develop networking skills.The university offers international student scholarships to recognize and award excellence.York university offers career services to students and has a  great employment rate. MBA graduates earn an average of $137,000 per year, making it the highest-paying degree at the university.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Grand Falls - Windsor
Overview: College of the North Atlantic has 17 campuses located in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador in Canada, with its Grand Falls- Windsor campus, located in Central Newfoundland. The college offers one, two and three-year diploma and certificate courses to students from Exploits Valley and Coast of Bays.The College of the North Atlantic offers 128 programmes in Law, computer science, business and management, architecture and construction, social studies etc. The college also provides 300+ part-time programmes that promote continuing education at home for international students. The college has a placement rate of 94%, and 90% of undergraduates get placed within 6 months. According to UniRank, it is ranked 85 among all Canadian universities. On the 120-acre Grand Falls- Windsor campus of the college, there is a guidance counsellor, a student development officer, an academic resource centre and an active student council. Students also have access to a renowned library and a full-service cafeteria. The Grand Falls- Windsor campus has a safe and friendly living environment, provides high-quality education at reasonable tuition fees, and allows transferability of certificates and diplomas. It offers one of the lowest tuition fees in all of Atlantic Canada, which attracts international students to this college.

Name: Algoma University - Brampton
Overview: Algoma University, founded in 1965 as Algoma College, is spread over three campuses, namely, Sault Ste. Marie, Timmins, and Brampton. This university was conferred the status of a private university in 2005 and has expanded hugely. Found in the center of the city of Brampton, this campus offers a variety of courses. It is well known for its BBA courses in various disciplines via accelerated courses in less than 20 months. The college provides undergraduate degree options. Students can pursue 3 to 4-year courses via the program. A variety of programs are included in the university's academic structure, including those in biology, business, science, computer science, history, social work, sociology, political science, English, geography, psychology, music, fine arts, and community development. The notable alums are Joanne Robertson (Author), Kevin Hodson (Ice hockey player), Ryan Hardern (Olympics Gold Medalist), etc.The university provides a dorm with a single bed, wardrobe, desk, and complimentary Wi-Fi access. The university's events, competitions, festivals, and quizzes occur on its grounds. For the convenience of the students, the school is close to many cafes, restaurants, department stores, and chemist and stationery stores. From the campus, public transportation is conveniently accessible.The tuition fee for International students at Algoma university is 12,740 CAD.

Name: Red Deer College
Overview: Red Deer College is located midway between Calgary and Edmonton in Alberta. It offers a diverse choice of courses, with over 100 programs, including diploma and certification programs. Red Deer College has a total enrollment of 7,500 full-time and part-time students. Popular courses can be applied online through the college's official website. The teaching approach encompasses practical insights, making the students job-ready immediately after graduation. Red Deer College is known for its excellent sports education programs. The college boasts one of Canada's most popular athletics programs, allowing students to participate in extracurricular activities. Basketball, volleyball, hockey, badminton, and other sports are available to students throughout the year.

Name: University of Regina
Overview: The University of Regina is a public university in Regina, Canada, established in 1911 as a private institute. In 1974, it was converted into a Government University. The University of Regina offers over 120 undergraduate and 78 postgraduate degree programs in over 15 disciplines, including business administration, engineering, social work, media, health, and many more. It has 25 academic divisions and schools, 18 institutes and research centers, three federated colleges, and ten faculties. Some top courses offered at the University of Regina are Masters in Business Administration, Human Resource Management, Economics, Finance, Nursing, Health Studies, etc., and Bachelors in Business Administration, Biochemistry, Nursing, etc. The fees range from CAD 6,586 to 32,957 per year for the courses offered at the University. The accommodation and meal expenses per year of the University are around CAD 8,561. The University provides awards up to CAD 200,000 annually, and CAD 3,000 is automatically awarded to undergraduate students on a Study Permit. The prestigious award of the University is given to the top three students in three specific regions identified annually throughout the world. In addition, the University of Regina offers placement assistance to the students through a career center by conducting career fairs, and the University also h

Name: Medicine Hat College
Overview: Medicine Hat College, also known as the MHC, is a public college founded in 1965. The institute has two campuses, with the main campus in Southwestern Saskatchewan and Southeastern Alberta and the second campus in Brooks. The main campus has over 2,500 students, while the Brooks campus enrolls around 200 students every intake.﻿The library on the main campus is one of the best in the country, with over 10,000 e-books, 20,000 periodicals, and 100,000 printed resources. The institute offers around 40 bachelor's, diploma, and certification courses and over 25 university transfer programs. The institute also conducts job expos for students yearly to help them get placed in various companies, with over 70 employers attending the expo.Media Hat College is a public university offering a wide range of courses and programs that are affordable. Tuition fees for B.Sc (Year 1 &2) start at $14,131.20. The number of scholarships provided, even at the entrance level, makes studying at the institute more affordable for students. Students at MHC have access to scholarships and bursaries worth hundreds of thousands of dollars. Each year, the Student Financial Aid Office awards new, continuing, and current MHC students with over $350,000 in financial aid.The college is well equipped to provide students with necessary services like on-campus residence facilities. It is also home to several student-run clubs and has a strong athletics team.

Accommodation: University On-campus Accommodation The institution provides on-campus accommodations to students. However, the number of rooms available is limited. College follows a first-come, first-serve process, and the price starts from 4,000 USD a year. The college provides students who wish to stay off-campus a list of accommodations with contact details of landlords and housing dealers. Off-campus accommodation is the sole responsibility of the students. Medicine Hat College also provides homestay facilities for the students, where they will be placed with a native Canadian family according to the best interests and preferences of both students and homestay providers.

Name: San Mateo Colleges - Skyline College
Overview: Skyline College is one of three comprehensive community colleges among all the community colleges of San Mateo County. The institution was founded in 1969 and over the years with proper strategy it has incorporated complementary student success resources within academic divisions and come up with several unique educational programs. Now students get the convenience to select their preferred course from over 100 degree and certificate programs it offers. The college is located in the North Peninsula, south of San Francisco, and both the San Francisco international airport and Highways 280 and 380 make it easily accessible for students. This private institution is a member of the Accrediting Commission for Community and Junior Colleges. In terms of cost of attendance, the average in-state tuition cost remains around $11,331, while the out-of-state tuition cost stays around $27,028. The expenses might differ depending on the facilities (gym facilities, technology resources, library services, etc.) students choose. However, the institution offers scholarship facilities to the students after assessing their financial requirements and merit. In this regard, apart from academic achievement, a student’s athletic achievement will also be considered. San Mateo Colleges - Skyline College offers work-study programs to students who qualify for it while plenty of campus jobs are offered to students who need to earn money. It boasts more than 235 international students who are provided with facilities like transfer programs, affordable tuition and scholarships, priority class registration, etc.

Name: Mohawk College - Institute for Applied Health Sciences at McMaster
Overview: Mohawk College was established in 1966 in a government-funded college in Canada. The Mohawk College Fennell Campus is the largest among its other campuses and is located in Hamilton, Ontario. Mohawk College is a member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada and is fully funded by the Ministry of Training Colleges and Universities. The Mohawk College faculty is dynamic and teaches 160 programs with specialities in technology, healthcare, skill trades, business, etc. It also offers graduate programs which include programs like Autism and Behavioral Science, Business Analysis, Cyber Security Analytics, Global Business Management, Public Relations, Supply Chain Management, Creative Arts Business and others. Mohawk College also offers programs on Continuing Education on Parental Support Worker and Cyber Security Analytics. Mohawk College has about 4,000 international students from 90 countries. Students can also apply for Mohawk College financial aid as scholarships, awards and bursaries. Apart from this, the Ontario Student Assistance Program or OSAP is a financial aid program for students and is a mix of grants and loans. Also, students can settle for External Donor Awards such as The Stantec Equity and Diversity Scholarship, S.M.A.R.T. Scholarship, Pink Pearl Foundation, Pain Care Clinics Medical Scholarship and others. Apart from on-campus courses, it also offers online courses for both national and international students. These programs are Advanced Diplomas, Diplomas, Certificates, Graduate Certificates, and Nursing. Among those, Diploma in Business, Diploma in Computer System Technician – Software Support and Advanced Diploma in Civil Engineering Technology – Transportation are full-time programs. Mohawk College Fennell also ranked No.1 continuously for 5 times in the graduate employability rate in the Hamilton and Greater Toronto Area. Some notable alumni include Gary Nelson, Ted Rakoczy, Joal Roshko and Luke Johns.
Accommodation: Accommodations are meant to level the playing field for students in terms of meeting programme and course requirements. You may have heard it referred to as an IEP or a disability accommodation in high school. As part of our shared responsibility to accommodate students with disabilities, providing accommodations invites collaboration between the student, Accessible Learning Services, and Instructors/Professors. Documentation supporting these adjustments is on file with Accessible Learning Services.for more information click on this link-https://www.mohawkcollege.ca/accessible-learning-services/accommodations

Name: Western Community College - Abbotsford
Overview: Western Community College Abbotsford offers a wide range of courses in Health Care, English Language Programs, Accounting, and IT. The college belongs to the community and has been providing affordable, premium-quality education to the students who have taken part in this institution over the years. It has shown its commitment to offering several academic and student development services that help students to achieve their desired career goals and attain cultural and civic accomplishments at the same time. The institution ensures that the evaluation of student-learning outcomes take place on a regular basis as that will help to identify the close gaps in achievement levels. The teachers will be able to assist students in revisions and that would automatically lead to course efficacy and institutional effectiveness. A brand-new campus has been opened at Abbotsford and expansion is going on at the Surrey campus. With all that, the number of students has gotten increased in all the program offerings. Western Community College Abbotsford has been renovated with new rooms as well as amenities that students will find ideal. Higher education opportunities are also provided by the institution that allows students to develop knowledge and skills that are required to attain their professional goals. It has introduced several team building activities that will bring improvements among students, improve their productivity, and instil leadership skills in them. The institution is accredited by Education Quality Assurance (EQA), Student AidBC and Designated BC Private Training Institutions Branch. Western Community College Abbotsford is registered with BCCAT. Its partnerships with Yorkville University, Nicola Valley Institute of Technology (NVIT), and Vancouver Community College enable students to apply for academic credit transfer.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the three most important selection criteria:Academic success (high school and/or post-secondary education)Appropriateness for the field of studyObtaining the required level of English competence

Name: Vancouver Community College - Broadway
Overview: The Vancouver Community College was formed after the Vancouver School Board's Night School Program, Vancouver Vocational Institute, King Edward Senior Matriculation and Continuing Education Center and Vancouver School of Art merged together in 1965. There are three campus locations of Vancouver Community College. The Vancouver Community College Broadway is located at 1,155 East Broadway. This campus opened its doors in January 2009. The building of Vancouver Community College Broadway campus is seven-storied and covers a total area of 133,000 square feet. It is home to the Training programs of Health Sciences of VCC. Vancouver Community College offers both full-time and part-time programs. Some of these include Music and Dance, University Transfer, Academic Upgrading, Design, Hospitality, Baking and Culinary Arts, Hair, Esthetics and Makeup, Instructor Training, Technology, Apprenticeship Training, and others. VCC has a yearly budget of $105 million and is a major college offering postsecondary educational courses in the B.C. Through the University Transfer program of VCC, students can earn first-year university credits via flexible programs and transfer them to schools all over Canada. Webometrics ranked VCC 6327 in world university rankings and 1460 in continental ranking in the year 2020. The tuition expenses at this institute vary across programs and its value ranges between CAD 35,000 to CAD 35,500. It also extends financial aid in the form of bursaries, grants, awards, scholarships and Student Loans to students requiring financial assistance. The various scholarships offered are Pyrrha Scholarship worth CAD 3,500, BMW Group Canada Body and Paint Pre-Apprentice Scholarship of CAD 15,000 among others. Some notable Vancouver Community College alumni are Canadian novelist Keith Maillard, politician Steve Fortin, politician Joy Davies, Canadian chef Anthony Sedlak, artist Gwaai Edenshaw, Canadian composer Marc Baril, Canadian chef Kevin Cherkas, poet Haruko Okano, film actor Rudwan Khalil Abubaker, and Canadian television presenter Benny Yau.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the requirements for applying to various programmes at Vancouver Community College available to overseas students: Academic Requirement– Applicants must have finished 12th grade in a relevant subject with good grades from a recognized educational board.Age Requirement– To be admitted to VCC, an overseas student must be at least 17 years old when the programme begins.
Placement: To investigate potential career paths, students can enroll in courses such as Assessment and Career Options, Career Decision and Action Plans, Job Search Techniques ACED, Effective Communication, and Career Access-Academic Upgrading at VCC. VCC also offers programmes for students with disabilities, such as Career Awareness and Deaf and Hard Hearing-Job Readiness.Students at VCC can receive one-on-one assistance and speak with a counsellor or an advisor to find the best path for career exploration. BC Settlement and Integration Services assists international students (work permit holders) at VCC with job search, resume writing, and making employer connections.Visit:- https://experiential-ed.mcmaster.ca/students/career-placements
Accommodation: Documentation from a certified and approved healthcare practitioner is used to implement accommodations and services. Accommodations will only be offered if a handicap has been clearly diagnosed and will be based on the impairment's functional impact. Disability Services will determine this in accordance with VCC's Students with Disabilities Policy. https://www.vcc.ca/services/services-for-students/disability-services/accommodations/

Name: Camosun College
Overview: Camosun College, established in 1971, is one of the most prominent public colleges in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada, providing opportunities for students from diversified cultures and backgrounds. With two campuses in Lansdowne and Interurban, Camosun College has seven schools offering around 160 courses and academic disciplines in business studies, engineering, technology, health, and human services to students. Camosun College ranks among the top 200 colleges in Canada, making it a premier choice for students to pursue graduate and undergraduate degrees. The college also provides students with diplomas, online courses, and associate degrees. The college provides excellent financial assistance to students of Canadian and international backgrounds. Students from more than 80 countries form the diversified population of Camosun College, making it an excellent choice for international students. Moreover, the college is affiliated with renowned organizations such as the Canadian Collegiate Athletic Association, Colleges, and Institutes Canada, Canadian Bureau for International Organization, and Canadian University Press, giving it an edge over other universities in Canada.
Eligibility Overview: Before applying to any full-time programme at Camosun College, international applicants must meet the following criteria:
Eli Table:
Eligibility Requirements
  • The student must be a high-school graduate
  • They must be at least 19 years old.
  • An English proficiency test is required for international students.
Language Test Requirement

International students are required to provide an English language test score. 

  • TOEFL: 78
  • IELTS: 6.0
Placement: Camosun College provides specialised assistance to students to secure a job or an internship after the degree. The college has special cells dedicated to providing help to students to build their profiles and resume.  In the past, Camosun College has secured a record of around 86% placement, with students getting placed with the government of Canada and other popular organisations at various positions and levels. The average salary of a graduate from Camosun College is 53,164 CAD.
Accommodation: Camosun College does not offer on-campus accommodation to students, whether Canadian or international. However, you can find accommodation through the Camosun Homestay Program, specially designed for international students, where you can match with host families and live with them during your course duration. There are specific rules and regulations of the program that a student should keep in mind while going for it.
University Ranking: Camosun College is one of the leading post-secondary institutions in Canada, providing quality education to students from all over the world. Located in Victoria, British Columbia, Camosun College has earned a reputation for excellence in teaching, research, and community engagement. The college offers a wide variety of programs and services to meet the needs of its diverse student body. Camosun College is consistently ranked among the top colleges in Canada. According to Maclean’s Magazine, Camosun College is ranked #1 in the “Best Overall College” category in British Columbia. The college also ranks #2 in Canada's “Best Overall College” category. Camosun College is also highly ranked in student satisfaction, student services, and student engagement. According to the National Survey of Student Engagement (NSSE), Camosun College ranks #1 in the “Overall Student Engagement” category in British Columbia. The college also ranks #2 in the “Overall Student Engagement” category in Canada. In addition to its high rankings, Camosun College is also recognized for its commitment to sustainability. Camosun College is an excellent choice for students looking for quality post-secondary education. The college is a leader in sustainability initiatives, such as its commitment to renewable energy sources and reducing its environmental footprint. The college has also been recognized for promoting diversity and inclusion on campus. The college’s high rankings, commitment to sustainability, and dedication to student engagement make it an ideal choice for students looking for an education that will prepare them for success in the future.

Name: Humber College - North
Overview: Humber College is a reputed public college imparting education to students since 1967. It has three campuses in Canada; Humber College – North is in Toronto, Ontario. It offers programs like bachelor degree, post-graduation, diploma, certificate, etc. Humber College – North has a diverse, comprehensive, and student-friendly education system. Every year it educates 33,000+ students; out of those, 6,500 approximately are international students. More than 200+ programs in various disciplines like arts, science, business, engineering, health science, law, etc. are there. It has an exclusive faculty and team members, with state-of-art technology to train students to international standards in a multicultural system. This benefits students to compete in the corporate world and easily adapt to multi-ethnicity. They have a wide network of 20 varsities and 50+ clubs and mentors worldwide for enriching the study and training program preparing for the corporate world. They have many partners who are leading respective fields to link the students' theoretical knowledge with the practical world. The diverse learning program offers research projects, internships, and placement to hit career goals. Humber College – North fee per year is CAD 16,059, cost of living is CAD 12,960, and application fee is CAD 75. The bachelor's degree is four years, and other degrees range from 0.6 to 2 years in respective fields. More than 75% of Humber College – North students get placements within six months of passing out due to the exclusive training efficacy. It has on-campus, off-campus, and online programs so that every student can get an opportunity to study over here. Due to international education standards and a wide network, placement facility students prefer to get admitted to this college. It has a moderate acceptance rate; however, students must secure IELTS Score - 6.0 to 7.0, TOEFL p-BT Score - 550 to 600, or PTE Score - 53-64.

Placement: Humber programmes provide students with unique chances for work-integrated learning as they prepare for their future jobs. Through a variety of academic, community, and industrial relationships, students apply what they've learned in class to real-world situations. Field placements, practicums, clinical placements, co-operative education work periods, internships, applied research projects, and service-learning are examples of work-integrated and experiential learning possibilities.  Workplace Advantages Real-world experience and increased employment chancesStudents acquire relevant on-the-job work experience in addition to academic credits, and many of them find potential job possibilities after graduation.People skills development and personal maturity enhancement are examples of social skills.Transitions from academia to paid work are more seamless.Students are better prepared with self-marketing skills and job-search techniques.Students who have participated in work placements report greater pay and overall job satisfaction when they enter the workforce. Workplace Assistance Expertise, direction, and resources are all available.Self-assessmentPreparing your resume and cover letterMock interviews with industry specialists are part of the interview strategy.Branding strategies for professionals (i.e. LinkedIn)Opportunities and tactics for networkingTechniques for researching and interpreting relevant and current information about vocations and the labour market, as well as job search adviceSpecial events, guest speakers, workshops and information sessions relating to job seekingOpportunities for volunteering, placement, and employmentSupporting domestic students seeking overseas work experience and assisting international students in their employment search in Canada  Criteria for Paid Work Term The Paid Work Term is 14 weeks long and lasts 420 hours. It takes place over the summer before Semester 7. (between years 3 and 4)The placement must be relevant to the curriculum and degree programme.The student is responsible for understanding and following the requirements of the Paid Work Term component of the programme.Students are assisted by Placement Advisors in securing their placements.One-on-one employment coaching and job search strategy sessions are available in the Business Career Development Class.Students and employers receive ongoing support while they are on the job.

Name: Northern College - Kirkland Lake
Overview: Established in 1967, Northern college or Northern College of Applied Arts and Technology is a public educational institution. It has an affiliation with CCAA, AUCC and ACCC. It has four campuses- Timmins, Moosonee, Hailey bury and Kirkland. The campus at Kirkland Lake is surrounded by the busy downtown and public amenities, making it easier for students to access civic facilities. The Northern College Kirkland Lake campus has the School of Welding Engineering Technology. It specializes in offering welding education and training. The college became the first recognized training institution for IIW or International Institute for Welding in North America. Some Northern College Kirkland Lake programs include - Welding Design (International), Welding Engineering Technology, etc. 500+scholarships are available to support the education of NC students financially. Besides, each year approximately 1000 eligible students receive bursaries, scholarships and awards. It invests more than $700,000 in scholarships, awards and bursaries annually. The Students can access bookstores to purchase textbooks and other essentials. Moreover, a free parking facility is available on campus. The Northern College offers an academic pathway that allows students to transfer within, into, and out of the NC. Professionals busy with their schedules can opt for online distance learning. Some of the courses available for online learning are - Accounting (Business), General Arts and Science, Law Clerk, Mineral Exploration Techniques etc. With the Employ All program, students with disabilities can receive support to find suitable jobs and prepare for interviews, among others. Students of Northern college who are willing to work on-campus do not require a work permit. In the case of off-campus, students only need to hold a Study Permit to work off-campus during their week for up to 20 hours educational sessions. They can also work full-time during the scheduled breaks. For this, they do not need to own a separate work permit. If students have enrolled for an internship, they must require an Internship Work Permit in addition to a Study Permit.

Placement: The students must get an Internship Work Permit if they are enrolled in a programme that requires mandatory co-op or internship terms (along with your Study Permit). If the co-op/internship begins in the first term of classes, the application for the Co-op/Internship Work Permit must be submitted at the same time as the Study Permit. In case of procedural delays, one should apply for co-op/internship work visa at least three months before the internship begins. This application is free of charge. If the student has a valid Study Permission, the employment in question is a prerequisite of the programme, and/or the employment represents less than 50% of the programme, the students are eligible for this permit. Citizenship and Immigration Canada has information on study permit processing times. On-Campus Work: There is no need for a work permit. The student must have a valid Study Permit and be enrolled full-time to be able to work on campus (except during scheduled breaks & the last term before graduation). Off-Campus Work: If you are granted a Study Permit, you will be instantly authorised can work off-campus for 20 hours per week throughout the school year the academic session and full-time during specified breaks. If the applicants are granted a Study Permit, they will not need to apply for a separate work permit. Post-Graduation Work Permit: Under the Post-Graduation Work Permit (PGWP) programme, international students who have completed a Northern College diploma can acquire an Open Work Permit (valid for 1 to 3 years depending on the length of your programme of study) with no restrictions on employment type and no job offer requirement. The PGWP application must be submitted within 90 days of receiving your final grades or proof of graduation, whichever comes first, and while your Study Permit is still valid. Open Work Permit for Spouses: If the student is a full-time Northern College student with a valid Study Permit, the respective spouse or common-law partner may apply for a Work Permit. The spouse/partner will not need a job offer to apply, and his/her permit will be valid for about the same amount of time as the student

Name: University of Montreal
Overview: The University of Montreal is a French-language public research university located in Quebec, Canada, established in 1878. The University of Montreal has 8 different campuses. The main campus is spread over 65 hectares of land and other campuses are the Laval campus, MIL Campus, Saint-Hyacinthe Campus. It is recognized for its higher education and offers 600 study programs through 13 faculties including Law, Dentistry, Medicine, Nursing, Arts and Science, Music, Optometry, etc. Different campuses of the university offer education in different fields. HEC Montreal is the management institute that offers programs in business administration, management, and finance, etc., Polytechnique Montreal offers programs that specialize in civil, chemical, electrical, computer, mechanical, and other fields of engineering. The School of Public Health is the largest provider of public health training in Canada and the School of Optometry is the only French-language school in Canada that provides a doctoral degree in Optometry. The other specialized programs provided by the university to its students are Library and Information Management, Veterinary Science, Mathematics, Statistical, and Operational Research, Computer Science and Information Systems, Pharmacy, etc. The University Language Centre provides programs in over 15 languages. The annual fee of the courses offered at the university approximately ranges between CAD 9,893 and 23,083 The University provides housing facilities to its students at the University. The on-campus single room cost around CAD 380 a month and CAD 4,560 a year. There are affordable rooms near the University for the students who want to live off-campus which ranges between CAD 4,800 and 6,000 per year. The University of Montreal offers scholarships to its international students. Postgraduate students can avail part-time job opportunities on campus such as lecturing, teaching assistantships, research assistantships, etc. The University provides various online resources and materials to enhance career skills, employability, and the job search process. The university conducts various events such as workshops, career quizzes, and networking for its students.
Eligibility Overview: International students wishing to study in Quebec must meet certain government of Quebec and government of Canada regulations. International students must first receive a Québec Acceptance Certificate (CAQ), a study permit, and, in some cases, a visitor visa from the Government of Canada after being accepted to UdeM.After receiving your formal letter of admission from UdeM, contact the Quebec authorities and the Canadian diplomatic post in your country of residency to obtain these documents. You must demonstrate that you have been admitted to UdeM as a full-time student and that you have adequate financial resources.It's also important to remember that you'll need to get a guest visa and a study permit before coming to Canada.
Accommodation: Regular full-time students are only allowed to live on campus. The number of rooms available is extremely restricted, and there is no accommodation for couples (with or without children). The request form and flier for the fall session will be available in mid-February, and registration will begin on March 1. Housing requests for the winter term are placed on a waiting list. A single room costs roughly $380 per month, and you must sign a leasefor more information click on this link-http://www.bei.umontreal.ca/english/mtl_logement.htm
Course Ranking: The University of Montreal provides a wide range of courses in 14 distinct academic fields, including Business, Arts, Polytechnic, Nursing, Social Sciences, Law, Engineering, Medicine, and Dentistry. Business, engineering, and computer courses are some of the University of Montreal courses that have been ranked; more information is provided below: PG Business & Economics courses are ranked #98 by THE for 2021. For the year 2021, PG Computers courses are ranked at #34 and PG Engineering & Technology courses are ranked between 251-300.
University Ranking: While the University of Montreal is ranked among the top 100 universities in Canada, it is also among the top 200 worldwide. The University of Montreal is ranked #140 in the 2021 US News & World Report rankings, moving up one spot from the previous year. The academics, admissions, courses, general rankings, etc. of the university have a significant impact on these US News & World Report rankings. Admissions at the University of Montreal have a significant impact. Therefore, universities are ranked according to these criteria. THE places University of Montreal at #73 for 2021, one spot higher than US News & World Report. The University of Montreal is ranked #118 by QS in 2021, better than THE but lower than US News & World Report. The University of Montreal scored above average on the following ranking criteria: international student ratio (88.3), faculty student ratio (74.1), academic reputation (56.6), employer reputation (52.5), and overall score (57.3), which is above average and shows that the university performs admirably in all significant facets of its role.

Name: langara College
Overview: Langara College is a public college in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The institution was founded in 1965 as a division of Vancouver City College, offering courses and programs at the King Edward Centre.More than 23,000 students receive the institution's autonomous university, career, and continuing education programs each year. The institution provides classes for theatre arts, creative writing, digital and art publishing, photography, and art history.The institution also offers cooperative education programs so students can take part-time jobs while still in school and earn money. Students can also participate in exchange programs to spend a semester abroad in Korea or Japan. Langara College offers many scholarships to assist students financially, including the Chapoton Hall Scholarship, the Langara Bursary, Canada Students Loans, Work on Campus, and Beyond the Classroom Award.The college ranks 99 in the country, according to Webometrics. The college's acceptance rate is 85%, and the employment rate is around 95%. The biggest advantage is the affordability that Langara offers. The tuition fees are much lower than most universities in Canada.

Placement: Langara College provides a cooperative education program for courses, allowing students to earn and gain work experience while studying. It also provides internship opportunities to students through its network of companies. Students can log in to the C3 Job board, an online career management system that helps them look for suitable jobs. The college furthermore offers support by providing resume templates, interview practice, and more. They feature a job board where students may search for full- or part-time employment. The following are the average salaries of graduates in different job positions: Business Manager - CAD 72,065 per yearWeb Designer - CAD 52,072 per year03Mobile Application Developer - CAD 71,000 per yearMarketing Manager - CAD 66,184 per yearBiologist - CAD 58,551 per year
Accommodation: There are no accommodations available on-campus at Langara College. However, you have the option of living in one of the houses in the area. A common place for Langara college students to live is GEC residence.  The monthly rent for shared residences ranges from 500 to 1000 CAD.  The college is surrounded by residents of various racial, ethnic, and religious backgrounds and is situated in Vancouver, the largest city in British Columbia. Students who visit the mountains and the ocean tend to have better mental health and experience less stress. This says a lot about the kind of lifestyle that students at Langara College can expect. The college is also close to shopping centres like Oakridge Center, making it simple for students to get the necessary supplies. Students can easily get around Vancouver without owning a private transportation vehicle, thanks to buses, SkyTrain, and Seabuses. Students experience the entirety of Vancouver within their budget when enrolling at Langara College.

Name: Sault College - Sault Ste. Marie
Overview: Established in 1967, Sault College is known for blending education with extra-curricular activities and refreshment ideas. The college has received several affiliations, including CCAA, ACCC, AUCC. Over the years, the college has successfully improved its services to accommodate both in-state and international students with diverse programs. Currently, Sault College serves more than 2600 students in full-time courses. The college enables the students to undertake the courses for receiving certificates, diplomas and degrees with more than 160 programs. Some of the popular programs here are in Design and applied arts, Nursing, Telecommunication, Gerontology, Cosmetology, Social work and so on. Some of the common facilities on campus include internet and Wi-Fi, television and cable, games, kitchen and laundry. Located in Ontario, Canada, the Sault Ste. Marie campus of the college serves the maximum number of students, being the main campus. Library, gym, study hall and dining space have made the accommodation easier for students. According to the 2020 Student Satisfaction Key Performance Indicators, Sault College ranking shows its first position for quality education and student satisfaction in Ontario. While the college has been generous with its acceptance rate, it requires the applicants to have a minimum score of 6.0 in their IELTS examination. The college believes in smaller class sizes with a balanced student-faculty ratio. The decided fees structure can be affordable for international students, currently between $14,000 and $18,000. The students can apply for annual scholarship schemes after checking the eligibility criteria. About 91% of the graduate students of this college are employed within six months of their graduation. The college also offers on-the-job work experience opportunities for the final year students and groom them for future employment. The students can also find job updates on the placement section of the college website.

Name: College lAvenir de Rosemont
Overview: College I'Avenir de Rosemont is a private institute located in the center of Montreal, Canada. Students who want to work with children can apply to this college's Early Childhood Education Techniques program. It is a 1260-hour program, divided into 885 contact hours for visits, workshops, labs, courses, and conferences and 375 hours for the workplace. The students get practical and theoretical knowledge to work with children from 0 to 12 years. Students who complete the course earn a Collegial Studies in Childhood Education Technique certificate, which opens up various employment opportunities. The course is in two languages: English and French. Also, the class size is smaller, ensuring better and more personalized learning. The college aims to provide knowledge, tools, and interpersonal and professional skills for the students to develop their careers in education, particularly in early childhood education and care. Many daycare centers recognized by the Ministry of Family have an excellent network with the college. It assures easy employment access and paid internship options to its students. International students can get a work permit after completing the course.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria and admission requirements are described below: Academics12th pass in Arts or Medical background Undergraduate or Graduate Bachelors of Science, B Ed, B.A, or GNM English Language ProficiencyEnglish proficiency test score - minimum requirements are as follows: IELTS score of 6.0 with a minimum of 5 in each band PTE Score Required: 53 Overall Score not less than 50TOEFL iBT: 80 ScoreDuolingo English Test Score: 105 Score
Placement: The technical program trains students to offer education and basic care to children. It will provide the skills to work as a childcare staff per the law on educational childcare services and the regulation in force. Students can work at the following places- Childcare CentresSchool Daycare Coordinating OfficesHome Childcare ServicesSchool Daycare ServicesEarly Childhood CentresFamily Daycare CentresKindergartensCommunity Recreation CentresPrivate Daycares in Subsidised and Unsubsidised Facilities
Accommodation: The college provides assistance services to its international students for housing and necessary support. The cost of living in Montreal is estimated to be $12,960 CAD per year. It is low compared to the other Canadian provinces. Also, the nearby college area has shopping centers, restaurants, and entertainment options.

Name: Lakehead University
Overview: Lakehead University is a public university established in 1846 by the order-in-council of the Province of Ontario. It has two campuses- Thunder Bay (main campus) and Orillia in Ontario, Canada. The university offers many undergraduate, graduate, doctoral, diploma, and certificate courses to students worldwide. There are nine faculties, including Education, Engineering, Medicine, Business Administration, Faculty of Health and Behavioural Sciences, Science and Environmental Studies, Science and Humanities, and Natural Resources Management. It is a student-centric and dynamic university with 319 full-time faculty and 1,850 staff. After graduating from the university, 97.7% of graduates get jobs in reputed companies within two years of completing the course.

Placement: The goal of Lakehead is for all of its students to graduate and pursue their ideal careers. They participate from the outset to make sure this occurs. Together with you, the student support services will create a strategy to help you comprehend the course's objectives and general direction. They make sure you are on track to graduate. Student advisors assist you in making plans for the future as you get closer to graduation by creating attainable goals based on your interests. The college assists you in finding suitable employment through its job bank. They also help you create a strong CV and be ready for interviews. Lakehead alumnus work in top companies like Vimeo, Baffinland, and National Hockey League. As per Lakehead University, around 97.7% of its students get employed within two years of graduating.  The average salary of the graduates from Lakehead University is listed below:  Lakehead University also offers placement assistance to its students in the following ways: Events and workshops to learn career-oriented skills Networking opportunities to build meaningful connectionsMajor maps program and career pathway tool specified to your programResources and tools required to get a decent job such as resume and cover letter resources, interview resources and job searching tools

Because there is an abundance of assistance and services offered on-site. As Lakehead will handle all your chores, you don't need to worry about them. You may give your studies your undivided attention. Along with safe, fully furnished rooms, you get to enjoy various events conducted on-campus. The residences even provide different meals of different types like Asian, halal, gluten-free, vegetarian and more.  If you wish to live off-campus, the university has plenty of resources on its website that will give you a head start. All in all, we advise you to be safe and research enough before finalizing.

Name: Parkland College
Overview: Situated in the Yorkton area of Saskatchewan, Canada, Parkland College was founded in 1973. It was established as Parkland Regional College, but later, in 2008, it was renamed Parkland College. Parkland College registers more than 600 full-time students and 1,650 students every year. It offers various study programs such as diplomas, bachelor's degrees, certificates, and adult education. The College also regularly holds multiple cultural, art, and other recreational programmes. The College is highly recognised and has been accredited by the government. It has six campuses across the state, a training centre in Yorkton in Eastern Saskatchewan, and its main campus. Other campuses of this College are in Melville, Esterhazy, Fort Qu'Appelle, Canora, and Kamsack. Parkland College also provides evening, part-time and online courses for its students. It provides education in business, agriculture, arts, early childhood education, dentistry, kinesiology, global trade, nursing, and law. It offers pharmacy, power engineering, veterinary medicine, and Microsoft project training. It helps international students gain the necessary skills required for working in Canada. Parkland College is also known for providing the best placements for its students across various renowned companies. According to the latest data, college graduates earn around $ 45,135 per annum.The College also provides housing on rent for its students covering the food for about 9000 CAD per annum. The average cost of living is around 40000 CAD, which covers the living costs, additional costs, tuition fees, and placement fees.
Eligibility Overview: Transcripts from your previous high school or college. Official transcripts from other languages notarized and translated into English. Tests of English language proficiency (such as IELTS) A copy of the first and last pages of an international passport is required.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: AccommodationsProvided to students who are differently abled only: To qualify for accommodations, official documentation of disability must be provided to Accessibility Services. You will need to communicate with your adviser for finalized accommodation details once you have completed the necessary forms.Check this link for more details: https://www.parkland.edu/Main/About-Parkland/Department-Office-Directory/Counseling-Services/Accessibility-Services/Accommodations

Name: University of Toronto
Overview: The University of Toronto, popularly known as UToronto, is a public research university located in Toronto, Ontario, Canada, and was founded in 1827. The university has been one of Canada's foremost institutions in learning and research. The university offers over 700 undergraduate courses, 200 postgraduate courses, and various research-driven programs. These courses are available in various disciplines, such as business, engineering, humanities, arts, medicine, and education.The university is ranked highly in the QS World Rankings at 26 due to its research and innovative edge. UToronto's research in stem cells, electron microscopy, and the discovery of insulin has made the university earn its place among the world's best.The University of Toronto has three campuses through which it operates. The first one is located in Downtown Toronto, St. George. The second is in Mississauga, and the third one is located in Scarborough.  UToronto has one of North America's largest and most successful intercollegiate sports programs, with over 900 Varsity players on 44 teams across 26 sports.
Eligibility Overview: The University of Toronto does not have any pre-set cut-off averages due to the strength and quantity of the candidate pool. The applications are also evaluated in light of the other criteria. According to recent applicants, the following table shows the average grades that are considered competitive for a few major university programmes:  ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY TESTS: Since most of the classes are conducted in English, it is required that you produce proof of your English proficiency. There are many popular English language tests you can choose from. The tests accepted by the University of Toronto and the minimum requirements are as follows:

Placement: The University of Toronto does not provide campus placements on its own. However, like most universities overseas, UToronto will assist you in every way possible to equip you with the skills necessary to find a job on your own. The University of Toronto has the reputation of producing some highly skilled graduates; naturally, companies look forward to hiring from there. The college has a dedicated career page on its website to make it easier for the students. More than 16,000 industry partners regularly approach students with opportunities and engage them in various activities. Currently, the number of opportunities listed on the website is more than 13,000, including on-campus, off-campus, and volunteering work! Your course and efforts significantly impact the job you acquire and the salary you make. Typically, UToronto students frequently land well-paying jobs. Below is the record of average salaries for different courses.

University Ranking: The University of Toronto was established in 1827 as the King's College and adopted its current name in 1850. Name: New York Tech - Vancouver (NYIT)
Overview: New York Institute of Technology, or New York Tech, was established in 1955. MSCHE accredits this institute and holds affiliation with NAICU. AACSB International recognises the institute’s School of Management. It has five campuses – New York, Jonesboro, Long Island, Vancouver, and China. Vancouver as a city is among the top three cities in the world to reside. Students can access all essential public amenities and famous cultural, dining and shopping venues Vancouver campus. New York Institute of Technology Vancouver courses include M.B.A, Master of Science in Cybersecurity and Energy Management. It also provides M.S in Instructional Technology, M.B.A in Finance. It houses nearly 2,100 international students. The campus is equipped with state-of-the-art computer labs, lounges, etc. The Graduate Student Association is available to address student concerns. It also allows students to engage in volunteering activities. One can join in sponsored educational and networking events. It conducts distance learning classes where students and professors communicate with other international campuses in Abu Dhabi, China, and New York. It also arranges several campus events to explore the areas of Vancouver. Students can reside in off-campus housing accommodation in GEC. The New York Institute of Technology Vancouver M.B.A fees depend on the credits students must require to complete M.B.A. For example, students requiring 30 credits may need to pay approximately $31,920. Students who require 48 credits may need to pay $52,185. Other fees vary with each course. According to the Cyber Degree EDU 2021, it holds a rank in 33rd and is one of the best schools to receive a degree in cybersecurity. According to New York Tech, 94% of the graduates have secured employment within a year of graduation, and some of them continue to pursue higher education. Students can access the online career portal, CareerShift, to browse employment opportunities. It also offers training to build professional resumes and develop interview skills.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria for applicants are as follows :  A bachelor's degree or its equivalent in computer science, engineering, management, mathematics, information technology, liberal arts, and allied fields from an approved institution or university.An accredited programme is one that has been approved by the Engineering Accreditation Commission of the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology if you have a degree in engineering (ABET).An accredited programme is one taken at an institution that is regionally accredited, such as the Middle States Association of Colleges and Schools, if you have finished degrees in computer science or a closely related discipline.If you have an international baccalaureate degree or diploma in computer science, engineering, or a related field that is comparable to three years of undergraduate study in the United States, you may be qualified for a bridge option in your desired graduate programme. For full matriculation, a minimum undergraduate GPA of 2.85 is required.You may be allowed at the dean's discretion if you do not meet this condition. Scores on the Graduate Record Examination or other diagnostic examinations to aid in the evaluation of your credentials are also considered. Your records may be released after you have completed nine graduate credits and met all pre-curriculum prerequisites. GRE scores must be submitted.Foreign university graduates are required to take the GRE and submit their results.If your GPA is less than 2.85, you may be requested to take the GRE or other diagnostic tests at the dean's discretion. Test results, previous academic performance, and relevant employment, if appropriate, will all be taken into account when determining admission.
Accommodation: GEC is Vancouver's largest off-campus student housing, offering great pricing, appealing locations, and the best in amenities to help you succeed in your studies. GEC reinvents student housing by providing fully furnished and move-in ready shared and private apartments, all-inclusive amenities, an on-site management team, and adjustable monthly rates with a simple booking process. https://vancouver.nyit.edu/housing

Name: Red River College - Exchange District Campus (Roblin Centre)
Overview: Red River College Polytechnic or RRC Polytech is the largest applied learning and research institution in Manitoba. It holds an affiliation with CICan, Campus Manitoba, CCAA, CBIE and CUP. It has a total of 8 campuses - Notre Dame Campus, Exchange District Campus and Stevenson Airport in Winnipeg. The regional campuses include - Portage la Prairie, Interlake and Peguis (Fisher River), Steinbach, Stevenson Southport, and Winkler. Located in the heart of Winnipeg, Exchange District Campus houses three campus buildings. Among them, Roblin Centre provides programs in IT, business, and creative arts. Students can access the bookstore, fitness centre and library. In addition to this, it comprises spacious modern classrooms and advanced equipment. The other two campuses are - Paterson GlobalFoods Institute and Manitou a bi Bii daziigae. Students can access the Red River College Exchange District Campus bookstore to purchase textbooks and other essentials. Security services such as Safe Walk offer escorts to students, visitors, and staff to drop them close to the college or help them reach other facilities at the campus. It has invested $2.9 million+ in scholarships, bursaries and awards to provide financial aid and support students’ education. According to Webometrics, the Red River College ranking is 102nd in Canada. Individuals busy with their professional endeavours can opt for part-time and online academic programs to upgrade existing skills or careers. Willing individuals can select from the available courses such as Business and Creative Arts, IT, Health Sciences, Education and Community Services to earn online certificates. Approximately 95% of graduates secure employment after graduating from Red River College. Multiple career assistance facilities such as internship and mentorship programs such as Career Edge, volunteer opportunities, and resume writing facilities are available. Some notable alumni graduated from this college, such as Chris Jericho, Rod Black, and Randy Bachman.
