Name: Canadian Tourism College
Overview: Based in British Columbia, The Canadian Tourism College is a private university and one of the few institutions from Canada to receive the Education Quality Assurance Award. It is owned and operated by the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC).This institute has two campuses in British Columbia - one in Surrey and the other in Vancouver and is also renowned for housing several South Asians residing in British Columbia. Canadian Tourism College programs include certificate, diploma and online certificate programs in disciplines like Travel and Tourism, Flight Attendant and Hospitality.Though CTC does not extend any on-campus accommodation facilities for international and domestic students, students can get in touch with CTC International Admission Coordinator. Alternatively, they can reach out to the International Language Academy of Canada and request accommodation services. The Travel and Tourism, and Hospitality programs at CTC are regarded as one of the best.Students can also opt for co-op opportunities for combining their regular curriculum along with paid work experience. Travel Agent Certificate and Events & Meeting Planning Certificate are two online programs offered by the Canadian Tourism College. International students not fluent in English can opt for In-person and Online English Assessment courses. Canadian Tourism College admissions occur on a rolling basis throughout the year.This institute extends scholarships ranging between 500 to 10000 CAD to those willing to learn about the tourism industry. Several other loans and scholarships are available for international students. These include BCCHS Scholarships, Surrey Partners36 Scholarships, John F. Hamilton Scholarship, BC John M.Toomer Education Scholarship, India Canada Cultural Association of Victoria Scholarship, and more. Besides these, the Canada and British Columbia Student Aid helps students with grants, scholarships and loans for post-secondary education.Some organizations that hire CTC graduates include Central Mountain Air, WestJet, Fairmont Hotels, Swissport, Princess Cruises, Red Mountain Resort, Pan Pacific Hotels, Hyatt Regency, Air Canada, Air North, Apex Mountain Resort.

Name: Humber College - International Graduate School
Overview: Humber College International Graduate School is a public college established in 1967 in Ontario, Canada. It has three campuses; Lakeshore, Humber, and Humber Orangeville. Its amenities, curriculum structure, fees, placement, and other features attract students worldwide. This institute offers full-time, part-time, and professional courses in various disciplines. Every year it imparts education to 29,000+ full-time and 1,500 part-time students. There are 200 programs in bachelor, post-graduation, and apprentice courses. To get admission, students have to secure IELTS Score- of 6.0 to 7.0, a TOEFL IBT Score- of 550 to 600, or PTE Score- 53-64. Humber College International Graduate School courses are science, arts, commerce, engineering, health science, marketing, business communication, architectural technology, etc. The classrooms have wireless technology to empower the students with practical demonstrations technically. Laboratories have all high-technology systems, research centres, playgrounds, swimming pools, food courts, libraries, etc., of international standard. After completing training or course, the Humber College International Graduate School placement and internship program trains students to be job-ready. They have 2,40,000 alumni who are industry players in their respective subjects. Students from more than 138 countries apply to this college to get the best education, training, and placement. It offers scholarships and grants to students in a financial crisis. It provides both on-campus and off-campus accommodation to students. Its acceptance rate is high due to its vast infrastructure, facilities, and capacity. More than 85% of students get a job within six months of graduating from this college. Humber College International Graduate School tuition fee is CAD 17,000 to CAD 22,000 per year. It has a pro-active placement service with a global network to place students in jobs at the earliest. The employee satisfaction rate is high, and recruiters worldwide prefer to recruit students from this institution.
Eligibility Overview: If English is not a student’s first language, or if their previous education was in another language, students will be required to demonstrate proficiency in English by completing and submitting the results of ONE of the following evaluation methods at the level relative to their applied program(s): For any program level, a minimum of two years of full-time study at the secondary school level in an English language school system in a country where English is considered the primary language, or the primary language of instruction and evaluation is English, with acceptable grades in all English courses. For any program level, a minimum of two full years of successful study in an accredited university degree program or two full years of successful study in an accredited college diploma program in a country OR in a postsecondary institution where English is the primary language of instruction.English proficiency test scores from one of the international English language testing bodies listed below. Tests taken within the last 24 months are considered valid for academic programs. Tests taken for placement into English for Academic Purposes (EAP) are considered valid within the last 18 months. Please refer to the minimum English proficiency test scores below

Name: Carleton University
Overview: Carleton University, or CU, is a public university in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada. It was founded in 1942 and is renowned for promoting experiential learning with an active and interdisciplinary approach. Carleton offers an array of more than 200 undergraduate and postgraduate courses in approx. 50+ disciplines. Some popular majors at Carleton University are Computer Science, Engineering & Technology, Physics, Social Sciences, Arts & Humanities, Business Management, Economics, Life Sciences & Psychiatry. The university's main campus is spread across 62 hectares of land situated south of Ottawa City center near the Rideau Canal. The campus combines 35+ buildings linked by 5 kilometers of underground tunnels. The Career Service Center of the University provides various placement and practical learning opportunities for students like on-campus jobs, work-study programs, international & domestic internships on a paid basis, volunteering opportunities, work abroad jobs after study, and various other workshops. The average annual tuition fee for an undergraduate student at Carleton is 33,990 CAD, and for graduate students, the yearly cost of attendance is 23,490 CAD, regardless of additional overheads. In addition, Carleton University offers around 12,000+ scholarships and bursary programs to its students worth 24 million CAD in approx. Carleton University provides students with on-campus housing facilities with two living styles at their residential complexes: Traditional and Suite. In addition, the university collaborates with Places4Students.com, a website for off-campus accommodation students in their budget and their requirements for those who want to reside off-campus.

Accommodation: Carleton University provides students with both on-campus and off-campus housing options. The Residence Complex offers two types of living arrangements: traditional and suite-style.  Carleton University's on-campus housing costs 9 lakhs per year. 3,600 students have chosen to remain on campus.  Carleton University's Places4Students program assists students in finding off-campus housing.
Course Ranking: Carleton is divided into six faculties and offers various academic programmes. They are the Faculty of Science (est.1963), Faculty of Graduate & Postdoctoral Affairs (est.1974), Faculty of Public Affairs (est.1997), Faculty of Engineering & Design (est.1963), Faculty of Arts & Social Sciences (est.1997), and Sprott School of Business (est:2006). The university is listed between 501 and 600 by The Times Higher Education (THE) for taking PG Business and Economics courses. The institution has received rankings for engineering programmes in the range of 201-250 (2021) for THE PG Engineering and Technology and 451-500 (2020) for QS Engineering and Technology Subject rankings. THE (Times Higher Education) - PG Computers Ranking has consistently placed Carleton University in the top 400 for the last three years, 2019–2021.
University Ranking: The institute, originally known as Carleton College, was established in 1942 to assist returning World War II veterans. In 1952, the provincial government granted the institute university status, and in 1957 it adopted the name Carleton University. When compared to the university's rankings in 2018 (489), 2019 (483), and 2020 (483), the US News & World Report, which is exclusive to the US, has Carleton University ranked at 471 for 2021. Reputation Indicators, including Bibliometric Indicators, Scientific Excellence Indicators, and Global and Regional Research Reputation, are considered by US News & World Report. For the current year, 2021, the institution has received rankings from QS World University Ranking and THE (Times Higher Education), which consider academic and research repute. These rankings place the university at 601-650 and 501-600, respectively. Check out the Carleton University Admissions 2021 page. In the 2020 ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) ranking, which considers citations written and the amount of Nobel Prizes received by faculty, Carleton University is ranked between 501 and 600.

Name: Mount Royal University
Overview: Mount Royal University, founded in 1910, is one of the premier public universities in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. With around 12 degree disciplines and 33 major courses, Mount Royal University provides a learning experience to approximately 10,000 students. The university provides courses in every discipline, namely business studies, journalism, science, and technology. Mount Royal University is a prime spot for international students willing to study in Canada. The university has two campuses, one of which is the Lincoln Park Campus, which is the main campus, and the other one is the Springbank campus.
Eligibility Overview: To apply to Mount Royal University, international students must meet the following minimum eligibility requirements:
Eli Table:
Eligibility Requirements
  • The student must be a high-school graduate with a minimum of 65% in their academics.
  • The most recent GPA of the student should be at least 2.0
  • An English proficiency test is required for international students.
Language Test Requirement

International students are required to provide an English language test score. 

  • TOEFL: 86
  • IELTS: 6.5
Placement: Mount Royal University provides extensive services to students to assist them as they venture into the professional world. With a diversified network and significant social backing, graduates can get a job in their desired field within a year of graduation, getting employment in various sectors and across multiple companies.  Mount Royal University has an individual cell to help you build resumes and cover letters and assist them in finding opportunities to get practical knowledge and help them land a job.
Accommodation: Mount Royal University provides on-campus accommodation to around 1,000 students. However, the students can also choose off-campus housing or a homestay. The on-campus residence, divided into two wings, East and West, has dormitories equipped with all the essentials that a student requires to live comfortably. The average cost of living around the university is $3,100.
University Ranking: Mount Royal University (MRU) is one of Canada's leading universities in Calgary, Alberta. Founded in 1910, MRU is a public university that offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs. MRU is ranked among the top universities in Canada and is highly respected for its academic excellence and research capabilities. MRU is ranked in the top 10 universities in Canada according to Maclean's Magazine's 2021 rankings. MRU is ranked 8th in the Primarily Undergraduate category, which looks at universities focusing on undergraduate studies. MRU is also ranked 8th in the Comprehensive category, which looks at universities that offer a wide range of programs and services. MRU is also ranked 8th in the Medical/Doctoral category, which looks at universities that provide medical and doctoral programs. MRU is also ranked among the top universities in Canada according to the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. MRU is ranked in the 501-600 range in the World University Rankings, which looks at universities from around the world. MRU is also ranked in the 201-250 range in the Times Higher Education Impact Rankings, which looks at universities positively impacting society. MRU is also ranked among the top universities in Canada according to the QS World University Rankings. MRU is ranked in the 551-600 range in the World University Rankings, which looks at universities from around the world. MRU is also ranked in the 251-300 range in the QS Graduate Employability Rankings, which looks at universities that produce graduates who are highly sought after by employers. Overall, MRU is one of the top universities in Canada and is highly respected for its academic excellence and research capabilities. MRU is ranked among the top 10 universities in Canada according to Maclean's Magazine's 2021 rankings and in the top 500 universities in the world according to the Times Higher Education World University Rankings and the QS World University Rankings. MRU is also highly ranked in the Times Higher Education Impact Rankings and the QS Graduate Employability Rankings, which look at universities that produce graduates who are highly sought after by employers.

Name: Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University
Overview: Ryerson University, frequently referred to as RyeU or RU, is a public research university established in 1948 in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. Ryerson offers seven academic faculties and has various degrees for undergraduate and specialized minor programs. The most popular majors students opt for at RU are Computer Science, Social Sciences & Public Health,Arts & Humanities, Business & Economics, Psychology, and Electrical & Electronic Engineering. The Central Campus of the University is located within the Garden District of Toronto and operates two more campuses across the city: Centennial College and George Brown College. At Ryerson, over 130 part-time, full-time, professional development, and online programs are offered, and it also provides distance education in more than 400 continuing education courses, including 300+ degree credit programs. The ideal student-faculty ratio at Ryerson is 23:1, which helps students seek various career opportunities and boosts their confidence, morale, and skill-set. The university offers several opportunities like the Work-Study Program, Jobs-On Campus, Summer and Fall/Winter Career Boost Approval, Internships on a paid basis, and Jobs-Off Campus after completing their degrees. Ryerson University has three residence buildings on campus: HOEM Residence, Pitman Hall, and the International Living & Learning Centre. Students can also stay off-campus and visit Ryerson Housing and Residences to find their ideal residence.The institution also offers several financial aid opportunities to international students via scholarships, fee waivers, bursaries, and work-study programs. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, may be approximately $28,570–$38,430 CAD, which may differ for international students.

Placement: This course prepares students for a 150-hour field placement at a company that deals with immigration or settlement policy, programmes, or services. Students apply and test their classroom learning in real-world contexts such immigrant-serving organisations, newcomer community organisations, schools, and government departments through placements. Students attend presentations by practitioners on policy creation, service delivery, and advocacy during the Winter semester. Students typically finish their placement during the Spring/Summer semester, while there is some flexibility to meet individual needs and goals.  Field placements are intended to assist students in bridging the gap between classroom information, theoretical discussions, and real-world job experiences. They provide pupils with the opportunity to learn by doing. This helps in building the following skills :  Grasp how companies' mandates impact their "culture," rules, practices, and interpersonal behaviour to improve their abilities and understanding of the fieldFind out about the obstacles that immigrant-serving organisations face in today's ever-changing environment.Expand their knowledge of problems such as diversity, power, privilege, and injustice. Students can also do the following during their field placement: Investigate personal identity concernsFind out more about value systemsFind possibilities for self-directed learningTime management and prioritizationMake professional connections
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation If you live on campus, the students will have the opportunity to make friends from many walks of life and participate in residential and campus life. It's your chance to be at the center of what's going on on-campus and in the city of Toronto.  There are dedicated personnel within Housing and Residence Life who are here to facilitate your transition to living independently, in addition to the students you will meet and learn from during the school year. Building access is constantly monitored by the Residence Service Desk employees to ensure that the residential buildings are safe and supportive communities. It is easier to live in a residence as the facilities are close to the classes, public transportation, and other conveniences. Within the department, professionals, peers, and student leaders are dedicated to ensuring that every one of the residents has a successful academic year. For more information, visit: https://www.ryerson.ca/housing/

For its PG Business and Economics programmes, the university received a ranking from The Times Higher Education in the range of 501–600.According to Times Higher Education's rankings for its PG Engineering and Technology programme from 2020 to 2022, Ryerson University's engineering programmes were ranked between 301 and 400. The university's engineering and technology programmes were placed between 389 by QS Subject Ranking in 2021. Times Higher Education has ranked the university between positions 501 and 600 for those interested in studying PG Computers.
University Ranking: The Ted Rogers School of Management, the third-largest undergraduate engineering school in Canada, and the Faculty of Engineering and Architectural Science, along with the faculties of arts, communication & design, community services, and science, are all located at Ryerson University, a public research university in Ontario, Canada.According to the ARWU Shanghai Ranking, Ryerson University is now positioned between 801 and 900 for 2021 and between 901 and 1000 for 2019 and 2020. For four years in a row, from 2018 to 2022, QS World University Ranking placed the university anywhere between 801 and 1000. For 2020, 2021, and 2022, Times Higher Education placed the university between 601 and 800, and between 801 and 1000. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).

Course Description: Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University was founded in 1948. Located in Toronto ,Canada the university is home to about 3314 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University is ranked 801th in Top Universities by Times Higher Education. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 4 postgraduate programs. Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University has 2 intakes in Sep,Feb. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University is around $29945-$38457 CAD approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University include Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award,Ontario Graduate Scholarship Masters Program.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University is the post-study work opportunities in Canada. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Toronto Metropolitan University - Ryerson University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Cegep Marie Victorin
Overview: Cegep Marie Victorin is among the top public universities for higher education in Canada. It is primarily a French public college located in the east of Montreal, Quebec.  With a student base of more than 4,100 students, Cegep Marie Victorin follows a specialized curriculum that makes the institution unique and one of a kind.For Undergraduate entrance, students must have an overall IELTS score of 6.0 with no less than 5.5; for Postgraduate entry, students must have an overall IELTS score of 6.5 with no less than 5.5.The average tuition fee is 33,980 USD. International students are eligible for the Canada Undergraduate Scholarship and merit-based grants. Students at Cegep are offered international internships, foreign exchange programs, and exclusive placement offers.

Name: FH International High School
Overview: Located in Scarborough, Canada, the FH International High School offers a curriculum for grades 9 to 12. Their 25,000 square feet campus provides a warm, homey feeling while providing academic services for the development of the students. The high school aims to empower the students with active learning and independent thinking. Apart from their academic and educational improvement, the school tries to help the students provoke their creative impulses. They have focused their literary culture on a practical-oriented education system. FH International High School subjects include science, technology, engineering, mathematics, and arts (STEM-A). While aiming at higher academic scores, the teachers encourage the students to voice their opinions and use experimental teaching to incorporate an innovative approach. The teachers here ensure that they follow a non-standardised program pace to help every student individually. FH International High School encourages international students to participate in their courses annually. In this regard, the school and its teachers have been open about diverse cultures, backgrounds, and varying levels of English knowledge. Keeping this in mind, the teachers have customised lesson plans for students based on their specific requirements. They can choose to have one-on-one IELTS courses if their needs require it. The school maintains a student-faculty ratio of 5:1 in the classes and focuses on thinking rather than memorising. The summer and winter camps and other language programs further help international students improve their English-speaking abilities. The school's location is in Scarborough, on the borders of Victoria Park Avenue.

Name: Simon Fraser University
Overview: Simon Fraser University, located in British Columbia, Canada, is a research-intensive university established in 1965. Simon Fraser University offers undergraduate and postgraduate degree courses, diploma courses, and certificate courses. It offers courses in more than 150 subject areas. The University provides the courses across eight faculties, namely, the Faculty of Applied Sciences, Faculty of Communication, Arts, and Technology, Faculty of Health Sciences, Faculty of Sciences, Faculty of Arts & Social Sciences, Faculty of Education, Beedie School of Business, and Faculty of Environment. The University has four research centers: Health Technology, Health Solution, Big Data, and New Materials and Technology for Sustainability. Some top courses offered by Simon Fraser University are Bachelors in Business Administration, Software systems, Mathematics, Chemistry, Computer Engineering, etc., and Master in Economics, Health Sciences, Psychology, Computing Science, Business Administration, etc. The courses offered at the University cost CAD 4,940 to 49.435 per year. The food and hostel of the University are around CAD 16.626 per year. Scholarships are available to Canadian and International students at the University. Simon Fraser University does not directly administer external scholarships, awards, or bursaries. Instead, it admits students financially through awards, scholarships for undergraduates and graduates on a merit basis, government awards, etc. It also provides excellent campus placement to its students.

Name: St Clair College - Chatham Campus
Overview: St. Clair College of Applied Arts and Technology was founded in 1966. It is situated in the South-western Ontario Counties of Essex and Chatham-Kent. This college's central administration and largest campus sites are in Windsor, Ontario. The other two campuses are in Chatham and Wallaceburg. This college is a branch of the Western Ontario Institute of Technology. This technological institution and the colleges of applied arts and technology combined and formed St. Clair College. This college undoubtedly offered excellent teaching and used to learn with advanced facilities. Students can learn practical, employable skills and make connections. Providing education for more than 50 years, this college offers more than 100 courses across multiple levels, involving diplomas, degrees and graduate courses. Approximately 14,000 students emphasise business, health, media arts, IT, social services, trades, and technology. This college is dedicated to research activities, and nearly 13 faculty members are engaged in research projects. Advanced facilities and various support services highly assist students in their academic journey. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 87.5%, the graduates of this college are employed within six months of their graduation. This college holds a ranking in the top 50 research colleges in Canada. Besides, This College offers various bursaries and scholarships to international students, up to 10,000 CAD per student on average. With an acceptance rate of nearly 44%, this college offers a moderately selective application process. Presently, this college offers almost 8,500 full-time and 20,000 part-time students on the three campuses. Besides, this college also provides apprenticeship and placement programs. St. Clair College also offers professional and corporate training programs which assist students in maintaining a competition during placement.

Name: Northern College - Timmins
Overview: Established in 1967, the Northern College is located in Ontario, Canada. It is mainly known for applied arts and technology programs. Developing this college was a part of the provincial initiative to establish such colleges and provide career-oriented diploma and certificate programs. The college received several prestigious affiliations, such as CCAA, ACCC, and AUCC. Northern College uses four of its campuses for imparting educational services to students. A minimum of 6.0 in IELTS or 79 in TOEFL is mandatory for admission. However, some requirements are course specific. The college services have been effective and generated a general student satisfaction rate of 74%. Moreover, the Northern College fee structure seems affordable for international students, currently between $14,000-$19,000. The scholarship programs available in the college can be helpful for international students if they meet the eligibility criteria. The college looks after the students' employment prospects with industry-specific training modules within the education. About 85% of the students graduating from here have been employed within months following their graduation. The international students can also gain work permits from here for their mandatory co-op or internship after graduation.
Eligibility Overview: The minimum level of education required for admission to any UNDERGRADUATE DIPLOMA at Northern College is Class 12th with a minimum GPA of 50.0 percent or above. For any PG programme, a minimum level of education is required, which is a two-year UG diploma or a bachelor's degree with a grade point average of 50% or higher.For Undergraduate and Graduate ProgramsOverall IELTS score: 6 (Min Listening: 6.0, Min Reading: 6.0, Min Speaking: 6.0, Min Writing: 6.0) Only UG programmes may have a minimum of 5.5 in any one band.Score on the Duolingo English Test: 105PTE Overall: UG: 58 points | PG: 60 pointsScore on the TOEFL iBT: 79
Accommodation: The Timmins campus is located near the Mattagami River in Northeastern Ontario. It has been popular among students for its location and the quality of career-focused services. It has squash courts, gyms, cardio machines, and others. Northern College has welcomed international students and is generous with its acceptance rate. The management ensures to balance of the student population with more than 74 staff members across the college. The Timmins Campus Residence provides a safe, convenient, affordable living environment. Oh, and it's only a few minutes' walk from Porcupine Lake! You'll find just what you're seeking for among the 103 single rooms, 12 suites, and four double rooms. Each room has a private four-piece bathroom, a bed, desk, chair, light, closet, drawers, and phone, cable TV, and internet connections. A big shared kitchen with five cooking stations, laundry facilities, lounges with cable television, and a games area are also available at the homefor more information click on this link-https://www.northernc.on.ca/housing/timmins-porcupine-campus-residence-information/

Name: Douglas College - Coquitlam
Overview: Established in 1970, Douglas College is one of the best degree-granting colleges in British Columbia, Canada. This college comprises two primary campuses in the Metro Vancouver area, Coquitlam and New Westminster. This institution is considered the most accessible post-secondary institution, attracting students across the world. This college also has various smaller training centers in Maple Ridge, Surrey, and Burnaby. This college offers multiple bachelor’s degrees and general university courses, including healthcare, business, creative arts, human services, arts and science courses, and career programs.Besides, this institution offers ten bachelor’s degree programs in Physical education, Nursing, Child and Youth care, Criminology, Business administration, Physical education and coaching, applied psychology, and more. Students can directly interact with the professors as the class size is only 35 students per class.Douglas College offers 1,000-degree programs in association with several top universities. The Coquitlam campus of this college provides top-notch administrative, fitness, academic, and recreational facilities. Moreover, students can avail hands-on experience through field trips, work placements, field schools, and labs. This institution annually grants admission to nearly 4 000 international students from more than 92 countries. This institution offers over 100 short-term and top-quality non-credit courses, workshops, and programs to approximately 8,500 students through the Training Group and Continuing Education in different areas such as health, business, industry training, career development, etc. Students can take up on-campus and off-campus jobs, which their departments will consider. This institution annually extends $100,000 scholarships to international students, where individual awards usually range from $500 to $2,500. Apart from this, this institution offers students confidential, accessible, and professional assistance.

Name: Institut Teccart - Montreal
Overview: The Institut Teccart offers a range of programs at the undergraduate, postgraduate and diploma levels. Since 1945, the institute has been working on its ultimate aim of creating a competent new generation with employment-ready training courses. The three factors set for standardising the education quality here include expertise, knowledge and know-how. Moreover, the institute supports student autonomy by supporting their financial requirements and synthesising their studies with internships and professional projects. As foreign customers represent more than 30% of the total customer base of Institut Teccart, the institute and its management has paid attention to increasing the diversity among the students. For this, they have been less selective in their acceptance rate and have developed scholarship programs for them. Moreover, they have their specialised officers to help such students with course fees, visa settlement and accommodation. Some of the standard degree programs of the university include Instrumentation and Automation, Computer Management, Telecommunication, Casualty Insurance, Broker Commercial Real Estate and several others. The Montreal campus of Institut Teccart is more popular for its convenient location in Montreal, Quebec. The popularity of the institute is evident from the Institut Teccart reviews from the current students. The majority of the students have helped the institute gain 3.9 stars out of 5. The subjects offered on this campus include technology, computing, fashion, arts, commerce and business. The campus has been diligent in meeting specific student needs by updating its offered courses and technological processes. Even though the primary language spoken in Quebec is French, the Institution offers education in the English language based on student requirements.

Name: Bishop's University
Overview: Bishop's University was established in Sherbrooke, Canada, in 1843 to offer students an effective liberal education. The university has an academic structure that comprises two faculties, the Faculty of Arts and the Faculty of Sciences, along with two schools, the School of Education and Williams School of Business.The university also has a Sports and Recreational Center known as John H Price, housing an indoor pool, music recital hall, daycare center, historic chapel, and three gyms. The educational institution conducts learning and research using smart facilities, including classrooms, laboratories, and practice centers fully equipped with modern technology.It also has a library system comprising two units containing a large digital collection of printed resources for learning, teaching, and research. This center of education also has a large sports and recreation center to encourage students to engage in not only study but also extra-curricular activities.

University Ranking: Bishop's University is one of the most prestigious universities in Canada, with a long and distinguished history of academic excellence. Located in the small town of Lennoxville, Quebec, Bishop's University has been ranked as one of the top universities in the country for over a century. According to Maclean's University Rankings, Bishop's University is ranked among the top ten universities in Canada for overall quality of education. It is ranked first in the country regarding student satisfaction and second in the student-faculty ratio. Bishop's University is also highly ranked in its research and scholarly activities. It is ranked in the top five universities in Canada for research intensity and is home to several highly respected research institutes and centres. The University is also home to several prestigious academic journals and publications, including the Canadian Journal of Higher Education and the Canadian Journal of Educational Research. The University also has the highest graduation rate in the country, with over 85% of students completing their degree in four years. Bishop's University is also well-known for its vibrant student life. It is home to several clubs and organizations and hosts a variety of cultural, social, and recreational activities. It is also home to several student-run publications and media outlets, such as the student newspaper The Campus and various student-run radio stations. Bishop's University has consistently been ranked among the top universities in Canada for its overall quality of education and student satisfaction. It is also well-known for its vibrant student life and commitment to research and scholarly activities. With its long and distinguished history of academic excellence, Bishop's University is one of the premier universities in Canada.

Name: Mount Saint Vincent University
Overview: Mount Saint Vincent University is a public university in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. Founded in 1873, The Mount offers more than 190 courses. Mount Saint Vincent University offers undergraduate programs in a variety of streams across arts, education, science, professional studies, etc. The institution also offers 13 graduate degrees, including a joint initiative doctorate program with St. Francis Xavier University and Acadia University. Some of the top programs at the Mount Saint Vincent University are B.S. in Computer Science, Ph.D. in Educational Studies, M.A. in Public Relations, M.S. in Applied Human Nutrition. Located minutes away from downtown Halifax, Mount Saint Vincent University has more than 4,000 students from over 70 countries. The Mount promotes a unique sense of community through its specialty programs, small class sizes, and distance learning opportunities. Mount Saint Vincent University houses over 16 research institutes and centers. It is also the only university in Canada to offer a Master of Public Relations (MPR) program. The Mountao's Internship Program allows its students to experience hands-on research work before graduating. The average tuition fee at Mount Saint Vincent University is USD 40, 980. International students are eligible for scholarships and merit-based grants. Mount Saint Vincent University top priority is the well-being of its students, staff, and faculty. The university has an active Student Union and a team of professionals who are ready to help the students. There are social clubs, societies, and fraternities that encourage students to participate in various campus events. Mount Saint Vincent University Housing offers three furnished residential complexes on campus. The Birches, Assisi Hall, and Westwood. Apart from the convenience of residential halls, there is a cafeteria, several libraries, gyms and fitness centers. Mount Saint Vincent University provides an enriching college life experience to all its students.
Eligibility Overview: Students must show evidence of the following to be admitted to the Master of Public Relations programme:• A bachelor's degree in business administration, commerce, public relations, communication, or a similar discipline (four years).• A 3.0 (B) GPA in the last two years of undergraduate education is required.• Two recommendation letters (one academic and one professional).Students interested in learning more about Prior Learning Assessment (PLA) for admission should refer to section 2.1.8 of the MSVU Graduate Academic Calendar.If a student has not attended a post-secondary institution for at least three years, a second professional letter of recommendation may be substituted for the academic letter of recommendation. In addition, if a student has not held relevant job but has recently attended a post-secondary institution, a second academic letter of recommendation can be submitted in place of a professional letter of recommendation.Students must have completed the following courses in order to be admitted to the Master of Arts in Communication programme:A four-year bachelor's degree in a communication-related discipline (e.g., public relations, communication studies, journalism, marketing communication) with a B average (GPA 3.0) in the final two years of study.
Accommodation: For all students, MSVU has three furnished residence halls on campus: Assisi Hall, The Birches, and Westwood. Students will tell you that living on campus is one of the best ways to become more active in campus life, aside from the convenience of being close to courses, labs, the cafeteria, library, gym, and other amenities. We recommend that you learn more about your housing alternatives.for more information click on this link-https://www.msvu.ca/campus-life/residence-life-at-the-mount/residence-living-options/

Name: Georgian College
Overview: Georgian College is one of Ontario’s top higher education institutions in Canada. Originally known as the College of Applied Arts and Technology, Georgian College was established in 1967. The institution has alliances with the College System of Ontario and the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE). Georgian College believes in providing its students with a relevant and cutting-edge curriculum. The institution offers 130 programs in various fields, including business, liberal arts, tourism, marine studies, etc. Some top programs at Georgian College are Computer Studies, Automotive Business, Design and Visual Arts, and Business Management. Georgian College has seven campuses spread across various districts of Ontario :The Barrie Campus is the largest home to the Art Gallery, University Partnership Centre, Henry Bernick Entrepreneurship Centre, etc. The Owen Sound Campus is known as the Marine Training and Research Centre. The Orillia Campus features a fitness center and an amphitheater.The Muskoka Campus and the Orangeville Campus are home to multimedia departments.The average tuition fee at Georgian College is 20360 USD. International students are eligible for merit-based grants and bursaries. Student life at Georgian College is high-spirited, with abundant student resources, including social clubs, campus eats, events, etc. Students at Georgian College can pursue their interests through the state-of-the-art infrastructure and a plethora of social clubs. “Georgian College Residence” facilitates on-campus housing for students, with several residence halls spread across the campus. Georgian College has been acknowledged as the first and only changemaker college in Canada, emphasizing its role as a leader in social innovation.
Eligibility Overview: Degree/Diploma Courses Transcripts from secondary or high school, showing graduation, subjects studied, and grades earnedAt the Grade 12 level, math and English credits are necessary. Admissions requirements for specific programmes can be found on respective pages. Degree Certificate Courses Transcripts from a college or institution showing confirmation of graduation subjects studied and marks earnedWork/volunteer/internship experience described in a resumeA letter of intent explaining why you are applying English Language ProficiencyRequired proficiency in the English Language is as follows:   The requirements of the courses differ, and applicants are advised to carefully review the requirements of the chosen courses before beginning their application.

Placement: Georgian College has a career centre for its students and assists them in finding appropriate placements through online and offline resources. The centre provides information about job postings and volunteer opportunities and works to improve employability skills through resume writing, mock interviews, and career coaching.  Students are given access to online portals, and virtual employment resources where they can post their resumes and employers can choose the best candidates. The college provides placements through online fairs and interviews. Georgian College is a sought-after institution because it offers admission in three academic terms. The college boasts that approximately 90% of its graduates are employed within six months of graduation. With 100% practical experience and generous scholarship opportunities, the college has established itself as one of the most popular institutes for international students looking to study in Canada.

Name: LaSalle College - Montreal
Overview: LaSalle College is a subsidized private post-secondary educational institution in Montreal, Canada. The college is considered one of the largest bilingual colleges and the biggest fashion college in Canada. It provides professional, college, and pre-university training in 5 schools of specializations with over 60 programs based on creativity, innovation and entrepreneurship. LaSalle College of Montreal has five speciality schools in its educational plan: Business and Technologies, Hotel Management and Tourism, Fashion, Arts and Design, Social Sciences and Education, and VFX and Game Design. The college caters to the creativity of its students through creativity-based programs and daily activities. It also offers the students access to specialist equipment and facilities to produce creative projects successfully. Students and graduates can access excellent portfolios to showcase their expertise, creativity and accomplishments.Having campuses on five continents currently, it comprises 23 higher education campuses where more than 17,000 students are welcomed each year from across the world.The college is a part of the Quebec educational system. It grants three types of diplomas, such as Pre-university and technical programs, continuing education and technical programs and Vocational training. The pre-university and technical programs are college studies diplomas that can give a student access to a university or the job market. LaSalle College has a population of about 40% international students from more than 110 different countries.

Name: Royal Canadian Institute of International Studies (RCIIS)
Overview: Established in 1999, the Royal Canadian Institute of International Studies (RCIIS) is a reputed English Language School situated in Toronto, Canada. The academic standard of this university is high, and the pathway program is one of the best in the city. This university has more than 40 pathway partners and follows a motto of providing quality education. Since its foundation, this institution has been assisting students worldwide to learn English in a supportive environment. This university offers various English programs for beginners to advanced level students to meet the requirements of the corporate field. The counsellors at this university are interactive and always approachable as they work with the students to design pathway programs to meet their academic goals. This academy offers a wide variety of courses to fit the requirements of learners. The Power-speaking and discussion classes primarily emphasise teaching English communication, while pre-academic programs encompass four major language skills. In the Academic English programs, students will be able to learn various skills such as referencing, writing essays and researching. The Royal Canadian Institute of International Studies (RCIIS) also provides specialised programs, Café and Business English programs that allow students to work efficiently in an English-speaking environment. Besides, the Pre-academic programs of this institution cover all the study areas in Canadian institutions of higher education, including presentations, research etc. This institution offers programs during morning, afternoon and evening for all language levels. With more than 15 programs, each year approximately 1, 500 students’ study in this academy. One of the special courses designed by RCCIS is ESL foundation which is a course for entry-level beginners to help them develop four language skills. Besides, the EAP program and IELTS preparation are also offered to allow students to meet their broader academic goals.

Name: College of the Rockies
Overview: The College of the Rockies, founded in 1971 (COTR) is a well-known community college in British Columbia, Canada. With a mission to transform lives and enrich the community through the power of education, the College of the Rockies offers a full range of programs in a wide range of studies. In its 35 years of excellence, the university has reached significant milestones. A minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS is mandatory.The average tuition fee at the College of the Rockies is approximately CAD 10,000. International students are eligible for fellowships, financial aid, and merit-based grants.Housing over 83,000 students, the COTR main campus is located in Cranbrook. In addition, there are five satellite and regional campuses in Kimberley, Creston, Fernie, Invermere, and Golden. The college has a unique curriculum that nurtures every student's potential. The institution has an extensive team of career experts, and its annual International Youth Internship Program offers full-time and part-time placement opportunities.

A minimum grade of 60 per cent in foundations, and principles of mathematics, pre-calculus math, and calculus in 12th grade is required. Criminal and Social JusticeSubmit your official transcripts from secondary and post-secondary schools. A minimum of 65 per cent in English and mathematics is required. Business Management: Accounting; General Management & MarketingSubmit your official secondary or post-secondary school transcripts with your completed application form to the university. Placement: International students with a study permit can work and study in Canada if they have a Social Insurance Number (SIN). You can get your SIN by going to the Canada Access Center office and showing a valid passport and study permit.A full-time student can work up to 20 hours per week during classes and up to 40 hours per week during breaks. Name: The University of British Columbia
Overview: The University of British Columbia is an open research university located in British Columbia, Canada, established in 1908. The University comprises two campuses in Vancouver and Okanagan.The University of British Columbia provides over 200 undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs. It also offers joint academic programs, distance education, and exchange programs. Some areas of study are Law, Applied Science, Medicine, Dentistry, Architecture, Anthropology, Philosophy, Ancient Culture, Religion, and Ethnicity. Some top courses offered by the University of British Columbia are MBA, Masters in Computer Science, Data Science, Architecture, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical, and Computer Engineering, etc., and Bachelors in Nursing, Commerce, Science, etc. The fees of the courses offered at the University range from CAD 8,238 to 57,625 per year. The accommodation and meal expenses of the University are around CAD 13,510 per year. Unfortunately, Vancouver is an expensive city for off-campus accommodation, so finding an affordable place for rent is difficult. The University of British Columbia provides scholarships worldwide, from international to domestic students with excellent academics and extracurricular achievers, to study in Canada. Apart from scholarships, the University also offers students financial aid, grants, and awards.
Eligibility Overview: Eligibility for Undergraduates12th grade in a relevant field with an aggregate English proficiency score of at least 85 percent in one of the following:IELTS: Overall score of 6.5, with a minimum of 6 bands in each component.PTE Academic: A minimum total score of 65, including a minimum of 60 in each part is required.TOEFL: A total score of 90 is required, including a score of 22 in each section.Eligibility for GraduatesA bachelor's degree with a first class/division with a 65 percent aggregate or a CGPA of 8 on a 10-point scale or a master's degree with a first class/division with a 65 percent aggregate or a CGPA of 8 on a 10-pointa score in one of the following areas of English proficiency:IELTS: Overall score of 6.5, with a minimum of 6 bands in each component.PTE Academic: A minimum total score of 65, including a minimum of 60 in each part is required.TOEFL: A minimum total score of 90 is required, with a minimum of 22 in reading, hearing, and writing, as well as 21 in writing and speaking.English Test on Duolingo: 125 points in total. A solid command of the English language should also be demonstrated in video and writing samples. The university will only accept the Duolingo English Test from students who live in countries where no other English competency test is available.Eligibility for an MBABachelor's degree with a CGPA of 2.5 on a 4.0 scale, which equates to a 75 percent aggregate.Exams that are standardised, such as:GMAT score of 550 with at least a 50th percentile in both the quantitative and verbal sections155 on both the verbal and quantitative portions of the GREEither of the following English skills are required:TOEFL, TOEFL, TOEFL, TOEFL, TOEFL, TO 100 for the home edition, 600 for the print edition, and 250 for the computer editionAcademic IELTS or IELTS Indicator: 7.0 overall bandPTE Academic: A total of 70 points is required, with a minimum of 60 points in each component.CAEL (Canadian Academic English Language Test): band 70 overallCAEL Online (Canadian Academic English Language Test): overall band of 70

Name: Saint Clair College - Windsor
Overview: St. Clair College of Applied Arts and Technology was established in 1966. The public community college in Ontario, Canada, has its main campus in Windsor, while the other campuses are in Chatham and Wallaceburg. The college has partnerships with 16 institutions in 9 countries and has an acceptance rate of 44%. Having over 120 full-time, 50 part-time, and over 30 continuing education programs in undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma and certificate courses, amongst which Applied Technology, Nursing, Architecture, Liberal Arts, Sciences, Business, Management, Education, Health Sciences, Community Studies and Engineering are the top ones. St. Clair College Centre For the Arts in Windsor campus offers courses like Hospitality, and Media and Design.Application forms on the official website with an application fee of 125 CAD are submitted along with academic transcripts, resumes, scores of TOEFL, IELTS etc. and program-specific documents. The average tuition fee ranges from 14,000 - 33,000 CAD, depending on the program. Various scholarships and on-campus work opportunities are offered for financial aid. On-campus accommodation is provided in Windsor and Chatham campuses, having 204 two-bedroom suites and 12 four-bedrooms. The sports teams have affiliations with CCAA and OCAA, and the various student unions manage student affairs. 85% of St Clair graduates are offered jobs within six months of graduation, and a high employer satisfaction rate of 85% has been observed where the average annual salary is 34,276 CAD.

Name: Medicine Hat College - Brooks
Overview: The Brooks Campus of Medicine Hat College is located in Brooks, Alberta - a community of roughly 14000 people in Southeastern Alberta. It is situated adjacent to the Trans Canada Highway and approximately 110 kilometres west of Medicine Hat.  Students can also opt to pursue a part-time Pre-Employment Electrician program and a Pre-Employment Welding program from this campus. This institute provides more than 1 million to its students in scholarships, awards, and bursaries. Apart from these, international students can seek funding for studying in Canada from many other sources. The male-to-female ratio at this institute is 43:67. While the Medicine Hat College fees differ across courses, the average tuition fee for an undergraduate program ranges in between $7,200 to $7,300. According to Uni page rankings, Medicine Hat College ranked 143 in Canada. The various support groups of this college extend indigenous support, help in technology, personal counselling, wellness, writing and academics. This institute’s Entrepreneur Development Centre (EDC) assists interested students in launching their businesses. Some notable alumni of Medicine Hat College include Puppeteer Ronnie Burkett, beach volleyball player Megan Nagy and others. This institute hosts an annual Career Expo in October that is attended by over 70 hiring companies or employers.

Name: St Thomas University (CAN)
Overview: Incorporated in 1910, St. Thomas University is a government-funded university affiliated to many reputed international and national organizations, like the Council of International Schools, Canadian Federation for the Humanities, and Free Application for Federal Student Aid. It is situated in Fredericton, New Brunswick. This institute’s campus has six academic buildings equipped with student-friendly amenities. All classes in this institute are small. They are capped at 60 students, and the average class size is only 26 students. The upper-year classes have even smaller sizes. The several programs offered by this institute include Bachelor of Arts, Bachelor of Education, Bachelor of Applied Arts. It also houses a School of Social Work that provides the only English bachelors and masters social work degrees in New Brunswick. Students also get to choose from Certificate programs in Gerontology, Criminology and Criminal Justice. St. Thomas University is also partnered with HBX of Harvard Business School to deliver an intensive, multi-week, online program of courses on the business fundamentals – CORe. About 99% of St. Thomas University’s full-time faculty have their Ph.D. or highest degrees in their respective fields. The tuition fee for the Bachelor of Arts program lies in the range of $7,650 to $7,670 (Canadian). For the Bachelor of Social Work program, the tuition fee is in the range of $8,000 to $8,700 (Canadian). Every year, this institute dedicates around $1.8 million to student financial aid. Plus, there are over 40 different scholarship and bursary types available to help students offset tuition costs. This institute has produced several notable alumni who are pioneers in their respective fields. The official Connections Magazine of this university features famous alumni and their stories. Some noteworthy St. Thomas University alumni include judge Lewis C. Ayles, politician Guy Arseneault, author and poet Sheree Fitch, actor Lyman Ward and journalist Harry Forestell.

Residence is a place to develop life skills and lasting friendships. For students leaving home for the first time, living in residence is a comfortable first step to successful independence. Residence rooms are equipped with wireless internet, cable services and free long distance calling within Canada. Each residence has shared study areas, TV lounges, laundry facilities and snack machines. Quiet hours are in place every day for study and sleep. Upper campus is patrolled 24/7 by full-time security staff while a dedicated security staff member is in the Forest Hill residence between 10 pm and 6 am. Name: Royal Roads University
Overview: Royal Roads University, established in 1995, is a research-centric institution of higher education in Colwood city of British Columbia, Canada. It got affiliation from the International Association of Universities and the Canadian Bureau for International Education. Royal Roads University has consistently ranked among the top universities in Canada. It is a reputed research-oriented public institution of higher education. The university offers undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs and certificate and diploma courses on-campus and online in business, culture, communication, technology, education, tourism, humanitarian studies, environment and sustainability, hospitality, and interdisciplinary and leadership studies.

University Ranking: Royal Roads University (RRU) is a leading public research university in Victoria, British Columbia, Canada. Established in 1995, Royal Roads University has earned a reputation for being a quality educational institution that offers innovative undergraduate and graduate programs designed to meet the needs of today’s students. Royal Roads University is one of the leading post-secondary institutions in Canada. It is ranked the 151-200th best university in the world by the Times Higher Education World University Rankings, which places it in the top 4% of all universities worldwide. Additionally, the university was recognized as one of the top universities in Canada for its teaching, research, and innovation excellence. The university offers more than 50 undergraduate and graduate programs focused on developing critical thinking, problem-solving, and communication skills. These programs are delivered through a unique blended learning model that combines online, experiential, and on-campus learning. This approach allows students to learn at their own pace and progress towards their degree quickly. The university also has a strong reputation for research. The university’s research centres and institutes are actively researching and innovating in sustainable development, digital media, and global health. This research and innovation have earned the university numerous awards and accolades, including the prestigious Canada Research Chair in Digital Media and Global Health. Royal Roads University is also highly ranked for its student experience. The university provides a vibrant and supportive learning environment with various student services and resources. The university also has a variety of clubs and organizations that allow students to get involved in their community and have meaningful experiences. Overall, Royal Roads University is a top-ranking university in Canada. Not only does it offer a quality education, but it also provides various opportunities to get involved in research and innovation. It is the perfect place for students seeking a challenging yet rewarding post-secondary experience.

Name: Fairleigh Dickinson University
Overview: Established in 1942, Fairleigh Dickinson University is a private university in New Jersey, USA. Florham Campus and Metropolitan Campus are the two main campuses located in New Jersey, apart from which the university also has campuses in Oxfordshire and Vancouver. The institute ranks 35th for its undergraduate teaching. FDU consists of four academic colleges offering 26 undergraduate, 24 postgraduate, 4 Honors, 17 online programs, and various certificate and associate programs in disciplines like Biomedical Sciences, Psychology, Nursing, Liberal Arts, Humanities, Sciences, Business, Management, Performing Arts and Marketing. Petrocelli College of Continuing Studies provides continuing education programs, Silberman College of Business is one of the top business schools, and the other two are Becton College of Arts and Sciences, Sciences and Professional Studies and University College of Arts, The admissions are moderately selective, with a high acceptance rate of 87%. Applications are to be filled through the online portal for intake into Fall, Spring, and Summer semesters. Academic transcripts, LORs, and scores of TOEFL, SAT, ACT, etc., are also to be submitted with an application fee of 50 USD. The average tuition fee ranges from 25,593 - 45,528 USD depending upon the program. The institution awards merit-based, need-based, and sports scholarships like the Children of Alumni Grant, Fairleigh Dickinson University Family Grant, and Athletic Scholarship to all deserving students. On-campus accommodation in residence halls and apartments like Village Halls, Rutherford Hall, Park Avenue Apartments, and Twombly Halls is provided at the rent ranging from 7,378 - 11,250 USD. All housing options are equipped with fully-furnished rooms, meal plans, laundry, kitchen, lounge areas, study rooms, WiFi, TV, and appliances like refrigerators can be rented. The campus houses several sororities, fraternities, Greek Honors societies, and over 50 student clubs and organizations. FDU manages a Career Development Center and organizes workshops, career counseling, and internship opportunities to prepare students with an annual salary of 48,100 USD.
Eligibility Overview: If any of the following conditions apply, students applying to graduate programmes at the Silberman College of Business will be evaluated for admission:earned an undergraduate degree from an AACSB accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0; or earned a graduate degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0; or earned an undergraduate degree from an accredited institution with a minimum cumulative GPA of 2.5 and possess an approved professional licence or certification inc.Chartered Financial Analyst, Certified Management Accountant, Certified Financial Planner, Associate or Fellow of the Society of Actuaries, Associate or Fellow of the Casualty Actuarial Society, Professional Engineer License; or achieve a minimum score of 1050, which is equal to undergraduate GPA multiplied by 200 plus GMAT (or GMAT equivalent score).
Accommodation: Students needing accommodations for disabilities can contact Disability Support Services at (201) 692-2078 or metrodss@fdu.edu. Please visit our website at www.fdu.edu/metroada for more information.Metro's Student Health Services provides assistance to students who require specific accommodations or advocacy for those who may need to interrupt their academic obligations due to a medical emergency.for more detail click on this link-https://www.fdu.edu/campuses/metropolitan-campus/student-services/student-health-services/accommodations/

Name: TAV College
Overview: TAV college, founded in 1989 as Torah and Technology School of Montreal (TAT), is a private bilingual college in Montreal, Quebec, Canada.The college offers 10 AEC (Attestation of College Studies) courses in Mobile Application Programming, Digital Marketing, International Trade, and 6 DEC (Diploma of College Studies) programs in Social Science, Special Care Counselling, Science, etc. Many graduates from TAV College take admissions into first-choice university programs. At TAV, one of the core values is attention to the individual. In addition to a highly committed faculty and small class sizes, students can access personalized academic advising and other support services.

University Ranking: TAV College is one of the leading educational institutions in India. It is renowned for its quality education and has been ranked among the top colleges in the country. The college has been consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges in India and has been featured in the prestigious Times Higher Education World University Rankings. TAV College is a private college located in Bangalore, Karnataka. It was established in 2001 and is affiliated with the University of Mysore.  The college offers courses in engineering, management, science, humanities, and social sciences. It strongly emphasises research and has a well-equipped library and research centre. The college has been consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges in India by various ranking agencies. It was ranked 5th in the NIRF 2020 ranking of colleges in India. It was also ranked 6th in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. The college has a strong emphasis on research and has produced several research papers in various fields. It has also been awarded several grants and awards for its research activities.  The college strongly focuses on industry-academia collaboration and has established partnerships with leading companies. It has also established several international collaborations with universities in the US, UK, Canada, and Australia. The college strongly emphasises student development and provides several extra-curricular activities for its students. It also provides several scholarships and awards for its students. Overall, TAV College is one of the leading educational institutions in India and is consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges in the country. It strongly emphasises research and has established several partnerships with leading companies. It also provides several scholarships and awards for its students.

Name: LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre
Overview: Lester B. Pearson School Board is considered one of the largest English school boards located in Quebec, Canada. Lester B. Pearson School Board comprises 13 secondary schools, 37 elementary schools, and 8 Education centres. Renovated in 2016, the LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre is a top-notch learning centre. It serves a substantial number of students in the Youth and Continuing Education sector. LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre provides different residential and commercial drafting programs, general building maintenance and professional sales, plumbing and heating, and computer support, etc. LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre offers different programs: business, automobile mechanics, design, construction, electro technology, Pharmacy technical assistance, Interior Decorating, visual display, etc. In this centre, students can avail themselves of vocational training programs both online and on-site. Students can learn more than 25 vocational programs from six vocational centres. LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre has the highest 5-year graduation rate in the province, along with a strong association with 25 foreign countries. This results in recruitment coming from different countries. In terms of enrolment, LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre is one of the largest, serving more than 21,000 students in the Youth sector and nearly 8,700 students in the Continuing Education sector. Students experience a dynamic learning environment at LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre and engage in different activities that encourage their learning. From assembling piping structures in the plumbing to structure drawings and plans in drafting or executing complicated diagnostic exercises in computing support, this centre takes pride in these aspects. LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre also provides business programs that end within a year. With proper schedules, these programs are tailored to fit busy lifestyles. In LBPSB - Verdun Adult and Career Centre, students can get a UG certificate or Diploma. Besides, in this school, students can learn French with more than 25 vocational programs. The facilities offered are top-notch with affordable tuition fees.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Happy Valley-Goose Bay
Overview: The College of the North Atlantic is one of the pioneers in postsecondary education and training centres for skill enhancement. For the last 55 years, they have trained national and international students worldwide. The College of the North Atlantic—Happy Valley-Goose Bay offers industry-leading training infrastructure. It has 100 programs educating more than 9000 students per year. Presently it has 17 campuses; among those, the College of the North Atlantic at Happy Valley-Goose Bay is a technical education college in Qatar in the Middle East. It includes research and development, community and regional innovation, and international partnerships with leading organizations for training and placement. The student support team, faculty, and trainers accomplish the infrastructure of this institute. Some other amenities that might be helpful for students are the guidance office, Aboriginal Supports, and the Student Development Office. In addition to that, the College also provides cafeteria services and childcare facilities. College of the North Atlantic's Happy Valley-Goose Bay courses includes science, arts, industrial electrician, construction, heavy-duty equipment technician, etc. The short duration and diploma program empowers students to start careers in industry-leading organizations. The College of the North Atlantic at Happy Valley-Goose Bay's average tuition fee is $7,000-$8,000. For financial aid, they provide scholarships and grants to students. Some scholarships and awards offered at this College are the Happy Valley-Goose Bay Campus Awards, Student Representatives Council Award, Kathleen Murray Memorial Scholarship, and Shirley Crewe Memorial Scholarship, to name a few.
Eligibility Overview: Official academic transcripts provided by the issuing institution.The Canadian Embassy issues a student study permit/student visa.Degree certificates provided in the English language with official transcripts. If the transcripts are in a language other than English, the issuing authority or a professional translator should convert them into English.To be eligible for admission to the university, all overseas students whose mother tongue is not English or whose country's medium of instruction is not English must present proof of English proficiency. As confirmation of English proficiency, the university accepts the results of numerous tests. The minimum score required in each of these tests is listed below:

Name: Ecole nationale daerotechnique, affiliated with Cegep Edouard-Montpetit
Overview: Ecole Nationale daerotechnique, affiliated with Cegep Edouard-Montpetit, is one of the largest technical colleges in aeronautics in the world. It is located in the city of Longueuil, Quebec and is 20 minutes away from Montreal. It offers 3 programmes Aircraft Maintenance, Avionics and Aerospace Engineering, all in French, which is recognised by Transport Canada. Aircraft Maintenance is the only programme also provided in English as it is taught to the Canadian military and is authorized by the National Defense of Canada. All three courses take three years or six semesters to complete. Ecole Nationale daerotechnique admits 1300 students every year for regular education. It offers unique facilities like it houses 37 aircraft including certified aeroplanes, helicopters and several planes for training and has 38 specialized laboratories and workshops with test benches and wind tunnels. The school ensures a balance between theory and practice and offers a vibrant student life. Many events are arranged by the school in the field of music and sports to open networking opportunities for international students. Participation in these events is awarded with academic credits so that a stimulating environment is maintained. Ecole Nationale daerotechnique is located in the St-Hubert airport zone, which offers good placement opportunities to the students in the aeronautical businesses. The graduates from this school can enter the job market directly or continue to study engineering at university.

Name: Trent University - Peterborough
Overview: Founded in 1964, Trent University is a public liberal arts university situated in Peterborough, Ontario, along with a satellite campus in Oshawa. This university is widely known for its Oxbridge college system and various small-class sizes. Besides, this institution offers graduate and undergraduate at the master’s and doctoral levels. With an enrolment of approximately 9, 000 undergraduate students and nearly 7, 000 graduate students at Peterborough campus, this university holds its position among the top 6.1% of universities of the world. Aspiring students come from more than 79 countries and pursue different UG, PG, certificate and diploma programs. This university boasts of providing nearly 20 graduate and 60 undergraduate and different professional programs to the students. The programs offered by this institution comprises various fields like biology, accounting, anthropology, archaeology, African studies etc. Apart from PhD and graduate diplomas, this university has various course-based and thesis-based master’s programs. Also, this university provides specializations in inter-disciplinary areas like feminist and gender studies, ageing studies. International students are provided with certain facilities, including finances, health insurance, housing and academics. Moreover, different workshops are hosted by this academy to provide necessary guidance and advice to the students. Besides, this institution offers several career opportunities in various fields such as part-time, non-academic, full-time etc. Students who are unable to meet the entry requirements can join pathway programs offered by this university. Students can pursue their major courses at the Peterborough campus in subjects like Biology, Economics, Modern Languages, Political Studies, Cultural Studies, Geography, Philosophy etc. Trent University also offers multiple internet-based courses to their candidates, and nearly 70% of the courses use web-based components. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 90%, almost 96% of students get employed after two years of graduation. As per U.S. News & World Report, this university holds the 35th position for being the Best Global University in Canada.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Standard X Certificate scores PLUS a minimum 70% average in the best four academic subjects, including English, in Standard XII.The results of an English proficiency test will very certainly be requested. The CBSE curriculum exempts students from taking the EnglishLanguage Proficiency test. Acceptable exams and waivers can be found in the English Language Proficiency Requirements.Commerce stream students in India Senior High School are excluded from having Mathematics as a compulsory course for admission to the Bachelor of Business Administration programme.The following courses are required for the Bachelor of Science in Nursing programme: English, chemistry, biology, and mathematics are the four subjects.The following courses are required for a Bachelor of Science in Biomedical Science: English, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and one of Physics OR Earth and Space Science.Minimum undergraduate GPA of 3.0 or higher.   English language proficiency requirements are:  Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English language proficiency requirements:
