Name: Seneca College
Overview: The Seneca College of Applied Arts and Technology, founded in 1967, has four main campuses in Peterborough and Greater Toronto area. The Newnham campus is the largest in Canada, with over 30,000 full-time students and 70,000 continuing education students registering annually.The college admits more than 7000 international students from around 150 countries around the globe, allowing them to experience a rich and diverse culture in an inclusive environment.Seneca College aims to offer students the best experience mimicking real-world situations to provide them with skills to face challenges and find solutions through co-ops and work-term opportunities. Seneca Works has a setup to help students plan their careers while studying. It has an acceptance rate of 85%, which is excellent for international students. Students with disabilities get to experience a fully accessible system. The college also provides complimentary airport pickup, housing and accommodation assistance, orientation for international students, assistance with visas, etc., to help make the transition easier for international students.

  • PTE score: 60 or above 
  • Duolingo test score: 125 or above
Placement: The college provides work opportunities for its students through co-op, work terms and on-campus jobs. With an average salary of CAD 53,092, Seneca has maintained a graduate employment rate of around 71.4%. Some companies that recruit Seneca College graduates include Sheraton Hotels, Holiday Inn, Thomas Cook, Royal Caribbean, American Express, etc. The college provides facilities such as career developmental programs, workshops, career planning, reviews and more. Many students have testified that these services have helped them get closer to their dream job. There are also career fairs where students may find hundreds of work opportunities. A few courses include unpaid college assignments that allow you to build experience and knowledge in the industry. There is also the co-op option, which will enable you to study and work simultaneously. All of this contributes significantly to the worth of your resume and provides you with valuable corporate insights.According to Emolument, Programme & Project Management professionals are the top paid Seneca College alumni & graduates, earning $64,000 annually. Name: University of Waterloo
Overview: Established in 1957, the University of Waterloo is a public research university in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. The University provides cooperative education as its cornerstone. It has three satellite campuses in Canada and four affiliated university colleges, including St. Jerome's University, St. Paul's University College, Renison University College, and Conrad Grebel University College. The main campus of the University is spread over 1000 acres. Offers 100 undergraduate and 190 postgraduate programs. The various fields of study are engineering, business, health, the environment, math, science, arts, etc. Some top courses offered at the University are Bachelor's in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Materials, Nanoscience, etc., and Masters in Architecture, Taxation, Management, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Economics. The courses provided by the University range from CAD 11,525 to 54,334 per year. The University has a magnificent infrastructure, including the Earth Sciences Museum and the largest Centre for Quantum Research. In addition, the University has more than 200 student clubs, including academic, social, political, charitable, sports, and cultural, and over 100 volunteer services. The University of Waterloo has on-campus and off-campus accommodations for its students in different styles and facilities and at varying prices. On-campus housing includes residencies with single-sharing and double-sharing rooms, suites, apartments, and traditional dorm-style rooms. Off-campus accommodation facilities include homestays for international students. The accommodation and meal expenses per year are around CAD 14,828. The University offers various awards to its students who need financial help on a merit basis. In addition, the University also provides financial aid to international students, like scholarships and bursaries, to study in Canada.
Eligibility Overview: Eligibility Criteria: To be eligible to apply for their desired undergraduate and postgraduate courses, candidates must submit proof of their academic achievements. An academic score of 75%.IELTS band score of 6.5.Submission of supplementary documents like LORs, personal essays, and academic transcripts. Certifications required in English Language Proficiency (ELP)ELP evidence will be required for the majority of international students.The accepted ELP certification examinations and minimum needed scores are listed below. Accepted Exams and Required Scores

Placement: International students are offered placements at the University of Waterloo within 3 to 6 months of graduation. Almost all University of Waterloo alumni find work immediately after graduation. Within six months of graduation, the employment rate reaches 100%. The university's Master of Business, Entrepreneurship, and Placement (MBET) programme gives students who want to start a business hands-on experience. The University of Waterloo is one of Canada's best universities, ranking #24 in the QS Employability Rankings 2022. Students can participate in a variety of co-op programmes at the institution, which provide chances for hands-on study. Deloitte, Google, Bank of Montreal, Apple, Pfizer, and Johnson & Johnson are among the top employers of University of Waterloo graduates. Graduates of the University of Waterloo earn an average base salary of roughly 67,000 CAD per year. Conrad School of Entrepreneurship and Business graduates get a starting income of 148,000 Canadian dollars per year. Based on job placements, the Masters in Finance is the most popular degree at the university, with an average pay of 144,000 CAD.
Accommodation: You'll be able to live independently while making significant relationships that could last a lifetime, whether you're seeking for quiet study places and a room to call your own or maximizing common space and social possibilities. It's not only about finding a place to live on campus; it's about finding a place where you fit in. View the amenities, photographs, and virtual tour videos by clicking here: https://uwaterloo.ca/campus-housing/residences
Course Ranking: In 11 different programmes, the University of Waterloo provides courses at the undergraduate and graduate levels. The most popular courses at this university are those in engineering and computer science. The University of Waterloo is ranked 307 in the QS WUR Ranking by Subjects for 2023, according to QS World University Rankings. The Times Higher Education also lists the rankings of UW's courses; for example, the university's Business programme is ranked 201-250, Engineering is ranked 76, Social Science is ranked 151–175, and the Arts & Humanities programme is ranked between 301 and 400.US News also announces the University of Waterloo Subjects rating for 2022. The university received scores in a variety of engineering fields, including 78 in civil engineering, 42 in computer science, 45 in mechanical engineering, 456 in clinical medicine, 93 in chemical engineering, 49 in engineering, etc. This institution is ranked among the best engineering schools in Canada for foreign students. Candidates wanting to pursue higher education in Canada can review the University of Waterloo's course offerings and submit an admissions application.

The University of Waterloo has successfully maintained its position among the top 10 Canadian universities according to the QS World University Ranking 2023. Additionally, it rose 154 places in the international rankings to take the top spot for both undergraduate and graduate programmes among universities worldwide. The University of Waterloo is listed between number 200 and number 250 in the world in The Times Higher Education's ranking of universities for 2022.The University of Waterloo is ranked 199 in the list of the best global universities and 8th in the list of the best global universities in Canada by US News World University Ranking 2022. It is now ranked higher than its previous position of 210 in the world. For more than ten years, the university has maintained its standards for instruction and academics. It has turned into the ideal option for overseas students who want to study in Canada.

Name: BLI Canada - Quebec City
Overview: Approved by Languages, Canada, BLI Canada is a top-notch international language school. Backed by 40 years of experience in the language industry, this school conducts successful academic and general immersion programs for English and French at every level. Nowadays, this international language school is functional in Montreal and Quebec City. Talking BLI Canada- Quebec City campus provides a proper immersion environment to learn French for the students and arranges various activities that allow students to explore the city and accept the innovative French-Canadian culture. Some of the essential BLI student programs include General English, TEFaQ preparation, Pathway programs, General French, Language camps, Online French for kids etc. This campus is spread over two floors, situated in the heart of Quebec City, where students can access public transport and different amenities. This college's average BLI tuition cost is approximately CAD 10,000 - CAD 10,500. This international language school also conducts placement tests for both languages, wherein they must enter their name, email address and campus name to give the test. Besides, it offers various accommodations to make them feel at home. Even students can choose to learn from the comfort of their homes by choosing the online programs offered by BLI. Besides offering academic facilities, this institution also conducts exciting activities that differ from season to season, such as conversation clubs, skating, rollerblading, visiting museums, rafting, biking etc. Moreover, this language institution also extends the homestay facility, which provides students with a complete language immersion program.

Name: Kaplan International English - Vancouver
Overview: Kaplan International English - Vancouver provides English courses to students looking to improve their English language skills while either living abroad or travelling. These English courses are unique because of the use of the K+ system, which is Kaplan’s exclusive English Language Learning System. Kaplan International English schools are present in 6 English speaking countries. One of its campuses is located in Vancouver, Canada. The Vancouver campus is near local bus stops and three Skytrain stations. It is only a 30-minute drive to downtown Vancouver and to the slopes of the North Shore Mountains. The institute believes in maximizing student satisfaction, and thus it arranges frequent ski trips and weekends getaway to cities like Victoria and Seattle. Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities in the world with a low cost of living. Kaplan International English- Vancouver offers 4 types of English courses: Flexible English Courses, which can be taken for 1 week or any period till 1 year; Long-term English Courses, last for 20+ weeks; Business English Courses, which can be taken for 1 week and Exam Preparation Courses, the time period of which depends on location and course. There are more than 320+ students from 40 different countries enrolled at the Vancouver School. These students can avail facilities like Student Lounge, Library, Study Center, Wi Fi and Interactive whiteboards. The Kaplan International English - Vancouver faculty speak Spanish, French, Japanese, Arabic, Portuguese, and Mandarin. The institution partners with 250+ colleges and universities, and its University Placement Service helps the students with the application process to these universities and opens doors to various careers.
Eligibility Overview: Intensive English courses give students the most classroom time possible each week, with additional classes concentrating on specialised topics like Business English, Academic English, Literature, or TOEFL ®/IELTS preparation. Students can start at any level and study for as little as two weeks or as long as a year.But don't forget that at Kaplan, discovery and adventure are part of the learning process, so they'll get to practise their abilities in the real world while also enjoying their destination.

Name: Liaison College - Brampton
Overview: Established in 1996, Liaison College: Brampton is a private, professional center solely focused on providing career training in the culinary arts. Situated at 350 Rutherford Road South, Brampton, the university aims at supporting people who desire to pursue their careers in cooking areas. The college has ten years of experience conducting classes on classic French cooking and food preparation methods. People applying for this college generally aspire to have a café or a restaurant of their own. Liaison College has many campuses spread all over Ontario. The campuses have a pleasant environment for the easy grasping of culinary skills and have well-built kitchens for practical learning. The college offers education which is rated among the finest in the world. The students receive first-hand experience through various programs. All the programs are approved under the Private Career Colleges Act and designed to develop skills needed in today’s demanding hotel industry and foodservice operations. Furthermore, most of the students who graduate from here work in some prestigious restaurants in Canada. Chef-Owner Michael Elliot of Liaison College, Toronto campus, has secured 3rd position on the” Top 100 Instructors list.” Receiving a diploma from this college will guarantee opportunities in the hospitality industry and provide a jump-start to one’s career. Liaison College also provides placements and scholarship programs to the aspirants. Above 66% of people receive scholarships, and 90% of passed out get reputed posts and a variety of homestay options. Besides ensuring a promising culinary career, the college also provides business and English programs.

Name: Herzing College - Montreal East (St-Leonard)
Overview: Herzing College is one of Canada’s most renowned career-oriented private institutions spread across 5 campuses. Its central campuses are in the city of Montreal, Québec. The Montreal campuses are famous for their courses in the field of Business, Design, Technology and Education. One of the campuses in the city is the Montreal East (St-Leonard) campus which is 20 km away from the main downtown Montreal campus. Montreal is a hub for various multicultural art and music events like the International Jazz Festival and Just for Laughs comedy festival. The students at the Montreal East campus have easy access to these festivals and are situated close to many parks, restaurants, and sources of entertainment. Herzing College - Montreal East (St-Leonard) aims to educate and train students with marketable skills that will allow them to attain internships and jobs soon after graduating. According to Webometrics, the college is ranked 193 among Canadian universities and has a graduate employment rate of 89%. Recognizing the demanding lifestyle of college students, Herzing College- Montreal East (St-Leonard) allows the students to take classes during the day, evening or online. All 10 diploma degrees are offered in Canada’s official languages, French and English. Herzing College achieves its goal of providing career-focused, post-secondary education by using innovative teaching technologies. It has an experienced faculty who train the students in attaining attributes valued by employers. The college does not offer on-campus accommodations, but Montreal has one of the lowest rents among all Metropolitans in Canada. Thus most students prefer to rent apartments close to the campus.

Name: University of Guelph-Humber
Overview: The University of Guelph-Humber is situated on the North Campus of Humber College in Toronto. The University of Guelph-Humber provides undergraduate programs and around 39 electives. These programs are offered as a four-year degree plus diploma program.The annual fee payable by the students for the various programs ranges between 27,500 and 32,000 (in CAD). The University of Guelph-Humber extends financial aid to its students through bursaries and scholarships. The kinds of scholarships offered are In-course Scholarships, IGNITE Emergency Financial Relief Fund, External Scholarships, and Entrance Scholarships. Based on the different academic departments, the University of Guelph-Humber features separate placement departments - Kinesiology Placement, CSS Placement, Early Childhood Placement, Media Studies Placement, etc. This university boasts a placement rate of 90% after graduation. University of Guelph Humber alumni enjoy several benefits, including credit card services, alumni awards, group insurance, etc. Some noteworthy alumni of this institute are Kaleed Rasheed (Politician), Mark Saunder (Former Chief of Toronto Police Service), Greg Roe (Developer of Freestyle Trampoline), Kristin Fairlie (Actress), and Suze Morrison (Politician).

Name: College St-Michel
Overview: Collège St-Michel, or the St Michel College, is situated in Montreal, Canada. It was founded in 1904 and is a private and non-subsidized institution. The MEES recognizes all the programs offered by this institution. The college offers numerous programs and courses in various areas. With its faculty of experienced members and instructors, the College St-Michel extends quality training, which helps students acquire in-depth knowledge in several disciplines. Students can pursue DEP/DVS in IT support, AEC/ACS Early Childhood Education Techniques, AEC/ACS in Accountancy, AEC Office Systems Technology, and AEC/ACS IT Programmer Analyst. Its partnership with the Organization Internationale de la Francophonie (the organization of Francophonie) helps international students access many facilities, such as travel, accommodation, scholarships, etc. Students can apply for the Quebec Loan Program that College St-Michel Montreal provides in order to get financial aid. The admission procedure is similar to what most private institutions follow. That said, the admission requirements and eligibility criteria vary with every course. Therefore, prospective students must check these details before applying. The College St-Michel also extends the quality and short-term training to individuals who want to resume their studies, consolidate their skills, and acquire new ones. These individuals can pursue job-oriented training in Information Technology, Early Childhood Education, and Finance, among other disciplines. After completing these programs, students can also participate in the campus training facilities, followed by an internship, to get first-hand experience of job life. Students attend the College St-Michel for its wide choice of schedules, employment assistance, personalized service, state-of-the-art technology, guaranteed internship, additional aid for international students, job-oriented training, and stimulating environment.
Eligibility Overview: To study at College St. Michael, you must obtain a Study Permit, to do this, follow the steps to follow:Apply for admission by clicking on the admission tabApply for a CAQ, Certificate of Acceptance from Quebec.

Overview: Canadian Business College has been educating students for more than 30 years. It offers several courses in higher studies in different disciplines. Students worldwide opt for this college as the infrastructure, placement, and other facilities are very good. It has three campuses; among those, Canadian Business College Mississauga has an award-winning infrastructure. They provide a platform where trainers and students can best interact, learn theory, and relate it with the practical system. Canadian Business College Mississauga offers more than 19 courses in various streams like law, IT, Engineering, business, gaming, community services, etc. Both graduate and diploma degrees are there in the course curriculum. Name: University of Guelph
Overview: Guelph Institution is a public research university in Guelph, Ontario. It offers 48 graduate and 94 undergraduate programs and six associate degrees in a broad range of disciplines within seven colleges. The popular courses at the university are Agricultural Sciences, Physics, Biotechnology & Applied Microbiology, Engineering, Ecology, Social Sciences & Public Health and Plant & Animal Science. The Ontario Agriculture College has a network of research stations and campuses across Ontario. It offers English language courses in Guelph, Ridgetown and Kemptville Campuses and French courses in the Alfred Campus near Ottawa. The Satellite Campus is located in Toronto, named the University of Guelph-Humber, which grants honours degrees and college diplomas.The estimated average tuition & fees for full-time undergraduate programs for international students range between 24,300 CAD - 33,551 CAD; for graduate programs, the average cost is 6,837 CAD, excluding additional expenses.The university offers scholarships and financial aid like International Scholarships, International In-course Scholarships and International Registrar Entrance Bursaries. The Placement Cell of the University of Guelph is focused on students' practical exposure and financial independence by providing them with various career opportunities like part-time work on campus, Seasonal Employment in Summer/Winter Break, Internships, Volunteering and Jobs after completion of the degree.

Name: MacEwan University
Overview: Founded in 1971, MacEwan University was initially known as Grant MacEwan Community College and a higher education institution. In 1988, this college achieved authorization to extend university programs. Later, in 2009, this college became Alberta's 6th university and was renamed MacEwan University for all public communication and marketing purposes. The campus of this university offers multiple facilities and conducts programs such as a clinical simulation center, professional nursing education, and social innovation institute. This university holds the 4th position as the most sustainable university in Canada.More than 900 students from across 70 countries are admitted annually to this university. Furthermore, nearly 12,300 students are enrolled in different credit programs at the university. This institution provides small-class sizes, interactive sessions with the faculties, and technological and library resources. Creativity prospers through this university's research and innovation involving faculties, students, and the community. Known for offering the largest transfer-in higher education in Alberta, this university offers undergraduate programs. This university offers courses, including eight baccalaureates, 43 diploma and certificate programs, and two applied degrees. This institution maintains two schools and four faculties providing various programs such as fine arts and communication, liberal arts and sciences, engineering and physical education, business, nursing, health, and community studies; this university extends more than 19,000 parts and full-time students.MacEwan University encourages its students by offering them scholarships, grants, and awards. Enriched with culture, this institution provides transformative education and is associated with various international universities and colleges.
Eligibility Overview: Admission at MacEwan University varies greatly depending on the degree. In most cases, international students must apply with their Grade 12 results and subject credits. The entry requirements for Grade 12 are based on Alberta Education approved curriculum and nomenclature. Name: College of the North Atlantic - Labrador West
Overview: North Atlantic College has been a public college operating for the last 55 years. It is one of the most renowned colleges in postsecondary education and skill training centers. The College of the North Atlantic - Labrador West is in Canada and has been educating students since 2011. It is one of the new campuses among 17 other campuses. This city attracts many international students for the community, amenities, cost of living, and other facilities. The Labrador campus enrolls 160 regular students per semester offering business programs, apprentice training, and other industry-leading training skills. Besides regular programs, College of the North Atlantic - Labrador West courses include customized Contract Training and Educational courses for more than 500 participants per year. The tuition fees for one year are CAD 7,700.00, and the cost of living is CAD 12,960.00. The comprehensive program in arts and science is identical to Memorial University. Students get credit from both institutes, enhancing their portfolios' strength. All the program's curriculum meets the demands of the industry. It includes research and development, community and regional innovation, and international partnership with leading organizations for training and placement.The college offers courses in science, arts, industrial electrician, construction, heavy-duty equipment technician, etc. The facilities and infrastructure are student-friendly, and the placement rate is very high.

Name: St George Brown College
Overview: George Brown College in Toronto, Canada, is a public applied arts and technology institute established in 1967. Seven academic centres, namely the Centre for Health Sciences, Centre for Business, Centre for Preparatory and Liberal Studies etc., offer 170+ programs to about 30,000 students. Some of the courses are Art and Design Foundation, Gemmology, Media Foundation, Fashion TECH and Dance Performance. There are three George Brown College campuses in downtown Toronto; Casa Loma Campus, Waterfront Campus and St. James Campus.Those employed in a trade can enrol in one of the college's Apprenticeship Programs like Child Development Practitioner, Plumber Apprentice, Steamfitter Apprentice etc. Bridging Programs like Pathway from Architectural Technology and Pathway from Civil Engineering Technology allow for previous credits to be transferred towards a degree program in a similar area. Fast-Track programs in Early Childhood Education, Child and Youth Care etc., enable students to complete diploma courses faster.Online, day, weekend and evening Continuing Education courses include African Cooking, Cardiac Rehabilitation, Addictions and Mental Health Program etc. Through the Second Career Program, laid-off and under-employed individuals can receive further training to find suitable employment. The estimated tuition fee is CAD 3,537- CAD 19,646 Canadian and CAD 14,330- CAD 26,350 for International students. Financial aid options include scholarships, loans, bursaries and student employment like OSAP loans, George Brown College Alumni Endowment, George Brown College Bursary, Work-Study Program etc. George Brown College has an employment rate of 84%.

Name: University of Fraser valley
Overview: A university that achieved official university status in 2008, the University of Fraser Valley was founded in 1974 and is located in British Columbia, Canada. This government university has its campuses located in different places throughout Canada and also has an international campus in Chandigarh. 14.4% of the total students are international students from different parts of the world and have 25 students in a class. It offers 15 Bachelor's degrees, two Master's degrees, over 100 certificates, Diplomas, Postgraduate programs, and 110 online courses in the areas of agriculture, arts, social sciences, business, computer information systems, fine arts, and health sciences, sciences, and technology. The university's main campus is the Abbotsford campus, it consists of various student-friendly amenities such as a library, office spaces, a cafeteria, a residential area, a bookstore, and sports and student centers. The second campus is the Chilliwack campus, and it is located in Canada Education Park. This campus features a dental clinic, nursing station, theatre, and performance lab. The Mission Campus at Heritage Park Centre also offers students educational programs in graphic and digital design. The university also has other main centers situated in different places, which include The Aerospace Centre, The Agriculture Centre, The Hope Centre, and the Trades and Technology Centre. On-campus accommodation is available at the University of the Fraser Valley for its students in its Baker House Residence which is located on the Abbotsford campus. Each suite at Baker House Residence has two separate bedrooms. The shared common area has facilities like that a mini kitchen and bathroom and it is a non-smoking building. The fees for the University of Fraser Valley have to be paid in two instalments which comes to a total of 8,585 CAD.
Eligibility Overview: International students' admissions criteriaTo be admitted as an international student at UFV, you must meet the following criteria:Requirements in generalLanguage requirements in EnglishProgram specificationsUFV programmes are quite competitive. As a result, even if you meet the minimal programme entrance standards, an offer of admission cannot be guaranteed.
Accommodation: Why choose UFV as your home? The greatest way to have a full university experience is to live at Lá:lem te Baker, which is much more than just a place to live. Living on campus entails living in small communities with other students who also work, study, and socialise there. Feel supported while you learn new skills, expand your knowledge, and utilise many of the UFV campus's resources. Are you ecstatic? You ought to be!You Aspire to Achieve Academic SuccessThe academic performance of students who reside on campus is better. According to studies, students who live on campus have an average GPA that is 10% higher than that of the typical student. The Math Center, Assessment Center, Student Services, and Educational Technology Services are all just a stone's throw away.

Name: Yorkville University - Toronto
Overview: Established in 2003 as a private for-profit university and situated in New Brunswick, Canada, Yorkville University provides practitioner-oriented degree programs for developing the professional career of the students. It provides rigorous, career-oriented, and flexible degrees on campus and on the online platform. This university accepts students from different parts of the world, and students from nearly 35 countries have graduated from the university's career-oriented degree programs. Besides, this university provides undergraduate, postgraduate, and diploma courses. It also offers an online mode of education. This institution is widely known for its facilities. The mental and wellness department provides free counseling sessions to both offline and online students. They also offer career services to the students and provide assistance to them in every possible way. This university conducts small-class sizes so that every student gets individual attention. The institution offers a BBA program with specializations in Energy Management, Supply Chain Management, Project Management, and Accounting. These programs are approved by British Columbia and are offered on campus. Students can also participate in a UPS program while working at this university. One of the university's distinguishing features is that it provides both a BBA with a Project Management specialization and a Bachelor of Interior Design degree (BID). This institution provides jobs in a variety of fields, with a 100% placement rate.The average tuition fee for attending this university is CAD 10,500. Students can explore scholarship and bursary assistance and decrease tuition fees or maximum transfer credit compared to other universities.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Senior High SchoolStudents entering high school must have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (or equivalent) with a 65% average in six U/M level or equivalent courses, including Grade 12 English (ENG4U or equivalent), Grade 12 Math (or equivalent), and Grade 12 Science (or equivalent) (U or M Level). College/University Graduates from another university or college will be evaluated individually.Block transfer credits of up to 60 credits will be considered for graduates of 2 to 3-year college or university programmes. Language Proficiency in English

Name: European School of Esthetics
Overview:
European School of Esthetics is located at William Avenue in Winnipeg, Manitoba province. It is a member of both the National Association of Career Colleges and the Manitoba Association of Career Colleges. ESE is registered under the Private Vocational Institutions Act, Manitoba Advanced Education. Ever since 1986, this school has been delivering programs and courses in highly demanding fields.
This institute offers diploma and bridging programs. Besides this, it also provides Exam Prep Courses. Participants can opt to pursue their Diploma programs in Skin Care, Esthetics, and Nail Technician.  The two Bridging programs offered at this institute are Nail Technician and Skin Care Technician Bridging Program. 
The Exam Prep Courses delivered by this institute are in two areas - Nail Technician and Skin Care. These are curated for individuals who require this for government practical exams. This includes nail and skincare technicians entering Manitoba from some other nation or province.
The European School of Esthetics programs in Skin Care, Nail Technician, and Esthetics offer students a comprehensive understanding of the techniques and tools required for becoming the industry’s successful licensed professional. The Diploma programs of this institute are approved by the Ministry.
The class sizes at the European School of Esthetics are small. Students, therefore, receive a focused learning exposure from industry-trained faculty. ESE boasts of experienced admission counsellors who are capable enough to guide students in choosing the correct program. Besides this, there are experienced career services professionals who help students find a job.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - St. Anthony
Overview: College of the North Atlantic is a public college in Atlantic Canada and has 17 campuses across the state of Newfoundland and Labrador. It is renowned for being one of the largest post-secondary and education skills training institutions. One of the campuses, St. Anthony, is located on the tip of the Great Northern Peninsula of Newfoundland and Labrador.At the St. Anthony campus, students are offered five programmes Business Administration, Personal Care Attendant, Powerline Technician, etc., taught in a rural neighbourhood. College of the North Atlantic is home to 25000 students and offers 128 programmes in Law, computer science, business and management, architecture and construction, social studies etc.The college has a placement rate of 94%, and 90% of undergraduates get placed within six months. It also has an above-average acceptance rate of 65% and ensures personalised attention with a student-to-faculty ratio of 4:1. The college is focused on providing a friendly and safe living environment and enhancing students’ lives. Thus it offers many facilities like a renowned library and a full-service cafeteria and allows transferability of certificates and diplomas.Even though the College of the North Atlantic does not offer scholarships and financial aid, it attracts almost 3500 students from different countries with its high-quality education and low tuition fee. According to Webometrics, the college is ranked 85 among all universities in Canada.

Placement: Several programs call for students to complete an unpaid internship to receive a program certificate or graduate from the College of the North Atlantic. The goal of the work placement is to give students a unique learning opportunity in a natural workplace environment. Students gain technical skills and employability throughout the work experience, which furthers their personal development. It is a chance to get knowledge from a new network of connections and broaden perspectives on potential paths in life and business.  A work placement lasts two weeks for certificate programs and six weeks for diploma programs. Students must work a minimum of 30 hr/per week and a maximum of 40 hr/per week according to the employer's requirements. Commonly, the work placement occurs during intersession, pending the presence of an appropriate employer. The work placement will happen in the semester immediately following the last semester of studies for students who finish their degree outside of the standard order. Only graduates who receive certificates will finish the two-week work internship. Students' work placement will be completed at the end of your second year if you are in your first year of a two-year diploma program.
Accommodation: The campuses in Bay St. George, Burin, and Happy Valley-Goose Bay offer on-campus housing. Around the campus in Newfoundland and Labrador, the institution provides several off-campus housing choices. To make finding a place for students to live more accessible, the College of Atlantic has a list of off-campus housing options close to each campus. The following are some of the off-campus accommodations close to the university in Labrador and Newfoundland:Single room in an apartment or houseRental apartmentsRental housesBoarding houses Meal alternatives are available with off-campus accommodation options. These off-campus housing alternatives are accessible by car or foot and close to the college. Name: Coast Mountain College - Terrace
Overview: Incorporated in 1975 in Terrace in British Columbia, Coast Mountain College is an accredited post-secondary institute. Previously known as Northwest Community College (NWCC), this institution boasts five campuses serving 34 communities. The campus longhouse is present at the southern end of this Terrace campus.It is primarily utilized for cultural and student-centered activities. Additionally, it also hosts several events throughout the year. The First Nations Fine Arts program is one of its kind in Canada and takes place at the Freda Diesing studio. In this program, artists focus on the northern style of West Coast First Nations art.Coast Mountain College offers an array of Red Seal Trades training, post-degree diplomas, associate degrees, and certificates. Students can study environmental management, nursing, indigenous culture, social work, welding, business, and more. This college offers admissions to students entirely on a first-come-first-serve basis. Therefore, students who apply here first are given admission based on the number of vacant seats. The Coast Mountain College ranked 162nd among all the colleges in Canada as per Webometrics. On the other hand, according to the same ranking index, it secured the 2580th position among the colleges in North America as per Webometrics and the 10274th position globally. The average tuition fee at this college is CAD 12,500. On the other hand, residence and meal costs can go up to CAD 6,000 and CAD 54,000 each, while textbooks and other supplies can clock around CAD 2,000. Therefore, you can expect a total yearly expense of around CAD 25,900. The intake sessions at this college are fall, winter, and summer. Students here can also take advantage of several international degree partnerships and study abroad after spending one or two years at this institute.

Placement: The college helps students find jobs by providing job placement services. The college offers students positions and hiring prospects through its digital employment board and outcome campus connections.This platform serves as a skill-building and job-posting tool for current students and recent graduates. On this platform, students can find a variety of job possibilities provided by firms. Students can create a profile on the platform to be seen by potential employers.The college offers students various networking opportunities, job boards, and other resources to help them find the proper employment. Students can also get interview tips and skills from the college to help them prepare for their interviews.The college believes that the growth of its students is also the growth of the college. For this reason, the college offers students top-notch studies in various fields. Students can finish any full-time certificate programme to enhance their knowledge and develop their talents. Students looking for acceptable employment prospects can also get paid by the college to find jobs. The college can guarantee the overall growth of its pupils in this way.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation There are three two-story typical housing structures on the Terrace campus:Copper River Skeena River Nass RiverEach floor of each structure has a shower room, a TV room, and a kitchen area for light meal preparation.Microwaves, stoves, washers, and dryers are all included in the kitchens. Residents enjoy free wireless Internet access. Each room has a twin bed, a study table, and a closet.There are also lodging options on the Smithers campus.There are 20 single occupancy beds with TVs in each room, a communal kitchen, dining hall, shared living area with TV, laundry and dryer, and semi-private washrooms in the house. On-campus housing can be found here.

Name: Herzing College - Downtown Montreal
Overview: Herzing College is a private institute extending higher education and having its presence in several states including Toronto, Ottawa, Cambridge and Winnipeg. This institute boasts of being present at eight campus locations. There are two campus locations of Herzing College at Montreal. Out of these, the Central campus or Herzing College - Downtown Montreal is situated in the heart of downtown Montreal. Herzing College Montreal was established in 1968. This institute has accreditation and partnership with several associations and organizations on regional, local, and national levels. Some of these include NACC (National Association of Career Colleges), LSO (Law Society of Ontario), AMF( Autorité des marchés financiers), etc. Herzing College - Downtown Montreal aims to provide career-focused education, and thus the courses are designed to train students with skills that employers seek. It offers more than 10 diploma programs in the areas of Business, Design, Technology and Education. The college admissions take place in fall, winter and spring semesters. The college has a graduate employment rate of 89%. Besides being a secondary vocational studies institute (permit number 534501), Herzing College Montreal is a post-secondary institution with the recognition from the Ministry of Education and Higher Learning (permit number 749758). This institute extends several scholarships to its students for studying in Canada. Some of these include Academic Scholarship amounting to 1000 CAD; William R Rootham Scholarships valued at up to 20,000 CAD; Alumni Referral Scholarship. Qualifying Herzing College alumni can pursue a course at this institute at totally free of tuition cost, exclusive of textbook costs and lab fees. This institute’s alumni can also avail a 20% discount on certificates and courses offered by Kompass Professional Development. Besides their career-oriented education, students also receive Career Development classes to prepare professionally. Additionally, this college follows the P.R.I.C.E (Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Caring, and Engagement) model for students’ overall experience.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria is to be met by the applicant so that he/she is considered for admission. The eligibility criteria is as follows : Students should have completed high school and must be at least 18 years of age on the starting date of the programClear the Herzing College entrance assessment evaluationEnglish Proficiency Test Score requirement :TOEFL IBT : 78 or higherIELTS : 6.0 with no sub score less than 5.5Students who opt for a program in French need the language proficiency level, the requirements is as follows:DEP programs :  B1 levelAEC programs : B2 levelCandidates might have to clear a general admissions exam and program specific entrance tests.
Placement: Herzing College promises its students good and well-paying placements, with a placement rate of 89 percent (as of 2020). The college's Career Development Department works closely with employer partners to help them find the best personnel for their needs and to ensure that the curriculum of the programmes meets the needs of the industry. Aside from their career-oriented education, students are provided special Career Development classes to assist them prepare for the professional world. For their students' overall experience, they use the P.R.I.C.E paradigm (Professionalism, Respect, Integrity, Caring, and Engagement). The Career Development Department of the college assists students by matching them with appropriate internships and assisting them in developing their resumes. They send resumes to companies looking to hire students for full-time or part-time positions. Not only is continuous employment support provided during their programme, but also after they have completed it.
Accommodation: Herzing College's campus is noted for its diversity, friendliness, and inventiveness. The college campus, which is located in the heart of downtown Montreal, is close to all necessities as well as fun! The picturesque Montreal institution's campus includes beautiful grounds where students can get a breath of pure Canadian air. There are presently no on-campus housing options at Herzing College. There are numerous lodging possibilities in the vicinity of Herzing College. Students can ask the college administration for information on various living options, such as apartments, and then choose what best suits them. This assistance is given at no cost to you.

Name: Cape Breton University
Overview: Cape Breton University is a public university in Nova Scotia, Canada. It is an open research university comprising three institutes: the Xavier Junior College, Nova Scotia Eastern Institute of Technology, and the College of Cape Breton. It is the only university that grants post-secondary degrees within the Cape Breton Regional Municipality and on Cape Breton Island. Cape Breton University ranks well above the national averages for faculty-student interaction and service learning.Cape Breton University offers excellent research opportunities for undergraduate and graduate students. The college has a Center for local, regional, national, and international researchThe estimated cost to study at Cape Breton University is 28,000 CAD; in contrast, students can get jobs with packages up to 60,000 CAD.

To assist you in understanding the industry today, they also provide one-on-one and group workshops, lessons, and other services. You will receive help crafting your cover letters, CVs, and resumes. University Ranking: Cape Breton University is a public university in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada. Founded in 1974, it is the only post-secondary institution on Cape Breton Island. CBU offers a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs and professional and continuing education courses. CBU is consistently ranked among the top universities in Canada, with a reputation for excellence in teaching, research, and student experience. According to Maclean’s 2022 University Rankings, CBU is ranked #3 in the Atlantic region and #10 in the country. In addition, CBU is ranked #1 in the Atlantic region for student satisfaction and #2 in the country for student-faculty ratio. CBU is also highly rated for its research excellence. According to the 2022 Times Higher Education World University Rankings, CBU is ranked #1 in Canada for research impact. This ranking is based on the number of citations per faculty member, which indicates the research impact of a university’s faculty. CBU is also recognized for its commitment to sustainability. The university has achieved a Gold rating from the Sustainability Tracking, Assessment & Rating System (STARS), the most widely recognized framework for assessing sustainability performance in higher education. CBU is also ranked highly for its international reputation. According to the 2022 QS World University Rankings, CBU is ranked #1 in Canada for its global outlook. This ranking is based on the number of international students, faculty, and research collaborations. CBU is an excellent choice for students looking for a high-quality education. With its superb reputation, research excellence, commitment to sustainability, and international outlook, CBU is one of the top universities in Canada.

Name: Institut de tourisme et dhotellerie du Quebec (ITHQ)
Overview: Situated in the heart of Montreal, the Institut de Tourisme et d'hôtellerie du Québec (ITHQ) is a public school offering a range of academic and professional programs. The institute has been working on its vision of providing a world-class education to students from across the globe. Currently, the institute generates over 15,000 graduates annually. Focusing mainly on hospitality and hotel management, the institute has other courses, including restaurant management, event management, kitchen management, tourism techniques, etc. A highlight of Institut de Tourisme et d'hôtellerie du Québec (ITHQ) is its partnership with the real-world tourism business. It has helped the institute enhance its placement rate to almost 100%, ensuring that nearly every graduating student gets employed within six months. Moreover, the institute focuses on student prioritisation. The facilities on the campus include a café, restaurant and a 4-Star hotel, which help in first-hand training to the students. Institut de Tourisme et d'hôtellerie du Québec (ITHQ) Montreal is located at a crossroads between Europe and North America. Moreover, the internship programs they receive during the course periods help them apply the training and education in a practical realm. The institute’s partnership with some prominent brands in the hospitality and tourism industry guarantees placement following their graduation. It will not be wrong to conclude that ITHQ has been on the right track in fulfilling its ultimate goal of a world-class education. They have been less selective in their acceptance of international students. They are distinct in their approach, allowing the students to participate in student associations, join entrepreneurship, sommelier clubs etc., for enhancing their pre-training experience.

Name: ILAC International College - Vancouver
Overview: ILAC International College is a private career college founded by two scholars and pioneers of English education; Jonathan Kolber & Ilan Cohen. It has two wings, one in Toronto and another in Vancouver. ILAC International College Vancouver is a boutique campus connecting corporates with talent pools of students.They also provide short career courses like tourism, human resource, project management, business management, etc. Students across the globe aspire to get admission to this college for its entire infrastructure, education system, and location. Vancouver is a thriving ecosystem of economy, jobs, modern lifestyle, and globally leading companies. ILAC International College Vancouver tuition fee is CAD 7000-CAD 10500 approx, the cost of living is CAD 12,000, and the application cost is CAD 200 per year. The acceptance rate is moderate; applicants must pass the admission test to enrol in any course. They maintain a strong global network for placement and on-job training of their students. Some leading companies recruiting from ILAC International College Vancouver are CN Tower, Marriott Hotels, Toronto Pearson Airport, Hays Recruitment, Starbucks Coffee Co., Tommy Hilfiger, etc. It offers on-campus and off-campus facilities, classrooms, and laboratories; research centres are excellent for strengthening students' knowledge and skills. Therefore, it is on top of the wish list of numerous students.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for the courses provided by ILAC the applicant must have IELTS score of 4.0 - 5.0 or higher.
Accommodation: Students should book their lodgings well in advance of their arrival, since all available accommodations fill up rapidly, especially before the semester begins.Accommodations at On-Campus Residences The institution provides on-campus housing accommodations at its discretion. Accommodations Off-Campus Off-campus rental housing options include single homes, duplexes, apartments, and rooms for rent in the surrounding region. Students who choose to live off-campus must conduct their own research and arrive well before the start of the semester to do so. Homestay There are many different types of homestays to choose from, and our partners do their best to connect students and hosts based on their interests and preferences. Singles, young couples with children and pets, and elderly couples are among the homestay hosts. All homestay lodgings have been inspected, and all adults in the household have completed the mandatory criminal background check. https://ilacinternationalcollege.com/accommodations/

Name: ILAC International College - Toronto
Overview:
ILAC International College was founded by two English-language education pioneers, Ilan Cohen and Jonathan Kolber. It is registered as a private career college under the Private Career Colleges Act, 2005 and is a member of the NACC.
It extends career-focused programs in Sales, Customer Service, Marketing, and Business. One of this institute’s boutique campuses is situated in the heart of Toronto, a neighbourhood that is steps away from some major landmarks.
Some ILAC International College programs include Service Excellence with Business Communication, Health Care Administration, Service Excellence for Business, Sales & Marketing and Business Administration.
This Designated Learning Institution delivers TESOL programs taught by industry experts. These programs have reached perfection after being subjected to over 2000 hours of research and development.
ILAC International College has co-op specialists that support students in their job search and connect them with employers. This team helps students with their resume, job interview coaching, helping them in building their LinkedIn profile, and many others.
As a part of their studies, enrolled international students of full-time programs with a 26 week or longer duration are eligible for working off-campus for up to 20 hours every week. On the other hand, enrolled co-op program students can work on a full-time basis during the co-op portion of the programs.
Some of the best employers recruiting from this college include Marriott Hotels, Billy Bishop Toronto City Airport, Balzac’s Coffee Roasters, Four Seasons Hotel Whistler, Novotel Hotels & Resorts, etc.
The Accommodation Department of ILAC provides the students with many housing options that fit their lifestyle and profile.

Name: Southern Alberta Institute of Technology
Overview: A public polytechnic institute in Alberta, Canada, the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology (SAIT), established in 1916, comprises nine academic schools, namely the School of Business, School of Transportation, and School of Construction, that offer career-based courses in over ten areas of interest. Some certificate and diploma courses are: Architectural Technologies, Energy Asset Management, Hospitality Management, and Pharmacy Assistant. There are four campuses, the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology in Calgary, the Main Campus, the Mayland Heights, SAIT Culinary, and Art Smith Aero Centre. The institute offers Continuing Education programs concerning Health & Wellness, Graphic & Media Arts, Food & Hospitality, etc., to help enhance professional skills and part-time courses like Business Administration, Land Analyst, Data Analytics, etc. Through the Open Studies program, students can choose different credit courses to discover their interests and aptitudes. It provides apprenticeship courses in over 30 trades. SAIT also provides business and industry training to over 11,000 industry partners. Southern Alberta Institute of Technology has a graduate employment rate of 91%. Accommodation is available on-campus in 1, 2, and 4-bedroom suites and studio apartments at Begin Tower and East Hall. There are over 60 student clubs and societies to join, like Enactus and Phi Theta Kappa. Some fitness facilities are the Wellness Centre, Cohos Commons Field, squash courts, the Arena, etc. Financial aid includes awards, loans, scholarships, and bursaries like Canada Apprentice Loans, Bissett Bursary Program, and Allied Van Lines Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants' qualifications largely influence international admissions at the Southern Alberta Institute of Technology. Name: CDI College - Montreal
Overview: CDI College - Montreal, located in Canada, offers over 100 undergraduate, graduate, and diploma programs focused on developing skills in the students. With over 100 courses focusing on different fields, CDI Colleges provides a personalized experience for each student. The courses combine classroom-based theory knowledge with practical applications to help the students develop a broad knowledge and skill set.The cost of studying on-campus is course dependent and falls between 21,000 CAD to 78,000 CAD. The college offers many scholarships through loans, awards, and grants. The college is also renowned for including parents in a student's academic journey.The college also has Campus Financial Advisors who provide the students with expertise and advice related to financial aid and scholarships. The college offers fast-paced degrees and organizes projects to prepare students for workplace challenges. The college provides high-quality programs that combine a career-focused education approach and a candidate's professional skills. The CDI College has an employment rate of over 85%. Many programs at the college also offer job placement while studying to train individuals with the skills relevant to the industry.

Name: Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences
Overview: Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences is a private college in the North York district of Ontario, Canada. It was established in 2003 and offers challenging programs in life science. It has two branches; one in Toronto and another in Mississauga. Both premises have state-of-art laboratories, modern classroom facilities, cutting-edge technology, and programs preparing students to meet the thriving demands of the industry. It has a regulatory body and team of certified experts, trainers, and course development consultants. The institute's objective is to develop skills and enhance the career of students in systematic ways. Some popular disciplines taught here are Pharma, Biopharma, Medical Devices, Clinical Research, Healthcare, Food, Cannabis, Cosmetics, etc. The Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences programs include diplomas, certificates, online programs (diploma and certification), workshops, webinars, corporate training, etc. To get admission to this college, a student requires a Grade Point Average (GPA) of around 3 International Baccalaureate (IB score) of about 33, to name a few. The Academy of Applied Pharmaceutical Sciences' tuition fee varies from one course to another; however, the average course fee is $12,9000-$13,000. The institute also offers scholarships, loans, and grants to support all students financially while pursuing the course. The employment rates are 80% for graduate courses and 100% for certificate courses. Both domestic and international students can enroll in this college. Online registration and in-class virtual registration facilities are available. This institute has developed an educational system through the International Student Program of Citizenship and Immigration Canada. It helps maintain high-quality education and integrity in the academic system of Canada. This institute's personalized learning environment includes systematic support, training efficacy, evaluation, and grading.

Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation: Students who live in shared apartments have a private room in a house or apartment with one or more other people. They share a kitchen, bathroom, dining area, and living room area, like townhomes, and typically include a single-occupancy bedroom or living space.As you begin your new life in Canada, living with a host family may provide you with a sense of security and home. One to three meals per day, as well as internet access, are typically offered by host families in addition to a private, single-occupancy room. Homestay: A host family can also share meals with you and provide information about the area. They can also introduce you to Canadian culture and customs. Both shared housing and room-only accommodations (without meals) might be choices. To go to college, homestay residents should plan on taking a 30 to 50-minute bus or train ride. In Canada, this is a typical commute time. Tips for off-campus accommodationMake sure to inquire whether your school or agent can help you make reservations for housing in CanadaAlways transmit money after visiting the unit or meeting the owner in person to avoid falling victim to fraud on some platforms, like CraigslistSchools may suggest a placement agency, direct students to do their own searching for housing, or offer accommodation services internally. Determine the policy of the school and take initiativeIt is not required that you select the accommodations offered or suggested by the schoolWhatever you choose to do, make sure you find housing where you feel safe and secure and where you can study and succeed while you are in Canada

Name: Douglas College - New Westminster
Overview: Douglas College was founded in 1970 as a public degree-granting college in Canada. It has two branches; Douglas College—New Westminster offers university and degree courses. Apart from these two wings, it has many small training centres across Surrey. It has both on-campus and off-campus study options for students. Several national and international students study here every year to kick-start their careers and climb the career ladder. Douglas College—New Westminster enrols more than 24,000 students annually. This strength comprises approximately 17,000 credit students and another 8,500 continuing students. Around 4,210 are international students from 92 countries. They deliver education for ten bachelor's degrees with a team of 960 staff and faculty. The courses offered are applied community studies, commerce and business administration, health studies, humanities and social science, language, literature and performing arts, and technology. They offer a short degree duration that is well-knit and has the potential for gaining theoretical and practical knowledge. The faculty, infrastructure, training, curriculum module, accommodation, and all other factors are well rated by students. They provide a platform to achieve the career objective and acquire knowledge simultaneously.Some courses are business, administration, arts, science, nursing, healthcare, therapeutic science, child care, etc. Douglas College-New Westminster's fee is CAD 18,000 per year, and the application fee is CAD 100.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Ridge Road
Overview: College of the North Atlantic - Ridge Road offers a wide range of courses and programs, from Architectural Engineering Technology, Instrumentation and Controls Engineering Technology to Mechanical Engineering Technology, etc. It is situated in the southeast part of the island in the city of the historic commercial centre, St. John’s. The programs available here allow students to acquire in-depth knowledge and get hands-on experience after they are done completing their studies. Approximately 1,000 students can complete the full-time credit-course registration per semester, while for part-time registration, the college allows 150 students. To help students bear the educational expenses of College of the North Atlantic courses, the institution provides financial assistance like scholarships, loan facilities, etc. However, as claimed by the institution, its tuition fees are comparatively lower than other post-secondary colleges of that region. The college also ensures that the students get assistance from experienced faculty members and researchers before they get into their professional life. Additionally, students can opt for distance programs if they are not able to study on-site. In such cases, the study materials will be mailed out to their address. It also has certain facilities for international students and they can choose from any of the 200 online graduate and post-graduate courses, diplomas, certificate programs, etc. College of the North Atlantic Ridge Road’s UG/PG course ratio is 58.1%. Apart from academic assistance, it also provides student support services, a friendly living environment, etc.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - Saint John
Overview: Moncton is situated in New Brunswick's largest city, Moncton. Though founded in 1974, it embarked on a self-governance model in 2010, establishing itself as an autonomous Crown Corporation. The campus offers 40 full-time regular programs, part-time programs, and online continuing education courses.Courses include Administrative Professional, Applied and Media Arts, Business Administration, Civil Engineering Technology, Electrical, and Electronics Engineering, Health, Hospitality and Tourism, Information Technology, Social Sciences, and Trades. The campus promotes learning in a dynamic environment through hands-on training, state-of-the-art equipment, and real-world experiences.The campus boasts more than 1400 students from different countries, adequately represented by a diverse student body. The facilities include a cafeteria, dining room run by hospitality students, gymnasium, fitness center, bookstore, and student lounges. The NBCC foundation duly takes care of needy students by aiding them with scholarships and bursaries. The New Brunswick Community College ranking on Webometrics is 151 (in Canada) and 2538 (Continental). The college offers different pathway program options that allow students greater flexibility and freedom when studying. They can also opt for night school courses and apprenticeship training. Fees for international students are covered by 10,000 CAD. For them, the IELTS requirement is 6. Local students can study by paying fees of around 4,000 CAD. The college generally follows a first qualified, first admitted policy during the admission process.The alumni program at New Brunswick Community College is engaging as it boasts an alumni community of more than 1500 graduates. It acts as a virtual network for moving ahead. The annual graduate survey in 2020 reported that 91% of the graduates were employed. This statistic proves the success of its effective curriculums.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Burin
Overview: Established in 1997, the College of the North Atlantic (CNA) has a history dating back nearly 50 years. It has 17 campuses in Canada’s Newfoundland and Labrador province and various partner institutions across the globe. The College of the North Atlantic - Burin is situated on Newfoundland’s east coast on Placentia Bay. The College of the North Atlantic - Burin offers several programs in several disciplines, such as Business Administration, Comprehensive Arts & Science (CAS transfer), Executive Office Management, and Engineering Technology (diploma course). This campus also comprises a cafeteria, learning commons, and gymnasium. In addition, it offers numerous scholarships and awards, including the Johanna Noseworthy Memorial Award, Student Representatives Council Achievement Awards. A. Harvey Group of Companies Entrance Scholarships, Country Ribbon Entrance Scholarship, CICan Paul and Gerri Charette Bursary, AETTNL Scholarships, Lloyd Murchy CET Scholarship, and TD Insurance Scholarships. CNA is a notable name as it is one of the most considerable post-secondary skills and educational training centres in Atlantic, Canada. The College of the North Atlantic - Burin campus is famous among students due to its location in the historic town, which also offers several recreational facilities and amenities. The college's fee structure varies with each program and its corresponding semester. For instance, the tuition fee to pursue Executive Office Management amounts to $726 for the fall semester, $294 for the intersession semester, and $726 for the winter semester. Prospective students should also note that the fee structure comprises book costs, and compulsory fees, alongside supply and computer costs (for select courses). The College of North Atlantic-Burin aims to proffer knowledgeable, highly competent, and successful graduates who have fond and lasting memories of their educational experience at this campus.

Name: Great Plains College - Warman Campus
Overview: Great Plains College - Warman Campus, located in Western Saskatchewan, offers a wide range of courses, post-secondary diplomas, certificate programs, etc. It offers a six-week heavy equipment operator program that enables students to get first-hand experience about different field projects and training. It is the first regional college in Saskatchewan to come up with a health and dental plan for its students and also powerful scholarship programs for them. Additionally, a mental health and wellness program is also linked with this in order to help students acquire a positive approach while studying. Apart from academic life, students also get to remain involved in several campus events. The college hosts one event every three days, and the student association comprising hard-working students are in charge of hosting them. Besides on-campus programmes, students can also take part in the Olympic torch relay, community tree plantings, Halloween costume and ugly sweater contests, fundraising auctions, etc. during their course duration. Students who are interested in extra-curricular activities can get involved with the Sun Dogs Athletics program. Those who are enrolled in a full-time program can be a part of this. The overall performance data (2017-18) of Great Plains College shows that 70% of post-secondary students have gotten employed within 60-90 days of completing their courses. Great Plains College tuition fees depend on the course or program students are opting for. However, it also offers scholarship programs where a specific portion of the total educational expenses are provided by the institution.
Eligibility Overview: Grade 12 or successful completion of three Business Certificate courses (each worth at least three credit units)Language requirement: English
Placement: According to the Saskatchewan Ministry of the Economy, the annual income range for full-time professional vocations in business management consulting in Saskatchewan in 2019 was $51,000 - $107,720. Employees may make more or less money depending on their employer, location, company size, training, experience, and working hours.Students will have completed the educational requirements for the Certified in Management (CIM) professional designation when they graduate; people are able to apply for the privilege to use the highly valued "CIM" after their name after two years of management or supervisory job experience.

Name: Grant MacEwan University
Overview: Established in 1971, Grant MacEwan University was previously called the Grant MacEwan Community College. The public institution of higher education is located in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. Alberta College Campus and City Center Campus are the two urban campuses of the university. The city center campus is the larger of the two and spreads over seven city blocks in downtown Edmonton. It is a kilometer away from the Alberta campus. MacEwan has four faculties and two schools that offer eight four-year undergraduate programs, 2 applied degrees, and 43 diploma and certificate courses in full-time, part-time, distance learning, and online. Some popular courses offered are Accounts and Commerce, Bachelor of Design, and Business.  On-campus accommodation in a 13-story building has fully furnished suites to choose from at a monthly expense of 988–1,300 CAD. Facilities like game rooms, study and luxury lounges, theatres, meal plans, WiFi, shopping centers, and restaurants are provided. The acceptance rate at MacEwan is 59%, and admissions take place by filling out application forms on the official website with an application fee of 110 CAD. Academic transcripts, scores of TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, etc., and program-specific documents have to be submitted. 95% of MacEwan graduates found employment within six months of graduation, with an average annual salary of $64756 CAD.The average undergraduate tuition fee amounts to 20,137 CAD, and the overall cost of living is up to 11,549 CAD. Merit-based scholarships like the CFCW, worth 1000 CAD, and the Aaron Michael Memorial Bursary, worth 600 CAD, are awarded after students apply for the same on the university portal.
Eligibility Overview: Admission requirements at MacEwan University vary greatly depending on the degree. In most cases, international students must apply with their Grade 12 results and subject credits. The entry requirements for Grade 12 are based on Alberta Education approved curriculum and nomenclature. High school topics are divided into four divisions, with the exception of English Language Arts:Group A (Humanities)Group B (Fine Arts)Group C (Sciences)Group D (Optional/Electives )Credit requirements will vary depending on the subject chosen by the students. Credits from following internationally renowned tests are also accepted by the university:Any university credit from CanadaDiploma of International BaccalaureateAdvanced Standing (AP)International students from non-English-speaking countries must also present one of the following English language competency scores:

Placement: Before beginning field placement/clinical practice/practicum, international students must get a co-op work permit. A co-op work permit is distinct from your study permit; it is a separate permission that allows overseas students to engage in work that is directly related to their course of study. Because you will be working with vulnerable individuals in the health, community, or medical fields, you must have a current medical assessment by an IRCC approved panel physician before applying for a co-op work permit.Inquire with MacEwan International about the required paperwork. Because current IRCC processing periods are considerable, you should apply for a co-op work visa 4-6 months before the start of your field placement/clinical practice/practicum.Visit:- https://www.macewan.ca/academics/programs/bachelor-of-child-and-youth-care/academics/field-placement/

Name: Alexander College - Burnaby
Overview: Alexander College is a renowned institute for graduation and diploma courses in Columbia. It has two urban campuses in Burnaby and Vancouver, training more than 2,000 students yearly. It was established in 2006 and named after Sir Alexander Mackenzie, a Scottish author. It's accredited by top-notch organizations and is a member of the BC transfer system. Alexander College Burnaby has a first-rate infrastructure and academic facility with high-tech laboratories, libraries, a learning center, book stores, etc. The Alexander College Burnaby undergraduate courses comprise all subjects in the discipline of art, science, and commerce. It also offers graduate courses and other diploma courses. Faculty members and board members are industry experts and leading professionals.This institute trains and provides higher degrees to domestic and international students. The selection process, course curriculum, and evaluation process match industry requirements. Alexander College Burnaby is one of the best institutes among its peers, providing a competent platform for students to kick-start their careers. The training approach is scientific and practical oriented, connecting the world of theoretical academics and the corporate world. The fees of Alexander College Burnaby are affordable for other colleges and universities in South America.The diversified training program aligning with the industry-standard prepares the students very nicely to attain the further goal of their careers. Moreover, it provides on-campus work, academic advising, free tutorial, workshop, peer mentorship program, interactive events, activities, etc. Due to the location, they attract lots of students across the world.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: Students must possess a Grade 12 certificate from the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) Board or a CISCE high school diploma to study undergraduate (Council for Indian School Certificate Examinations). The university also accepts certificates from intermediate or pre-university levels. The cutoff is not specified. However, a secondary education score from CBSE or ICSE above 80% is advised. Graduate: To enrol in graduate courses, students must hold an undergraduate degree or diploma from a tier-1 or tier-2 university. For each course, a different GPA or set of prerequisites applies. They still require a review of 12 GPAs, with an overall average of at least 65 per cent on each topic. English Requirements:
