Placement: Alexander College is well known for its excellent career and employability programmes. The university staff works to connect students with the best jobs and training opportunities possible. A few of these include:Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP)Career and Academic AdvisingResume, Cover Letter and CV buildingJob Boards and Volunteer ServiceInternships and On-the-Job TrainingPlacement TestingRecruitment and Job FairsCo-op Education Program
Accommodation: Off-Campus Accommodation: All students require housing. Alexander College is currently unable to offer on-campus accommodation due to the schools' metropolitan settings. In light of this, campus campuses are adjacent to significant transit hubs to reduce students' commuting times.Homestay, room rental, or apartment rental are the three accommodation options most frequently selected by students. Homestay: Canadian homestay arrangements are appropriate for students looking for a truly Canadian experience. Host families give homestay students security, care, and safety, which also help them feel a part of the family and learn about Canadian culture. In British Columbia, students under 19 must live with a host family and have a local legal guardian. If they so choose, students over 19 may also choose to reside with a host family. If necessary, homestay firms offer guardianship services to international students. Apartment Rental SingleFrom one neighbourhood to the next, renting an apartment in Vancouver may be expensive. Downtown, Yaletown, Cambie Village, and West Vancouver are some of Vancouver's priciest neighbourhoods. The monthly rent for a studio or one-bedroom apartment in certain places may exceed $2,000. Apartments may start at $1000 a month in less expensive parts of the city such as East Vancouver, Commercial Drive, Fraserview, and Marpole. With typical rent for a studio or one-bedroom starting at $800 a month, Burnaby offers slightly more affordable living than Vancouver. Rent will be less expensive the farther you are willing to move from Vancouver. SharedEach year, hundreds of international students attend university in Vancouver. Making friends and saving money can be accomplished by living in shared housing with other international students. On the student notice bulletin boards at any campus, Alexander College students may post advertisements for available shared accommodation. The available apartment listings can also be obtained in newspaper classifieds, although the most recent listings can be located online.

Name: Kaplan International English - Toronto
Overview:
Kaplan International English Toronto is located in downtown Toronto, a few minutes from the CN Tower and is situated in the vicinity of Jack Layton Ferry Terminal. Kaplan International Languages has received accreditation from the British Council for teaching of English in the United Kingdom. This school is also an IELTS test venue.
This institute extends several courses and programs on English language to students who aim to make a career abroad. There are more than 30 customised programs offered by this institute. The various English courses offered at this institute are Flexible English Courses, Long-term English Courses, Business English Courses, and Exam Preparation Courses. Kaplan International English Toronto has 450 students on an average hailing from around 41 nationalities from all over the globe. This institute features 15 classrooms to provide them with intense English language training.This institute offers several facilities to its students like computer lab, student lounge, interactive white boards, and WiFi.
The teachers are highly-qualified in linguistics and have years of experience. It also extends its support to the students by offering them access to full-time support services including an academic tutor to help in studies. In addition, there is a student well-being service that provides support and guidance for any worry or help in student’s accommodation. All teachers at this institute are TESL certified, possess a degree and a minimum teaching experience of 5 years. Besides this, all of them are K+ teaching experts. The various languages spoken by this institute’ staff are Spanish, Ukrainian, Portuguese, Arabic, French, Italian, Japanese, Korean, and Russian.
Kaplan International English provides its University Placement Service (UPS) allowing the students to benefit from an extensive network of partner universities and colleges.

Name: Pacific Coast Community College (PCCC)
Overview: Pacific Coast Community College is a Designated Learning Institution that was established in 2004 to address the rising demand of highly qualified Health Care Assistants. This institute is designated by the Private Training Institutions Branch (PTIB) of the Ministry of Advanced Education, Skills and Training. Students can choose their desired Pacific Coast Community College program out of the several offered by this institution. These include the Health Care Assistant Program which trains individuals for functioning effectively as a front-line care-giver and a health care team’s respected member. It also offers an Acute Care Aide Program which is a full-time diploma program that prepares students for working as an Acute Care Aide. The Acute Care Skills Program for Health Care Assistants adds on foundational skills, attitude and knowledge gained through the Health Care Assistant (HCA/RCA) Program. Every program that this college delivers needs the students to possess several requirements. Some of these include a Grade 12 or mature student status (Age of 19 years or more) and required English Language Proficiency level. Pacific Coast Community College students pursuing the Acute Care Skills Program for Health Care Assistants need to pay a tuition fee that lies somewhere in the range of $2,200 to $2,300 (including a non-refundable registration fee of around $130 to $170). The tuition fee payable for students pursuing the Health Care Assistant Program lies in the range $7,700 to $7,800 (including additional fees). The Acute Care Aide Program delivered by this college asks for a tuition fee lying in the range of $16,600 to $16,700 (plus additional fees). Health Care Assistants who are newly qualified can expect their earnings to range between $25,000 and $35,000 for a year depending on the nature of their position. After gaining a few years of experience, this salary is likely to get hiked and touch a value of approximately $37,000 or above.
Eligibility Overview: All programs offered by Pacific Coast Community College have the following requirements:Grade 12 or mature student Status (19 years of age or older).English Language Proficiency (see details below)International students must provide a criminal record check from their country of origin prior to admissionTB Screening that is less than 6 months old + updated immunizations required before commencing practicumAcceptable criminal records check as required by the Criminal Records Review Act less than 6 months old before commencing practicum ENGLISH LANGUAGE PROFICIENCY REQUIREMENTS1. Applicants who have been educated in an  English-speaking environment  for a minimum of seven years or have been educated in an English-speaking environment  for three consecutive years at the secondary or post-secondary level, are to submit evidence of one of the following:Successful completion of Grade 10 English;OR Language Proficiency Index (LPI) with a total score of at least 20 and an essay level of 4 with a score of 24/40.2. Applicants who have not been educated in an English-speaking environment for a minimum of seven (7) years or four years at the secondary or post-secondary level, are to submit evidence of one of the following:Canadian Language Benchmark Placement Test (CLB PT) — test must be within the last six months: Listening 7, Speaking 7, Reading 6 and Writing 6.OR Test of English as a Foreign Language (TOEFL) — test must be within the last two years. IBT only: Overall score of 76 with no score lower than 20 in Speaking and Listening and no score lower than 18 in Reading and Writing.OR International English Language Testing System (IELTS) Academic or General — test must be within the last two years: Overall score of 6 with a minimum of 6 in Speaking and Listening and no score lower than 5.5 in Reading and Writing.OR Canadian English Language Proficiency Index Program (CELPIP – General) — test must be within the last two years: Listening 7, Speaking 7, Reading 6 and Writing 6.OR Canadian Academic English Language Assessment (CAEL) — Overall Score of 60, with no section less than 50.
Accommodation: With over 20 years of expertise catering to international students from over 40 countries, you can rest assured that with Home Sweet Homestay (HSH) all your accommodation needs will be anticipated. Our commitment is to providing you and your clients the finest homestay experience in Canada - bar none.All HSH Canada homestays are inspected by our staff of experienced coordinators to ensure our standards of top quality, cleanliness, and comfort are always met.Homestays are also selected with a mind to convenience. Families are located a maximum of 45 minutes between their homestay and registered school.All HSH homes provide internet free of charge so you can stay in touch with family and friends conveniently at no additional expensefor more information click on this link-https://pacificcollege.ca/home-stay

Name: Matrix College
Overview: Matrix College, Montreal, is a licensed private college specializing in Engineering, Technology, and Business programs. The secondary level programs offered at Matrix College help students develop industry-relevant, practical skills that make them career-ready. Moreover, the college ensures a dedicated focus on student welfare and satisfaction.The faculty at Matrix College includes industry experts. Additionally, the accelerated training system at Matrix College ensures that every student develops job-relevant skills, preparing them for the job market. Matrix College is a good choice if you are looking for a specialized course to help prepare you for immediate employment and job success. The programs offer hands-on training that helps prepare for job roles and functions. The small batch sizes and flexible schedules make studying and preparation more accessible, especially for those juggling the course with other educational or job demands. Courses run at Matrix College are approved by the Ministry of Education, which gives you much greater certainty about your chosen programs. Most importantly, all courses come with a 100% satisfaction guarantee meaning you can retake the classes for free if you aren’t completely satisfied with the teaching.Matrix College helps students avail financial assistance offered by the Quebec Government. Furthermore, the college ensures that all courses are affordable and offers flexible payment plans to new students. Moreover, the applicability of the Education Tax Credit and affordable course pricing ensure you save a lot more money compared to other colleges and programs.

Name: Red River College - Portage Campus
Overview: Established in 1938, Red River College of Applied Arts, Science and Technology is considered to be the largest institute of Manitoba province, applied research and learning. This college comprises different campuses in Steinbach, Winnipeg, Southport, Winkler, Portage, Selkirk etc. The Portage campus is situated in the Central Plains region of Manitoba and provides more than 200 certificates, workshops, part-time courses, and full-time diploma programs that offer opportunities for professional and personal development for aspiring students at various stages of their careers. It is one of the fastest-growing universities in Canada. This institution dedicatedly provides effective training to those who are willing to obtain a good skill in the fields of Trade, Science, Technology, Commerce and Arts. This college is one of the oldest research, vocational and educational institutions globally and provides top-notch learning in Applied Accounting, Digital Media Design, Medical Sciences, Aircraft and Aerospace, Business Information Technology, Culinary Arts etc. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 94% and a graduation satisfaction rate of 96%, this institution serves approximately 21, 000 students annually. At the beginning of every month, an additional English language program is offered to the international students. This Red River college comprises 8 student residences along with certain amenities, services and educational disciplines. The academy has achieved high appreciation for its Culinary Arts and Aerospace learning experience. This institution provides a comprehensive range of courses for international students, including Transportation technology, health sciences, Indigenous education, Intensive English, Creative Arts, etc. Apart from these, this Portage campus provides spacious classrooms, a computer study area, a gymnasium, accessibility and a gymnasium. The small-class sizes, the friendly environment, and convenient location are some of the essential advantages enjoyed by the students.
Eligibility Overview: The primary academic prerequisite is the first admission criteria, denoted by the number "1." This can be either Grade 12 (the equivalent of a Grade 12 education in Manitoba) or Post-Secondary Education (the equivalent of a Grade 12 education in Manitoba plus a diploma or degree in the associated profession, as indicated in that section).Pass a language proficiency test (TOEFL, IELTS Academic, or CanTest) with the required minimum results;Send your resume to the Department of International Business.Programs in the Creative Arts include: Participate in a necessary orientation and submit a portfolio (not required at the time of application, but required as part of the acceptance process).Provide proof of current and finished vaccines and tests to the Health Care Aide.

Name: University of Quebec
Overview: The University of Quebec or the Universití du Quíbec Montríal (UQAM) is a research university founded in 1969, located in Quíbec, Canada. The university has two campuses - The central campus in the Entertainment District and the Latin Quarter and Pierre-Dansereau Science Complex.The university offers 305 programs managed by six faculties of Science and Social science, Education, Arts, Communication, Political Science and Law and one school of Management. Some popular courses are Cognitive science, Biology, and Management Technology. QUAM is known for its research programs with more than 100 research units in humanities, natural sciences, social health and creation. The annual tuition fee ranges from CAD 18,000 to CAD 29,000 for various undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs. Students can seek assistance from the Ministry of Education and Higher Education Loans and Bursaries Program for financial aid. These provide scholarships such as Master's support scholarships, Fee Exemption Grants for Foreign Doctoral Students, Study Without Borders Scholarships, and Excellence Scholarship Programs for Foreign Students PBEEE - FRQNT.The university helps students seeking employment through the Job Bank at the Student Life Services. The average salary of a University of Quebec Graduate is CAD 67,000.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsIndividuals from other Canadian provinces or territories, as well as overseas students, can find all the information they need on the university's website on particular admission requirements.

Name: Ontario Tech University
Overview: Previously known as the University of Ontario, Ontario Tech University, established in 2022, is located in Canada. Ontario Tech University's academic structure comprises seven faculties, which house various departments focusing on different subject areas. The university provides career-focused education at the undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral levels, offering courses in science, business, education, humanities, health sciences, information technology, and social sciences. It also provides online programs for working professionals to educate themselves using a flexible learning module. The university comprises 10,000 students, more than 2200 academic instructors, administrative faculties, and supporting members, and possesses world-class research facilities, including over 80 specialized laboratories. The institution also has tie-ups with many companies and organizations that offer students internships and research opportunities. The Alumni Association Council of Ontario Tech organizes various events and programs for alums and serves as a liaison between them and current students.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the eligibility criteria and language requirements for applying to undergraduate and postgraduate programmes available to international students at Ontario Tech:  Requirements for Indian Students: Indian students must have passed the CBSE, CISCE, or Individual State Boards Class 12 or Standard XII Board Examination and submit mark sheets of the same for admission. The university encourages Indian students to upload a copy of their admit card to the university's official website.

University Ranking: Ontario Tech University, a government-run higher learning and research school in Oshawa, Ontario, was founded in 2022. The university's forename was the University of Ontario Institute of Technology. The seven faculties at Ontario Tech, each focusing on a different subject area, are the Faculty of Business and Information Technology, Faculty of Health Science (FHS), Faculty of Social Sciences and Humanities (FSSH), Faculty of Engineering and Applied Science (FEAS), Faculty of Energy Systems and Nuclear Science, Faculty of Science (FS), Faculty of Education (FE),  and Faculty of Graduate Studies.According to the ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) - Universities Rankings for 2020, Ontario Tech University is among the top 800 universities worldwide. For three years, in 2017, 2018, and 2019, the university was ranked between 701 and 800. In the Shanghai ranking, universities are not ranked according to their standing among academics or employers; instead, they are ranked according to the calibre of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes their team has earned.The Ontario Tech University is also included in the list of top global universities published by US News & World Report, where it has received rankings of 1022 for 2020 and 1098 for 2021. As part of their ranking methodology, US News & World Report specifically considers the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each) for the US.

Name: Academy of Learning Career College - Surrey
Overview: The Academy of Learning Career College is a specialised college for business skills and computer training for adults and follows the mode of the integrated learning system. Operational since 1987, it has helped over 100,000 students achieve their professional ambitions. They provide diploma and certificate programmes in various disciplines like accounting, healthcare, community support, hospitality, customer support, etc. Their course structure follows a multi-sensory learning style and ranges from media presentations to practical demonstrations. The onsite campus facilitator supports the students in getting acquainted with the process of technical learning through an interactive classroom community. The curriculum is taught in a variety of ways and includes classroom as well as individual coaching that addresses queries and problems of every student. The e-learning portal has comprehensive course material, practice modules, and evaluation process. Online presentations, tutorials, instructional materials, pre-post-test makes the course material exhaustive. Presently there are more than 50 academic centres under the Academy of Learning Career College – Surrey facilitating over one million students worldwide. The institute focuses on transforming technically sound brains into corporate experts to bring an overall difference in the industry. The fee structure of the institute is competitive and affordable. Dedicated to the cause of students and their sound education, they have arranged many scholarship programs and study loan facilities. The best part is its academic environment and ambience that offers individual space and a familiarity with the corporate structure for better industry preparation. Since Canada wants to attract maximum technically proficient immigrants to join their workforce, this institute opens a gateway of education to all international students seeking employment opportunities in the country.
Eligibility Overview: Admission RequirementsSuccessful completion of high school is required for admission to an Academy of Learning Career College diploma programme. A copy of your high school diploma and/or transcript may be requested.If English is not your first language, you may need to take an English language admission exam before enrolling in a diploma programme.

Name: Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge - Calgary
Overview: Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge is a college of repute, operating since 1697. It offers a multicultural platform for students to learn and grow. Besides other streams, it specializes in finance. It is the future of finance students in terms of growth, development, and innovation. This institute has two wings; at Calgary and Lethbridge. Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge – Calgary is the second branch, which maintains the legacy and infrastructure associated with this institute. Every year many students complete their courses in different disciplines and levels from this college. They offer courses in graduate, postgraduate, certificate, pre-professional transfer programs, etc. Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge – Calgary courses are finance, arts, science, business, education, etc. Moreover, to adhere with advancement in technology, subjects like artificial intelligence, cryptocurrency, blockchain, etc. are taught here. This university ranks 1001 as per Times Higher Education 2021, and as per US News & World Report 2021 the rank is 1470. The students' satisfaction rate and placement rate is satisfactory. It thoroughly prepares the students in the theoretical and practical end to start their careers and achieve success. Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge – Calgary tuition fees are competitive among other international colleges. The yearly fee is $18,172.00 CAD, the cost of living is $10,000.00 CAD and the application fee is $140.00 CAD. Faculties are industry experts in delivering training in international standards. Staff and infrastructure are highly appreciable and efficient to prepare students for the global corporate world.
Eligibility Overview: Candidates for admission to the University of Lethbridge's undergraduate programmes must have a minimum average GPA of 3.00 and a minimum average score of 65 percent or higher on their high school secondary test.Academic Standard XII certificate with Second Division standing (e.g. Above Secondary School Certificate, All-India Senior School Certificate, Indian School Certificate) with a minimum average score of 65 percent or higher. Certificates of Vocational Standard XII will be considered on a case-by-case basis.Transcripts from your former high school, college, or universityEnglish language competence exams (such as the TOEFL and IELTS) are forwarded directly to the university's admissions office.SAT or ACT scores for students, and GRE or GMAT scores for graduatesTo meet the minimal requirements for English proficiency tests, students applying for any of the undergraduate programmes must submit the results of high school and post-secondary school English Language tests or exams. The submission of English proficiency tests or exams such as CPE, PTE, CAEL, CAE, TOEFL, and IELTS is one of the prerequisites for international applicants. The English proficiency tests' minimal requirements/scores are listed below.

Name: Kwantein college
Overview: Kwantlen College has five grounds in the Metro Vancouver area of British Columbia. The college has programs like fashion and design, arts and business, science, horticulture, and health and offers the only graphic design for marketing program in Canada. Students have the opportunity to bridge certificate and diploma credentials into bachelor's degrees, choosing educational and professional improvement of applied and technical programs. Costs for a semester are typically between CAD 2,000 and CAD 5,000 for domestic students, though they can rise above CAD 15,000 for international students. According to a student's academic merit, scholarships are awardedäóîthe student has access to the library facilities, athletic associations, sports, recreational activities, and student clubs. The school provides off-campus accommodations for college students. The average cost of living is around 8,600 CAD per semester. The college works closely with organizations and associate degreed business partners to ensure that graduates get an opportunity to work with them as interns or full-time employees. The main focus of Kwantlen Polytechnic University is not to solely supply traditional academics but to assist students in teaching hands-on skills and experiences, making it easier for them to apply for jobs.
Eligibility Overview: You must demonstrate the following to be admitted to an undergraduate programme (i.e., a certificate, diploma, associate degree, or bachelor's degree programme):1.You have met the English proficiency requirement at KPU*.2.You have completed at least 24 credits of undergraduate-level coursework from a recognised institution OR you have graduated from high school (secondary school) (Note: it is also possible to be admitted to certain programmes as a mature student)Please see Admission Intake Types for additional particular requirements for limited intake programmes.

Name: VanWest College - Vancouver
Overview: VanWest College Kelowna is located in the beautiful location of Kelowna, Canada. The college is a privately owned Canadian college with its two campuses located in Kelowna and Vancouver. It was established in 1988. The educational institution offers Post Secondary, Post- Baccalaureate and English as second learning (ESL) programs which are taught by industry professionals. The programs are designed to improve the employability skills, business knowledge and communication skills of the students so that they have the necessary skills to work in a Canadian workplace. The students will also spend 50% of their program time in a paid co-op which will help them to adapt the Canadian work culture and prepare them for better opportunities. VanWest College Kelowna is committed to assist international students from across the world who wish to pursue their education in Canada by offering them an ambience conducive to learning. The student services team is committed to helping international students from every step of the way from assisting students for the visa process, finances, on-campus accommodation and employment services. VanWest College Kelowna organizes a variety of activities to suit people of all nationalities and interests, including shopping, live entertainment, and sporting events. Additionally, it organizes other activities, including Summer water leisure, and weekend trips to different landmarks, including wineries, Big White Ski Resort, and Crystal Mountain Ski Resort.

Name: Greystone College - Vancouver
Overview: Greystone College is situated in the substantial trade and commercial hub of Western Canada, Vancouver. Vancouver is the most extensive metropolitan and largest port and home to booming digital start-up culture. The private vocational college was established in 2002 and proudly serves with premium quality education and vocational training in a stimulating and culturally inclusive environment. Greystone College’s courses are built for building skills, career experience, and networks to support the students' aims. The college runs business, digital marketing, hospitality and TESOL programs, and credit transfer programs. The courses are designed to fulfil the increasing demand in Vancouver’s leading industries such as business and tread, tech start-ups, tourism and hospitality and ESL schools. The business and hospitality courses help students develop business management and communication skills. Whereas digital marketing programs help build a dynamic skill set to attract, engage and convert clients through digital media. Greystone College provides the students with cooperative education and career support that expands their knowledge and capabilities to pursue their desired occupation quickly. Aspiring students can avail the courses at a very affordable tuition fee. The instructors have earned years of experience through working in the fields of education offered in the college and can provide students with both theoretical and practical knowledge. They also offer their students several non-academic facilities and services like residence, homestay, student health and safety benefits, and visa and immigration consulting. Moreover, the students in the college are presented with an education system that gives a challenging yet supportive, dynamic and practical learning experience.

Name: Kensley College
Overview: Each and every year, there are many students who look towards Canadian Universities for their education. Among a great number of excellent educational institutions is Kensley College. Located on the second-longest street in Montreal, Canada, the college houses a vibrant and exciting campus with a multicultural presence around the arena. The student lounge that comprises green spaces provides mobile charging stations and epitomizes a typical college campus.Montreal has a total university student strength of 180,000, the highest among graduate students in any North American city. Montreal, as per the students' opinion, is one of the best places to learn. Transportation is easy and inexpensive with a wide range of public transport, including the metros. The Kensley faculty is composed of the most experienced and successful professionals in the teaching business of contemporary times. The institution will kickstart your career.

Name: CDI College - Pointe-Claire
Overview:
CDI College is one of the premiere private colleges in Canada providing career-training for the last 50 years. The training programs are for undergraduate, post graduate, and diploma. Their alumni are recruited by top-notch companies across the world. They provide training on business, health care, technology, etc.
The graduation and certificate program aligns with the demand of the industry. Faculties and the entire team consist of professionals with high experience and skills. Their training procedure helps students connect the theoretical education with practical implementation. The CDI College Pointe-Claire campus is located to the west of Dorval. The infrastructure of this institute is highly appreciated by students. Moreover, the college provides willing applicants with the option to study online and complete training from anywhere. The estimated total cost of studying here yearly (inclusive of tuition fees and cost of living) is about $24,000-$25,000.
This campus offers subjects like 3D modeling, animation art and design, web design, etc. Apart from those CDI College Pointe-Claire courses comprise early childhood education programs and other programs like legal studies, health, business, technology, etc. The Ministry of Education has accredited this college. The CDI College Pointe-Claire’s placement system is very efficient. It places an average of 92% students in leading multinational companies. Average placement period is within 6 month of course completion. The training system, practical experiment platform, and curriculum design empowers the career path of the students. 
It is one of the best institutes in Canada as per student ranking and different accreditation authorities. Students further get the opportunity to work while studying along with convenient and affordable accommodation.

Name: St Stephens University
Overview: Situated as a small liberal arts university in the town of St. Stephen, New Brunswick, Canada, St. Stephen's University was established in 1975. The province of New Brunswick authorizes this university to endow bachelor's and master's degrees in ministry studies and liberal arts. Besides, this university provides undergraduate BA degrees in social sciences, humanities, philosophy, religious studies, psychology and literature. When compared to the other 100 colleges in the category of Arts, Stephens University is ranked 201st by Time's higher education rating. Additionally, it is ranked 151 globally out of 49 other universities by the Academy Ranking of World Universities.This university also offers undergraduate certificates and online graduate programs through Institute for Peace, Justice and Religion. Also, the post-graduate ministry program provides training for lay ministry and professionals. Presently, this university's undergraduate programs can be availed in Psychology, Arts in Humanities and Community engagement. Under post-graduation level, this institution currently provides two courses, Culture and Theology. This university has initiated a "School of Contemplation" for students willing to learn about contemporary and ancient practices. More than 400 students are graduates, with one-third of them going for further studies. This institution provides students with academic and non-academic services and facilities, including a library, study abroad, exchange programs, and administrative services. Besides academics, St. Stephens University offers various facilities, including scholarships, on-campus residence, alumni benefits and more. This institution offers scholarships ranging from 500-to 7,500 CAD. This university is primarily a selective institution with an acceptance rate of 70%-80%.
Eligibility Overview: Grade Point Average (GPA) Requirements for Admission The university considers potential and motivation when admitting students to St. Stephen's University. A cumulative Grade Point Average (GPA)  of 70% in all of your university-prep Grade 12 courses is the baseline threshold for entrance. If your average falls below this point, though, you will have the opportunity to convince the university, that your time at SSU will be more academically successful than your high school grades might indicate. One or more of the following examples can be used to illustrate this: A recommendation from a professor or other academic source stating that you have a good chance of finishing your degreeA written justification from you outlining the reasons your high school grades were low (such as personal circumstances or behavioural problems) and why academic success at SSU should be expectedA declaration outlining a pertinent learning disability, together with a copy of a legitimate evaluation or intentions to get one Experienced Students & HomeschoolingThe university's standard entrance requirement is a high school diploma. Homeschoolers and experienced students are welcome to apply, and the university considers each application individually. The score for International Students on the English Proficiency Test:

Placement: If their study visa specifies the work-study requirement, international students may work 20 hours a week on and off-campus by Canada Immigration rules and regulations. Work is permitted for students who are enrolled in full-time post-secondary, vocational, or professional training programmes. Through a variety of alumni networks and events, SSU keeps in close contact with its students and alumni members. The perks that alumni members receive include employment alerts, alumni events, and connections to the alumni network via various social media platforms. Transcripts are also available to alumni members for a fee of 10 CAD per transcript.
Accommodation: St. Stephen's University supports a sense of community among its students and encourages them to live together as a group. The campus' Park Hall is where the residence hall rooms are situated. Within the neighbourhood, SSU offers lodging through billets. If the university cannot provide billets for every student, some may be obliged to stay in other accommodations, such as Airbnbs. It is a requirement for first-year students to live on campus. Students can select between single rooms or shared double rooms, while upper-level students have the option of living off-campusThe resident hall does not provide meal plans; instead, students learn in the kitchen as they prepare their meals with the assistance of chefs. Students can also enjoy the flavour of home-cooked cuisineGraduate housing costs 300 CAD per module, whereas undergraduate accommodation costs 1575 CAD per termFor graduates, meal service fees are 300 CAD per module, while for undergrads, they are 1575 CAD

Name: Seneca International Academy
Overview: Seneca International Academy, or Seneca College, is a public institution in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The institute offers 27 graduate courses, 59 diplomas, 29 advanced diplomas, 19 certificate courses, and 11 bachelor's degrees across its six faculties. Some top programs are Aviation, Business, Education, Community & Social Services, Fashion & Esthetics, Hospitality & Tourism, Information Technology, Science, and Law. Seneca has multiple campuses throughout Greater Toronto & Peterborough in various locations, including Newnham, York, King City, Markham, Peterborough, Downtown Toronto, and Yorkgate. At Seneca College, the student-faculty ratio is 12:1. There are various programs that provide students with mandatory or optional work experience. At Seneca, the Career & Placement cell offers students multiple options to turn their classroom learnings into practical experience through co-ops, work-study programs, apprenticeships, employer-led projects (ELP), externships, internships, and job placements. Seneca College offers both on-campus & off-campus housing facilities to students. They have suite-style units having two bedrooms, a kitchen, and a bathroom. The institute also provides meal plans and various retail outlets on campus. In addition, Seneca has a partnership with Places4Student Inc. for off-campus residences to help students search for affordable off-campus living on an online platform.The average cost of attendance at Seneca for International students is about 6,795 CAD, excluding all other expenses. It offers various scholarships & bursaries to its students based on different criteria. Anyone who has applied to Seneca College is eligible for scholarships & bursaries ranging from 50 CAD to 1,500 CAD.
Eligibility Overview: Admission requirements differ depending on the level and program. In addition to English competence, programs may demand credits equivalent to Ontario's mathematics, biology, and chemistry curriculum or a postsecondary degree or diploma equivalent to an Ontario university or college. When applying to a Seneca degree program, the student must submit the following documents:1. Transcripts from grades 10th, 11th, and 12th indicate all pre-requisite courses for the program.2. Six (6) senior-level courses corresponding to Ontario university preparatory credits must be included on transcripts, with an aggregate average of 65 percent.3. A high school diploma or a secondary school diploma (certificate of completion).4. Any completed university/postsecondary college courses or programs have taken inside or outside Canada may have been submitted as transcripts or certificates.5. Academic documents written in a language other than English must be translated into English by an official/certified translator.6. Seneca College has the right to verify transcripts provided at any time. Seneca has the right to require that original transcripts be supplied directly to Seneca from the issuing institution for courses and certificates obtained within Canada.
Placement: Seneca College focuses on students' professional development by providing interview preparation, one-on-one resume reviews, on-site employer interviews, career events, and other services. Every year, over 16,000 organizations list 7,000 vacancies in the college's job bank.Seneca College offers comprehensive programs that prepare students for careers. The college has maintained a placement rate of more than 70% in prior years.  The following table shows the average incomes of Seneca graduates in several fields of study:

Name: McMaster University
Overview: McMaster University is located in Hamilton, Ontario, Canada. Established in 1887, it is a research-oriented, doctoral-medical university. The university has six academic faculties and is home to 70 research institutes. McMaster offers more than 3000 undergraduate and about 150 graduate programs to its students. Some renowned majors at McMaster University include Biology & Biochemistry, Computer Science, Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, Environment/Ecology, Neuroscience & Behavior, and Psychiatry/Psychology. The main campus of McMaster is situated in the Westdale neighborhood of Ontario, near western Lake Ontario. It is spread across 300 acres, connecting it with accessible metro and bus routes. There are three campuses: Core Campus, North Campus, and West Campus. In addition, the university has four regional campuses at Burlington, Niagara, Downtown Hamilton, and Kitchener-Waterloo. The university offers on-campus accommodation with a capacity of more than 3,600 students in 12 residences. Buildings are available in Apartment, Suite, and Dormitory styles. In addition, international students can find lodging to stay off-campus after completing their first year with the help of the Off-Campus Resource Centre.McMaster's annual average cost of attendance is 8,548 CAD for undergraduate programs. In addition, the university offers financial assistance to international students based on their academic qualifications and needs. The different types of scholarships available are:The McMaster Honour AwardsAthletic Financial AwardsEntrance Awards for Indigenous StudentsFaculty Entrance Awards. McMaster University provides its students with several career growth & development options like Work-Study Program, on-campus employment, paid internship opportunities, and placements after completion of the degree.

In addition, the college was also ranked as the top college in Ontario and the third-best college in the Greater Toronto Area. The college has several research centres and institutes, including the Niagara Research Institute, the Centre for Applied Research and Innovation, and the Centre for Advanced Research and Technology. These research centres and institutes are dedicated to advancing knowledge and developing new technologies. Overall, Niagara College is a top-ranked college in Canada, offering various programs and services to students from across the country. With its commitment to student success, research and innovation, and different degree and diploma programs, Niagara College is an excellent choice for students looking to further their education.

Name: Commonwealth College
Overview: The Commonwealth College, located in Winnipeg, Canada, provides career training and has applicants worldwide. Ministries that focus on quality learning approve all the programs extended by this college. In addition, the faculty of this college is highly professional and experienced industry-trained instructors. This college has registered itself as a Private Vocational Institute per the Private Vocational Institutes Act. The Commonwealth College has also acquired membership in the National Association of Career Colleges and the Manitoba Association of Career Colleges. This Commonwealth College program offers advanced learning through short-term annual programs with small class sizes allowing students to avail themselves of better support from the instructors with higher chances of success. The Commonwealth College courses are highly affordable, and students can save substantially on their tuition fees through different scholarships and grants. This college offers a wide range of courses, including Business and Beauty and Wellness Diploma programs, hospitality etc. These diploma courses can be pursued in culinary arts and hospitality. The college dedicatedly assists students in shaping their careers and preparing them to meet the employers’ requirements in the market. Moreover, this institution is widely known for working on community projects with different reputed organisations. The Commonwealth College evaluates its students with assignments and final exams where they need to score at least 70% in each subject to pass. The scholarship program of Commonwealth college holds significant value to students who need financial support and possess an excellent academic record.

Name: Conestoga College
Overview: Conestoga, one of Ontario's most well-established institutions, offers options in various fields in its schools, namely the School of Business, Creative Industries, and Language & Communication. Conestoga College has a 50-year legacy of providing a world-class education to nearly 23,000 students globally. It is also the only college to provide accredited engineering degree programs in Ontario. Conestoga offers a range of graduate, post-graduate, diploma, undergraduate, and apprenticeship programs. The college also offers 65+ co-op programs at the moment. Their first-class education covers 150 acres of the top facilities, including fully equipped modern labs, wellness centers, state-of-the-art labs, and a sports complex.The university has consistently ranked among Canada's Top 100 colleges based on variables like student education, employer satisfaction, and placements.
Eligibility Overview: If you want to apply for a program at Conestoga College in Canada, you must satisfy two criteria. The first is the prerequisites for admission, and the second is proof of English competence; if you are an overseas candidate, you must have cleared the TOEFL,  Duolingo English Test (DET), or IELTS exam. While aspiring students must prove their English proficiency, there is one exception. The Conestoga English for Academic Studies program can be opted for by students without English skills looking to obtain direct entry into post-secondary programs.  Applicants for the Hearing Instrument Specialist and Massage Therapy programs must have an overall band of 6.5, with no band lower than 6.0, except for the speaking band, which must be 8.0.Applicants for Technical Communications must have an overall band of 7.0, a writing band of 6.5, and no band less than 6.0.CAEL: 70, no sub-test band score less than 60PTE Academic: 58 or higher

Placement: Conestoga College is well-known for a variety of reasons. They have over 8000 students from dozens of nations, so students frequently witness the cultural diversity on campus. They have fully-fueled labs that support research and experimentation. It is well renowned for being a true pioneer of polytechnic education. Yet, what tops their list is that they provide unmatched placement opportunities for their students. According to sources, 87%  of students in the 2019-2020 academic year were placed within six months of graduation, with a significant number just within three months. Given the burden on students to find work, the university has always emphasized career development. Conestoga knows the market and the demands, and they prepare you with all the necessary skills to land the career of your dreams. The institution hosts job fairs and other events on campus to help you find jobs. The Conestoga Career Centre provides an array of services, such as assisting you with resume preparation and possible answers to interview questions. They allow you to develop a personalized plan to kickstart your career goals, understand the market and job opportunities in the given area, explore training options that align with your goals, and more.  When the chance arises, instructors do not hesitate to offer you a positive recommendation or refer them to Conestoga-affiliated employers.  Graduates from Conestoga easily land jobs with an average base salary of C$53k/ year but have gone up to $140k+. Reports suggest that graduates have scored the chance to work in well-established firms like Tesla and Microsoft. Many people have also stated that they have excellent benefits at work, such as a pension and insurance.Furthermore, more than 5000+ local businesses started and managed by Conestoga graduates justify their support for their entrepreneurial minds.

Accommodation: Conestoga, being the prestigious institution it is, has ensured that the accommodations are tailored to fit every lifestyle. You get a decent number of options in the categories On-campus, Off-campus, Homestay, and Temporary Housing. It is your responsibility, however,  to explore your options and determine what best meets your needs in terms of budget and preferences. Conestoga College lists various resources on their website addressing all sorts of issues like the stress of adjusting to a new roommate and moving in checklists to help the transition be as smooth as possible.  On-campus Accommodation On-campus accommodation comes with its own set of advantages. For one, as Conestoga quotes, “You don’t have to worry about your roommates not paying the bills!” Being just minutes away from the institution, you get to be a part of all the major events happening around campus. Library, labs, and sports complex are easily accessible. In addition, Conestoga also hosts activities to foster community spirit and provide opportunities to mingle with your neighbors. You can participate in many studying activities in the study room/lounges and enjoy various other amenities. On-campus living also saves you the hassle of securing a temporary housing lease, which might save you dollars. Furthermore, the building is monitored 24/7 as the safety of the students is of priority to the institution. The college also provides mixed-gender housing so you can find the perfect roommate without restrictions. There are two on-campus rooms: Suite Style: Neat, spacious, and private rooms with a fully equipped kitchenette and a private bathroom. Open style: Fully furnished, spacious rooms with a common kitchenette, shared bedroom (separate beds), and bathroom. The bedrooms are equipped with a double bed, desk and a functional work area, a TV with cable, high-speed Internet access, a telephone with free North America-wide call/voicemail, a dresser, and a closet with a storage rack. The kitchenette has a microwave, refrigerator, and food preparation area with a sink and cupboards for storage. There is also a dining space with a table and two chairs. The bathroom is simple with a stand-up or bathtub shower, a toilet, and a sink. Fee:  Students interested to opt for on-campus residence may easily apply for it on the Conestoga College website. Students can choose among the plans (varying due dates)  available.  Off-campus Accommodation Off-campus residences are not sponsored or monitored by the institution itself. However, prioritizing the safety and well-being of the students, the college has allocated resources to help with a smooth transition. The curated list of resources includes a list of websites that might help you find a rental and connections to Facebook groups and other relevant contacts. Some of the websites are:Places4StudentsRoomsterPadMapperGottarent.com: Browse rental locations in Canada for rent Conestoga has, however, partnered with Canada Homestay Network Inc(CHN) (CHN administers the Homestay Program) to provide you with comfortable spaces to live while you study there. Homestays can be a convenient option for those looking for off-campus accommodations. Most homestays provide a private room. You need not trouble yourself with cooking as well, since a meal plan is usually included. It further eases the load on students by offering laundry services and internet access. A month's homestay expenses will cost you around 875 CAD, with an extra 235 CAD as a placement fee. Temporary housing is a last resort option for students who have not yet found or finalized an accommodation. Generally, temporary housing demands a booking, but as a thumb rule, one must always check and double-check the authenticity of the place before going ahead. Exciting student discounts are also available for Students of Conestoga College.

University Ranking: Conestoga College is one of the most prestigious institutions in Canada. In 2021, the college was ranked first in Maclean’s Magazine’s ranking of Canadian colleges. This ranking is based on several factors: student satisfaction, faculty-student ratio, graduation rate, and student-faculty interaction.  The college has also been ranked in the top 10 for its overall quality of education and is the only college in Ontario to be ranked in the top 10. Name: Red Deer College at Sterling College
Overview: Sterling College and Red Deer College collaborated in 2020, and Red Deer Polytechnic at Sterling College was formed at that time. This college offers only three programs: Business, Nursing and Technology. After completing the diploma courses from this institution, students also get dual awards from both Sterling College and Red Deer College. For instance, once a student completes the Health Care Practice program, apart from a postgraduate certificate from Sterling College, they will also receive an occupational diploma from Red Deer College. Both the campus locations (downtown Vancouver and Lethbridge) of Red Deer College at Sterling College are appropriate for students to get easy access to amenities that will improve their study experience. The college also provides several training programs, which are engaging so that students can clarify their doubts regarding the courses. Even though the program fees vary depending on the course one opts for; it typically ranges from $13,935 to $27,000. For the admission process of international students, there are some specific requirements apart from visa and study permits. It boasts more than 7,500 students, out of which 3,000 international students are pursuing the above-mentioned courses. One of these includes English language requirements, where the college checks the IELTS scores of each candidate, and the score requirements vary across different programs. Red Deer College at Sterling College also has international admissions advisors who help students choose suitable programs and get both accommodation and financing options. Professional Canadian nurses develop all the programs available here, and the faculty members involved in teaching the subjects are also experienced, industry professionals. After completing the courses, Red Deer College at Sterling College students is provided with co-op job placements in the city.

Name: Yukon University
Overview: Yukon University is a public university located in Canada and spread across 13 campuses. Established in 1988, the university prioritizes its uniqueness through its various courses and programs. The university has some of the best instructors in Canada, thus ensuring quality education. They offer a diverse range of programs, including intermediate and advanced ESL courses, certificate programs of one year, diplomas of two-year duration, high school upgrading, and four-year degrees. There are various degrees, diplomas, and certificates in six academic areas through different faculties, such as the School of Science, School of Business and Leadership, School of Health, School of Academic and Skill Development, School of Trades, Technology and Education, and Human Services. The university offers specializations in business, early childhood development, culinary arts (cooking), and renewable resources management. Yukon University facilitates students with campus stores and gymnasium. Located among the mountains, the university offers stunning landscape views from its campus that help students relax and rejuvenate.Yukon University offers quality education programs at a competitive tuition fee of $400 per credit for bachelor's diploma courses. The university organizes many student recreational activities through student clubs, student unions, and fitness programs. With a focused approach, excellent facilities, and academic and non-academic support, the university is an ideal place to pursue higher education.

International students can also stay in a homestay facility, where they learn about Canadian culture while staying in a home-like environment. Name: Canadian College of Technology and Business (CCTB)
Overview: Based in Vancouver, the Canadian College of Technology and Business (CCTB) specialises in certification, career development, and technical training. This institute extends one-year graduate diploma programs focused on information systems and business. The campus of CCTB is situated in the heart of downtown Vancouver. CCTB is registered by the PTIB (Private Training Institutions Branch) of the Ministry of Advanced Education. It is also accredited by The Education Quality Assurance (EQA). The various Canadian College of Technology and Business programs include a Diploma in Software Developer in Test Practicum, Digital Marketing Co-op, Diploma in Business Administration Co-op, UIUX Developer Analyst Practicum, Database Developer Analyst Practicum, and Diploma in Cyber Security Analyst Practicum.The duration of programs at this institute ranges from 42 weeks to 70 weeks. These programs are available for January, May, and September. The diploma programs include either a practicum covering 20% of the overall duration or a co-op covering 50% of the program duration. Canadian College of Technology and Business has partnered with 4Stay.com to extend accommodation facilities.In addition, the Canadian College of Technology and Business also offers 6 online courses in multiple disciplines. Several technologies, like Docker, SQL, Amazon Web Services, etc., are incorporated into this institute’s programs. This is done to increase the employability of graduates. Students who complete CCTB programs can participate in work experience components like co-op or practicum. Moreover, these programs serve as academic pathways for continuing education at the University of Canada West.

Name: Pures College of Technology
Overview: Established in 2007, the Pures College of Technology is a private educational institution in Toronto, Canada. Business, IT and Social Sciences are the three fields of study with undergraduate, graduate, diploma and certificate courses. Some of the other popular methods are Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, Sales and Marketing, Event Management, Nursing, Information Systems Management, Supply Chain and Logistics Management, Database Administration, Computerized Accounting and Quality Assurance & Systems Testing. Vocational skill training and English Language Studies Program is offered to make international students comfortable with the language.To get admitted into Pures, a student should either have an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or a minimum of Grade 12 education equivalent to an Ontario Secondary School Diploma or appear for the Pures College Entrance Test and clear the program dependent cut-offs. Previous academic transcripts, CV, resume, scores on English Language Proficiency tests, and LORs are also submitted. 'Financial aid through Second Career, a Government of Ontario initiative, is provided to eligible students. The second Career allows students to get up to 33,786 CAD waived from their tuition or accommodation costs. Pures also provides study-work permits to students, and working 20 hours per week while studying full-time in courses longer than six months is allowed. Pures do not provide on-campus accommodation, but housing advice is provided, and international students are set up to stay with local Canadian families or with other students renting apartments. The college has facilities like a transportation hub, shopping centre, supermarkets, banks, government offices, recreational areas and restaurants nearby. The student union manages various clubs and societies that cater to students' academic and creative needs. Pures College offers career counselling services to assist students and alumni with placements and interviews. Workshops, internships and career fairs play an integral part in preparing students for the interviews.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions Criteria Students applying to Pures College of Technology for a certificate or diploma programme must have the following basic requirements:Academic status equivalent to the Ontario Secondary School Graduation Diploma is required (OSSD)ORA minimum score is necessary for admission to the specified programme on the Pures College Entrance Test (a ministry-approved test). Requirement for English Language Proficiency Participants who do not speak English as a first language must show oral and written English proficiency by offering one of the following:Secondary school diploma and English credit (Grade 12 U, M, or C) from an Ontario secondary school

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Placentia
Overview: College of the North Atlantic is one of the top-ranking public colleges located in Canada. It delivers primary, secondary, and postsecondary education. For the last 55 years, it has been operating and gradually opened 17 campuses to facilitate students worldwide. College of the North Atlantic – Placentia is a small campus accommodating 100 students per year. The faculty and staff member comprises 20 staff to systematically train students to meet the multicultural and multidimensional career options. This campus also offers hands-on experience to students. Thereby, many of its programs include field opportunities where students can apply what they learn in classrooms in real-life scenarios as well. It offers an array of sports and entertainment platforms like playgrounds, swimming pools, etc. The Placentia campus enrolls students in business programs, apprentice training, and other industry-leading training skills. The College of the North Atlantic - Placentia tuition fees per year is around $7,000-$8,000, and the cost of living is $12,960.00 CAD. The college also offers several scholarships and awards to eligible students. Some of these are the Eagle Scholarship, CNA Faculty & Staff Achievement Awards, College of the North Atlantic Industrial Trades Distinction Scholarship, Vale NL Industrial Trades Entrance Bursary, and the Ed Norman Memorial Scholarship The program curriculum meets the demands of the industry. It includes research and development, community and regional innovation, and international partnership with leading organizations for training and placement. This campus ranks high for student satisfaction, placement, and employer satisfaction.

Name: Canadian Business College - Toronto
Overview: Established in 1982 and backed by almost 30 years of experience, the Canadian Business College has provided students with the necessary guidelines, skills and resources to obtain their academic goals. Situated at 2 Bloor Street West, 22nd Floor Toronto, students can avail of every required facility and amenities from the Toronto campus that suits their requirements and busy schedule. The students at this college receive advanced learning experiences involving small-class sizes, direct interaction with experienced instructors and personalised career-oriented support. At Canadian Business College courses, students can choose from a wide range of 19 programs, including Gaming, IT, Marketing, Business, Health care, Community services, etc., and opt for one that meets their academic requirements. Students can pay the fees in monthly instalments without any interest for the diploma programs. At the Toronto campus, students are provided with hands-on training and work-related placements that will help students to develop market-related skills and personalities necessary for employment purposes. Students from this institution are offered financial assistance via student loans, credit lines and sponsorship. Moreover, this Canadian Business College Toronto Campus extends both full-time and part-time working options, allowing students to balance school life and work responsibilities. They can also receive extensive career and student services to assist them in every path. The monthly enrollment process allows students to proceed with their education without interruption.

Name: Renison University College - University of Waterloo
Overview: Founded in 1959, Renison University College - University of Waterloo is a public university located in Waterloo, Canada. It is affiliated with the University of Waterloo, and the primary education areas are Global Engagement through Languages and Culture, Social Engagement and Innovation and Community Engagement. The college was founded by Walter A. Bean, Carl E. Dunker, William N. Hancock, Russell A. Echlin, Stanley A. Lorriman, The Rev. Canon William A. Jones, Harold B. Soanes, William H.Timmis, The Ven. Harvey F. Southcott and Joseph A. Underhill. Renison University College - University of Waterloo has both undergraduate and graduate courses. In the School of Social Work, both bachelor’s and master’s degree programs are offered. Apart from this, these degree programs are available for both full-time and part-time studies. Whereas for social development studies, the courses are interdisciplinary and combine subjects like Social Work, Psychology, and Sociology. But, Community and Professional Education offers degree-free programs, courses and spirituality, language and culture. The annual acceptance rate of Renison University College - University of Waterloo is around 53%, with a faculty to student ratio of 1:18. The 6-acre campus of Renison offers a wide range of facilities and services to students. Some of the facilities are the Lusi Wong Library, Chapel of St. Bede, The Luscott Ministry Center, and the Great Hall Cafeteria. The class size of the college is around 60, and the enrollment for the Centre for Community and Professional Education, Global Engagement through Language and Culture, and Enrolment of Social Development Studies and the School of Social work is 5,129, 4,844, and 6,318 respectively. Renison University College - University of Waterloo also provides financial aid for its students. As per the latest data, the college's total financial aid for its students is $370,908.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Renison University College Social Development Studies, Honours Arts & Business, and Honours Arts are the three undergraduate programmes offered by Renison University College. Applicants must apply online through the OUAC site and pay a fee of 130 CAD.Application Requirements: The following are the application requirements:Transcripts from CollegeScores on English proficiency tests (for international students)Personal StatementsInterviewPortfolio of artistic endeavoursOnline evaluationsInformation Form for Admission (AIF)Admissions CriteriaRenison asks applicants to review and meet the country-specific standards for undergraduate admissions. The following are some of the country-specific requirements:System of India70 percent or higher in English in Class XII; 80 percent or higher in English in Class XIIThe Chinese MethodologyIn Senior 3 English, a minimum of 75% must be achieved; in Senior 3 Mathematics, a minimum of 85% must be achieved.Thailand's Governmental SystemGrade 3 or above in English; overall average of 4
Accommodation: College Residence at Renison UniversityThe city of Waterloo is said to be one of the most affordable university cities in Canada for students from all over the world.All new Renison students are guaranteed housing on Waterloo Campus, which is centrally placed.Many old buildings in the region have been absorbed by the university for use as residence halls.Renison University College Waterloo's residence provides four different types of rooms.Double room in the traditional styleA semi-private bathroom is included in the double room.A single room with a semi-private bathroom is available, as well asFor the most part, single rooms are reserved for upper-class students.Once the application has decided where they want to live, all they have to do now is submit their request and wait for the housing provider to call them to finalize the booking.Students can choose whether they desire single or mixed gender rooms, en-suite or shared bathrooms, and so forth.International students must pay for their room and board in whole and in advance.Captain's bed, dresser, desk, book shelf, wireless internet connection, heating, and elevator are among the common room features.Laundry facilities, a game room, a common lounge with a huge TV screen, wireless internet, study rooms, snack machines, and mail service are all available in residence halls.

Name: Canadian College for Higher Studies
Overview: Canadian College for Higher Studies is a private career college located in Ontario, Canada. The college was founded to provide diploma and post-secondary education to students in the developing fields of information technology and data sciences. The campus is located in Scarborough, Ontario. The top courses at Canadian College for Higher Studies include a Diploma in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence, Diploma in Enterprise IT Management, and Diploma in Supply Chain and Logistics Management. The faculty of the college are experienced professionals in information technology and business. Many are certified by leading companies such as Microsoft, Cisco, and IBM. Courses are designed to help students gain academic knowledge and practical skills throughout their duration, with active faculty involvement and interaction. Smaller classroom sizes, world-class teaching facilities, and tools ensure that students make the most of their courses. The college also provides short courses designed for working professionals looking to upgrade their skills. They enable them to learn specific skills that align with the academic requirements, allowing them to grow faster in their career. It also offers second career programs for locals, which are partly sponsored by the Government of Ontario.
Eligibility Overview: Provide proof of academic standing comparable to an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) OR a Bachelor's degree. Applicants above 18 must complete the CCHS Academic test (WONDERLIC) and receive the minimum test score required for the program to which they are applying.

Name: St Lawrence College at Canadian College
Overview: Formed in 1967, the St. Lawrence College at Canadian College is known for its applied arts and technology subjects. Premier William Davis recognised the need for technical education in Ontario, which was the college's set purpose. It has received multiple affiliations, including CCAA, ACCC, AUCC and CBIE. With over 6,439 students, St. Lawrence College at Canadian College aims to provide undergraduate and postgraduate degree and diploma levels. The students here can choose from over 137 options for areas of study for selecting the appropriate program for their career. Some popular areas include mental health, business studies, advertising, nursing, behavioural science, engineering, computer science, fine arts, culinary management, and various others. The college functions with three of its campuses, the central campus being Brockville. Major facilities drawing student attention include bookstores, food and health services, library, parking lot, emergency and security measures, and helplines. The growth of the college is evident from the St. Lawrence College ranking, which is at 57th position in National Liberal Art Colleges for Canada. The college might be considered selective since they have set an average acceptance rate of 47%. The student-faculty ratio followed in the classes is about 10:1, offering a balance of students with staff members. Moreover, the college has been successful in generating a student retention rate of 90%. The tuition fees structure set for international students is between $55,000 and $60,000, which many find unaffordable. However, the college offers scholarships based on the financial requirements and merits of the students every year. The alumni of the college have shown tendencies of employment within months of graduation. The college further includes a placement section on its official website, whereby the students are encouraged to register and keep track of the updates.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Corner Brook
Overview: The College of the North Atlantic is a public college that is one of Atlantic Canada's largest post-secondary educational and skills training institutions. It comprises 17 campuses throughout the province of Newfoundland and Labrador. The Corner Brook campus is located in the west coast’s Humber Valley region and offers several certificates and diploma courses. The University has a full-time enrollment of 1,510 and enrollment in continuing education of 11,754 students in total. However, the Corner Brook campus serves almost 800 students annually and 1200 students to continue their education courses upward. The University provides on-campus accommodation by giving residence to nearly 170 students. The student-to-faculty ratio of the University is 4:1, with over 700 alumni. It ranked 86th in National Universities by Unirank University Ranking in the year 2020. The World University Ranking of the college is 6188 by Unirank. The College of the North Atlantic’s courses are diverse and specialize in several fields of education. They run programs for undergraduate, postgraduate, associate, and doctoral degrees. The College of the North Atlantic offers a variety of programmes at some of the lowest tuition fees among all the other colleges in Atlantic Canada. However, the college doesn’t provide any scholarships to international students. But it offers a searchable database where international students can hover and find scholarships to afford to study in Canada. The campus provides the students with services and resources to enhance the student’s life. Additionally, there are 3 licensed child care centers at the Corner Brook campus which also serve as model training facilities for the students studying early childhood education (ECE).

University Canada West is an excellent choice for students seeking a high-quality education. With its innovative approach to teaching and learning, its commitment to excellence, and its commitment to social responsibility, the University of Canada West is an excellent choice for students looking to further their education.

Name: Birmingham International Collegiate of Canada
Overview: The Birmingham International Collegiate of Canada offers a superior educational experience that encourages students to develop their potential. This private high school encourages interactive teaching by utilising multimedia and online simulations, allowing students to develop their skills and personality. It also allows students to adapt, integrate and learn the local culture. The highly-qualified professionals and dedicated faculty efficiently provide students with top-notch service essential for flawless learning. Additionally, the Portfolio Development and Preparation Program offers students the opportunity to build a well-structured portfolio for their post-secondary requirements.

Name: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College
Overview: Canadian Institute of Management and Technology College is an accredited institute, registered as a private career college. A recognized member of the Ontario Association of Career Colleges and National Association of Career Colleges, CIMT is authorized by the Private Career Colleges Act of 2005. Since its foundation in 1998, CIMT has been a forerunner in guiding students towards professional growth. With a specialized teaching and learning curriculum, CIMT offers many programs across disciplines such as management, business, technology, healthcare, etc. Some of the top programs at the Canadian Institute of Management and Technology are PG Diploma in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, PG Diploma in Sales and Marketing, MBA, etc. Located in the heart of Ontario, and surrounding the Greater Toronto Area, CIMT College has four main campuses, the Scarborough Campus, the Malton Campus, the Mississauga Campus, and the Brampton Campus. Besides, CIMT College also has three satellite campuses. All the campuses are easily accessible from the International Airport and well-connected through public transport channels. CIMT College has a monitored placement cell that allows students to join their choice of profession. The institution offers several job-oriented internship opportunities to students. The college application fee at CIMT College is $500. The faculty at CIMT College is not only well-versed in the disciplines, but also cordial and helpful to the students. The Student's Union at CIMT College organizes campus events to provide entertainment and recreation to the students. CIMT College also looks after the health and well-being of its students. The college has a medical insurance plan for every student and faculty member. CIMT College does not support on-campus housing. However, it has ties with local representatives like Homestay and Airbnb to provide affordable housing to the students.

Name: Lakehead University - Orillia
Overview: Lakehead University is a dynamic and modern institution in Canada, established in 1965. It is one of the largest institutions in the country and has two campuses, Thunderbay and Orillia. The university has been ranked 2nd for undergraduate research in Canada. Times Higher Education has placed Lakehead University in the band 601-800 among all global universities. More than 1400 students study at the campus and can reside on-campus in the 240-room residential hall. A minimum of 6.5  in IELTS or 80 in TOEFL is compulsory for admission.These scholarships are primarily merit-based and range from CAD 6,000 to CAD 40,000. Each year, 80% of the students get their scholarships renewed. The university puts aside 11 million to give scholarships, bursaries, and awards.97.7% of the graduates from this university get employed within two years of graduating. As Lakehead University is home to 550+ international students, it offers many scholarships and financial aid opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: Applicants will be eligible for admission if one of the following certificates is presented: A State Higher Secondary Certificate awarded by a State Board of Higher Secondary Education OR India and Delhi Senior School Certificate awarded by the Central Board of Secondary Education OR Indian School Certificate awarded by the Council for Indian School Certificate ExaminationsEnglish language requirement tests  English language proficiency requirements are:
