Placement: International Teaching Placements You can learn in a variety of methods and a variety of locations as part of your Lakehead experience. The university can allow you to learn, teach, and work in attractive areas worldwide by partnering with international partners. For a 5-week placement, the university is glad to offer five overseas placement destinations, such as:Malaysia Sint Maarten London, UK  Scotland Wales Note: Before 2020, members of the Faculty of Education worked in China and the United Kingdom as international teaching assistants. While these collaborations are not now active, they may be in the future.  Community Placements Students can use what they've learned in class to apply what they've studied in the community and obtain firsthand experience working in a history-related field. Completing a combination of community service hours (150), career seminar classes, and other relevant assignments is necessary.Career placement, fieldwork, and internship are terms that are sometimes used interchangeably to refer to the actual work students conduct to augment and enhance their theoretical class work. Community Placement is defined as practical, community-based experiences in history and heritage-related job areas for this course. Community Placement experiences are established with a Community Partner to provide students with learning opportunities under the direct or indirect supervision of someone who works in that field.Before being considered for placement with a Community Placement Partner, students must complete the Department of History's Application for Community Placement. In addition to satisfying the standard academic requirements, the application is shared with the Community Placement Partner for them to choose the best candidate for the placement. Recent Community Placement Partners:City of Thunder Bay ArchivesLakehead University ArchivesShebaFilmsNorthwestern Ontario Sports Hall of FameThunder Bay Military MuseumThunder Bay Historical Museum SocietyThunder Bay Public Library
Accommodation: The campus is located across many restaurants like Starbucks, St. Louis Bar, Pizza Hut, and Taco Bell. It has two outstanding research facilities, the Paleo-DNA Laboratory and the Biorefining Research Institute. The university believes in enhancing student satisfaction and promotes various sports on campus. It is home to four varsity and six competitive extramural athletic teams. Lakehead University- Orillia offers undergraduate and graduate degree programmes. On-Campus Accommodation The institution seeks to offer a clean and safe environment where students can achieve academic success and personal growth. The vision is to build a thriving and diversified community and environment. Lakehead University Residence offers a variety of social, educational, and recreational possibilities. This is the place to go if you want a complete experience and to broaden your horizons. The university's environmentally friendly 240-bed house has a distinctive modern design in which each student will have a single room with only one person sharing a bathroom. There are 40 single rooms on each floor and a washing room, kitchenette, and quiet study space. Residence Halls Orillia Residence is a seven-story modern, smoke-free residence hall. It is the preferred housing option for Secondary School students moving away from home for the first time and on a global scale and upper-year students who appreciate community living and the stress-free convenience of being on campus. Residence students can enjoy more study and activity time without worrying about food preparation and cleanup because a comprehensive meal plan is supplied. Students share a single room with only two other students and a full bathroom.  Amenities provided by the university are: Double-sized long captain-style bed with two large storage drawers below Desk, desk chair and desk lampBookcaseBulletin boardCloset with shelves and clothes barWaste & Recycling binsWindow blindSnack fridgeFull-length mirrorIn-room sinkWi-FiCable TV hookup (TV not included)Utilities included For more information, visit: https://www.lakeheadu.ca/students/student-life/residence

Name: Dhillon School of Business at University of Lethbridge
Overview: Dhillon School of Business at the University of Lethbridge was established in 1967. It has the most innovative and world-class teaching procedure. More than 8787 students study here in graduate and undergraduate courses per year across the world. Business, education, science, arts, math, and technology are subject areas. The school aims to provide a great learning experience with optimum research techniques. In addition, they try to serve the modern-day requirement of university aspirants and working professionals by providing the best learning approach.

Name: International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) - Vancouver
Overview: For more than 20 years, The International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) has offered top-notch learning experience involving Business English, IELTS/ TOEFL Exam Preparation, College and University Pathway, GAP Year Accommodation and more. This Vancouver campus is situated centrally in modern Downtown. Moreover, the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Vancouver offers college and university placement services along with post-secondary counselling. The University Pathway course offered by this institution is acknowledged by more than 70 Canadian universities and colleges. Languages Canada entirely approves both the campuses of this institution. At this institution, students can receive top-notch English language education at its highest degree. International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Vancouver also offers Adult English Programs as well as Young Adult English Programs. The International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Vancouver professionals speak in more than 40 languages and ensure that they have quality experience in this institution. They all are TESOL trained and possess top-grade degrees from renowned universities. One of the best parts of this institution is the advanced boutique style in both campuses, namely Vancouver and Toronto. The International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) campus is approved by the British Columbia Education Quality Assurance program and functions as per regulations and standards. This institution has associated partnerships with more than 70 post-secondary institutions and offers placement opportunities for more than 1,000 graduates. Moreover, the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Vancouver is a developer of University pathway programs and a leader in college and university placements in Canada. For years, this institution has achieved various awards worldwide, acknowledging ILAC’s commitment to teaching English and excellence in customer service. This institution has been awarded for being a winner of the top language school in Greater Toronto.
Accommodation: Stay with one of the carefully selected homestay families or live in one of the houses with Canadian and foreign students to make lifelong memories and relationships.https://www.ilac.com/student-housing/

Name: Laval University
Overview: Laval University, founded in 1663, is an open research university in Quebec City, Quebec, Canada. The university has over 30 buildings designed in a modern style. The university offers both undergraduate and postgraduate degree programmes. Furthermore, it has 60 departments, 17 faculties and 500 programmes in various fields of study. Laval University's well-known faculties include the Faculty of Architecture, the Faculty of Pharmacy, the Faculty of Dentistry, the Faculty of Forestry, the Faculty of Agriculture, the Faculty of Theology and Religious Studies, the Faculty of Administrative Sciences, and the Faculty of Science and Engineering. Laval University's top courses include Masters in Business Administration, Arts, Science, and so on, and Bachelors in Business Administration, Technology, Science, and so on. Laval University also offers excellent job placement opportunities to its students.Laval University offers on-campus housing to its students in four pavilions. The University's annual hostel and meal expenses are approximately CAD 4,118. Laval University also provides its students with excellent facilities such as sports facilities, a botanical garden, a science training complex, etc. The fees for the university's courses range from CAD 13,172 to 19,769 per year. Academic and leadership scholarships, international mobility scholarships, work-study opportunities, paid internships, and government financial assistance programmes are all available at the University.
Eligibility Overview: Students must show proof of academic excellence for admission to Laval University. To be accepted into a program, students must have the minimum diploma required for the level of study they are pursuing and demonstrate a sufficient level of French proficiency.Have a diploma indicating 13 years of education, which is equivalent to a Québec Diploma of College Studies (DCS, or DEC in French). Consider the following scenario:Baccalaureate de FranceBaccalaureate from most French-speaking African countries' institutionsGCE General Certificate of Education (GCE) with three "A Levels" in topics relevant to the desired university program from an English-speaking country
Accommodation: The Laval University campus comprises 64% green space and wooded areas. A network of pedestrian tunnels connects nearly 40 campus buildings. UL has a library, PEPS is a sports complex, and TELUS is a university sports stadium.  The campus is outfitted with cutting-edge technology to benefit students as well. An integrated science training complex on campus encourages students to study anatomy. It is home to the Montmorency Forest, the world's most extensive teaching and research forest, and an open-air laboratory.MonPortail is also available to students to help with online learning by providing centralized access to course websites and various assistance tools.

Name: Greystone College of Business and Technology Inc.
Overview: Greystone College of Business and Technology Inc., located at 443 University Ave, 3rd Floor, Toronto, Ontario, Canada, emphasizes on combining theory with practical mode of learning preparing students to work for any prestigious platform. The college jump-starts students' Global Careers, lifetime opportunities in Business, Digital Marketing, Hospitality and provides International learning pathways and dynamic learning opportunities. The college is a part of the ILSC Education group. The college provides vocational training and career-enhancing programming for the students and has ties with over 150 University Pathway partners. Greystone College of Business and Technology Inc. offers popular courses in business, corporate communication, international business, etc., and TESOL Diploma Program and Job Readiness Training Certificates. International students are given a bursary that covers the maximum part of their tuition fees. Greystone College is affiliated with International Language Schools of Canada and is certified under Private Career Training Institutions Agency (PCTIA). They focus on curriculum development, course delivery, student practicum and co-op activities. The college has the Academic, Marketing, and Operations management team of ILSC ensuring students premium training facilities and industry experts instructors. The college was honored with Study Travel’s Star Vocational College Award winner. Besides providing multiple opportunities, the college extends on providing off-campus housing inspected and monitored by Homestay Department, Cultural Coordinators, and staff. Additionally, the college arranges on-campus events and celebrations and offers volunteer and fundraising opportunities and talks from community experts as per the students' needs.

Students who do not yet meet the language entry requirements might build a package curriculum that begins with ILSC Language Schools lessons.You can provide proof of your test result or studies to satisfy the language entry requirement if you already have a valid score from another approved test or if you have completed a minimum of three full years of study in a secondary or post-secondary institution where English is the sole language of instruction. Name: University of Moncton
Overview: The University of Moncton, officially known as Universití de Moncton, is a public institute in New Brunswick, Canada, established in 1963. It offers 165 study programs, of which 40 are postgraduate programs, and has conferred over 53,000 degrees since its establishment. Some courses are Marketing, Business Administration, Engineering, Music and Psychology. The Rhía-Larose Library, Champlain Library, and Library of Shippagan are three of the university's six libraries that house books, journals, media and e-publications. Several courses like Biotechnology, Visual Arts, Translation and Biology are offered as part-time courses too. Through the university's Co-operative/ COOP Education programs, students can work for 3-4 months while pursuing their courses to gain professional experience. Business Administration- Finance, Mechanical Engineering and Information Management are some COOP programs. The University of Moncton recognises specific educational qualifications acquired at other universities through Interinstitutional agreements. To meet the university's French-language requirements, it provides French Immersion courses (4 in the first year) for students from an English-based education system. The Continuing Education initiative permits improving career skills through workshops and seminars and includes Contemporary Management, French in Business, Healthy Start etc. The estimated baccalaureate tuition fee is CAD 7,860 and CAD 13,808 per year for domestic and international students. Some financial aids are Bourses Abdou-Diouf, Bourses Harrison-McCain, Bourses d'accueil etc. Accommodation is provided on-campus at the Lafrance, Lefebvre, Mídard-Collette Residences in studios. Summer and short-term housing are also available for interns and guests. Students can participate in sports and recreational activities like badminton, CrossFit, swimming, theatre shows, music performances etc. It has a graduate employment rate of around 94%.

Name: CDI College - Longueuil
Overview: CDI College is a leading career college in Canada. It has offered students premier career training for over five decades. This institute is present at 23 locations across five Canadian provinces. CDI College Longueuil campus is situated on the southern shore of the Saint Lawrence River, a municipality that is the second biggest suburb within Greater Montreal. CDI College Longueuil extends a range of programs to students in the areas of Technology, Legal studies, Art and Design, Healthcare, Early Childhood Education, and Business. Students willing to get admission at CDI College must have a high school diploma unless otherwise mentioned in a program outline. Individuals might also have to provide their graduation proof while enrolling or when their classes begin. Every program has its own admission requirements, like prerequisite courses and grade point averages. Students of this institute can choose between evening or daytime classes as per their availability and convenience. The enrollment at CDI College takes place on a rolling basis, which allows students to begin studying on multiple start dates throughout the year.Students can avail several options to finance their education. These include Provincial Government Student Assistance and RBC Royal Credit Line for Students. The Career Services team of this institute assists the students in their professional goals starting from the time of beginning classes till graduation. Students can also attend workshops from Employment Specialists. CDI College students receive counselling, career advice and assistance with job search from these specialists for up to six months after graduation. Besides this sector, the other options for students of CDI College are Web Page Designing, Website Architecture, Sales director, Tariff coordination etc. The placement rate for the Early Childhood Education-JEE.13 program was 96.4% for 2019 graduates who were available for employment.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - Fredericton
Overview: Located in New Brunswick, Canada, the establishment of New Brunswick Community College can be traced back to 1974. The Canadian Institute of Management accredited the college mainly for its business studies section. The 2+2 study options here enable the students to credit their two-year NBCC diploma up to two years of a four-year degree. Currently, the college has received a roundabout enrollment of 4,300 students, with about 115 international students. The college is responsible for about 70% of all the publicly-funded research conducted in the New Brunswick province. With about 20 research institutes and 65 research laboratories, the New Brunswick Community College is on a growing spree. The Fredericton campus serves more than 400 students, which shows the increasing popularity of the campus. The classes here maintain a standard student-faculty ratio of 9:1. Moreover, the college has successfully generated an average student retention rate of 66%. Apart from this, the New Brunswick Community College fees are set keeping the international requirements in mind, which can be affordable for most people ranging from $8,000-$10,000. The college also tries to provide scholarships for deserving candidates. About 90% of the students of this college are employed within a year of their graduation on average. The NBCC Alumni Association section of the website keeps the students posted on the latest job opportunities and encourages the young graduates to apply for the same.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Seal Cove
Overview: The Seal Cove campus of the College of North Atlantic was established in 1997 and is situated on the Avalon Peninsula. The institution boasts an array of courses and programs in areas of study like Arts, Law, Science, Engineering, etc. The training programs are designed in a way that can help students acquire professional skills once they are done obtaining in-depth knowledge about a specific subject. The institution has more than 31 faculty members and staff who are easily accessible to students.Students can opt for financial assistance to finance these expenses; however, that is provided based on merit and need only. Also, to meet College of North Atlantic tuition fees requirements and other costs, it offers scholarships to all its students. Some popular scholarships include Jack McGrath Memorial Scholarship, Patricia Helen Gosse Memorial Scholarship, Newfoundland & Labrador Hydro Trades & Information Technology Bursaries- Newfoundland, etc. Apart from academic assistance and training programs, the college also provides multiple other facilities, such as accommodation, food, transport, etc. Educational advising facilities are also available, which help students get employed within six months of their course completion. The institution has a 92% placement ratio which helps further due to the student performance every year.The College of the North Atlantic ranked at the 86th position in the National Universities index by Unirank University Ranking in 2020. For international students, it has specific country-specific document requirements. The student-to-faculty ratio is 14:1. In addition to that, the College of North Atlantic Seal Cove campus has more than 7900 international students.

Name: Ascent College
Overview: Ascent College of Technology is a private career college in Montreal, Canada. With the increasing prominence of fields like artificial intelligence and network security, the college was founded to provide students with the skills and knowledge required to keep up with the growing demand for skilled employees. The college is known to offer courses in multiple disciplines of information technology. The best courses at Ascent College are Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning AEC and Network Security and Ethical Cyber Piracy AEC, both graduate certificate courses. The college offers programs to residents as well as international students. It offers courses in both English and French to cater to the academic requirements of a large number of students. The highly-rated courses also help students find employment in up-and-coming information technology fields such as cybersecurity, data analysis, and gaming technology. Students can enjoy an active social life thanks to its proximity to other regional universities and downtown Montreal. Located in Montreal, the average cost of living per annum can come up to CAD 11,000 per annum. On-campus accommodation for international students costs around CAD 5000.
Eligibility Overview: To get admitted to Ascent College of Technology, you must have a 3-year bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 60.0 percent (or 54 percent as per Indian requirements).IELTS general requirements: 6 band (no band lower than 6). (Min Listening: 6.0, Min Reading: 6.0, Min Speaking: 6.0, Min Writing: 6.0)The total PTE requirement is 46. ScoreThe TOEFL iBT minimum score is 60. (Min Listening: 12.0, Min Reading: 13.0, Min Speaking: 18.0, Min Writing: 21.0)

Students who choose to live off-campus must conduct their own research and arrive well before the start of the semester to do so.

Name: St Lawrence College - Brockville
Overview: Situated in Eastern Ontario, 3.5 hours away from Toronto, St. Lawrence College Brockville campus has many world-class attractions on its doorstep. The college boasts more than 7,000 full-time students who come from Canada as well as over 40 countries worldwide. Initially the institution was established as a college of Applied Arts and Technology which is its primary focus has still remained on this. However, now it offers numerous courses in different areas of discipline, from Business Administration to Electronics, Engineering and Technology, etc. In 2018, the Brockville campus received a major refurbishment and came up with a newly renovated cafeteria, library, individual and group study space, student common lounges, etc. Apart from academics, students can also participate in events and social clubs. More than 5,400 St. Lawrence College Brockville students get access to student placement opportunities every year which help them get industry-related experience. After successfully completing the courses, students also get an Ontario College Certificate in CICE, helping them get employed at renowned companies. As per data, the college holds a graduate employment rate of nearly 90%. The college offers several conveniences to the international students, such as language support, assistance from international student advisors, accommodations, including help regarding transitioning to life in Canada. Students interested in applying at St. Lawrence College Brockville can use their official website for the same, however, there are certain admission requirements they need to meet first. For a few specific programs, the Health Occupations Aptitude Examination is conducted, including English proficiency assessments. Students will have to submit academic transcripts along with some program-specific documents. The average tuition cost for each academic year ranges between $21,722 and $16,672, depending on the program one opts for. Bursaries or scholarships worth $500-$3,000 are provided to the students who qualify for them.

Name: St Lawrence College
Overview: St. Lawrence College (SLC) is a public institution established in 1967 as a college of applied arts and technology, located in Ontario, Canada. It has three campuses in Brockville, Cornwall, and Kingston. SLC has about 6,700 full-time students and employs approximately 830 full and part-time staff and faculty for the 89 programs offered by the institute, including more than 30 certificate programs, 40 diploma courses, and 20 advanced diploma programs, certificates, and apprenticeship training programs in Applied Arts, Community Services, Business, Computer and Engineering Technology, Justice Studies, and Health Sciences. The yearly tuition fee for various courses can range from $15,000 CAD - $22,000 CAD. Students can avail of several scholarships for financial aid, including the Board of Governors Entrance Scholarships and the Laul's M. Square Media Scholarships. SLC provides various amenities such as bookstores, food services, Scruffy Salon, Essence Dining Room, Hairstyling & Esthetics, Music theatre shows, and Event and Banquet Services. The campus features the Marianne van Silfhout Gallery, an 80,000-square-foot Student Life and Innovation Centre, double gym, outdoor atrium and deck, Health Care Simulation Labs, Student Services, and Davies Hall study area. The college also provides options for various societies and clubs that the students can join, including the St. Lawrence Surge varsity teams that regularly compete in several national championships. Accommodation for students is available at all three campuses, with 29 double-occupancy rooms at the Brockville Campus, 44 private suites at the Cornwall campus and the 600-bed residence at the Kingston campus. The living expenses can be up to $7,000 CAD. The career management services of the institute help the students find employment, and 91.6% of the graduates find a job or opportunities for further studies within six months of graduating. The top employers of the institute are the Department of National Defense, Queen's University, Empire Life, City of Kingston and Kingston Health Sciences Center.

Name: Vancouver Film School
Overview: Vancouver Film School is one of the leading private entertainment arts schools located in British Columbia, Canada. Founded in 1987, Vancouver Film School is recognized internationally as a global leader in entertainment art education. The institution functions more like a studio instead of a school, as an entertainment conglomerate that creates content for TV, film, games, and design. The curriculum at Vancouver Film School tries to balance hands-on production work with industry-led theory. The institution offers 15 signature post-secondary programs. Some of the top programs at Vancouver Film School are VR/AR Design & Development, Classical Animation, Film Production, and Sound Design. With a student base of more than 1,000 students, Vancouver Film School is spread across eight campuses in Downtown Vancouver. In 2014, Vancouver Film School launched a campus in partnership with Shanghai University to incorporate the unique VFS teaching model for entertainment arts programs. Students at Vancouver Film School have access to their wide repository of career resources including full-time and part-time internships, and summer programs. VFS believes in building a powerful and creative portfolio and helping its students gain access to the best industry-standard tools and job placements. The tuition fee at Vancouver Film School ranges from $10,500 to $53,250. VFS offers scholarships to both domestic and international students. VFS believes in enriching the student experience on campus. There are several student clubs and social organizations, including school-wide opportunities where students can connect, have fun, and learn. The institution is committed to the well-being of its students, and thus offers student services including student housing and student counseling facilities. The campus is well-equipped with state-of-the-art infrastructure and amenities such as vending machines, studios, etc. Vancouver Film School Housing Service operates off-campus housing with homestays, apartment complexes, and dorm rooms for rent.

Name: University of Windsor
Overview: The University of Windsor, founded in 1857, is located in southern Canada. It has 16,231+ students from over 100 countries, with 23% coming from the international student community.The college has 190 undergraduate students and 65 graduate and doctorate programs. Education, arts, social sciences, humanities, engineering, graduate studies, law, nursing, science, human kinetics, and the Odette School of Business are among the nine faculties.The college has several departments like the EPICentre (Entrepreneurship, Practice, and Innovation Centre), WEtech Alliance, CAW Centre, St. Denis Centre, and the Essex Centre of Research.Students can get on- and off-campus jobs while attending the University of Windsor. This institution also enables international students to acquire a work permit that leads to permanent residency after graduation.
Eligibility Overview: The University of Windsor requires Grades 10, 11, and 12 for undergraduate applicants. The grade 12 score requirement varies by school/course, although the class average is normally 3.0 or higher. Students are also encouraged to submit their SAT and ACT scores to the university. The credits for Advanced Placement, International Baccalaureate, and other internationally recognized tests can be transferred.  UWindsor needs a three or four-year bachelor's or master's degree (US equivalent) with a 70-77 per cent average for graduate and PhD programs. ENGLISH PROFICIENCY REQUIREMENTS:  Aside from that, the following standardized tests are required:  For MBA programs, the institution expects you to have prior job experience. The following are the minimum test score requirements:PTE or TOEFL iBT (100) or IELTS (7.0) (68)GMAT: 550–600

Placement: University of Windsor does not conduct any on-campus placements. It does, however, prepare you well enough to land the job of your dreams. The courses are created in such a way that they mirror the existing norms of the job market. Students of Windsor can participate in a variety of co-op programs as well. Co-op programs allow you to put your classroom learning into practice. It will enable you to try out new things with your education. It is a fantastic chance for you to network and gets a flavor of Canadian work culture. You'll receive frequent feedback on your strengths and shortcomings as a co-op student or student intern so that you may learn and develop throughout your program of study. There will be a work term evaluation where you will receive feedback on your progress. The university also has CCES (Career and Employment Services) devoted to helping students secure jobs smoothly. The opportunity may vary from course to course. There are also one-on-one counseling sessions; you can seek career advice and a roadmap. Mock interviews happen, which helps you practice for the real world. It is a great way to increase your confidence and feel prepared. The institution stated in an interview with IDP that they conduct two types of surveys: one during the first six months of graduation and another after two years. This survey assists them in determining the employability of their graduates. Graduates of Windsor have secured jobs in multinational companies like IBM and Blackberry. Name: College of the North Atlantic - Bonavista
Overview: The College of the North Atlantic is one of the enormous post-secondary skills and educational training centres in Atlantic, Canada. This institution comprises 17 campus locations throughout different provinces in Canada and handles a technical education college in the Middle East. This institution provides courses of nearly 100 full-time and more than 300 part-time courses for approximately 25,000 students annually. Some College of the North Atlantic courses includes a Diploma in Civil Engineering Technology, Hospitality Tourism Management, Computer Systems and Networking, etc. This college provides various certificate courses, including Certificate Comprehensive Arts and Science Transition, Certificate Heavy-duty Equipment Technician, Certificate Heavy Operator etc. The Bonavista campus of this institution is located on the East coast of Newfoundland in Bonavista Bay. This campus is linked with a local high school and Discovery collegiate. This campus currently extends full-time credit programs, advanced block trades training, and Contract and Continuing Education courses.Additionally, most students participate in different courses offered at this campus during weekends. The meritorious students are offered the necessary financial assistance in the form of scholarships and grants by the Canadian government and the government of Newfoundland and Labrador. As per US News 2022, this College of the North Atlantic has been ranked 92 among the Best Colleges in National Liberal Arts College.

Placement: Work Placement: Several programmes call for students to complete an unpaid work exposure placement to receive a programme certificate or graduation from the College of the North Atlantic. The goal of the work placement is to give students a unique learning opportunity in a natural workplace environment. The high standards of behaviour and performance that are typically anticipated in the workplace are something that students are supposed to learn, develop, and display. Students gain technical skills and employability throughout the work experience, which furthers their personal development. It is a chance to get knowledge from a new network of connections and broaden perspectives on potential paths in life and business. A work placement lasts two weeks for certificate programmes and six weeks for diploma programmes. Students must work a minimum of 30 hr/per week and a maximum of 40 hr/per week according to the employer's requirements. Commonly, the work placement occurs during intersession, pending the presence of an appropriate employer. The work placement will happen in the semester immediately following the last semester of studies for students who finish their degree outside of the standard order. Only graduates who receive certificates will finish the two-week work internship. Your work placement will be completed at the end of your second year if you are in your first year of a two-year diploma programme.
Accommodation: The campuses in Bay St. George, Burin, and Happy Valley-Goose Bay all offer on-campus housing. Around the campus in Newfoundland and Labrador, the institution provides several off-campus housing choices. To make finding a place for students to live more accessible, the College of Atlantic has a list of off-campus housing options close to each campus. The following are some of the off-campus accommodations close to the university in Labrador and Newfoundland:Single Room in an Apartment or HouseRental ApartmentsRental HousesBoarding Houses Meal alternatives are available with off-campus accommodation options. Name: Canadian Technical and Management College (CTMC)
Overview: Canadian Technical and Management College (CTMC) is a private career college in Milton, Canada. The College is owned by Religare Learning Group of Canada, which specializes in the setting of new schools, colleges, franchises, and MTCU compliance-related work & course settings. The college runs programs focusing on its education model, which includes several different aspects. They provide critical learning, which is one-on-one or small group learning led by instructors, and facilitate learning which is group learning directed by students and instructors. Alongside this, they provide independent learning, which is the solo learning of students with instructors. The college utilizes the best practices in adult education to help students transition successfully to post-secondary education, return to work or upgrade their skills. The average tuition cost at this college is $9,000 to $10,000. On the other hand, the cost of living is about $13,000. Canadian Technical and Management College courses allow students to interact meaningfully with the study material to gather thorough knowledge. There are several courses on Diplomas, Hospitality Management. Technical and Management College makes students' lives easy by offering them flexible and extended monthly payment plans. They allow financial grants and allowance to their students by allowing them to withdraw amounts from RRSP to support their courses and studies. The college focuses on education through research, theory and in-classroom testing, leading students toward a prosperous careers.

Name: Brock University
Overview: Brock University is a public research university with rich academic and research programs in Ontario’s picturesque Niagara region. Brock is one of the top five Ontario universities for the number of 3M National Teaching Fellows. Brock University has an acceptance rate of 73%. More than 120 programs at Brock University have been carefully chosen to cater to the requirements of all minds. International undergraduate students are eligible to receive awards and are subject to international tuition rates. Brock University provides placement opportunities to its students and organizes job fairs yearly.Brock University provides a variety of career-driven degrees, including those in game development, public health, and sports management, co-op work periods, internships, and experience opportunities. 90% of Brock graduates find jobs within six months of completing their degree and have one of the greatest employment rates in the nation.With students from more than one hundred nations represented on campus, Brock is an international educational hub with a team dedicated to international student success. Additionally, to ensure the well-rounded development of its students, the university offers co-curricular and extra-curricular activities in 10 different domains, including community engagement, health and wellness, and art and culture. They also offer various leadership development opportunities.

Since most of the classes are taught in English, you must prove your English language abilities. Below are the tests accepted at brock university.

Name: Mohawk College - Stoney Creek Campus for Skilled Trades
Overview: The Ministry of Ministry of Training, Colleges and Universities funds and accredits Mohawk College. It is a public college and a member of the Association of Community Colleges of Canada. It has three main campuses – Ontario, Canada and Hamilton. The college is one of the largest trainers in Ontario, training around 2,900+ apprenticeship students annually. This campus covers approximately 36 programs. Mohawk College Stoney Creek programs include – Auto Body & Collision Damage Repairer, Construction Engineering Technician, Construction Techniques, Welder, Electrician (Construction & Maintenance) etc. Apart from these, there are approximately 146 continuing education programs available on campus. These include – courses on Accessible Media Production, Air Brake Training, etc. It also has an Apprenticeship Community Hub, which connects with employers and works towards building a skilled workforce. Mohawk's Marshall School of Skilled Trades & Apprenticeship is equipped with advanced facilities and experienced faculties to provide in-school job training. After completing this apprenticeship training, students will earn an Ontario College certificate. The Mohawk College also offers off-campus housing accommodation. It has invested around $3 million+ in bursaries and scholarships over the years. This college provides financial literacy through Mo' Money Resource Centre. According to Webometrics, Mohawk College ranking is 88th(in Canada). It has earned over 25 awards as a leader in sustainability, including the recent one as Canada's Greenest Employers in 2021. It was also among the "Top 3 Performers" in North America in AASHE Campus Sustainability Index (2020). Nearly 86% of graduates find jobs in their respective education fields within the 6 months of graduation. The Mohawk College offers a CareerReady portal where students can find seasonal full-time, part-time jobs or schedule an appointment for career assistance. Mohawk College Alumni Association allows one to remain in touch with the instructor and former classmate for any career-related help.

Name: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) - Grenfell Campus
Overview: Memorial University of Newfoundland (MUN) or Memorial University is the only university in the Province of Newfoundland and Labrador. This multidisciplinary, multi-campus, public, research/teaching university is present at four campus locations and one of them is the Grenfell campus. The Grenfell campus of Memorial University of Newfoundland is a small, interdisciplinary campus providing graduate programming in science and arts and undergraduate degrees in business, science, fine arts, arts, nursing, and resources management. To name a few degrees offered at this institute, it includes Bachelor of Business Administration, Bachelor of Fine Arts, Bachelor of Arts, Master of Fine Arts, Master of Arts, and many more. This 185-acre campus site houses around 1300 student population. The several schools featured on this campus are School of Fine Arts, School of Science and the Environment, Western Regional School of Nursing and School of Arts and Social Science. The provincial government highly prioritizes education, thereby offering extensive funding to this University. This in turn allows the students to avail an affordable and high-quality post-secondary education. The Memorial University of Newfoundland fees for undergraduate students (2 semesters, full time)​ lies in the range of ​$2500 to ​$11500 depending on whether the candidates are international students, ​Newfoundland and Labrador students or other Canada-based students. The Graduate tuition fee at this university is one of the lowest in Canada. There are several excellent facilities present on this campus that help enhance the learning experience of students. This includes new research labs and classrooms for digital multi-media and GIS and the Boreal Ecosystem Research Facility. It also houses a fine arts theatre and gallery along with the Navigate Business Advising Centre. Astronomy and Physics students of this institute conduct research on this institute’s astronomical telescope - one of the biggest ones in Atlantic Canada.
Eligibility Overview: You must have graduated from a recognised university preparatory programme with approved senior level courses in five subject areas, which often include:EnglishMathematicsLanguage, whether modern or classical, or laboratory scienceSocial Science Elective A minimum grade requirement : A minimum overall grade of 50% in the essential subject areas is required. This is usually comparable to no more than two grades below 50% and a "pass" in each of the five academic areas. English Language Proficiency Requirement :                   Admission to a competitive programme (if applicable) : Some programmes have a restricted number of spots, thus admission is tough. As part of the faculty-specific admissions, a higher admission average and/or further material may be required.

Name: Columbia College
Overview: Columbia University is a private research university established in 1754 and located in Manhattan, New York, USA. The institute hosts three undergraduate schools across a vast area of nearly 40 acres.Apart from the main campus, the institute has two other campuses outside of Manhattan that offer various courses and programs. Some popular programs at Columbia University are B.E, B.Tech, MBA, M.A, B.Sc, LLB, etc. The average tuition fee at the university is around 61,000 USD per annum, and the institution offers several grants even at the entry-level. The university has an acceptance rate of only 5%. The university also has a record-breaking 100% placement for all its students within three months of graduation.Columbia University is an Ivy League School and one of the country's top private research universities. The institute offers over eighty courses and bachelor's, PG, certification, diploma, and PhD programs. The programs feature special research options and summer research jobs, among other greater facilities. Apart from that, the institute is known to have a placement percentage of 100%, which is remarkable. The institute also offers several scholarships and grants, has on-campus accommodation, and has top faculty for students to hone their skills.
Eligibility Overview: Since Columbia University has a very low acceptance rate, you should aim for a 75th percentile, with 1560 SAT or a 35 ACT, to have the highest chance of getting in. A GPA of at least 4.12 is also required.

It costs around 14,500 USD for first-year students per annum and 15,300 USD for other students, which includes housing, meals, and other living expenses.

Name: Metalworks Institute
Overview: With more than 40 years of reputation, the Metalworks Institute is a house some of the most popular musicians and artists in the world, inspired the establishment of the Metalworks Institute campus, which is located just outside of Toronto. It has facilities like Woz Lab, Common Spaces, Classrooms, lecture halls and Studios and an Auditorium. Courses offered include diploma as well as advanced diploma programs and also certified programs training. Diploma programs include Stage Lightning and Video, Audio Production and Engineering, Live Sound, Music Business, post-graduation in Music Mixing and Mastering and others. Courses on Advanced Diploma include Music Performance and Technology, Music Performance, and Professional Sound and Music Diploma. These diploma courses start in September. The Institute also partners with Apple, Warner Music Canada, Yamaha, Universal Music Canada, Songwriters Association of Canada and other groups. Apart from its on-campus courses, it also has online diploma programs, namely Music Business Online Diploma, Recording Engineering Online Diploma, Electronic Music Production Online Diploma, and Professional Sound and Business Online Advanced Diploma Program. It also provides scholarships for its students. Some of the scholarships include Musicounts Scholarship, Student Recognition Entrance Scholarship, and The Slaight Family Scholarship. Apart from these scholarships, the institute also has additional financial aid for its students. For Diploma programs, there are specific scholarships for international students, which are the Academic Excellence Scholarship, Commonwealth of Independent State Scholarship, High School Scholarship, and Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree Scholarship. To know the Institute fees, aspirants have to contact the institute personally. For admissions, applicants have to meet a few eligibilities and English proficiency tests. For example, the minimum considerable overall IELTS score is 6.0, and TOEFL IBT is 80. Some of the notable alumni of Metalwork Institute are Nav, WondaGurl, and Noel Cadastre. As international applicants, apart from providing relevant documents and a passion for music, students will have to pay an application fee of CAD 100.
Eligibility Overview: Not Disclosed
Accommodation: HOMESTAY To assist you in adjusting to living in Canada, MI suggests contacting one of its partner homestay agencies, which is committed to helping you discover the ideal residence during your time studying at the Institute. Depending on the amenities needed, homestay providers charge between $700 and $1200 CAD per month for housing. Many come with free internet, and some even include food plans. Some of the prominent neighbourhood homestay organisations committed to helping you discover the ideal residence while your study at Metalworks Institute include Homadorma and MLI Homestay

Name: Bow Valley College
Overview: Bow Valley College, established in 1965, is a public institution in Alberta, Canada, offering industrial and training courses. The college has seven schools and centers on campus: the School of Foundational Learning, Chiu School of Business, School of Global Access, and School of Community Studies. Aspirants can choose from various certificate, diploma, and academic programs in fields such as pharmacy technician, business administration, foundation in entertainment arts, and disability studies.International students can also participate in overseas programs and internships through the college's 'Study Abroad Programme.' Additionally, the college offers various scholarships like The Financial Need Bursary, Entrance Awards, Metis Scholar Award, and National Chief Atleo Scholarship.Students at Bow Valley College receive industrial training to prepare them for real-world employment scenarios. Additionally, the college invests in skill development to help students develop an affinity for cutting-edge technologies and provides career services and specialized interview training. The college flaunt's a '1000 Women Rising Fund,' established by the college, aiming to empower women via higher education despite financial constraints. The college has already helped over 500 women by raising over $880,000.
Eligibility Overview: International candidates must meet Bow Valley College's English proficiency requirements for all post-secondary programmes except Health Care Aide Certificate, Pharmacy Technician Diploma, Practical Nurse Diploma, and Recreation Therapy Aide: Certificate, or complete an Alberta Education English Language Arts course that is consistent with the specified academic admission requirements for the applied program. English Language Proficiency Scores:Candidates must submit a copy of their IELTS, TOEFL-iBT or PTE results for verification.

University Ranking: Bow Valley College is one of Alberta's most respected post-secondary institutions. Founded in 1965, the college has grown in size and stature, offering an array of academic, career, and personal development programs to students worldwide. With a commitment to quality and excellence, Bow Valley College has been consistently ranked among the top colleges in Alberta, Canada, and the world. Bow Valley College is ranked among the top 3 colleges in Alberta by Maclean's Magazine. According to the National Survey of Student Engagement, the college is also ranked in the top 10 for overall student satisfaction in the province. According to the International Student Barometer, Bow Valley College is also ranked among the top 10 in the world for student satisfaction. Bow Valley College has also been recognized for its commitment to excellence in teaching and learning. The college was awarded the prestigious Quality Assurance Framework (QAF) International Standardization Award in 2019, recognizing its commitment to quality assurance and continuous improvement in its academic programs. Bow Valley College is also highly ranked in terms of student success. The college has consistently ranked among the top 10 colleges in the province for student completion and graduation rates. Bow Valley College is accredited by the Alberta Ministry of Advanced Education and is recognized as one of the leading post-secondary institutions in the country. The college has been rated as one of the best colleges in Canada for student satisfaction, and its commitment to quality and excellence has earned it a place among the top post-secondary institutions in the world. Bow Valley College also ranks highly in student employability, with a job placement rate of over 90% for graduates.

Name: New York Institute of Technology, Canada
Overview: The New York Institute of Technology (NYIT or New York Tech) was formed in 1955 as a private research university. It has two main campuses in New York, one on Long Island's Old Westbury and the other in Manhattan. It also includes campuses in Arkansas, the United Arab Emirates, China, and Canada, as well as a cybersecurity research facility and a biosciences, bioengineering lab in Old Westbury. The Computer Graphics Lab at the New York Institute of Technology is significant in the history of computer graphics and animation since it is where Pixar and Lucasfilm began their research. The School of Architecture and Design, School of Interdisciplinary Studies and Education, School of Engineering and Computing Sciences, School of Health Professions, School of Management, College of Arts and Sciences, and College of Osteopathic Medicine are among the five schools and two colleges at New York Institute of Technology, all of which focus on technology and applied scientific research. Undergraduate, master's, and doctorate degrees are all available at New York Tech. The institute now offers five PhD degree programmes, with intentions to add more in the near future. New York Institute of Technology (NYIT) is the birthplace of entirely 3D computer-generated imagery (CGI) films. Two Turing Award winners are linked with the university as of 2020. As of 2018, New York Tech has 9,930 full-time students enrolled throughout its global campuses. According to US News & World Report, NYIT is a "selective" university with a 75% acceptance rate as of 2022.
Eligibility Overview: For UG StudentsUndergraduate admission is based on their AP, IB, and A-Level exam results, transcripts for any college-level coursework, and verification of graduation from all previous schools and colleges. For PG studentsStudents are admitted to postgraduate programmes at the institution based on their GRE, GMAT, and MAT results. To be a member of the university's postgraduate programme, students must also obtain an undergraduate or bachelor's degree from a recognised institution. English Language Requirements

Name: University of Saskatchewan
Overview: With a legacy of over 100 years, the University of Saskatchewan has emerged as one of the leading universities in Canada. Besides its research and infrastructure, the university is known for its beautiful campus, including art galleries, museums, and activity complexes. Apart from its prime location, students can enjoy various cultural and fitness activities developed by the college. You will find over 100 campus clubs that cater to varied interests. These clubs help boost interactions between like-minded individuals. The college has multiple avenues for students to engage, showing an increased interest in its international student population. International students are encouraged to be part of the executive body, programming, and leadership.
Eligibility Overview: Since English is more or less the dominant language overseas, the lessons are taught in it. Due to this, you must prove your English language proficiency to the university. Popular tests like IELTS, TOEFL and PTE can be used as proof of your English language abilities. Those who do not meet the minimum requirements may as well take English language classes at the same university or prepare themselves and try again. Below are the minimum requirements for the University of Saskatchewan.

Placement: The University of Saskatchewan believes that career development is a lifelong process that involves self-awareness, skill acquisition and goal planning. The college provides career educators to help you accomplish the qualities mentioned above. Career educators are well-versed in current trends and market demands; they help you explore career options, plan it out and set goals for yourself. They also help you with resumes, CVs and cover letters by reviewing them and helping you chisel them down to the best version. The college strongly focuses on networking and teaches you how to create one and use it to grow your career effectively, which is  accelerated by the often held job fairs, career mixers, and seminars. Lastly, there are co-op opportunities, internships and volunteering work to gain experience and learn by doing. According to Emolument, a Bachelor of Science is the best-paying degree at the University of Saskatchewan, with alumni earning an average salary of $73,000. A few other salaries are as below.

Accommodation: Students prefer on-campus residence for multiple reasons. It is always easier to be closer to the campus, so you can access all the amenities whenever possible. It is hassle-free and safe for students living independently for the first time. The community experience is valuable; building connections and experiencing life with your friends is fantastic. While all of this is true for Saskatchewan's on-campus housing, it also offers the advantage of a stronger academic focus. Sure, you get to have fun, but you can also take advantage of the faculties that are on site who are more than happy to help you academically. You may also seek the assistance of PhD students who are ready to tutor you for free on various nights.There are mainly four types of accommodation available on the campus. All of them are fully furnished, fully functional, student-friendly housing systems and are inclusive of meals. The average cost of a hostel and meal goes up to 10,000 CAD. The offers are sent out on a first-come, first serve basis, so be sure to apply early. Below are the four residence options available.   Off-campus housing is always an option. The University of Saskatchewan has a homestay program where you can apply to stay with a local family. You can also find rentals and homestays on other websites, but do your research before finalising anything. Saskatoon is less expensive than other cities, which can be a significant advantage for international students. The college provides a U-bus pass (included in your college fee) to make transportation around the city easy for you.

Course Ranking: The University of Saskatchewan provides a vast selection of programmes and courses. In addition, the affiliated colleges of the University and the Centre for Continuing and Distance Education offer degree programmes, certificates, and training programmes. The university is ranked 601+ by QS Subject Rankings for pursuing a postgraduate degree in business and economics and 201+ for pursuing a global MBA.Times Higher Education ranked the university between 301 and 400 for pursuing PG Engineering and Technology for engineering programmes (THE). The university has been ranked between 301 and 400 by THE ranking providers for three consecutive years (2019-2021) for its computer courses.
University Ranking: The University of Saskatchewan, founded in 1907, is a Canadian public research university member of the U15 Group of Canadian Research Universities. It is one of Canada's leading research universities. Additionally, the institution is the largest educational institution in Saskatchewan, Canada. According to the ranking in the table below, the University of Saskatchewan (uSask) has maintained its position over time.The university has been ranked 465 by QS World University Rankings, a rise from its 2016 ranking of 471. The university has been ranked between 301 and 400 by ARWU Shanghai Ranking for four consecutive years, 2017-2020. The university is ranked 465 by QS World University Rankings and 538 by US News and World Report.Candidates should know that different ranking providers employ distinct ranking criteria during the ranking process. While QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio (20%) and Citations per Faculty (20%), Times Higher Education (THE) places equal emphasis on Teaching, Research, and Citations (30%). As part of their ranking methodology, US News & World Report considers the Global Research Reputation, Regional Research Reputation, and Number of Publications Cited (12.5% each). Admissions to the University of Saskatchewan in 2021.The Shanghai ranking disregards an institution's reputation among academics and employers, instead ranking universities based on the quality of their academic research and the number of Nobel Prizes won by their faculty.

Name: Fleming College
Overview: Fleming College, also known as Sir Sandford Fleming College, is an Applied Arts and Technology institution in Peterborough, Ontario, Canada. The institute is affiliated with the ACCC and the Peterborough Centennial Museum & Archives.The college offers over 100 programs in business and information technology, trades and technology, community development, health and wellness, law and justice, art and design, and environmental and natural resource sciences.  Fleming College has over 5,800 full-time and 10,000 part-time students. The college's student exchange programs allow you to learn about a different curriculum and gain exposure. Furthermore, the institute provides scholarship programs to students with a solid academic record and involvement in extracurricular activities. The college offers flexibility in the choice of courses. Students can enroll in full-time or part-time certificate or diploma courses according to their preferences and academic needs. All the courses at Fleming College provide specialized training to students that helps them prepare for jobs in the relevant field.

Name: Niagara College - Niagara-on-the-Lake
Overview: Established in 1967 and Welland, Niagara College is considered the first college in Canada to educate students regarding breweries and wineries. This college has three active campuses, namely the Taif campus, Welland and Niagara-on-the-lake. In addition, this college has established the Tourism Industry Development Centre to train students in the tourism and hospitality sectors. The Niagara-on-the-lake campus is located at 135 Taylor Road and comprises a winery teaching section, dining room, Niagara culinary institute and more. Moreover, it has a field nursery, living labs, on-site greenhouse equipment etc. Also, this campus has a wine sensory laboratory and 3 on-site vineyards. This college offers various undergraduate, diploma, graduate and certificate courses. Also, it offers several general and vocational courses in spa, salon etc. In addition, aspiring and interested candidates in a brewery and culinary programs can explore several courses offered at the Wine Institute at the Niagara-on-the-lake campus. Though a wide range of programs is provided at Niagara College, it is popularly known for the courses associated with business, hospitality, engineering and management. With more than 130 innovative programs at world-class campuses, this college provides top-notch research facilities, small class sizes along with a friendly atmosphere. The Niagara-on-the-lake campus comprises several schools, namely Academic, Liberal and Access Studies, Environmental and Horticulture studies, Apprenticeship, Canadian Food and Wine Institute etc. Niagara College also offers a 4-year Bachelor's degree in fields like Game programming, Human resources, International Commerce and Global Development, Game design etc.  Students can make education affordable in this college through various scholarships, bursaries, awards etc. With a graduate employment rate of nearly 86%, this institution prepares students for the job market and ensures their employment within 6 months of completing graduation. As per US News and World Report, this college holds 21st position in Regional Universities North.

Name: Yorkville University - Vancouver
Overview: Yorkville University is a for-profit private educational institution in Canada. It was established in 2003. It has several campuses across the country, which includes the west coast campus of Yorkville University – Vancouver. The institution also has partnerships with numerous universities, colleges, and organisations, including the Royal Bridge College, McKenzie College, Bishop’s University, and Toronto Film School, among others. Yorkville University – Vancouver offers an on-campus program for undergraduate studies in Business Administration. The Bachelor of Business Administration or BBA degree provides one with the knowledge and skills that present-day employers value. Students can either choose a general degree that does not include any specialisation or opt for specialisation in Accounting, Project Management, Energy Management, and Supply Chain Management. The rigorous curriculum of this course covers a variety of core business functions, such as strategy, leadership, operations, accounting, and marketing, thereby preparing one for on-the-job challenges. It also provides a number of bursaries and scholarships to students, such as The Jacob Markovitz Memorial Scholarship, United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) Bursary, etc. This institution also extends a UPS Partnership program which allows students to earn their degree while they work. Under this program, students can receive a special bursary, along with fee waivers and more flexible tuition payment options. To ease tuition payment for students, Yorkville University – Vancouver extends financial aid in the form of the Canada Student Loans Program, Student Line of Credit, Lifelong Learning Plan (LLP), and the Registered Education Savings Plan (RESP). The university extends students an opportunity to earn perquisites towards applying to become a Professional Project Manager, Chartered Professional Accountant, and other career prospects. This allows students to apply for various professional designations and stand out in today’s competitive job market.

Name: College of the North Atlantic - Prince Philip Drive
Overview: College of the North Atlantic is Canada’s largest post-secondary educational centre located in the province of Newfoundland and Labrador and has 17 campuses across the state, out of which the Prince Philip Drive campus is located in the southern part of the capital city of St. John. On this campus, there are 37 full-time and per-semester credit courses, like applied music, business management, cooking, early childhood education, graphic design, journalism, etc. The College of the North Atlantic has a placement rate of 94%, and 96% of graduates get placed within 6 months. The college ranked at 7th position in National Universities by Webometrics University Ranking in the year 2020. What attracts international students is that the college offers one of the lowest tuition fees in all of Atlantic Canada. It ensures personalized attention with a student-to-faculty ratio of 4:1. As the college provides high education quality at a reasonable tuition cost, it does not give scholarships or financial aid to international students. The college has set up an International Student Contact to resolve queries about accommodation, events, orientation, or application process to welcome more students from different countries. Further, the college offers financial aid to eligible students by working in tandem with the Government of Canada and the Government of Newfoundland and Labrador. Students can also apply for an education loan to meet their study expenses. In addition, the college offers several scholarships and awards, which include the Boyd Summers Memorial Bursary, Atlantic Credit Union Bursaries, TD Insurance Meloche Monnex Alumni Achievement Awards, CNA Faculty & Staff Achievement Awards, and the College of the North Atlantic Industrial Trades Distinction Scholarship.

Name: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada - Cornerstone Tech
Overview: Cornerstone International Community College of Canada is a public university in Vancouver, British Columbia, specializing in courses like Web & Mobile App Development, Network & System Solutions Specialist, Digital Marketing Specialist, Hospitality Management, and English Language Training. The college has two campuses, Cornerstone Tech and West Hastings. The Tech campus is located in Downtown Vancouver and is 10 minutes away from the other campus. The location places the students in the center of cafes, bars, shopping malls, and major transport routes. Famous attractions like Stanley Park, Vancouver Aquarium, and 2 beaches are located within 5 minutes from the campus, which enhances the student satisfaction with the college. Cornerstone International Community College of Canada offers diploma and certificate Co-op programmes, which allow students to get paid work experience during their academic term. It is assured that 96% of the students will get a job in the first month of their Co-op. This allows international students from over 72 countries to get trained with relevant academic content and gain practical work experience in a Canadian workplace. Cornerstone International Community College of Canada has many scholarship opportunities for international students in order to fund their tuition and accommodation costs in Canada. The college aims to build a multicultural culture and organizes social activities in order to improve the reading and speaking skills of international students and make them feel welcomed in Canada.
Eligibility Overview: Cornerstone College has three intakes for international students: in September, February, and July. Thus, you need to follow four steps to apply for a diploma program at Cornerstone College.You should complete the online application form.You have to prepare a copy of your passport and an English Language Proficiency test score. However, you do not need to submit the test score if you apply for any of the English as a Second Language programs.You need to create an online profile and submit your documents via the online platform.You need to complete the placement test if you have not taken an English Language Proficiency test. The placement test is a mandatory requirement for international students who apply for English courses or other career programs.If you pass TOEFL PBT, you should get a score of 513. You need to get a score of 183 if you pass TOEFL CBT. If you pass TOEFL iBT, you ought to get a score of 65. If you pass IELTS Academic, you need to get a minimum score of 5.5. If you decide to take the Cornerstone Placement Test, you should get the high intermediate level.Once you meet the admission requirements and submit all documents, Cornerstone College will send you an invoice with the request to make the first payment. After receiving the payment, the school will send you a letter of acceptance. Then, you have to apply for a student permit and work permit (if you apply for co-op).

Name: Canadore College - North bay
Overview: The Canadore College started in 1967 as one of the campuses of the Cambrian College of Sudbury, and in 1972 it became a stand-alone organization. The college is home to world-class facilities to advance Canada's sports culture, with about eight campuses scattered across 650 acres.The college's primary goal is to give students the best learning environment possible. Forty thousand graduates from diverse fields have graduated from this college over its 55-year history; each year, over 1000 students do so.Canadore College collaborates across the many departments on campus to provide the best experience to its students. The college includes individuals belonging to different communities and ethnicities irrespective of age, gender identity, and sexual orientation. All the campuses are made accessible with electronic doors and elevators, designated parking, and more. The campuses are all equipped with surveillance cameras 24 hours a day. On-site security, safety initiatives, campus walk program, and emergency telephones are deployed to ensure student safety.The college provides many opportunities for students to learn about leadership. They have a dedicated student success service to help you conquer all your fears and push you toward your dream job. Be it student council or residence council, you may be able to take part and learn leadership skills and decision-making.

Canadore broadens students' educational experiences outside the classroom by promoting personal and academic growth and involving them in academic and community activities near their residences. Canadore has RAs assigned to each building to assist you with everything you need because it may be the first time most of you are living alone.The buildings are filled with lounges, multi-purpose rooms, laundry rooms, fitness centres and more. To live off-campus, you might have to search for suitable homes nearby, utilising well-known housing websites. University Ranking: Canadore College is a public college located in North Bay, Ontario, Canada. Founded in 1967, Canadore College is one of the oldest colleges in Ontario and has a long-standing reputation for providing quality education and training to its students. The college offers various programs and services, including university transfer, apprenticeship, career and technical education, and continuing education. Canadore College is ranked among the top colleges in Ontario.  According to the 2020 Maclean’s rankings, Canadore College is ranked number 9 out of 24 colleges in Ontario. The college has consistently ranked in the top 10 for the last five years. In addition to its high ranking, Canadore College is also known for its commitment to student success. The college offers various support services to help students succeed, including academic advising, career and employment services, and financial aid. Canadore College also strongly focuses on experiential learning, offering students the opportunity to gain hands-on experience through co-op placements, internships, and volunteer opportunities.  Canadore College also has a solid commitment to research and innovation. The college has established several research centres, including the Canadore Research Institute, the Centre for Advanced Manufacturing, and the Centre for Applied Research and Innovation.  These research centres allow students to participate in cutting-edge research projects and gain valuable experience in their field. Canadore College is an excellent choice for those looking for a quality education. With its high ranking and commitment to student success, Canadore College is a perfect choice for those pursuing higher education in Ontario.

Name: Georgian College, Toronto, Ontario
Overview: Georgian College was founded in 1967 and has 7 campuses which encompass a total area of 21,000 square kilometres. 12 of the co-op education programs of the college have been accredited by the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education, making it Ontario's best co-op college. Along with that, its health, veterinary assistant and veterinary technician programs have a high accreditation rating. The college enrolls more than 5,000 students every year and houses over 13,000 students including 3,600 foreign students representing 85 countries across the world. The college offers 100% of the students an experience of professional transformation and real world opportunities through hands-on and practical learning. It maintains an acceptance rate of 81%. Also, it achieved a high graduate employment rate by creating a record of 89.7% of graduates employed within six months of graduation in the academic session of 2018-19. Georgian College’s courses are diverse and offered in bachelor’s, graduate, apprenticeship and diploma degree levels. They provide over 130 programs in various study areas such as automotive, computer studies, engineering, business, management, visual arts, liberal arts, design, health, environmental technologies, sciences, hospitality, human services, tourism, indigenous studies, skilled trades, and marine studies. All the courses are available in the mode of full-time, part-time and preparation programs. The co-op programs prepare the students by providing experiential training in skill-enhancing courses by collaborating with various industries. Georgian College at Toronto, Ontario is located in the heart of the city. The students can apply for Canadian scholarships through the college. The college also endeavours to provide the students better experience by offering laboratories for state-of-the-art technology, excellent athletic and fitness programs and equipment and a variety of necessary amenities and services including housing, food services, library, health care and more.

Name: Nova Scotia community college
Overview: Established in 1996, Nova Scotia Community College is a public community college located in Halifax, Nova Scotia, Canada. It consists of 16 campuses and community learning centers. The college enrolls more than 22,000 students in various fields such as computer science, human and health services, new media, industrial trades, arts, business, and technologies. The NSC College is also known for offering around 130 undergraduate and postgraduate degrees to its students, both full-time and part-time. The four specialized institutes of Nova Scotia Community College are the School of Fisheries, Centre of Geographical Sciences, Nautical Institute, and Aviation Institute. The college accepts admissions only in the fall of spring and during winter. The students of this college also receive customized training programs in different industries, government agencies, and businesses. Some of the college's top courses include aircraft maintenance, animation, programming, graphic designing, and dental assisting. NSCC also offers an Adult Learning program that gives students an excellent opportunity to get an adult high school diploma. The college has excellent placement opportunities where nearly 88% of students get employed within a few months from graduation and earn a maximum salary of $25,000.Sobey Awards are some of the most common scholarships. The Nova Scotia Community College does not provide on-campus accommodation, but it allied with Places4students.com to help students with off-campus accommodation facilities.The university offers scholarships and Financial aid to its international students via Students Awards Programs: urgent Aid, Sponsor A Students, and Donald R.
Eligibility Overview: Testing for English proficiency If English is not your first language, Students must provide official results from one of the English proficiency tests listed below. The testing company must send the findings directly to NSCC Admissions to be considered official. The exam date must be fewer than two years before the date you submit your NSCC application.1. International English Language Testing System (IELTS Academic Test) - each test must have a minimum score of 6.0. (Listening, Reading, Writing, Speaking).2. TOEFL Internet-Based Exam (TOEFL iBT), 60 on the Paper-Delivered Test, or 550 on the Paper-Based Test – minimum test scores of 80 on the TOEFL iBT, 60 on the Paper-Delivered Test. 3. CanTest (Canadian Test of English for Scholars and Trainees) - 4.5 average.4. Canadian Language Benchmark (CLB) - each test must have a minimum Level 8 score.5. Minimum Band 60 on the Canadian Academic English Language Assessment (CAEL).6. MET (Michigan English Test) — a minimum score of 59 is required.7. Pearson Test of English Academic (PTE) - a minimum score of 55 on this test is required.
