Name: Trent University
Overview: Trent University, a public research university, is one of the top universities in Ontario, Canada, established in 1964. The University provides 128 undergraduate programs (degrees, certificates, diplomas, and specializations), 12 postgraduate courses, 14 thesis-based masters courses, 6 doctoral degree programs, and 4 graduate diplomas in the fields of arts and science, accounting, and African studies, archaeology, anthropology, and biology. It also offers programs in areas like feminism, ageing studies, and gender studies. Some of the top courses offered by the University are B.B.A., M.S., M.I.M., B.E., etc. The average annual fee of the courses offered by the University ranges between CAD 6,609 and 18,175. It offers several courses, such as Continuing Education, to its students that provide access to a variety of experts. Trent University offers financial aid through grants, scholarships, jobs, and other external aids to its international applicants. Some scholarships are Trent University Entrance Scholarships, I.B. Entrance Scholarships, Trent International Global Citizen Scholarships and Awards, Justin Chiu International Scholarships, etc. The University offers one of the best placements in Canada. Nursing and Mathematics graduates have a 100% employment rate after graduation. The average annual salary of University graduates is approximately CAD 56,000.

University Ranking: Trent University, a public liberal arts college in Peterborough, Ontario, was established in 1964. The university is renowned for its small class sizes and Oxbridge college system. The Oxbridge college system appears to the uninitiated to be a collection of structures, frequently beautiful and historically significant, that make up a small, self-contained community. Each college complex includes housing for students, common areas, cafes and bars, libraries, computer labs (often open round-the-clock), and staff offices. Although Trent University's student body is primarily composed of undergraduates, master's and doctoral programmes are available. FAQs about Trent University admissionsAccording to US News & World Report's Global Universities ranking for 2021, Trent University is ranked 1436 overall. Prior to this, the university was ranked 1270 for 2019 and 2020. The university dropped a few positions in the rating criteria. In addition to other ranking factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).Trent University Ranking

Name: Olds College
Overview: Olds College is a public post-secondary higher education institution in Olds, Alberta. The institution was formerly known as the Olds Agricultural College. Olds College is a member of the esteemed Alberta Rural Development Network. The curriculum at Olds College is uniquely curated to advance the agricultural industry. A distinct and provincially focused school, Olds College aims to provide accessible education to its students. Olds College is regarded as Canada's Smart Agricultural College. Some top programs at Olds College are B.S. in Agribusiness, Business Management Diploma, Precision Agriculture- Techgronomy Diploma, and Horticulture Technologist Diploma. Admission is given based on GPA and English proficiency test.The average tuition fee at Olds College is USD 4,460.International students can apply for the Alberta Scholarship & Bursary Program. The institution offers accessible counselling services and other learning support. The Calgary Campus is an alliance of the Calgary Stampede Board. Olds College offers its students ample career opportunities, including the prestigious Alberta Smithsonian Internship Programme.

Placement: Internships An internship is a professional learning experience provided by a company to give students valuable job experience. Internships help students build their careers by allowing them to explore interests and gain professional skills and competencies in their field of study. Internships come in a variety of lengths, disciplines, and job types. Alberta Smithsonian Internship Program: Spend 10-12 weeks at the Smithsonian Institution, the world's largest museum conglomerate, in Washington, D.C. Learn from professionals, make an impact, and grow personally and professionally by assisting with research and assisting in the production of world-class programmes and exhibits. This internship provides opportunities in a wide range of fields, including science, business and public administration, history, education, and the arts. A $10,000 prize will be awarded to successful applicants (the internship is unpaid). Eligibility All OC students enrolled in a diploma or applied degree programme are eligible to apply.Have completed a full-time academic programme with at least 60 creditsA minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on all post-secondary work is required.Prior to the application deadline, have a minimum GPA of 3.2 in the most recently completed termBe a citizen or permanent resident of Canadabe an Alberta resident, which is defined as any of the following for the purposes of these grant programmes:Albertan by birthgraduated from an Alberta high schoolgraduated from an Alberta post-secondary institution with an Eligible ProgramI spent a total of 12 months in Alberta  Alberta-Saxony Internship and Intercultural Alliance (ASiiA): The ASiiA programme provides Alberta students with the option to participate in a research or industry internship in Saxony, Germany, that is directly related to their subject of study. Technology, business, health, energy, the environment, education, and economic development are all relevant topic areas. It's possible that some internships will be unpaid. Eligibility All OC students participating in an Applied Degree programme are eligible to applybefore leaving for the internship, you must have completed a minimum of 24 creditsA minimum GPA of 2.50 is requiredbe a citizen or permanent resident of CanadaThe ability to communicate in German is preferred but not needed

Overview: College of the North Atlantic's Clarenville campus is situated at 69 Pleasant Street in Clarenville, Newfoundland. It receives around 175 students for full-time credit course registration per semester, and nearly 400 students participate in the Continuing Education evening courses. The student-to-faculty ratio is 14:1, and the acceptance rate stands at 48% here, clearly stating that the admission process is somewhat competitive. The university offers one four-year degree, the Bachelor of Arts and sciences. The classes are seminar-style, where a maximum of 20 students can attend each course. It boasts five divisions instead of regular departments covering arts and humanities, life sciences, mathematics, physical sciences, and social sciences. More than 600 international students from over 40 countries get the opportunity to study for a Bachelor of Arts and Science degree. However, they need to provide certain documents, including TOEFL and IELTS test scores, to be eligible for the same.This university's estimated annual cost of attendance stays nearly around ca. $15,000. However, eligible students can also benefit from scholarships and bursaries, including government loan programs facilitated by the university. Apart from academic assistance, the Quest University Canada campus ensures students get a good experience while studying here. For that, the institution has a library building, a gymnasium, and a service building with a cafeteria. It also provides accommodation assistance, and there are five student residences.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Academic Requirements: You must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements:By the time you begin your studies at Quest, you will have to finished or will complete the International Baccalaureate (IB) DiplomaYou have to completed three years of full-time academic studies in which English was the language of instruction English Requirements: You must meet the below-mentioned English language proficiency score requirements:

Placement: All campus jobs pay an hourly rate (plus 4% vacation pay). Some have set hours, while others work on a project basis. Students report to a staff or faculty supervisor who controls their employment; students who do not show up for scheduled work shifts or do not perform satisfactorily may lose their job and will not be replaced. Following the end of the spring semester, a limited number of full-time or part-time job opportunities may become available beyond the usual academic year. Students can learn more about themselves, obtain professional skills for the next level, explore a variety of job options, and continue their education at university. Career Services offers: Providing career guidance and adviceSupport and workshops on resume writing, interview skills, and other important job search and application skillsProfessional Week is a week of career development programming that includes panels and seminars on career skills and career explorationThe Job FairWorkshops on how to advertise your Quest degreeInternet-based resourcesJob and Opportunity Postings
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation: The Quest experience is incomplete without living on campus.You'll participate in activities in a safe and friendly setting, have some alone time, and get to know your neighbours.At Quest, each residence building has a student Resident Assistant elected by their peers. They assist in coordinating activities, providing support, and building a sense of community. The University Faculty-in-Residence programme provides campus accommodation to selected Tutors, and some employees live on campus as Residence Coordinators.University attempt to build a generically designed environment. Accessibility and equity are essential to Quest. Please review the University Student Accommodation Policy if you require lodging. The Peaks ResidencesThe Peaks: Ossa and Red Tusk are home to most students. They were named after the peaks of the Tantalus Range, which rise magnificently on the horizon. The Peaks were created to balance quiet and private spaces and communal and creative spaces. Students share a washroom with a neighbour and reside in single rooms. Most students will remain in these residence halls until their third year. These are the following facilities provided : Single BedroomBike StorageYoga and Interfaith roomsStudy spaceCreative studios Off-Campus Accommodation: The Residences At Quest University, Squamish, extend a warm welcome and provide excellent value budget accommodation with 31 well-appointed rooms, nine offers on selected rentals including nearby parking, and free WiFi in all parts of the facility.All rooms at the Residences At Quest University include a welcome tray, fresh towels, amenities, a hairdryer, and tea and coffee-making facilities. In addition, for your comfort, the pleasant non-smoking, and disabled-friendly rooms include a flat-screen TV.The Residences At Quest University receive a 7.5/10 rating based on verified guest ratings.

Name: International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) - Toronto
Overview: Established in 1997, the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) is a private English language school that provides long and short-term English language courses for international students. This institution has several campuses in Canada, precisely in Ontario, British Columbia, Vancouver. The Toronto campus is conveniently situated in the neighborhood of Yorkville and consists of innovative boutique-style schools with advanced student lounges and common spaces. International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Toronto offers multiple programs, including Business English, IELTS Exam Preparation, General English, College and University Pathway. In addition, it offers accommodations and activities, young adult programs, GAP year, high school programs etc. This educational institution provides college and university placement services along with post-secondary counselling. Every year, this college accepts thousands of students from more than 75 countries. This institution offers English courses for any level, age and requirements. Moreover, it facilitates students with customized study packages to meet their academic goals. This university provides modern, advanced, boutique style facilities in the Toronto and Vancouver campuses. The International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) specializes in fluency in more than 40 languages. It also ensures the best experience for students in this institution. The facilitators of this institution are TESOL trained and have top-notch degrees. International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) – Toronto won the Award for Language School in the Greater Toronto Area in 2021. It also bagged the Best Language School in Toronto Award for seven consecutive years. Moreover, the International Language Academy of Canada (ILAC) was the Language Educator of the Year finalist in The Pioneer Awards 2020. Backed by years of experience, the professionals provide students with an opportunity to practice English in real situations. For more than 20 years, this institution has been hosting exciting social events and offering different English programs and top-notch customer service.

Name: Red River College - Steinbach Campus
Overview: Founded in 1938, Red River College Polytechnic (RRC Polytechnic) is located in Steinbach, Canada. It is the largest college in the Manitoba Province for applied learning and research and offers more than 200 full-time and part-time degree programs. At Red River College - Steinbach Campus, courses are available on a variety of subjects. A few of the disciplines include Accounting, Business Administration, Business Accounting and Management, Computer Applications, Early Childhood Education, Languages, Human Resources Management, Nursing, and others. But for international candidates, programs are available in Business, Intensive English, Health Sciences, Computer and Information Systems Technology, Community Services, Creative Arts, Transportation Technology, Health Sciences, Indigenous Education, Hospitality, Skilled Trades, Engineering, and CAD Technology, and Creative Arts. RRC Polytech also offers financial aid and scholarships for its students. These financial aids are available as awards, scholarships, and bursaries. A few of these financial aids are Bell MTS Telecommunications Award, C.P. Loewen Family Foundation Bursary, Dave Orton Award, Perry Allan Scholarship Award, and others. The total student population at Red River College is more than 22,000, with international student strength of 1400+. The average cost of living is around CAD 11,000, whereas the tuition fee changes as per the course. The average undergraduate tuition fee ranges between CAD 8,000 to CAD 18,000, whereas the average graduate tuition fee is CAD 17,000 to CAD 18,000. These fees are an approximation and might change as per the course or citizenship of the students. For admissions, apart from subject-specific requirements, applicants will also have to provide English Language Score. The average minimum undergraduate IELTS score is 6, and the TOEFL score is 79. Whereas for graduate admissions, the minimum IELTS score requirement is 6.5 and the TOEFL score requirement is 80. Of approximately 22,000 students, 24% are international learners representing 60 countries. Red River College - Steinbach also provides various opportunities for its students such as Recruitment Fairs, Work-Study Programs, Interview Preparation, on-the-job training and internship, and others.
Eligibility Overview: The primary academic prerequisite is the first admission criteria, denoted by the number "1." This can be either Grade 12 (the equivalent of a Grade 12 education in Manitoba) or Post-Secondary Education (the equivalent of a Grade 12 education in Manitoba plus a diploma or degree in the associated profession, as indicated in that section)Pass a language proficiency test (TOEFL, IELTS Academic, or CanTest) with the required minimum results;Send your resume to the Department of International BusinessPrograms in the Creative Arts include: Participating in a necessary orientation and submitting a portfolio (not required at the time of application, but required as part of the acceptance process)Provide proof of current and finished vaccines and tests to the Health Care Aide
Placement: Students and alumni can make use of the college's dedicated career services.Job/internship advertisements, on-campus recruitment drives, training, and counselling are just a few of the services it offers.Employers are permitted to publish vacancies and offer employment opportunities to students via the college's Job Central platform.Employers are also invited to visit the college to recruit students.In the last three years, salaries for the college's programmes and courses ranged from 24,960 to 90,000 CAD.A work placement programme is also available at the college.According to Emolument, the following are the average earnings of RRC graduates and alumni by degree:

Name: George Brown College
Overview: George Brown College of Applied Arts and Technology is a public, certified school set up in 1966 by the public authority of Ontario. The college has three vibrant and spacious campuses situated in Downtown Toronto. One of the three campuses, Casa Loma, is the main university campus with five buildings and vast green space within the property.It also houses a gym, a library, student services, a cafeteria, and a theater. The St. James campus holds the Center for business, art, design, information technology, hospitality, and culinary arts. The Daphne Cockwell Centre for Health Sciences at Waterfront Campus hosts dental health, health service management, nursing, a school of design, and many more.The college offers over 162 courses and over 193 areas of continued education available to international candidates. The course comprises 27 certificate programs, five pre-college programs, ten apprentice programs, and 28 graduate certificate programs. The college offers courses through its Center for arts, design & data technology, business, community services & early childhood, construction & engineering technologies, wellbeing sciences, hospitality & cookery arts, and preparatory & liberal studies. The university is known for its campus tours which can be done virtually and in person. The college houses innovative learning facilities that stimulate what students can experience in the real world. The institution's primary goal is to help the students plan and execute the work in the best manner. The fee for international students is between CAD 13,275- 18,102. The college offers on-campus and off-campus accommodation, including single and shared apartments costing around CAD 10,100 a year. George Brown College provides financial support to the students for their excellence in academics and sports. The college has several scholarships, bursaries, and awards for its students. The highest-paid graduates are offered human resource, sales, and business development roles.
Eligibility Overview: English Proficiency Test Requirements:Before applying to George Brown College, all international students whose first language is not English must pass the ELP (English Language Proficiency) test. The minimum scores required for students to have their applications accepted by the college are listed below:IELTS- 6.5 TOEFL (Online)- 84CAEL (Overall)- 70PTE (Academic)- 60MELAB- 85
Placement: The highest-paid graduates were offered positions in Human Resources, Sales, and Business Development. Graduates with a degree/certification from George Brown College can earn around $45,000 per year. The college provides assistance through a career coach, who guides students on their future path by offering resume building services, career assessments, and job search in Canada.
Accommodation: Candidates can choose from different accommodation facilities like Shared Accommodations, One-Bedroom Apartments, and Two-Bedroom Apartments available at varying costs.

Name: Canadian Business College - Scarborough
Overview:
The Canadian College of Technology, Science and Business is located in Scarborough. Students can get professional career training for a bright future in multiple fields. The Canadian Business College, Scarborough campus is located very close to town Centre Plaza, Canadian Tire along with different cafes, banks, etc.
This educational institution can provide students with top-notch education, career support as well as professional training to develop their careers in various fields such as Healthcare, Law, Business programs, IT programs, Education programs, English courses etc. To become a reputed professional, students will receive advanced professional training from this college. Moreover one can receive Diploma and Certificate programs which are filled with knowledge and information. Some of the Canadian Business College Diploma programs involve internships so that students can build their skills and abilities.
Apart from these, Canadian Business College ensures a 100% placement guarantee in top organisations and offers flexible weekend classes to match up the schedule. To match up with the ever-changing market, a professional certificate is a must. Students can receive career-oriented training along with IT and Business Certificate programs. Moreover, this institution provides different online programs including Artificial Intelligence, Logistics and Supply Chain Management, Graphic and Web design development, Big Data Analytics etc. Backed by 30 years of experience and more than 20 certificate and diploma programs, this college provides necessary employment-focused programs and ensures interactive teaching. 
The courses developed by Canadian Business College – Scarborough improves the students’ knowledge, reinforce analytical skills and prepare them to succeed in a professional environment. Besides, the Second Career Assistance and Financial Aid training will provide monetary assistance to the individuals so that they can complete their training and fund their education.

Name: Red River College - Notre Dame Campus
Overview: Established in the mid-1930s, Red River College or RRC is the biggest applied learning and research institute in the province of Manitoba, Canada. There are three major campuses of Red River College Polytechnic in Winnipeg. Out of these, the largest one is the Red River College - Notre Dame Campus. The Red River College - Notre Dame Campus houses most of this institute’s transportation technology, health sciences, skilled trades, and engineering programs. This campus location is home to the athletic teams of RRC Polytech - the Rebels. It also hosts computer labs, two gyms, student lounges, Tim Hortons, applied research labs and many other facilities. The Awards and Financial Aid Office of RRC offers several support services to students that cover information on financial assistance programs available to Manitoba students. In 2020, this institute administered bursaries, scholarships and awards, totaling over $2.9 million for helping students achieve their academic goals. The tuition fees at this institute vary across programs. Besides this, there are several other fees that students need to pay wherever applicable. Some of these fee types include Student Services Fee, Technology Fee, Material Fee, Technology Infrastructure Fee, Canadian Nursing Student Association Fee, Supplemental Exam Fee and several others. Domestic aspiring candidates should submit a non-refundable application fee ranging between $100 to $120 with every application. Aspiring international candidates should submit a non-refundable application fee amounting anywhere between $130 to $160 with each application. The Student Employment Services of RRC Polytech prepares students for becoming employment ready. It extends a complete range of employment supports and services for employers and alumni. This includes Job Central which is an online job board. Red River College alumni can access Student Employment Services within 6 months of their graduation.

Name: Okanagan College - Salmon Arm
Overview: Located near British Columbia, Canada, Okanagan College is known for its post-secondary educational services worldwide. It was initially established in 1963 with the name B.C. Vocational School and got its current name in 1965. The college has received a range of affiliations including Ci CAN, CCAA, CCBC, and CBIE. Okanagan College uses four of its campuses for imparting education to the students. Every year, the college serves more than 20,000 new enrollments and applicants from across the globe. The mission of the college is to help the students and community with an inclusive environment for all. The Salmon Arm campus is known for its wide range of programs at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. Some of the popular areas include science, humanities, accounting, business studies, tourism, technology, a trade apprenticeship, education assistance, etc. The college comes with facilities such as a library, bookstore, student housing and rentals, campus security, etc. One of the most significant advantages of the Salmon Arm campus is the adult upgradation system, whereby students can upgrade their diplomas with degree courses. Moreover, the Okanagan College ranking shows its 82nd position in the Top universities in Canada by Canadian University ranking (Uni Rank). The acceptance rate followed here makes the university moderately selective, which has increased international enrollments to about 900 on average. The student-faculty ratio maintained in the classes is 19:1. The university has set tuition fees, which might seem unaffordable for many, currently ranging from $55,000-$60,000. However, there are scholarship schemes for deserving candidates. The college makes efforts to understand the employment requirements of the newly graduating students and alumni. The collaboration of the college with the Student, Graduate and Co-op Employment Centre helps update them with the latest employment and internship news soon after their graduation.
Eligibility Overview: ESL STUDENTSDuolingo: Language Assessment for placement in the English Language ProgramStudents are required to submit the results of a Duolingo test in order to be placed in the appropriate level of the ESL program.  Test results should be sent to  intedapps@okanagan.bc.caIELTS,  and OCELA scores are also accepted for placement
Accommodation: Okanagan College Student Housing is located on the Kelowna campus and is nestled in the mountains of the magnificent Okanagan Valley. It offers furnished, non-smoking apartments. Classrooms, libraries, recreational and exercise facilities, and food services are all within walking distance of the apartments.Local beaches, recreation sites, downtown, the airport, and commercial districts are all accessible through public transportation.A study area with a desk, chair, and lamp is provided in each room. Your prices include access to a high-speed Internet connection.Individual or group study is possible in a quiet study lounge. The library is near by, and living in a community makes it easier to find a study partner.

Name: University of Calgary
Overview: The University of Calgary, or UCalgary, is a public-funded research university founded in 1966. It's located in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The University comprises 250 academic programs, more than 110 majors in undergraduate, and 70+ graduates across its five campuses, having 14 faculties. Major popular subjects provided by the University of Calgary are Arts and Humanities, Psychology, Physical Sciences, Biotechnology, Applied Microbiology, Business Management, Economics, Engineering & Technology, Architecture, Education, and Communication. The Main Campus of UCalgary is situated in the Northwest Quadrant of Calgary and spread across 530 acres. The other four campuses are: The Foothills Campus for Advanced Medical Research and Faculty of Veterinary MedicineThe Downtown Campus comprises the Haskayne School of Business and the School of Public Policy.The Spy Hill Campus is home to the Veterinary Science Research Station and the Wildlife Research Station.T Qatar Campus in Doha offers Master's and Bachelor's Degrees in Nursing. The average annual cost of attendance at the University of Calgary for international students is 16,642 CAD. In addition, UCalgary offers different kinds of need or merit-based financial aid and scholarships to their international students, including work-study programs and bursaries up to $25,000 for masters. The student-faculty ratio at the University is 17:1. Most graduate and undergraduate students choose to stay at the campus, which has a range of accommodation facilities in both dorm and apartment-style. The on-campus residence has a capacity of 2,500 students. The University of Calgary is at the forefront of providing students with various career opportunities to learn the practicalities of their learnings and get exposure to real work insights. A full-time student can opt for a Work-Study Program where they can work part-time on-campus and off-campus during their academic sessions. Other Placement options are also offered to students, like full-time and part-time placements, paid internships, research opportunities, and training.

Accommodation: The University of Calgary provides a variety of residences on campus because the majority of undergraduate and graduate students live there. On-campus housing is available for approximately 2,500 students and faculty members. In the dormitory-style residence, students under 21 are assigned a single or double-occupancy room. The university's Qatar Campus is home to 450 students from 39 different countries. The university also has studios, one, two, or three-bedroom units with full kitchens for third-year undergraduates, graduate, transfer, and international students who want to live more independently. Interested candidates should apply on the university's official website. Staying in a university residence typically costs between 6,000 and 11,000 CAD (3.5 to 6.5 lakh INR).
Course Ranking: More than 250 programmes are available through the 14 faculties at the University of Calgary. According to the Times Higher Education subject rankings for 2022, the Business and Economics course at the university is ranked between 301 and 400 among all business courses. Since last year, it has fallen in the rankings. According to THE, the Business and Economics course placed 251-300 in 2021.The University of Calgary has kept its place in the rankings for engineering programmes from the previous year. In both 2021 and 2022, it is ranked between 201-250. According to THE, the course's ranking dropped a little in 2020, placing it in the 251-300 range. If we look at the University of Calgary's Science course rankings, THE places the Life Science course between 301 and 400 in 2022. On the other side, the Times Higher Education subject rankings for 2022 place the Psychology programme between 126 and 150. University of Calgary Course Ranking FAQsQ. What are the best programs at the University of Calgary?A. 6According to the most recent QS World University Topic Rankings, of the subject areas at the University of Calgary are among the top 50 in the world in their respective fields. The top 6 subjects are as follows:Anatomy and Physiology: 38th globallyEngineering – Petroleum: 38th globallyHospitality & Leisure Management: 43rd globallyNursing: 40th globallySports-related subjects: 19th globallyVeterinary Science: 37th globallyQ. How has the University of Calgary performed in terms of the Engineering courses?A. The university's engineering programmes were classified in the 201-250th category in 2019, 2021, and 2022. The university was ranked in the 251-300th category in 2020. With the exception of 2020, the institution has consistently maintained the same stance for this course throughout the past three years. The rankings experienced a minor decline in 2022.Q. Where do the Business courses of the University of Calgary rank in 2022?A. According to the Times Higher Education, the University of Calgary's Business and Economics degree will be ranked between 301 and 400 in the world in 2022. Global MBA programme is ranked at number 251+ in the QS in 2022.Q. What are the rankings of the Science courses of the University of Calgary in 2022?A. The Life Science programme is ranked in the 301-400th category by Times Higher Education, up from the 201-250th position it held in the topic rankings for 2021. However, the Psychology course is listed at the 201-250th position in 2022 and at the 126-150th position in 2021..Q. What majors are the University of Calgary known for?A. The University of Calgary is renowned for its engineering, computer science, health, social science, and humanities majors, according to U.S. News.
University Ranking: One of the best universities in the world is the University of Calgary. One of the most comprehensive research institutions in Canada, it combines the best of the university's legacy with the dynamic vitality and diversity of the city. The University of Calgary, founded in 1966, includes 5 campuses. When it comes to the University of Calgary's ranking, the Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU) placed it in the 151-200 range globally in 2021. Read: Admissions at the University of Calgary. 2022The University of Calgary is ranked 235 in 2022 and 242 in 2023 by QS. Employer reputation, academic reputation, faculty to student ratio, citations per faculty, international student ratio, and international faculty ratio are the factors used to produce the QS World University Rankings. U.S. News and World Report's 2022 rankings place Calgary University at 169th place worldwide. Different weights are assigned to several ranking factors by U.S. News & World Report, including total citations, publications, conferences, and global research reputation. The University of Calgary is ranked 201-250 globally in the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022. University of Calgary Ranking FAQsQ. Is the University of Calgary a good university?A. The University of Toronto is ranked first in the QS World University Rankings 2022. On the list, University of Calgary is in position 10.Q. Is there any improvement in the QS rankings of the University of Calgary?A. If we look at the University of Calgary's QS rankings from 2021 and 2022, we can see that it has risen in the rankings. The university was ranked at position 246 in 2021, and at position 235 in 2022.

Course Description: University of Calgary is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Calgary was founded in 1966. Located in Calgary,Canada the university is home to about 3000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Calgary is ranked 6th in Top Universities by Webometrics - National. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 7 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. University of Calgary has 8 intakes in Sep,Jan,May,Mar,Apr,Feb,Jul,Aug. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 4 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Calgary is around $6,821 CAD Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Calgary include Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University ,Doris Dixon Scholarship,University Of Calgary International Entrance Award,Ontario Graduate Scholarship Masters Program.The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Calgary is the post-study work opportunities in Canada. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Calgary has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: New Brunswick Community College - St. Andrews
Overview: Established in 1974, New Brunswick Community College is a public community college. It currently has 6 campuses in Fredericton, Moncton, Miramichi, Saint John, St. Andrews and Woodstock. The campus at St.Andrews is well-connected with banks, groceries, shopping markets, and medical services. It approximately takes an hour to reach the nearest airport, which is located in Saint John. It has an affiliation with CCAA, CBIE, AUCC, and ACCC. Students willing to build their careers in the tourism and hospitality sector can enrol in the St.Andrews campus. It is known as Canada’s ‘first resort town’ and attracts 80,000+ tourists annually, making it easier for students to find jobs in the tourism and hospitality sector. This campus provides full-time programs in Aquaculture Operations, Carpentry, Culinary Arts, Culinary Arts Management, Electrical (Industrial), Hotel and Restaurant Management etc. Students can opt for part-time online programs in Abnormal Psychology, Calculus, Business Math etc. It also offers apprenticeship in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning, allowing students to gain hands-on professional experience while studying. This college grants scholarships, awards and bursaries to fund an eligible student’s education. According to Webometrics, the New Brunswick Community College ranking is 152nd in Canada. Besides, the New Brunswick Community College fees vary with each course and differ between domestic and international students. For example, the tuition fees for domestic students enrolled on the full-time program may need to pay approximately $3,380.00. It is $​9,468.00​​​​ for international students. Through TutorMe, students facing difficulty in understanding a subject can find a tutor. Individuals can receive free three hours of private lessons per week. Hours are subject to change every Sunday at midnight. Besides, Learning Circles and peer tutoring are available to resolve students’ academic queries. According to the 2020 survey, approximately 91% of graduates from the 2019 batch found jobs within one year of graduation. Nearly 94% of graduates from the 2019 batch were working in New Brunswick. The New Brunswick Community College has an expansive alumni network where individuals can find jobs, recruit potential candidates, connect with graduates and enjoy other benefits.
Eligibility Overview: Official transcripts from all prior educational institutions attended.A transcript from high school or a bachelor's degreeStudents will be required to demonstrate their English language skills by IELTS, TOEFL, or other tests.All applicants who come from countries where English is not the official language or who have not completed three years of secondary school or one year of post-secondary education at a university that uses English as the medium of instruction must submit their IELTS, TOEFL, or other test scores to demonstrate their English proficiency. Each test has its own set of basic criteria.

Name: Holland College - Summerside Waterfront
Overview: Holland College was established in 1969 as a provincial community college in Canada’s smallest province Prince Edward Island. It has 8 campuses spread across the island, each campus specializing in a particular field. One of its newest campuses is the Summerside Waterfront campus, which was opened in 2012. The campus is 60 km away from the College’s main campus, the Prince of Wales campus in Charlottetown. Summerside is the second-largest city in the province and is famous for its rich cultural heritage. The campus is situated on the banks of Summerside Harbour, allowing students to indulge in water sports and visit the Wyatt Historic House Museum and Eptek Art and Culture Centre. It is also among the safest cities to live in Canada. Holland College - Summerside Waterfront offers courses in the field of Business, Computer Studies, Health Studies and is the centre for Industrial Technology and Trade. Due to its location by the waterfront, this campus is also the Marine Training Centre. Holland College is renowned for having one of the highest graduation rates of 92% in 2020. It offers the students a chance to apply their theoretical knowledge in relevant industries during internships. International students can also work on campus for 20 hours a week. Holland College has a fund of CAD 500,000, which it uses to give scholarships to international and domestic students. It also has 90+ pathway degree courses, allowing students to further study in distinguished universities in Canada and the USA.
Eligibility Overview: Official academic transcriptsstandardised test results for studies in Canadafinancial documentationimmigration documents are among the essential application requirements.The institution accepts TOEFL, IELTS, and comparable scores as proof of English language proficiency.To establish their language skills, international applicants might submit TOEFL, IELTS, PTE, and other scores. Glendenning Hall and Cumberland Residence, with a total capacity of 277 students, are the college's two residence halls.Cumberland Residence: Cumberland Residence has 31 units and 80 beds. The hall contains 13 two-bedroom units and 18 triple apartments. Every floor of both residence halls and flats has a common area, security with 24-hour staff, mailboxes, laundry facilities, cable TV, Wi-Fi, and phone service. Students who participate in the Police Cadet programme must live at the Atlantic Policy Academy.

Name: Coquitlam College
Overview: Coquitlam College, located in British Columbia, Canada, is a member of the British Columbia Council on Admissions and Transfer (BCCAT) system and part of the EduCanada Brand, a government venture supporting the international education offered in Canada.The college has educational partnerships for transfer programs in North American and Canadian universities to help its students achieve their ambitions. Instead of the usual two, Coquitlam College offers three semesters per year to help its students graduate sooner. Students are Coquitlam's priority, and the college does a great job of emphasizing it through academics and extracurricular. The college places a high value on athletics and uses it to create an engaging learning environment. A multicultural student body promotes the well-rounded growth of a student as an individual.
Eligibility Overview: The following documents are required for international students to apply for admission:Official transcripts from prior educational institutions attended.Applicants from India must have a cumulative grade point average of 60% in four subjects and have Mathematics in their tenth year.A duplicate copy of your passport's front pageEvidence of health insurance coverage English Language Proficiency  Coquitlam college mainly teaches English. Placement: The College offers various career services in each discipline to assist students in finding suitable employment in Canada.Students can look for jobs in their chosen field of study on UBC's (The University of British Columbia)website.Students may also use ONET Online to research career possibilities accessible in the United States and the academic requirements for the position.Additionally, the Career Service Center at Coquitlam College offers access to various employment search websites.
Accommodation: Students at Coquitlam College have access to one of the best homestay programs in the Greater Vancouver region. A maximum of two students may reside as paying guests with a family. This enables students to get familiar with Canadian culture while strengthening their English-speaking abilities via regular interactions with their host family. Available housing alternatives are located within a 30-minute walk of the campus and are convenient to travel to via bus stations. Homestay accommodations include private furnished bedrooms, a communal bathroom, and a laundry area. Meal plans include three meals every day, including lunch at school.
University Ranking: Coquitlam College is one of the top post-secondary institutions in British Columbia, and it consistently ranks among the top institutions in Canada. Located in Coquitlam, the college offers students a variety of programs, from certificates to diplomas and even bachelor's degrees. With its strong academic focus, Coquitlam College is known for its high-quality education and excellent faculty. Consequently, it’s no surprise that Coquitlam College consistently ranks among the top post-secondary institutions in the country. In terms of rankings, Coquitlam College is highly regarded and consistently ranks among the top institutions in Canada. The college has earned recognition from multiple organizations, including Maclean's Magazine and the Globe and Mail.  In Maclean's Magazine rankings, Coquitlam College was ranked in the top 10 of the Medical/Doctoral category, and it was also ranked among the top ten universities in the province by the Globe and Mail. These rankings reflect the college's commitment to providing high-quality education and its excellent faculty. In addition to its rankings, Coquitlam College also has a strong reputation for its research and innovation. The college is renowned for its research, widely published in prestigious journals such as the Journal of Higher Education and the International Journal of Engineering Education.  Coquitlam College is also known for its innovative approaches to education, such as its use of blended learning, which combines traditional classroom instruction with online learning. Coquitlam College also has a strong commitment to student success. The college offers many student services, including academic and career counselling, tutoring, and student life services. Additionally, the college offers a variety of extracurricular activities, such as sports and clubs, designed to help students engage with the college community and develop their leadership skills.  Overall, Coquitlam College is one of the top post-secondary institutions in British Columbia and consistently ranks among the top institutions in Canada. With its strong academic focus and commitment to student success, Coquitlam College deserves its excellent reputation and high rankings.

Name: Mentora College of Business & Technology
Overview: Mentora College of Business and Technology is a post-secondary initiative of BAU Global and a business career college based in Toronto. This institute provides diploma programs in Hotel Management and Business Administration Management. It focuses on delivering interactive and project-based learning in its classes that currently feature a maximum of 14 students. Every program offered at this institute consists of a 384-hour supervised practicum for ensuring a real-world, hands-on learning experience. Students can opt for a Diploma in Business Administration Management or a Diploma in Hotel Management from this institute. This institute also houses an ESL school - Mentora Language Academy Toronto. It is also a member of the BAU Global Network. Mentora also holds a program pathway agreement with one of the leading public colleges of Ontario - Georgian College. The diploma program credits of this college can be transferred to Georgian College. Students looking for Mentora College of Business and Technology admission criteria must note that they need to possess an Ontario Secondary School Diploma (OSSD) or equivalent. Plus, they should be at least 18 years old, and pass a qualifying test that is approved by the Superintendent of Private Career Colleges. Besides these, international candidates should get a minimum score of 5.5 on the IELTS English language test. Both the Diploma programs at Mentora College of Business and Technology provide work placements. The work placement team at this institute supervises and supports the students during their placement. Apart from the support from Mentora staff, students earn employment references through these work placements. The various career options open for someone pursuing a Diploma in Hotel Management are Guest services supervisor, Banquet supervisor, Front office supervisor, Assistant restaurant manager, Food and beverage controller and many others. Students opting for the Diploma in Business Administration Management program will also find several career options open after themselves. Some of these include Office administrator, Marketing assistant, Assistant manager, Management trainee, Branch manager, Project coordinator and many more.
Eligibility Overview: You must be at least 18 years old and pass an admissions test that has been approved by the superintendent.If English is your second language, you may be asked to show proof of one or more of the following:1.1) Your score on a recognised English proficiency test (e.g., Duolingo English, IELTS 5.5); 1.2) Official proof of a degree from a recognised higher education institution where English is the language of instruction; 1.3) Successful completion of other recognised English preparation courses where students have demonstrated an equivalent to a 5.5 IELTS score or better.1.4) Achieve a minimum mark of 60% in each course
Placement: Work PlacementsIf you're a Mentora College student, you'll complete a 384-hour work placement during your final semester. Although it is essential in order to receive your advanced diploma, we have never heard a student complain about it! Work placements are with companies in the Toronto area that are interested in learning more about what you learned in school. You can work toward a diploma on the same campus in downtown Toronto once you finish your English studies!
Accommodation: Students should book their lodgings well in advance of their arrival, since all available accommodations fill up rapidly, especially before the semester begins.Accommodations Off-CampusOff-campus rental housing options include single homes, duplexes, apartments, and rooms for rent in the surrounding region. Students who choose to live off-campus must conduct their own research and arrive well before the start of the semester to do so.Homestay There are many different types of homestays to choose from, and our partners try their best to connect students with hosts based on their interests and preferences. Singles, young couples with children and pets, and elderly couples are among the homestay hosts.

Name: Georgian College - South Georgian Bay
Overview: Located across Ontario, Georgian College has accreditation from the Canadian Association for Co-operative Education (CAFCE). The college is known for its efforts towards the academic upgradation of students with the help of graduation degrees, certificates, apprenticeship training, and university programs. The students can choose from a wide variety of more than 130 programs for the subjects offered here. With over 3,600 international students, the college has encouraged a diverse range in its classes. Currently, Georgian College functions across seven campuses. The South Georgian Bay Campus provides educational services in its 20,000-square-foot building. The main subjects offered on this campus include business and management, healthcare, community services, tourism, hospitality, and human services. The campus provides community rooms, computer labs, nursing simulation labs, etc. Georgian College's career has been booming, as evident from the fact that 89% of the graduates received placements within six months of graduation. The college supports smaller class sizes and is transparent in its student-faculty ratio. Education and training services are connected to direct employment, so college graduates find a job faster than most. The acceptance rate followed here is about 81%, making it more selective towards new applicants for the college. The campus is near Collingwood, on the southern shores of Georgian Bay. The placement offices of the college help students with their career development. The college alumnae association has successful names, revealing the effective placement strategies of the college. They also receive benefits such as discount codes for college newspapers and magazines.

Placement: College Placements in Georgia Georgian College features a career center for its students that helps them find appropriate jobs using both online and offline resources. The center provides job advertising and volunteer opportunities, as well as resume preparation, mock interviews, and career coaching to help people improve their employability skills. Students are given access to an online portal and virtual employment tools where they can post their resumes and employers can choose the best prospects. Through online fairs and interviews, the college partners with industry to complete placements.Georgian College is a sought-after school since it offers admission in three academic periods. The college boasts that nearly 90% of its graduates find work within six months of graduation. With 100 percent practical experience and generous financial opportunities, the college has established itself as one of the top choices for international students looking to study in Canada.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available. Students can choose between on-campus dormitories (Barrie, Orillia, and Owen Sound campuses), off-campus apartment buildings, room and board, and houses to rent or share at Georgian.The institution offers a variety of dining programmes.On-campus living provides students with all they need to have a fun and safe college experience. On-campus housing information can be found here. https://www.georgiancollege.ca/student-life/campus-services/residence-housing/on-campus-residence/barrie-residence/ Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus housing is available. The average monthly rent for shared rooms is between CAD 350 and CAD 550.Apartments and sublets on a sharing basis are available.Wi-Fi, laundry services, dishwasher, heater, and other amenities are available.Apartments are available both furnished and unfurnished. Off-campus housing information can be found here. https://www.places4students.com/Places/Roommate?SchoolID=e1/D0gPD0wE=http://caprataproperties.com/

Name: Keyano College
Overview: Opened as the Alberta Vocational Centre (AVC) in Fort McMurray in 1965, Keyano College is a comprehensive community institute based in the Regional Municipality of Wood Buffalo. It caters to its students through Suncor Energy Industrial Centre in Fort McMurray, Clearwater Campus, Fort Chipewyan Campus, its Learning Centers in Gregoire Lake and Fort McKay.This college meets both the industry's skills and training acquisition requirements and the Wood Buffalo community's cultural needs and personal enrichment. Keyano College programs lead to baccalaureate degrees, certificates of qualification (trades), certificates and diplomas. It also supports the development of professional skills and knowledge in multiple sectors, including education, human services, energy, arts, sciences, construction, business, transportation, health and safety. This public, board-governed college also extends an array of corporate training options available to client organizations. These are also available as Aboriginal Education, and Regional Stewardship programming focused on enhancing access to learning opportunities. The various programs and courses include Construction Management, Corporate Training, Driver Training, Business Aviation, Educational Assistant Certificate, and many more. Students receive bursaries, scholarships and awards from this college for their achievements. Keyano College also extends financial support for the studies of the individuals. Individuals studying at this college can become a member of the Syncrude Sport and Wellness Centre, which offers several training and recreation facilities for the people of the Wood Buffalo area.

Placement: There are certain employing bodies that recruit college students. The employers are :  Magnet Student Work Placement Program: Employers, students, and post-secondary education stakeholders collaborate to offer high-quality work-integrated learning (WIL) opportunities through the Student Work Placement programme. Employers can receive pay subsidies if they hire post-secondary students for paid internships. Students benefit by acquiring significant work experience that will help them advance in their careers and assist students in finding employment in their subjects of study. Canada-Alberta Job Grant: The Canada-Alberta Job Grant is a training programme in which a company can apply for approved training expenditures for present or future employees. Employers choose who receives training and what type of training they require for their staff. The Canadian government contributes money to the Workforce Development Agreement. Government of Canada - Science And Technology Internship Program: Employers can receive up to $13,200 per internship for a maximum of 52 weeks through the Green Jobs - Science and Technology Internship Program (STIP). This money goes to the intern and is intended to entice employers to hire interns. When a non-federal organisation (a private corporation, university or college, non-profit organisation, or provincial or municipal government) hires an eligible intern to work on research and development projects, it becomes a partner of Natural Resources Canada (NRCan). A contribution payment for a portion of the intern's income is available to partners. Canada Summer Jobs: Not-for-profit groups, public sector employers, and small businesses with 50 or fewer employees in Canada Summer Jobs is a programme that allows you to apply for the money. This grant assists in the creation of jobs for students aged 15 to 30. Young Canada Works: Young Canada Works provides pay subsidies and access to outstanding individuals with creative ideas and competitive skills to employers in the domains of heritage, arts, culture, and official languages.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation During their studies, the single students and student families can stay in Keyano College student housing, which is convenient, accessible, clean, and comfortable. Provides a variety of housing options to meet the needs of the students. Types of accommodations are :  Single housingFamily housingCommunity Rentals  For more information, visit: https://www.keyano.ca/en/student-services/housing.aspx

Name: Wilfrid Laurier University
Overview: Wilfrid Laurier University, named after the seventh prime minister of Canada, Sir Wilfrid Laurier, is a public university established in 1960 in Waterloo, Ontario, Canada. The university offers bachelor's, master's, doctoral, online, minor, and other courses in nine fields, including arts, science, business and economics, education, human and social science, liberal arts, music, social work, international policy, and governance. Career centers established by Wilfrid Laurier University help its students network with the search for employers. It also helps them get internships and job offers. Also, the centers help you prepare for interviews and write cover letters and portfolios. Laurier's International Student Work Experience Program (ISWEP) helps students develop skills and work experience required in the field during their studies. It is for students who have maintained a 5.0 GPA and completed one semester. The pay scale is 12 CAD, and the work limit is 70 hours per semester.Around 94.9% of Laurier's international students get employment or pursue further education within 12 months of graduation. The college has partnered with institutes in over 25 countries for the global student exchange program.

Name: Concordia University of Edmonton
Overview: Concordia University Edmonton is a privately owned university located in Edmonton, Canada. Founded in 1921, the Alberta Post-Secondary Learning Act recognizes this university. It offers various student programs, including undergraduate degrees in Arts, Management, and Science and graduates degrees in Information Security, Education, Information Technology, and Psychology. Besides, this institution offers several post-graduate degrees, diplomas, and certificates. Both faculty and students have dedicatedly performed research activities at this university. Not only do they research in their disciplines, but they also collaborate with other research communities.Moreover, the library has a comprehensive range of online tutorials exclusively designed to help students with their research and citations. Concordia University is universally recognized and holds 77th place in the country, as per UniRank. The admission rate of Concordia University of Edmonton ranges from 50% to 60%, which makes this institution slightly selective. It also ranks number 24 as the best affordable school in the US. It is globally acknowledged for its consistent commitment to outstanding academics in research and teaching, which accepts nearly 2000 students across Canada and more than 40 countries worldwide.Furthermore, this university also provides academic and non-academic services to the students, including libraries, financial aid or scholarships, housing, sports facilities, etc. This institution records a nearly 92% employment rate after graduation.

Name: Vancouver Community College
Overview: Established in 1965, the Vancouver Community College is one of the oldest colleges in the state of British Columbia, Canada. At first, the college had set up a campus in Langara and later became an independent college after 1994. The college has three campuses across the state. Its main campus located in Hamilton is called the Downtown Campus. The second campus is on East Broadway, while the third is on Annacis Island. The Vancouver Community College has around 36 community and learning centers. Some of its renowned programs are Design, University Transfer, Academic Upgrading, Health Sciences, Business, Dance, and Music. Around 1600 students are enrolled in several programs at this college. Several International students also arrive here from 150 countries across the world. The university provides a homestay where students get a private room with basic amenities. There are several options that the students can choose for living, such as apartments, basement suites, condos, etc. Vancouver Community College is also famous for providing excellent opportunities for students to grow in their careers. Renowned companies such as Vancouver Lookout, Bansito Foods, and Hospitality Pvt. Ltd, UNESCO-DBT Regional Centre, and Mecury Capital Group of Companies partner with the university for placements.The average tuition fee for international students starts from $10,326.

Name: Musitechnic
Overview: A recognised singer, composer and songwriter, Gilles Valiquette, established Musitechnic in 1987 in Montreal. This WWISE certified institute has four campuses - Canada, Montreal, France, United Kingdom. The Ministry of Education and Ministry of Culture recognises this institution. The Musitechnic campus is equipped with 3 labs with 45 workstations which are well-equipped with industry-standard audio tools. Besides, students can access 24 recording tracks which they can use during classes or personal projects. 5 digital studios are ideal for mixing music, audio post-production for video games, music production etc. ‘Online Campus’ allows students to schedule courses or book a studio to avail discounts related to education etc. Consistent support to produce and develop music, build resumes and job portfolios etc., are available. It offers courses in A.C.S. Recording and Sound Design. Upcoming courses such as A.C.S. Sound Techniques For Video Game And Film will also become available for students soon. Musitechnic tuition fees for 16 months of training for permanent or Quebec and Canadian residents is approximately $17,000. International students may need to pay $21,050 for pursuing a 16 months training course. Students can access online courses according to their convenience. Name: Thompson Rivers University
Overview: Thompson Rivers University is a public institution in British Columbia, Canada, offering vocational, research, and training degrees. The university provides over 200 programs, with around 140 full-time, 60 online/open learning, and some offline programs.In addition to offline classes, students also access learning material online. The university offers its students various opportunities to make a living alongside their degrees, both on-campus and off-campus. The university has made numerous international partnerships through its TRU world division and is accredited by the Northwest Commission on Colleges and Universities (NWCCU) at various degree levels. The university has 12 athletics teams for various sports, including basketball, volleyball, badminton, rugby, swimming, baseball, and soccer.

University Ranking: Thompson Rivers University (TRU) is a public university located in Kamloops, British Columbia, Canada. It is one of the largest universities in British Columbia and offers a wide range of undergraduate, graduate, and professional programs. TRU is ranked among the top universities in Canada and is known for its innovative approach to teaching and learning. TRU is ranked among the leading universities in Canada for its academic excellence and research. According to Maclean’s University Rankings 2021, TRU is ranked #7 in the Comprehensive category, which includes universities that offer a wide range of undergraduate and graduate programs. TRU is also ranked #2 in the Primarily Undergraduate category, which provides for universities that focus primarily on undergraduate education. TRU is also rated highly for its student experience. TRU is also rated highly for its research. According to the Research Infosource Inc. rankings, TRU is ranked #7 in Canada for research intensity. This ranking is based on factors such as research funding, research publications, and research partnerships.  According to the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2021, TRU is ranked #2 in Canada for its global perspective. This ranking is based on factors such as international student enrollment, international faculty, and international collaborations. Overall, TRU is a highly-ranked university in Canada and is known for its innovative approach to teaching and learning. It is ranked highly for its academic excellence, student experience, research, and international outlook.

Name: University of New England
Overview: A public university headquartered in Armidale, Australia, the University of New England was founded in 1938 and provides more than 200 undergraduate, postgraduate and research courses. More than 22,389 students are enrolled in courses focusing on 12 study areas taught by three faculties, such as Community Services, GeoScience, Educational Studies and Professional Psychology.Several pathways programs like the Pathways Enabling Course and TRACKS Tertiary Preparation Program enable students to prepare for undergraduate study at UNE. Through the cross-institutional program, students from other institutes can pursue UNE courses as part of their degree. Bespoke courses are available to students wherein they can combine different units to create their courses.The study online option allows students to pursue degree programs and standalone courses in 12 subject areas from home while still having access to campus facilities. Several study abroad and student exchange programs are open to the students, including study tours and language courses at universities in China, Austria, the USA, France etc. Loans, scholarships, grants, bursaries and awards are some financial aid options that students can apply for, like SA-HELP loans, S Barrett Memorial Award in Psychology, BCG Scholarships, Society One and Real Futures Grant. UNE undergraduates have been known to earn a median salary of AUD 64,700.
Eligibility Overview: Students under the age of 18 are not permitted to enrol in any programme. They can, however, attend classes at the English Language Centre. Additionally, before being given a Student Visa, students can appoint a guardian for the duration of their stay in Australia and present corresponding papers. The following are the general requirements for admission to UNE's undergraduate and graduate programmes:Admissions to the undergraduate programmeCandidates applying to UNE for undergraduate studies must have completed the equivalent of Year 12 in Australia. It's a good idea to double-check the qualifying requirements for PG programmes because they may have additional requirements that applicants must complete.English Proficiency Requirements for Undergraduate and Graduate ProgramsThe needed English proficiency scores to apply to UNE's undergraduate and graduate programmes are listed below. It provides education in multiple fields of study. The cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Melbourne (Heidelberg)
Overview: Established in 2007, the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) is a career-focused training and education providing institution offering courses in Health Management, Nursing, Community Services, including Aged and Disability Care, and Early Childhood Education. IHNA is one of three firms besides Edu Systems and the Institute of Health and Management (IHM) that belongs to HCI (Health Careers International). There are several benefits of Health Careers International. For instance, the certification is in line with Post Graduate certification through TEQSA (Tertiary Education Quality Standards Authority), Australian national regulation of Vocational Education and Training (VET), and Higher Education accredited by the Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA). This institute delivers quality education to more than 14,000 students who hail from over 50 nations. It is present at several locations, including the cultural and sporting capital of Australia – Melbourne. IHNA undertakes a teaching strategy that is based on self-directed learning. The educators are actively involved and prepare the courses using adult learning principles that include self-directing, learning by doing; practice; personal development, etc. The education and training programs extended by the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia Melbourne is based on AQF (Australian Qualifications Framework). Some of the university partners of the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia include Charles Darwin University (CDU) Australia, Western Sydney University, Murdoch University, Flinders University, University of Southern Queensland. The various courses offered at this institute include Diploma of Practice Management, Certificate III in Early Childhood Education and Care, Diploma of Community Services (Case Management), Diploma of Mental Health, Infection Control Skill Set (Retail) and many more. This institute provides mock interviews, career counselling sessions, CV writing workshops to the students. IHNA boasts of more than 200 placement partners, and Uniting is one of its partners.
Eligibility Overview: Each course has its own set of criteria to be met by the applicant. The university has set some specific set for each degree and course offered.

Name: Mercury Colleges - Sydney
Overview: Mercury College was established in 1960, offers courses on 6 programs. The Sydney campus of this college is located in the heart of Sydney City. The Mercury College Sydney provides courses on various programs such as Project Management, Marketing, Leadership and Management, Business, English, and Aged Care. Mercury College Sydney draws students from around the world. Students from the Middle East, East and South Asia, Europe, North America, and South America study at Mercury College. Within its Business programs, the courses offered are Certificate III and Certificate IV in Business. Secondly, within Ageing Support and Community Services programs, the courses offered are Certificate III in Individual Support, Certificate IV in Ageing Support, and Diploma of Community Services. Additionally, there are also courses in Project Management programs: Certificate IV courses in Project Management Practice and a Diploma of Project Management. The English courses offered in Mercury College are English for Academic Purposes, General English Course, and IELTS preparation course. Additionally, its leadership and Management program provides courses on Diploma of Leadership and Management and Advanced Diploma of Leadership and Management. Besides these courses, there are also courses like Advanced Diploma of Marketing and Communication, Certificate IV in Marketing and Communication, and Diploma of Marketing and Communication. The fee structure of Mercury College varies as per courses. The total course fee of the English language program ranges from $3,480 to $13,920. Whereas, for the Leadership and Management program and marketing courses, the total fee is $10,000, regardless of the course. Similarly, for business programs, the course fee is $8,000, irrespective of the course. But, for courses for project management courses ranges from $6,000 to $10,000, while courses on Aged Care, the total fee varies from $8,000 to $20,000, whereas the fee structure. Mercury College Sydney has facilities for students like Wi-Fi, Kitchens on each floor, and Computers in the classroom. But, it should be noted that Mercury College doesn't have an accommodation of its own; thus students have to arrange their accommodation.

Name: Charles Darwin University
Overview: Charles Darwin University (CDU) came into existence in 2003 with the collaboration of Northern Territory University, the Menzies School of Health Research, and Centralian College. The public university has five campuses - Casuarina, Palmerstone, Katherine, Alice Springs and Sydney. Being one of the highly ranked universities nationally, CDU is a member of the Innovative Research Universities. Undergraduate and postgraduate programs are provided in Arts, Business, Education, Management, Engineering, Psychology, Nursing, Midwifery, Tourism, Humanities and Information Technology. Vocational courses like Accounting and Bookkeeping, Rural Operations, Construction, Creative Arts and Design, Sport, Tourism and Hospitality, Transport and Logistics are offered for skill-building. Sixteen weeks-long Pathway programs are also there for assisting students in specific areas.International House Darwin offers on-campus accommodation for international students in 16 buildings with around 334 rooms with computers, a study lounge, recreational areas and a swimming pool. Single furnished rooms in Katherine campus and Alice Springs are available at 385 AUD and 448 AUD per week. With a high graduation rate of 83.39%, Charles Darwin ranked 28th as a millennial university by Times Higher Education. CDU's average undergraduate tuition fee ranges from 25,328 to 33,480 AUD. It is 28,104 - 34,680 AUD for postgraduate programs with scholarships like CDU Global Excellence Award, CDU Global Leader Award, CDU Global Achiever Award, and Destination Australia Scholarship provides financial aid.

Name: Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) - Federation University - Melbourne Campus
Overview: First founded in the Indian subcontinent, Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a nationally recognised educational institute. The college is registered in Victoria, Australia and has two campuses. One of them is in Melbourne. ATMC is associated with two leading Australian universities specialising in business and information technology - The University of the Sunshine Coast (USC) and Federation University Australia (Fed). In association with USC and Fed, this institute provides associate degrees, bachelor's degrees, graduate diplomas, bachelor's and master's degrees in Accounting and Business, and master's degrees in Information Systems and Information Technology. The college’s classrooms feature technologically updated teaching, learning resources and equipment. It aims to provide all students with the best, latest software and hardware solutions. The college offers training in several areas. This includes high-end applications software like Java Enterprise, .NET, Case Tools, etc. and diverse operating systems like UNIX, Linux, and XP. The laboratories at ATMC contain Database management solutions, high-end HP servers, the latest wireless devices and multimedia workstations. Australian Technical and Management College also offers students WIL or Work Integrated Learning opportunities through Capstone Industry Projects featured in their curriculum. This venture is involved in engineering genuine IS and IT projects for its final-year students. These are mapped to the SFIA or Skills Framework for the Information Age. Students work on digital projects in one or multiple business areas. These include project management, software testing, development, and systems administration. Through this, ATMC provides different opportunities to students that help them gain industry experience. It also helps them build real-life skills and experiences that employers value. ATMC offers job placement assistance as well. Through this, students receive complete guidance related to mock interviews, resume preparation, etc.
