Name: Stanley College - West Perth
Overview: Stanley College - West Perth is a private institution situated at 69 Outram Street, Perth, WA 6005. It is a multi-award-winning accredited higher Education Institution and a registered training provider. The college specialises in arts, science, engineering, law, etc. and aims to provide quality learning and training experience, thereby elevating the academic standards of the students. The institution offers multiple English languages, undergraduate, postgraduate, vocational and other professional programs along with Industry related courses in ELICOS, VET, HE and PYP. Students across faculties like Hospitality, early childhood education and business receive Articulation pathway programs. The college comprises 200 experienced and qualified members speaking over 18 languages and assisting students from different corners of the world. The college has four campuses across Perth and has certificate programs in Accounting Professional and Early childhood education. Stanley College - West Perth tuition fee ranges from (421,483- 534,351) INR according to the program opted by the students. The college encompasses more than 1300 students and stretches over six faculties, making Stanley college rank among Australia’s largest and most awarded independent education providers. The college houses several departments like the faculty of health, culinary arts and Hospitality, faculty of business and many more. Their Employment liaison team has ties with several reputed industries, giving the students chances to uplift their career choice. Students will benefit from the integrated approach that the college has and will have cutting-edge skills to prosper in the competitive era. Apart from receiving a slew of programs, students can access copious resources from the library and get student services in the form of scholarships and other financial aid. Students will also have numerous internship and placement opportunities. Stanley College - West Perth solely focuses on the personal development and academic achievement of the aspirants.

Placement: Internships and cooperative education (or co-operative education) are means of integrating classroom learning with real work experience. A cooperative education experience (or "co-op") is an organised work experience that earns academic credit. Full-time, paid or unpaid co-ops are available. Internships can be full-time or part-time, and they can be paid or unpaid.

Name: Lead College - Parramatta
Overview: Lead College is a registered training institution housing three campuses in Sydney, Perth and Parramatta. The college offers degrees that are recognised with CRICOS registration. Moreover, its courses meet the quality standard ESOS National Code and Standards for Registered Training Organisations. It specialises in Automotive, Business, Building and Construction, Children's Services, Community Services, Hospitality and Information Technology courses. The college offers these courses with a primary focus on providing employment opportunities in respective fields. For example, students qualified with Certificate III in Light Vehicle Mechanical Technology can find employment opportunities for the job role as a Motor Mechanic and Automotive Light Vehicle Mechanical Repair Technician.  Students must meet the respective minimum eligibility parameters to apply for the courses offered by this college. For example, students must score a 6.0 IELTS score and 60 TOEFL score, among other eligibility criteria. The Lead College’s OBA Preparatory Program prepares international nurses for the OSCE examination and NCLEX RN. Students enrolled in NCLEX-RN Preparatory Program, and OSCE (OBA) may need to pay approximately AUD 2500. The college offers NCLEX-RN preparation courses online and is ideal for working professionals. Students enrolled in both these courses can approach staff for help 24x7. In addition, students can browse for employment opportunities through Lead College's online job portal.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Gladstone
Overview: Situated opposite the Gladstone Marina parklands, Central Queensland University Gladstone specializes in research with the campus hosting several industry partnership projects, industry conferences, training and professional development activities. This institute sits beside the Gladstone Harbour and houses the University's Engineering and Environmental Management Complex. This is dedicated to research and training and serves as a venue for residential schools and conferences. This campus features bookshops, The Cyril Golding Library, a computer lab, lecture theatre and training facilities, and an array of career counselling and support services. The Gladstone area boasts of an active sporting community, and University students can start their own teams or join the local team. Adequate options for outdoor and indoor activities are available for university students. This includes yachting, fishing, rowing, bowling, boxing, BMX, dancing, etc. Besides these, the Campus Life Committee (CLC) at Central Queensland University Gladstone conducts social activities for students on a regular basis. Central Queensland University merged with CQ TAFE on 1st July 2014. Following this, it has become a more comprehensive university. It now extends more than 300 education and training options. These include several certificate courses and diplomas, short courses, postgraduate, undergraduate, and research higher degrees. CQ University graduates also experience one of the best employment outcomes in Australia. This is evident from the recently released data from the Graduate Outcomes Survey.
Eligibility Overview: Admissions to the undergraduate programmeDiplomaA minimum of 55% in four academic courses is required by CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards.All other bulletin boards: A minimum of 60% in four academic disciplines is required.BachelorsA minimum of 60% in four academic courses is required by CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards.All other bulletin boards: A minimum of 65 percent in four academic subjects is required.Admissions to Postgraduate ProgramsInternational applicants must have a bachelor's degree comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree from a recognised institution. In the final two terms, a minimum score corresponding to an Australian pass grade average is required.International applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency, and they can do so by submitting either of the following exam scores:

Skills training seminars and sessions are provided to students in order to prepare them for the workforce. Furthermore, they are taught how to write a professional cv and cover letters, management techniques, work ethics, and a variety of other topics. Regular career fairs, seminars, and workshops are offered to assist students in making connections with industry professionals and obtaining jobs in Australia and throughout the world.Employers and graduates are brought together via the Career Cell. It hosts yearly career fairs.Career Hub is a website that lists job openings in a variety of organisations.With a full-time domestic graduate employment rate of 79.5 percent, the University outperforms the sector average of 72.3 percent.It is also routinely regarded as one of the best universities in the country for graduate beginning salary.Graduates of Central Queensland University receive the following salaries based on their chosen courses:

Name: University of Notre Dame Australia
Overview: The University of Notre Dame Australia, established in 1989, is a national Roman Catholic private institute with campuses in Western Australia and New South Wales. It has a student enrollment of 12,000 across undergraduate and postgraduate programs in nine study areas, including education, health sciences, medicine and physiotherapy. Some courses are Human Resource Management, Business Administration, Philosophy, Bioethics and Journalism etc. The university has three campuses: Fremantle, Sydney and Broome.Students who do not meet the university's undergraduate program requirements can avail of the Tertiary Pathway Program, which comprises VET study, Higher Education study, recent secondary education etc. Through the Early Offer Program, class 12 students can secure a seat at the university before graduating high school.  There are numerous academic, sports and special interest clubs and societies like Newspeak, NDA Labor, Basketball Association etc. Students can avail internal and external volunteer opportunities at Orientation Day, RUOK? Day, Caritas Australia etc., or participate in sports like badminton, netball and volleyball. Student accommodation is available on the Fremantle and Broome campuses, at residential halls (Port Lodge, P&O Hotel and Cleopatra Hotel) and in the Village, which has a hostel and nine self-contained houses. Notre Dame undergraduates earn an average salary of AUD 83,311, while postgraduates earn a median salary of AUD 10,000. Some financial aids available include the Bushfire Relief Scholarship, Student Hardship Assistance Fund, The Trophy Land Scholarship and HECS-HELP loans.
Eligibility Overview: Students must meet the following eligibility criteria to be considered for admission to the university: Higher education applicants can apply if they have completed at least two subjects; however, several programs, such as theology, philosophy, nursing, and education, demand a minimum of four subjectsApplicants with work experience must submit supporting documentation as well as a completed enabling course to demonstrate their capacity to pursue higher education in Australia. Placement: The Majarlin Kimberley Centre for Remote Health is based on the Broome Campus of the University of Notre Dame Australia. In Broome and around the Kimberley, they arrange placements for allied health and nursing students.Placement in the Kimberley offers a unique combination of academic, professional, social, and cultural experiences, all of which are centred on inter-professional education.  Majarlin offers a wide range of placement opportunities, including the following: HospitalPrivate practiceNDIS providersCommunity healthCommunity organisations e.g. Anglicare, Life Without BarriersHealth organisations e.g. Milliya Rumurra Aboriginal Corporation, Boab HealthAged careVisits to remote communitiesCommunity events e.g. Garnduwa football carnival, NAIDOC weekCommunity work readiness placements in schools and aged care  The following are some of Majarlin's student services: Clinical placements are organised and facilitated.Orientation and cultural instruction for one dayClinical educator, placement oversight, and evaluationSupport for social and emotional well-beingStudent social activities and networking Reflection and debriefing exercises, as well as interdisciplinary educationPastoral assistanceSupport for the InternetCycling is a fantastic way to move around during the week and explore the sites on weekendsSubsidies for travel and lodging (only for domestic students)
Accommodation: The college provides a variety of on-campus housing options to students above 18 years. On-campus housing is available at the Fremantle and Broome campuses, while nearby student housing is accessible at the Sydney campus.  Broome Campus accommodation On-Campus Accommodation The Village consists of a dormitory with a capacity of 28 people and nine self-contained houses with five single bedrooms, ensuite bathrooms, and study areas in each. Students have access to communal kitchens, lounges, and eating facilities, free Wi-Fi, a common kitchen, BBQ facilities, pool tables, a basketball court, a television room, laundry, campus library and computer facilities and off-street parking. Other tertiary students and individuals attending training, workshops, meetings, or retreats, can apply for campus housing. Students can get help from the Coordinator and Campus Services personnel to make the most of their time at the Broome Campus. For more information, visit: https://www.notredame.edu.au/current-students/campus-life/accommodation/broome-accommodation   Fremantle accommodation The University of Notre Dame provides both on and off-campus accommodations. On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available at Notre Dame Fremantle Campus Student Residences for people who desire to be a part of a community, meet other students from across the world, and live in the heart of Fremantle's West End, Western Australia's primary port city. Shops, cafes, restaurants, beaches, and sports facilities are all close by or easily accessible by public transportation. The benefits of living on-campus are: AFL matches, Caversham, Fremantle Prison tour, Scarborough surf and beach day are just a few examples of semester-long excursionsDinners with a theme - Taco Tuesday, Grease Movie Night, and Murder Mystery Dinner Fiesta Meals for the community thrice a week to meet and discuss issues concerning the residencesAcademic support and study space Friendly Residential Hall Supervisors and Advisors24*7 campus securityThe train station and bus terminal in Fremantle are both close byBathers Beach is within a walking distance Facilities provided are: Rooms BathroomsKitchen LaundryRecreation spacesParkingStudy facilities internet  Off-Campus Accommodation The Student Support Officer can help you discover short-term or long-term housing that meets your needs. The focus is on assisting you in finding suitable housing while taking advantage of public transportation.  Types of accommodation the university provides are: Student accommodationShort-term accommodationCrisis accommodation For more information, visit: https://www.notredame.edu.au/current-students/campus-life/accommodation/fremantle-accommodation  Sydney Accommodation The Sydney Campus has two locations: Broadway, which houses the Schools of Arts & Sciences, Business, Education, Law, and Philosophy & Theology, and Darlinghurst, which houses the Schools of Medicine and Nursing. Students looking for off-campus housing can use the university's accommodation information service. The Prospective Students Office can provide assistance and advice, but students must make their own housing decisions.  Types of accommodations Renting a house or an apartment Notre Dame is informed of available houses for rent in the City of Sydney district by local real estate agents or individual owners. Furnished, partially furnished, or unfurnished rental units are available. Rent must be paid in advance, as well as a security deposit equal to one month's rent. Renting a room There are a limited number of options for this type of lodging. A shared bathroom and social spaces of the house are normally included with a room rental, along with a private bedroom and study area. Typically, utilities, gas, phone, and extra water bills are paid in addition to rent. Sharing with other students Many students opt to live in a shared house or apartment with their peers. They post notices on student bulletin boards or through the Student Services Office. This arrangement entails having your own bedroom, as well as sharing public areas (kitchen, laundry, living room, and bathroom), as well as housekeeping chores. Share housing can provide low-cost housing, the ability to split expenditures, and the potential to form connections and a social network. Guest houses, hotels and residences Near the university, there are a variety of high-quality guest hotels and student hostels like 94 Glebe Guest Houses, Big Hostel, Iglu Student Accommodation (three locations), Link2 Student Living, UniLodge, and Urbanest that provide student housing. Students at the University of Notre Dame Australia can apply to a number of residential halls, including St. John's College, St. Andrew's College, Sancta Sophia College, and Warrane College. For more information, visit: https://www.notredame.edu.au/current-students/campus-life/accommodation/sydney-accommodation  For general enquiries, visit:  https://www.notredame.edu.au/current-students/campus-life/accommodation

Name: Coder Academy - Melbourne
Overview: Coder Academy has extended an array of online tutorials, part-time courses, short workshops, school programs, and coding boot camps in three locations in Australia, including Melbourne. Through this institute, students acquire the required technology and coding skills for tackling their future work. Coder Academy is the only accredited coding boot camp in Australia. Coder Academy courses are curated to be intense in nature. They compress qualifications having a duration of 2 years or more into shorter periods of 6 or 10 months. And for this, they do not compromise with the learning outcomes. The various courses offered at Coder Academy include Undergrad Certificate in Data Analysis, Web Development Bootcamp (Standard), Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp, Web Development Bootcamp (Accelerated), Undergrad Certificate in Programming. The two delivery options for the Web Dev Bootcamp are of varying durations. The Standard Web Development Bootcamp is for 10 months, while the Accelerated one is for 6 months. This academy’s Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp is the first of its kind in Australia. It enables students to gain a higher  Diploma of Information Technology. Besides this, there is also an option for undertaking the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner Exam. The boot camp courses at Coder Academy Melbourne have CRICOS approval. The Undergraduate Certificate courses in Programming and Data Analysis are accredited by the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA). The course content for these is drawn from an existing higher education qualification. This ensures that students can transition to the AQF level 5, 6 or 7 qualification after completing the Undergraduate Certificate course. The placement opportunities at Coder Academy are lucrative. More than 50% of Coder Academy graduates get hired from industry placements. And 80% of graduates receive employment within three months. It also extends a 1-month optional industry placement opportunity.

Name: Australian National University
Overview: Located in Canberra, Australia, the Australian National University is a national research institute founded in 1946. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate and professional development programs across seven colleges (divided into schools and research centres) in subject areas like Business & Commerce, Law & Legal Studies and Arts, Society & Culture. Some of the courses provided are Energy Change, Robotics, Human Rights, Linguistics and Legal Practice. Research study programs focus on areas like Biodiversity, Food Security, International Studies and Space Sciences. Australian National University has three campuses, namely the Acton campus, Kioloa Coastal campus and North Australia Research Unit campus. It also has the Siding Spring Observatory and Mount Stromlo Observatory and six library branches (Art & Music Library, Hancock Library, Menzies Library etc.) Students can opt for flexible degree programs like Flexible Double Degrees (750 combinations), Vertical Double Degree and Flexible Double Master Degree and create their own study program. Students from partner and non-partner universities can study at the Australian National University through the Exchange and Study Abroad program. Furthermore, several online degree programs and certificate/diploma courses are offered by the university. Financial aid options available to students include scholarships, loans, bursaries and awards like FEE-HELP, DFAT Australia Awards, ACTION Trust Honours Scholarship and CanHELP. Numerous catered and self-catered residential facilities are provided on-campus at Burgmann College, Fenner Hall, University House, Warrumbul Lodge etc. Students can stay in single/double rooms, studios and apartments, all equipped with dining services. Over 130 student clubs and societies engage in academic, cultural, social, and political activities. Moreover, ANU Sport includes 35 clubs (basketball, cycling, quidditch, etc.) and fitness services like gyms, fitness studios, the Functioning Training Studio, sports courts/fields, and more. Placement records show that Australian National University undergraduates have earned an average gross annual salary of AUD 59,000 while postgraduate students have earned AUD 82,330.
Eligibility Overview: To get admitted to ANU, international applicants must have a minimum GPA of 5.0, an IELTS score of 6.5 or higher, and 3 to 5 years of work experience. To improve their chances of acceptance, students are encouraged to write a statement of purpose.To attend any of ANU's exchange partners in the United States, students must have a minimum GPA of 6.0. A 6.0 means that a student receives virtually exclusively Distinctions and High Distinctions.
Accommodation: Living in a catered or self-catered student home gives you the opportunity to be at the centre of our campus, thriving among your peers and in your academics. Our residential community is diverse, with students from many walks of life, personalities, sexual orientations, and hobbies - and they'll all be looking for friends like you.for more information click on this link-https://www.anu.edu.au/study/accommodation
Course Ranking: Even while QS and THE have consistently placed ANU outside of the top 100 programmes, both publishers have gradually stopped including it. ANU's QS (Global MBA) ranking has increased from 151-200 in 2020 to 121-130 in 2021, nevertheless. This represents a remarkable advancement in just one year. THE (Times Higher Education) has lowered ANU's position in its PG Business and Economics ranking from 36 in 2018 to 69 in 2021.The engineering and technology rankings from QS and THE clearly demonstrate how well-known ANU's engineering programme is. It was ranked 46th by QS in 2017, but that rating dropped to 71st in 2020. The same way, THE ranked it from 66th in 2018 to 101-125th in 2021. In addition to this, it was consistently ranked among the top 100 programmes in THE's PG Computers list from 2017 to 2021.
University Ranking: Popular open research university Australian National University (ANU) was founded more than 50 years ago. Among the top 100 universities in the world, ANU was included by major rating publishers. Amongst some of the top 50 universities in the world, it has been listed by QS (Top Universities) since 2017. Academic reputation, faculty-student ratio, and citations per professor all received high marks for ANU. Additionally, from 2016 to 2020, the Academic Ranking of World Universities (Shanghai Ranking) ranked it in the top 100 universities worldwide.It is among top 100 academic institutions worldwide according to two more reputable rating services, THE (Times Higher Education) and US News & World Report. ANU was ranked 47th by THE in 2017 but is now ranked 59th by THE in 2021. ANU has consistently ranked among the top universities according to US News & World Report. From 2018 to 2021, it fluctuated in the 60th to 70th spot on the rankings.

Name: Kaplan Business School - Melbourne
Overview: Kaplan Business School has been operating since 2008 under the leadership of Stanley Kaplan. The school has been providing tuition to students through its education centre since 1938, the first tutoring centre in London. After its accreditation in 2008, it gradually became a business school with three campuses. Kaplan Business School Melbourne is a student-friendly campus with highly advanced infrastructure and facilities. Two main courses by Kaplan Business School Melbourne are undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Undergraduate programs comprise diplomas and bachelor's degrees in business administration, business analytics, accounting, data-driven leadership, tourism, hospitality, etc. IELTS 5.5 is the minimum requirement for most courses.The Kaplan Business School Melbourne tuition fee is AUD 18,992, the cost of living is AUD 20,290, and the application fee is between AUD 260 - AUD 285. They offer scholarships and internships to students to support their financial needs. There are 300,000+ alumni of this business school working with industry-leading companies. They are considered one of Australia's best institutions for student success. They maintain a strong network with community and industry-leading companies for internships, training, and placement. Some of their corporate partners are Swans, Davidsons, etc.

Name: Browns English Language School - Brisbane
Overview: Browns English Language School is located in Brisbane, the capital of Queensland, and provides top-class education with a commendable and affordable lifestyle compared to costs in other developed countries. The Browns English Language School comprises four campuses, two in Brisbane City and two on the Gold Coast. It is now one of the largest private English language schools. It was founded in 2003, and more than 5000 international students are registered on four campuses. There are three types of Browns English Language courses: Standard, Intensive, and Barista. Each course has a different fee structure, and students can explore multiple courses that suit their academic requirements. Moreover, the virtual classes conducted by this school for International students are interactive and full of knowledge. The curriculum of Browns English Language School is based on the well-known and reputed Common European Framework of Reference for Languages. This institution dedicatedly provides students with the necessary resources and information they require while staying in this school. This reputed English Language School includes services like School orientation, Academic Counselling and Further Study Advice, Travel Advice, Student Activities, Adjusting to life in Australia etc. This Brisbane campus is situated in the city's centre, and the school comprises the entire first and fourth floors of a modern building. The classrooms of this school are comfortable and equipped with big TV screens. In between the classes, students can connect with other students in the spacious lounge, where they can conveniently access computers and learning software, review necessary lessons in the library etc. The school notice boards display the current job offers available in Brisbane, while the activity office provides regular information about Brisbane.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Adelaide
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) Adelaide is located southwest of the city in the vicinity of the Adelaide Showgrounds. Students can easily access numerous forms of public transportation from this location. Besides a campus based in Adelaide, students receive online study support from partner Regional University Centres in Murray River, Port Augusta, Port Pirie, and Berri. The Central Queensland University Adelaide courses in paramedical science, occupational health and safety, and psychology are now delivered on campus. This offers students access to small class sizes, thereby encouraging an interactive and personalised learning experience. It also provides them with an opportunity to develop strong relationships with their fellow peers and teaching staff. The various study areas at Central Queensland University in which students can study are Allied Health, Law, Criminology and Justice, Digital Media, Communication and Arts, Business and Accounting, Safety Services, Service Industries, etc. Many study levels are available for students to choose from for pursuing their courses. This includes undergraduate, postgraduate, research, certificates and diplomas. This campus also houses The Appleton Institute, a multidisciplinary research hub. The various areas in which this institute specialises include teaching, research, and community engagement in many areas, including human factors and safety management, human-animal interaction, sleep and fatigue, safety science, applied psychology, and cultural anthropology. Some of the most popular scholarships available for deserving students include Destination Australia Scholarship (Bachelor), CQUniCares Adam Scott Foundation Western Australia Scholarship, Indigenous Laptop Bundle Bursary, Research Training Program (RTP) Stipend Scholarship, CQUniCares Adam Scott Foundation Scholarship, and CQUniCares Industry Placement Scholarship.

Placement: University Placements in Central QueenslandThe institution provides students with career and leadership opportunities to help them improve personally and professionally. Skills training seminars and sessions are provided to students in order to prepare them for the workforce. Furthermore, they are taught how to write a professional cv and cover letters, management techniques, work ethics, and a variety of other topics. Regular career fairs, seminars, and workshops are offered to assist students in making connections with industry professionals and obtaining jobs in Australia and throughout the world.Employers and graduates are brought together via the Career Cell. It hosts yearly career fairs.Career Hub is a website that lists job openings in a variety of organisations.With a full-time domestic graduate employment rate of 79.5 percent, the University outperforms the sector average of 72.3 percent.

Name: University of Wollongong - Australia
Overview: Situated in New South Wales, Australia, the University of Wollongong is a public research university established in 1975. With four faculties divided into several schools offering undergraduate, postgraduate and research programs, the university has a student enrollment of 35,969 and an academic staff of 1,094 members. Students can opt for courses from 18 subject areas such as Information Technology, Health Analytics, Exercise Science, French and International Studies. The University of Wollongong has campuses in Wollongong (main campus) and Sydney and several regional campuses across the state. There are eight libraries on the metropolitan and regional campuses where students find books, journals, articles, collections and online publications. The university offers pathways programs like UOW College and the Indigenous Admissions Program to help students prepare for university life. UOW provides several short courses in economics, data analytics, engineering etc., through SMART, students interact with professors and earn credit points. Students from other universities can spend a semester or two at the University of Wollongong. In contrast, UOW students can study overseas as part of their degree program through study abroad and exchange opportunities. Scholarships, awards, grants, loans and bursaries are some of the financial aid options available to students, such as UOW Equity Scholarships, Tertiary Access Payment, HELP loans, Austudy and Youth Allowance. Accommodation with dining services is available on and off-campus; Kooloobong Village, Bangalay, Marketview, and Graduate House are some of the residential facilities where students can stay in studio rooms/apartments, 2-5 bedroom units, flats and more. Off-campus residential options include private rentals, shared accommodation and short-stay facilities. There are numerous cultural, artistic, political, volunteer and academic clubs to join and different sports to play like badminton, volleyball and netball. Reports show that UOW postgraduates have been known to earn a median starting salary of AUD 90,000.
Eligibility Overview: More than 12 years of full-time education from any accredited board or institution. At least 80% of the grade in higher secondary school. A sufficient command of the English language. JEE scores aren't required.English Language Requirements

Name: Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus
Overview: Charles Sturt University, or CSU, is a multi-campus public university in New South Wales, Australia. It was founded in 1989. The Charles Sturt University Study Centers in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, and Wangaratta are managed in collaboration with CSU Study Centers in those cities. Study Group is a global pioneer in education and training for international students, providing a comprehensive range of educational possibilities to students from over 120 countries. Students can choose courses at the bachelors and postgraduate levels through Charles Sturt University's Distance Education programme, as well as the Single Subject Study programme. The Distance Education programme is designed for students who are unable to visit the university campus in person and uses written or electronic media to promote contact between lecturers and students. The curriculum is designed with the idea that students are already employed in the subject of study.The Charles Sturt University Study Centres are located in Sydney's Central Business District (CBD), close to shops, restaurants, and Darlinghurst's handy public transportation. Students can pick from a variety of postgraduate and undergraduate courses, all of which offer modern classrooms with all of the facilities and study materials needed to succeed. Every year, Charles Sturt University awards over $3 million in scholarships and grants to students.

Course Description: Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus was founded in 1989. Located in Sydney- Aus,Australia the university is home to about 10033 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus is ranked 764th in Top Universities by US News. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 5 undergraduate and 3 postgraduate programs. Charles Sturt University - Sydney Campus has 6 intakes in Feb, Jul,Sep,Jul, Sep, May. Name: Acknowledge Creativity - Sydney
Overview: Acknowledge Creativity – Sydney was primarily established with a vision that creative skills and fresh thinking could bring changes in the corporate world. It has three units in Australia nurturing and shaping the entrepreneurial instinct of the students. This institute is nestled in Sydney’s recreation and fastest-growing business hub. The course module of Acknowledge Creativity – Sydney is spread across diploma, graduate, and unit programs. The staff systematically trains each student through innovative tools, training modules, and practical programs. Its focus combines arts, commerce, and business and makes entrepreneurs. The graduation course is for three years, and the diploma is divided into 8 units. Domestic students can do single units; however, international students must complete all 8 units. Marketing, PR, sales, budget, risk, cultural communications, finance, management, etc., are subjects under these courses. The Acknowledge Creativity Sydney fee for domestic students is $2,250 per unit. The average cost of living ranges between $21,000 and $22,000 per year. For international students, fees range from $2,250 to $10,000 per unit. The amount varies for a different stream; diploma, graduate, pursuing single units, etc. It provides a loan through FEE-HELP that assists eligible students in paying their tuition fees. Each subject has a higher bracket to take a loan under this scheme. The higher limit of loans is the tuition fees’ value. The program and evaluation modules endeavour to make a perfect combination of ideas and business plans to evolve the industry operations. It nurtures the vision of creative minds to get shape in reality. Also, the institute helps the students learn from a combination of traditional and contemporary teaching models. The process strengthens the problem-solving techniques collaboratively and creatively.

Name: Murdoch University - Mandurah
Overview: Murdoch University is a public university established in 1976 in Perth. It has five campuses worldwide – Perth, Rockingham, Singapore, Dubai, Myanmar and Mandurah. The Mandurah campus is 45 minutes away from Perth. This University holds affiliation with Open Universities Australia, Innovative Research Universities, and Universities Australia. The Mandurah campus specialises in subjects such as Nursing, postgraduate Counselling – Creative Arts Therapies. Besides, the University provides nearly 270+ courses in subjects like Accounting, Animal Health, Animal Science etc. The University houses 80 seats in a video communication room, one multipurpose laboratory, and three 30 seats in teaching rooms. The University is also equipped with advanced audio and video conferencing technology. It also provides counselling services keeping students' physical and mental health as one of the primary focuses. It offers a 14-week OnTrack program that helps eligible candidates qualify for direct application for any university's undergraduate degree. This university has a substantial research output. According to Excellence in Research Australia 2018, nearly 81% of research met world standards or above. This University awards Murdoch scholarships, International Accommodation Scholarship etc., to eligible students.According to the International Student Barometer, nearly 90% of students were satisfied with their educational experience. Individuals with busy professional schedules can opt for some free short courses online through FutureLearn. Students can access the 'my Murdoch Career' portal to search for jobs, browse networking events to find employment, etc.

Placement: Murdoch University provides students with a variety of Work Integrated Learning programmes and internship opportunities. Murdoch University's Career and Employability cell assists students in locating appropriate employment, as well as creating resumes and cover letters. myMurdoch Career connects students with companies by providing up-to-date information on industry trends and requirements.The Career and Employability Unit hosts a variety of programmes and activities to help students improve their skills and connect with various firms in the field.Students have a variety of possibilities to work on a real project for an industry on campus in order to gain project management experience.Murdoch University also offers work simulation experiences for students to learn in an industrial learning setting while dealing with the intricacies of real-world challenges, such as deadline demands and other practical issues.Murdoch University graduates and alumni earn on average:

Accommodation: Murdoch University offers foreign and domestic students a variety of on-campus and off-campus housing options. Murdoch University Village offers on-campus accommodations, including fully furnished rooms, a swimming pool, table tennis, and air hockey, a recreation room with barbecues, a projection screen, and communal kitchen, a movie room with satellite TV, group study rooms, a music room, and three large communal laundries. For 2022, weekly rates vary from AU 176.20 to AU 409.20.Students who desire to stay at the Village for a short period of time while exploring for long-term housing choices in Australia can do so. Students can book a single room in a shared apartment on a nightly basis for as little as AUD 45.Accommodations away from campus:Shared houses: Students can either share a house with other students in a nearby Perth neighbourhood or rent an apartment individually. Students will have their own room in a shared house, but common areas such as kitchens and baths will be shared with housemates.Homestay housing is available for those who want to live with an Australian family and learn about their culture. Students benefit from a variety of services, including a ride from the airport by their host family upon arrival, improved English language abilities through interaction, and assistance and advice from the host family.

Name: Imagine Education Australia - Southport Central Campus
Overview: Imagine Education Australia - Southport Central Campus, located at Building 3F, corner of Lawson and Scarborough Streets, Southport is a privately owned vocational training centre. The institute is offering Certificate Guarantee Program, Higher Level Skill Program, Apprenticeships and user choice programs. Imagine Education Australia has four campuses: the Main Campus is at Benowa Road, Southport Central Campus at Scarborough Street, Ashmore Campus in Ashmore, a Brisbane Campus in Brisbane City. The main campus is home to several VET faculties. They provide a plethora of courses in the Institute of Business, Faculty of Children's Services, Faculty of Community Services, Faculty of Finance etc. Lessons are taught following the National Training Packages and are compliant with the VET Quality Framework. Students can opt for Imagine Education Australia’s Foundation Pathway program for undertaking further degree programs. Students will receive first-hand training to get accustomed to the rapid growth of competition. Southport Campus emphasizes enhancing the students' English proficiency and preparing them for IELTS, helping them grasp the English language to cope with the academic pattern in the educational institute of Australia. Students can opt for flexible study options even. The institute offers nine well-equipped classrooms, a computer lab, student common area, offices, plenty of free parking and other facilities—interactive whiteboard technology and study materials and computer labs are used for the smooth conduct of the classes.

It provides education in multiple fields of study. The main campus of Sydney Business School, University of Wollongong is located in Wollongong. Name: Imagine Education Australia - Main Campus
Overview: Imagine Education Australia is a Vocational Education and Training Centre and is a private English language center with modern campuses. Imagine Education’s Main Campus is located on 13 Benowa Road, Southport, on the beautiful Gold Coast. The state-of-art campus is located only five minutes drive from Southport Central Business District and 10 minutes from the famous Surfers paradise. The main campus is situated amid native bushland and provides a serene environment. The campus is located near a major shopping center that has a post office, medical facilities, a chemist, three supermarkets and other specialty stores, among others. Besides these, Gold coast not only boasts world-class surfs and beaches but is also known as one of the best beach cities for international students to study. The main campus is home to Vocational Education and Training faculties, including Business, Finance, and Childcare. The High School Preparation and Young Learner English Program are also based on the main campus. Gold Coast campus also boasts three live training environments, where students gain valuable real-time experience in the fields of Faculty of Automotive, Faculty of Children’s Care and Faculty of Hospitality. Imagine’s Main Campus has ten classrooms equipped with comfortable furniture and the latest in teaching facilities. In March 2021, the campus opened a brand new on-site commercial kitchen for our hospitality students. The Children’s Services students have the unique benefit of having an on-site childcare center for their live practical training. Services like purpose-built classrooms, on-site commercial kitchen, computer labs and wi-fi connectivity, students kitchen and common areas, and outdoor deck. The Main Campus is conveniently located near public transport, shopping complex, supermarkets, doctors, banks and dining facilities.

Consider what education in Australia entails:5.5 on the IELTS (with no single band less than 5.0)Academic PTE - 42 (with no communication skill less than 36)TOEFL i-BT - 65-78 (as determined by Imagine Education Australia), or successful completion of General English at the Upper Intermediate level.

Name: Front Cooking School - Brisbane Campus
Overview: Front Cooking School is an Australian school that offers certificates, diplomas and advanced diplomas in the field of Cookery, Patisserie & Hospitality Management. It has 3 campuses, among which is the newest addition, the Brisbane Campus. The campus is located in Australia’s second-largest city and 39th best city in the world, Brisbane. Front Cooking School has 8 different courses specializing in various areas of cooking and hospitality. All programmes are for a period of 18-months and are only offered on-campus. It offers a diploma and advanced diploma in Hospitality Management for students who want to be involved in managing the world of hospitality. There are certificate courses III & IV in Commercial Cookery and Patisserie. The school also offers work-based training to allow the students to gain hands-on experience in a real workplace kitchen environment. The average cost of tuition per year is approximately $10,000, while the cost of living can easily climb above $20,000. Therefore, the total cost of studying here can be around $30,000 to $32,000. Front Cooking School attracts many students every year with its creative courses, location and unique facilities. The school promotes a balance between theory and practice and thus has fully equipped kitchens and ovens for individual hands-on learning. The students can access the 24x7 Wi Fi, changing rooms, lockers, break rooms and resource library. But no scholarship or financial aid is offered to international students. It is situated on the banks of the famous Brisbane River and can easily be accessed via bus, car and plane. The nearest airport, Brisbane Airport, is just 15 minutes away from the campus. The students at this campus are placed very close to Brisbane’s Central Business District.

Name: Imagine Education Australia - Brisbane
Overview: Imagine Education Australia is a vocational education and training centre, a privately owned English language centre with modern campuses on Gold Coast And Brisbane. Imagine Education’s Brisbane campus is situated at 170 Leichhardt Street, Spring Hill, in the heart of Brisbane’s Central Business District. The newly designed campus is just a 10-minute walk from the Brisbane Central Station and Queen’s Street Mall. The campus has been built keeping in mind the beauty of Australia. Imagine Education Australia’s Brisbane campus offers several English courses, which include IELTS and general English courses. Imagine Education Australia’s Faculty of Hospitality provides students with a large commercial kitchen to give the student exposure to real-life scenarios. Brisbane commercial cookery kitchen is located inside the Best Western Plus Hotel Diana, which is just a short distance from the Brisbane campus. The institute has also partnered with renowned Ridgeway Group, which means that the hospitality students have the opportunity to gain valuable work experience and placement in one of six Ridgeway Group’s highly regarded restaurants. Imagine Education’s Brisbane campus offers classrooms equipped with comfortable, modern furniture and the latest teaching facilities. Imagine Education also has a commercial kitchen for students' practical training for Brisbane commercial cookery students near The Brisbane campus. The Brisbane campus also has a newly made Automotive workshop. Imagine Education offers a wide range of student services to provide our students with the resources they need to gain from their experience at imagine. Student counselling services are provided to all the students who require it. The institute also offers airport pickup services. Assistance for job search is also provided to the students daily.

Consider what education in Australia entails:5.5 on the IELTS (with no single band less than 5.0)Academic PTE - 42 (with no communication skill less than 36)TOEFL ibt - 65-78 (as determined by Imagine Education Australia), or successful completion of General English at the Upper Intermediate level.​

Name: Curtin University - Australia
Overview: Curtin University, a public research university in Bentley, Perth, Western Australia, is in the top one per cent of universities worldwide. The university's Australian campuses are Perth, Kalgoorlie, Midland, Murray Street and St. Georges Terrace. Five main faculties and 95 specialist centres offer undergraduate, postgraduate and research opportunities. Engineering, Geosciences, Energy and Fuel, Public, Environmental and Occupational Health, Chemistry, Economics and Business, Agriculture and Environment, Mining and Minerals and Architecture are some popular courses. With an acceptance rate of 49%, admissions happen twice a year based on previous academic performance, TOEFL scores, IELTS, PTE etc., if needed, and work experience, if any. International students must submit the Genuine Student Assessment Form with their application as part of the SSVF requirement through the online portal. Academic Transcripts, Graduation Statements (AHEGS) and Award Certificates are also submitted. On-campus accommodation for students in 1000 single and shared rooms is available at 152- 336 AUD per week. Curtin has its bus stations connected to the public transport network, and TL Robertson Library has the John Curtin Prime Ministerial Library collection. The average tuition fee ranges from 27200 - 38000 AUD, depending upon the program chosen. Scholarships to international students amounting to up to 25% of the first-year tuition fee are available along with other merit-based scholarships like Australian Year 12 Scholarships and Destination Australia Scholarships. Curtin graduates are offered great job opportunities in various fields with an average salary of 201,000 AUD for an MBA and 168,000 AUD for an Executive Masters.
Eligibility Overview: The general eligibility which is required for students to achieve in order to be considered for admission are as follows :CBSE/ ISC with 60 percent in the highest four courses plus 60 percent in English OR High School with 65 percent conferred by recognised Higher Secondary Education Boards. All overseas students who come from countries where English is not spoken or who do not speak English as their first language must demonstrate their ability by English language tests or certifications. English Language Requirements :

Name: Kaplan Business School - Adelaide
Overview: Established in 2008, Kaplan Business School is an independent higher education institution in Australia. This college is an essential part of Kaplan International, headquartered in London and has significantly grown into a big campus with more than 2000 scholars. Kaplan International later opened a few more campuses in Melbourne and Sydney. The university has an IELTS minimum requirement of 5.5. Additionally, students will need to submit their GMAT scores for some courses.Eligible candidates can apply for scholarships in Australia, and high-achiever scholarships are provided to both domestic and international students. Kaplan Business School – Adelaide has achieved international education rewards by AFR Higher Education Awards, 2020. With a nearly 100% employment rate after graduation, Kaplan Business School – Adelaide students are placed in reputed organisations. Moreover, this institution is associated with multiple companies throughout Australia. These partnerships and collaborations with leading companies offer students opportunities that help them build necessary skills and improve internship opportunities.

Name: Federation University Australiaa
Overview: Federation University in Victoria, Australia, is a dual-sector public institution. The university offers courses in philosophy, Landscaping, Human Services and Entrepreneurship, Mental Health, etc. Over 20 short courses, including higher education courses, are offered by FedUni to help the professional development of the students. Accommodation is available on Campus in residential units, apartments, and shared/ensuite rooms at Peter Lalor Hall, Victoria Street Halls of Residence, etc. Students can apply for financial assistance such as scholarships, grants, loans, and bursaries, namely Professional Development Grant, TAFE Scholarships, Elite Athlete Scholarship, OS-HELP loans, etc. Employment records show that FedUni graduates earn a median salary of approximately $63,000 AUD.

Name: Monash University
Overview: Located in Victoria, Australia, Monash University is a public research university established in 1958. With over 5,000 research students, the university has ten faculties (Science, Law, Engineering, Arts, Education etc.) offering 145 undergraduate and 205 graduate courses. For admission, candidates need a minimum IELTS score of 7.0 and 94 in TOEFL.The tuition fee depends on the course chosen, and financial aid comes as loans, scholarships, grants and more, for example, FEE-HELP, Monash Leaders Scholarship, Achieving Potential Placement Grant, Gandel Scholarships etc. MRS Halls Cafe provides dining services. Students on all four campuses can join one of the several clubs and societies centred around art, film, music, academics, politics, philosophy, volunteering etc. Monash University bachelor's degree graduates earn an average full-time salary of AUD 65,691. As part of the study abroad program, students can spend a semester/year at 150 partner universities, including the Monash University Malaysia campus, and participate in global study tours and summer/winter programs.
Eligibility Overview: You must meet our English language requirements to undertake an undergraduate or postgraduate course at Monash. Some courses require a better level of English than others.Monash evaluates your ability based on your most recent test. We only consider the most recent test or assessment, even if you've completed several throughout the years.You can take English language proficiency tests to obtain admittance into your selected Monash course if you have not met the English language criteria from your previous studies. The University maintains the right to request an English proficiency test from an applicant.If your English test result does not meet the English language criteria for your selected programme, the Monash University English Language Centre offers English language programmes that will help you transfer to Monash University as smoothly as possible.Refer the Admission to Coursework Courses and Units of Study Procedures for the minimal English language requirements.for more information, click on this link-https://www.monash.edu/study/courses/entry-requirements
Accommodation: Accommodation is available for students in studio apartments, shared houses and units, traditional halls and more on campus. A few options include Peninsula Residential Village, Clayton Urban Community and Gillies Hall. Mannix College also provides off-campus housing, Rooming Houses, the Uniting Homeshare Program, and private renting services.One of the most important decisions you'll make at university is where you'll live! Because everyone is different when it comes to picking a place to live, we've created a variety of on-campus housing alternatives!for more information, click on this link-https://www.monash.edu/accommodation/accommodation/on-campus-options
Course Ranking: At Monash University, various departments, including the Department of Forensic Medicines, the Department of Epidemiology and Preventive Medicine, and the Department of Physiotherapy and Occupational Therapy, among others, teach undergraduate and graduate courses. The faculties of engineering, law, the arts, business, economics, health sciences, and IT are on campus.According to the QS Subject Ranking, Monash University is placed 36 among universities for studying accounting and finance in 2020 and 73 for studying a global MBA. According to Times Higher Education (THE), the university's PG Business and Economics programme is number 67.Monash University's engineering programme received a ranking of 54 from QS Subject Ranking for its undergraduate engineering programme and 71 from THE for its postgraduate engineering programme. The university's PG Computers Program has been ranked 151–175 for its computer courses by Times Higher Education (THE) for 2021.
University Ranking: The Australian public research university Monash University was established in 1958 in Melbourne. The institution, the second-oldest in Victoria, was named after a well-known World War I general named Sir John Monash.Monash University, one of Melbourne, Australia's finest universities, has been placed 48th by US News & World Report for 2021. Times Higher Education has placed the university at number 64, an increase from its previous position of 74 in 2017. The university was ranked 55 by QS World University Rankings in 2021, an increase from its previous level of 65 in 2017; similarly, the ARWU Shanghai Ranking gave the university an 85 ranking for 2020. Refer to: Monash University Admissions 2021.While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by the Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases its rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). In the Shanghai ranking, institutions are ranked based on the calibre of academic research they generate and the number of Nobel Prizes their faculty have earned rather than on their reputation among academics or employers.

Name: Central Queensland University
Overview: Central Queensland University is the largest university in Australia that provides a wide range of courses in education, humanities, accounting, law, psychology, health, This institution is also renowned for having a vast alumni network of 100,000+. Most of its alums have also achieved dizzying heights of success, having become leaders in various social fields. Some prominent alumni include filmmaker Wayne Blair, Craig Zonca, breakfast presenter at ABC radio, Julian Assange, the founder of WikiLeaks, and Terry Effeney, the CEO of Energex.Today, Central Queensland University has students from Australia and 140 countries across the globe. They are involved in a research partnership with national and international researchers and research networks.

You may be eligible for advanced standing in your CQUniversity course if you have finished a certificate, diploma, or advanced diploma (or equivalent). These entry requirements can be met through authorized university foundation studies or a formal Australian Certificate IV.For Postgraduate:Obtaining a bachelor's degree equivalent to an Australian pass grade average in the final two terms from a recognized higher education institution.English Language Requirements:

Name: Western Sydney College - Parramatta
Overview:
The University of Western Sydney or UWS began operations as a federated network university in the year 1989. The predecessors of this university date back to as far as 1891. In 2001, the university underwent restructuring and started operating as a single multi-campus university. Today, it has 6 campuses, which includes the Western Sydney College – Parramatta. This campus comprises “Building 1 – Peter Shergold Building” and “Building 2 – Engineering Innovation Hub”, with a college at 100 George St.
Building 1 of the Western Sydney College – Parramatta includes the acclaimed Sydney Graduate School of Management or SGSM, which offers a range of postgraduate studies. Its Engineering Innovation Hub located in Building 2 offers courses on Industrial Design, Architecture, and Masters of Engineering. Its college situated at 100 George St provides a number of Diploma programs and University Foundation Studies. Students can also apply for scholarships, which are available in 3 groups, namely ‘A’, ‘B’, and ‘C’, and funded by the university, donors, and the Commonwealth of Australia/an Australian State or Territory, respectively. 
Due to its location in a major urban centre, it allows enhanced transport connectivity, access to retail and community amenities, and employment opportunities. As for on-campus accommodation, students can opt for a flat, studio apartment, or shared villa, all of which come with 24x7 security, Wi-Fi access, and support. These also include a courtyard, games room, computer lab, and laundry facilities. 
This institution holds the 494th position in the QS World University Rankings 2022. Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2022 includes the Western Sydney College – Parramatta in its rankings for the top 2% in the world as well as top 250 universities globally. It also received an overall score of 5 stars in the QS World University Rankings – Star Audit 2021 under the categories of employability, teaching, inclusiveness, facilities, innovation, and internalisation. 
It also extends welfare and career support to its students. Through its Global Mobility, Western Sydney College – Parramatta provides internship and placement programs in over 400 destinations across the globe.

Name: Institute of Science Management and Technology (ISMT)
Overview: Institute of Science Management and Technology (ISMT) is a registered training organization in Sydney, having its campus on Level 1, 575-597 Pacific Highway, St. Leonards NSW 2065, near the St.Leonards train station. It is surrounded by restaurants, daycare centres, group homes, gyms, cafes, residential apartments and a local hospital. This fully air-conditioned institute has segregated its various facilities into male and female amenities. ISMT offers modern interiors, wheelchair access, and a breakout area meant for students from all cultures and nations to study, connect and stay comfortably. ISMT offers a number of courses for domestic and international students. These courses are divided into management, health and short courses. Some of the courses for domestic students include Diploma of Leadership and Management, Certificate IV in Disability, Graduate Diploma of Management (Learning), Certificate III in Pathology Collection, and many more. To name a few, the courses for international students include Certificate III in Health Services Assistance CRICOS Code 105560F, Certificate-IV in Disability CRICOS Code: 0101896, Graduate Diploma of Management (Learning) CRICOS Code: 105562D, Certificate III in Pathology Collection CRICOS Code 105561E, etc. IInstitute of Science Management and Technology also extends some Pathways and Articulations programs. These are for students willing to go to university but require some learning foundation. Besides all these, students receive an adequate amount of support from this institute. These include mock tests, counselling sessions, tutorials for every subject, congenial student-teacher relationships, etc.

Name: Front Cooking School - Melbourne
Overview: Front Cooking School of Melbourne offers its world class education through its three vibrant campuses, which are in Exhibition Street, Carlton (on Lygon Street) and Brunswick (on Brunswick Road). Students can avail state-of-the-art amenities to experience an exceptional learning process and successfully pursue their cooking career. The courses in Front Cooking School are offered to the students through different streams. The streams are Advanced Diploma of Hospitality Management- Commercial Cookery and Patisserie Stream, Diploma of Hospitality Management- Commercial Cookery Stream, Diploma of Hospitality Management- Commercial Patisserie Stream, Certificate III in Commercial Patisserie, Certificate III in Commercial Patisserie, Certificate IV in Commercial Patisserie, Certificate IV in Commercial Patisserie and Work-based Training. The cooking school provides the students numerous facilities and services like a fully equipped practical kitchens and ovens for individual hands-on learning, front desk student support for 7 days a week, over 70 computers for students, multiple theory classrooms, and a resource library. They also offer a number of non-academic facilities to the students such as toilets for disabled individuals, student changing rooms, student kitchens, student lockers, student lockers, student break rooms and wi-fi for students on all campuses. Front Cooking School of Melbourne doesn’t offer any allowance or financial aid since the course is for a short period. However, the college offers the students with student counselling before choosing a diploma or certificate. In addition, they have over 100 families to host the students to provide accommodation. The school puts efforts to educate the students through a theoretical and practical learning process that helps them achieve their dream occupation in the cooking and food service industry.

Name: Institute of Health and Management - Perth
Overview: The Institute of Health and Management, formed in 2007, is known for its educational services, especially in professional healthcare. With over 5,000 students and about 250 staff, the institute has been popularising its various services. The institute's values maintain an amalgamation of care and excellence for improving the students and their skills. The management has made efforts for incorporating innovation within the design and delivery of the educational programs. The Institute of Health and Management courses can be classified into their four schools of community services, management, allied health, and education. The diplomas, certificates, and degrees constitute nursing subjects, individual support, disability, health administration, early childhood care, etc. The collaborative approach of the institution has helped it rank higher. The institute offers a wide range of courses. It has divided the same into seven divisions, aiming at expert nursing and healthcare training for the students describing the employment requirements. The Institute of Health and Management fees structure is moderate, accommodating several international students. As the name suggests, the Perth campus is in Perth, the largest city in Western Australia. The campus offers various courses, including graduate certificates in Nursing, English Language Intensive Course, PTE Academic for Nurses, and others. The institute provides placements for graduate students, mainly in the healthcare sector. Therefore, students choose to enroll in this university to enhance their knowledge and ideas about the professional healthcare industry. The flexible and remote learning opportunities have been helpful for the international students as well. The acceptance rate of the institute shows that it is less selective and supports a diverse environment.

Name: University of Southern Queensland
Overview: University of Southern Queensland (USQ) is located in Toowoomba, its founding campus. The university offers over 700 undergraduate, postgraduate, and research courses in various fields.The school accepts TOEFL (both) and PEARSON test scores for admission. The tuition for an international student would depend on the individual course and range from 24,644 AUD to 30,141 AUD. The yearly cost of the hostel and meals would be 9,574 AUD for campus residential students.There are more than 40 organizations that provide scholarships for students, and the college offers a maximum of USD1000 under scholarships to students.The University of Southern Queensland ranks #1 in Australia for graduate starting salary.
Eligibility Overview: Academic RequirementsCandidates must meet particular entry requirements to be considered for a USQ degree. Indian students must have an average of 60% in four academic subjects and an IELTS score of 5.5 for the UG programme and 6.0 for the PG programme.
Accommodation: On-Campus ResidencesToowoombaResidential Colleges are located on-campus at UniSQ Toowoomba. Whether you want the whole package with meals included or to share a kitchen, UniSQ Residential Colleges offers a great uni experience. SpringfieldThe Education City Residential Village located just 100 metres from UniSQ Springfield provides a friendly residential community environment. The modern four to seven-bedroom townhouses are fully furnished and include appliances. The Education City Residential Village is independently provided and managed by Hive Property Group on behalf of Springfield City Group. Please email springfield@hivepropertygroup.com.au or telephone +61 1300 882 326 or +61 466 050 661 to discuss the student accommodation options available at the Education City Residential Village.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Rockhampton
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU), Rockhampton, established in 1967 is considered as one of the largest and reputed universities in regional Australia. Students get two location choices, such as Rockhampton City and Rockhampton North and they can also make use of the facilities that include a newly refurbished library, community sports center, Willby's Training Restaurant, etc. In QS World University Rankings, the university secured a rank of #601-650. It offers several courses leading to UG, PG degrees, and 300 programs for diploma in subjects like Psychology, Accounting, Agriculture, Performing Arts, etc. There are certain admissions retirements applicants need to meet, for instance, having an overall GPA of 4.0 for 2 years of UG full-time course or diploma qualification, letters of recommendation, etc. In the case of international students, there is an English proficiency test conducted by Central Queensland University (CQU), Rockhampton. From accommodation assistance to merit-based scholarships, international students get all these conveniences during the entire course tenure. When it comes to graduate employability the university ranks in the top 2% of universities worldwide. The university also offers apprenticeships and traineeship courses which comprise training and paid employment. Apart from academic aspects, the university makes sure that students stay involved in extracurricular activities. Different activities like music, sports events, outdoor movies, etc. are conducted in the Central Queensland University (CQU), Rockhampton campus. Among additional facilities, students get to use food outlets, gyms, entertainment zones, etc. Students also get the convenience to opt for online graduate and post-graduate courses and all these distance programs are supervised by learned faculty members. Central Queensland University (CQU), Rockhampton conducts several career support workshops and flexible, mixed-mode study to help students get access to study materials easily.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: HousingThe majority of CQUniversity's campuses are in the heart of the city and are easily accessible by public transit. It is recommended that you utilise Google Maps to determine the distance between your long-term accommodation and your campus when looking for long-term housing. The majority of student apartment complexes are within a 5-kilometer radius of your campus. While it is feasible to find shared housing near school, it is usually more expensive. Because it is more cheap, most students choose to live in shared housing 5-10 kilometres from our campuses.COMPLEXES OF STUDENT ACCOMMODATIONIn Rockhampton and Mackay, on-campus student housing is offered. There are several private providers to select from if you are studying at one of our urban campuses and want to live in a student housing complex.Check here for details: https://www.cqu.edu.au/international-students/studying-in-australia/planning-your-arrival/accommodation/long-term-accommodation

Name: The University of Melbourne
Overview: The University of Melbourne is a public university founded in 1853. It is a top-ranking university in Australia in the fields of research and discovery. The university offers 100+ courses for the undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The courses are available in many study areas; Architecture, Building, Arts, Business and Economics, Planning and Design, and Education. Humanities and Social Sciences, Engineering; Environment; Health; Information Technology and Computer Science; Law; Music, Visual and Performing Arts; Science, Veterinary, Agriculture and Food Sciences. Its top courses are MBA, Masters of Computer Science, and Masters of Information Systems, being the top three among others. For the undergraduate degrees under Arts, Commerce and Sciences, the program fees would cost between 1,06,656 - 1,70,600 AUD; for the postgraduate degrees under Engineering, Science, Commerce, Arts, Computer Science, and MBA would cost between 77,802 - 1,41,030 AUD. Scholarships and bursaries are open to being availed by deserving students. The placement opportunities at the university come among the top recruited graduates, the top courses to avail high salary recruitments were under the Legal department (200,000 AUD as annual salary); Executive Management and Change (157,000as the annual salary); Legal and Paralegal (146,000 as the annual salary) among other courses.
Eligibility Overview: The following are the requirements for admission to the University of Melbourne's various programmes:Undergraduate: The applicant must be at least eighteen years old. Applicants under the age of 18 must obtain special approval. It is critical to complete high school, which is similar to Australian class 12. Scores from the SAT or ACT may also be accepted in some courses. The following are the minimum score standards for Indian students: Graduate: Completion of a bachelor's degree from an accredited university is necessary. For most courses, a minimum of 65 to 70% of bachelor's degree results are required for admission. According to the course, a GMAT score of at least 630 or a GRE score of at least 315 is necessary.Language Requirements in EnglishInternational students must demonstrate their English competence by taking one of the regular examinations. Name: Canterbury Technical Institute
Overview: Canterbury Technical Institute is a part of the Canterbury Education Group training students on vocational courses in diversified and international arenas. Its location is Brisbane in Australia that attracts students due to comfort in commuting and other facilities. AQF has accredited it for delivering vocational training. The nurturing environment, well-designed course material, helpful and experienced team accomplishes the study programs. Registered Training Organisation' (RTO) operates wholly within the VET Quality Framework, which has registered this institute. It offers courses like management, information technology, hospitality, business, project management, commercial cookery, etc. It also offers certificate and high-level skill programs. The Canterbury Technical Institute tuition fees is around $28,712 AUD per year. This is a competitive fees structure in the market. CTU offers 2 years undergraduate, 3-year diploma, project management practice, and certificate program. All are designed to meet the increasing demand for IT and business skills in the industry. It has scholarship programs, loans, and grants to support the financial strength of students. This institute ranks in the top position for courses, fees, student satisfaction, and a lot more. It is a registered member of the Australian Skills Quality Authority (ASQA), National regulator for Australia's vocational education and training sector, Member of the Australian Council for Private Education and Training, Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS). Moreover, the institute offers flexible courses that cater to both international and domestic students. Plus, most of its courses are nationally-recognised, accepted industrially and cover a comprehensive range of topics and units.
Eligibility Overview: With an international qualification, you can apply to UC.If you have an international qualification (from a secondary school or institution outside of the United States), you must apply for Admission with Academic Equivalent Standing (AES) in myUC. You may also be required to apply for admission to the programme you want to pursue.Admission RequirementsCheck the requirements for admission to the UC qualification you want to pursue to discover if your foreign credentials are sufficient. You may also be asked to demonstrate your English language skills and provide further paperwork.Check: https://www.canterbury.ac.nz/enrol/eligibility/
Accommodation: It's just as vital to figure out where you'll live in your first year as it is to figure out what you'll study. UC can assist you in finding a hall, flat, or homestay.Have a query or need some lodging advice? Please inquire here: https://www.canterbury.ac.nz/life/accommodation/
