Name: University of Technology, Sydney
Overview: Founded in 1988, the University of Technology Sydney is a public research university in Ultimo, New South Wales, Australia. University houses 46,000 students study in 9 faculties and schools- Faculty of Design, Faculty of Science; and Faculty of Transdisciplinary Innovation. The University of Technology Sydney offers 112 short courses, 210 postgraduates, and 130 undergraduate programs in Architecture, Business, Communication, Education, Law, Nursing, Pharmacy, and Engineering. With AUD 100 admission fee, students can apply online along with the tuition fee of AUD 437 per credit of course after meeting minimum eligibility criteria in IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (79), and PTE (58). The university provides multiple financial grants under Undergraduate Merit Scholarship, UTS President's Scholarship, UTS Postgraduate Academic Excellence Scholarship. Notable services like health care, student media, cultural activities, food outlets, catering, parking are provided. The three floors of the UTS Library contains approximately 640,000 educational items for students, including study areas and group presentation rooms. Students get 24/7 access to computer labs and can choose to join 130 clubs and societies like Athletics, Backstage, African Society, etc. With AUD 50 application fee, you can book on-campus residential accommodations like Yura Mudang (720 students), Guam Ngurang (251 students), Bulga Nagurra (119 students), Gee gal (57 students) with two, three, four, six, seven, eight, nine-bedroom apartment options. The studio and two-bedroom apartments cost are AUD 340 -AUD 420 and AUD 295- AUD 360 per week, including bathroom, kitchen, common living room, and bus shuttle services. Career Hub, the online job portal of the University of Technology Sydney, helps around 78.6% of undergraduates achieve a full-time placement with an average pay scale between AUD 80,000 and AUD 120,000 (highest in Business Development).
Eligibility Overview: To apply for a course at UTS, students must meet the university's minimal eligibility standards, which vary by nation. Indian students must meet the following criteria:Undergraduate StudiesSuccessful completion of the Higher Secondary School Examination (10+2) with the following grades from any educational board (CBSE/CISCE/State Boards):CBSE: The best four subjects' overall grades are counted, with A1=5, A2=4.5, B1=3.5, B2=3.0, C1=2.0, C2=1.5, D1=1, D2=0.5.CISCE: The best four externally assessed subjects' overall percentage grade average.State boards may accept a competitive pass percentage.Postgraduate StudiesA recognized degree comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree is required for PG programmes. The academic performance of an applicant at the bachelor's level will be reviewed as part of the candidate's application evaluation. Some courses will additionally ask for appropriate employment and/or research experience. Research programmes, for example, require the submission of a research proposal.
Placement: Student placements are instances in which an academic supervisor arranges for a student (or students) to visit a host organisation that serves as a work-based learning provider. The Vice-Directive Chancellor's on Course Related Work Experience at UTS specifies the standards for course related work experience and outlines the University's and Faculties' safety duties.For More:https://www.uts.edu.au/about/safety-wellbeing/preventing-injury-and-illness/work-and-study-campus/student-placements

Course Description: University of Technology, Sydney is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Technology, Sydney was founded in 1988. Located in Sydney- Aus,Australia the university is home to about 13963 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Technology, Sydney is ranked 137th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 0 postgraduate programs. University of Technology, Sydney has 7 intakes in Mar,Jul, Feb,Sep,Feb, Jul,Oct. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is NaN years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Technology, Sydney is around AUD 34000 - AUD 52000.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Technology, Sydney include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Technology, Sydney is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Technology, Sydney has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Lead College - Perth
Overview:
Best known for its vocational and professional training courses, Lead College helps the students meet their academic goals using their skills and talent. With its mission to cater to the future needs of the students in the professional space, the College believes in innovative ideas and technical incorporations in their training. As all the training courses of this College are under the recognition of CRICOS registration, they are more valid and suitable for international students. 

Lead College has been instrumental in expanding its offerings by understanding the current needs of the market. Some of the Lead College courses include Business and leadership, Community services, Cookery and hospitality, Early Childhood, Automotive, IT. These courses are primarily professional and comply with the ESOS National Code, making the students easily eligible for employment. It can be considered the main reason for the popularity of the College across all three campuses. 

Apart from the one to one tuition and customised training plans, the tutors of the College also provide English language support and counselling to the international students. The Perth campus of Lead College is situated near Western Australia, about 13 kilometres from the Perth City Center. The alumni of the institute show a notable increase in the employment rates among young graduates. 

The College has offered professional training courses for both in-state and international students. This institution spent necessary time and effort to ensure that the trainers are skilled to provide necessary training and resources to the students. Besides, students can avail one-to-one support from the Academic manager regarding courses. Also, it extends various welfare services including counselling, financial matters, accommodation, medical issues etc.  Moreover, the College has increased the number of graduates getting employed within six months.

Name: Eynesbury College
Overview: Eynesbury College, founded in 1989, is one of Adelaide's oldest private senior secondary schools serving students in years 10, 11, and 12. The college takes its name from the historic Eynesbury House on Old Belair Road in Kingswood. The English language, Diploma, and Foundation Studies programs are located on the Coglin Street campus, while Senior High School is located on Franklin Street. The college's learning style emphasizes self-motivation, self-evaluation, self-regulation, and self-management, resulting in increased student independence. Students at the college are encouraged to think in unique ways to foster all innovative ideas. Students from many backgrounds and countries attend the college, making it naturally multi-cultural and multi-national.Eynesbury has regular intakes throughout the year, leading to university semesters in February and July. International students share classrooms with Australian pupils at Eynesbury. Around 75% of the students at the high school are Australian, while about 25% are international. Students come from around the world to study in the diploma and foundation programs. Eynesbury also provides academic excellence scholarships to high-achieving international students applying to the Eynesbury Senior College program or the Eynesbury Foundation Studies Program. The scholarships range in value from 10% to 50% of the program price, based on the student's academic performance in their most recent year of schooling in their home country.One of the most impressive aspects of Eynesbury College is that it provides a comprehensive curriculum with practically all types of studies. If the college does not offer a subject, it arranges for it through other institutions. Such flexible and open college ideas inspire students to grow intellectually and positively impact the college's reputation worldwide.
Eligibility Overview: India ICHM Tertiary Preparation Program / Foundation Studies Program/Two-Stage Diploma (Stage 1): Year 11 consists of the Indian School Certificate, All India Senior School Certificate, and Higher Secondary School Certificate.Two-Stage Diploma (Stage 2) / One-Year Diploma: Year 12: An average of 55% or above on the Indian School Certificate, All India Senior School Certificate, and Higher Secondary School Certificate. A minimum of 60% in math and physics/chemistry is required for the Diploma of Engineering programme.  Requirement in English

Name: Deakin University
Overview: Established in 1974, Deakin University is a public university in Deakin, Australia making it the first to specialize in distance learning. Five campuses of Deakin University are spread over 67 acres, namely Melbourne Burwood Campus, Waurn Ponds Campus, Geelong Waterfront Campus, Warrnambool Campus, and Cloud Campus, housing more than 60,000 students (local and international). With 14 schools, Deakin University is governed by the Faculty of Arts and Education, Faculty of Business and Law, Faculty of Health, Faculty of Science, Engineering, and Built Environment. Eligible students with minimum requirements of IELTS (6.5), TOEFL (69), and PTE (50) can enrol in 106 graduating courses, 171 postgraduate courses, and 43 research programs with an average tuition fee of AUD 27,000.The university provides financial aid through scholarships like the Deakin Scholarship of Excellence, Donor Scholarships, Deakin Student Support Scholarship, Deakin HDR Scholarship, and International Student Scholarships.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements:An approved three-year undergraduate degree or equivalent from an approved university or other educational institutionEquivalent qualifications through examination or relevant professional or industrial experience.Done some sorts of university (tertiary) or high school (secondary) education, passed an English language test such as IELTS, Pearson, TOEFL, or Cambridge, completed an approved English subject in the IB Diploma, Australian Year 12 or other high school qualifications spent at least five years living and working in an English-speaking nation
Placement: Pathway to a Career PhD Xtra includes placement opportunities. Placements give excellent learning opportunities and evidence of practical expertise while also assisting in the development of your professional network. The option of completing a career pathway placement will add another element to your tailored learning programme if you have a specific career path in mind, or even if you simply want to 'test the waters.' Placement inside a collaborative research group or laboratory may be negotiated if you are intending a research-intensive career. If you want to work in industry, government, the public sector, or the creative arts, you might be able to negotiate placement with a relevant organisation to meet your demands. Your placement must be relevant to your overall topic of study, but it is not required to be related to your research project in the vast majority of situations. Placement possibilities are accessible to local and international higher degree research students, with the possibility to participate based on time and availability. In many circumstances, you and your supervisors will be required to play a key part in finding possible placement providers. A placement can be done at any point during your candidature, including while your thesis is being examined.  Eligibility criteria While there is a lot of leeway in terms of location, there are a few basic guidelines to follow. You must do the following as a student: Be currently enrolled in a PhD or Master by Research degree at DeakinHave successfully completed your confirmation of candidatureBe making satisfactory progress in your candidatureRemain an enrolled student for the full duration of your placementHave discussed the placement with your supervisor and acquired the required sign offBe aware that the placement must be completed within your normal candidature time limitAcknowledge that the maximum time you can spend on placement is six months (periods of three to four months are more likely)Record your placement, including the final project report, in your Individual Learning Plan examination
Accommodation: 'On-Campus Accommodation Feel safe, connected, and supported by relocating to Deakin Res, a place where you can explore new activities while also having access to the complete Deakin experience. It's a significant step to decide to live away from home while you study. It's your chance to step outside of your comfort zone, try something new, and discover more about yourself. The modern lodging alternatives were created with you in mind, to give a safe and friendly environment in which to create lifelong memories.Some on-campus accommodation places are:Melbourne BurwoodGeelong Waurn PondsGeelong WaterfrontWarrnambool Off-Campus Accommodation If you choose to live off campus, you have a lot of choices. The Houseme website at Deakin University provides a database of local rooms, houses, and flats for rent near each campus. The university also offers an off-campus housing service that can assist you with Houseme, rental application paperwork, and knowing your rights and obligations as a tenant, among other things.  The off-campus housing service can help. They regularly run information sessions for new arrivals and can help you with: Using HousemeFilling out rental application formsUnderstanding your rights and responsibilities as a tenantAvoiding housing scamsArranging emergency accommodation For more information, visit:  https://www.deakin.edu.au/accommodation
Course Ranking: When it comes to Deakin University, there are over 200 undergraduate and graduate degrees available in fields like design, business, engineering, law, medicine, nursing, and others. Deakin University is separated into four faculty, which include those for business and law, health, science, engineering, and built environment studies, as well as for the arts and education. According to the QS Subject Ranking, Deakin University consistently placed between 101 and 150 for business courses including accounting and finance and between 150 and 200 for a worldwide MBA.Times Higher Education placed the university 201-250 for pursuing PG Business and Economics (THE). According to Times Higher Education's QS Subject Ranking, Deakin University is placed between 151 and 175 for pursuing PG Engineering and Technology and 233 for pursuing Engineering and Technology by QS Subject Ranking (THE). Times Higher Education (THE) has ranked the university between 201 and 250 for those interested in pursuing PG Computers in 2022.
University Ranking: Public research university Deakin University was founded in 1974 and is situated in Victoria, Australia. The university was named after Alfred Deakin, Australia's second prime minister, which is an interesting anecdote. Deakin University, one of Australia's top universities, is ranked 218 for 2022 by US News & World Report. The university is now ranked higher than it was in 2021 (238). The university was ranked 15th among global universities in Australia by US News. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each).The university has a QS ranking of 266 and a Times Higher Education Ranking of 251 to 300 for 2022. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. Name: The Australian National University (ANU)
Overview: Australian National University is an open research institution having 4 centres such as School of Social Science, School of Physical Sciences, School of Medical Research and School of Pacific Science. It was established in 1946 and received several recognitions over the years. In QS World University Rankings 2022, it bagged 27th position and 6th position in Best Global Universities in Australia. It is located in the inner-city suburb of Canberra Acton. The institution offers more than 390 majors and minors (undergraduate level) and over 110 specialisations (postgraduate level). It boasts more than 9,076 international students (39% of the total student population) coming from across the world. The acceptance rate stands at 70% which is indicative of the fact that the admission process gets highly competitive. In order to get in they are required to meet some basic admission requirements, set by the university. Students also need to meet the required TOEFL (iBT), TOEFL (PBT), IELTS, PTE, CAE test scores and some additional country-specific requirements as well. The cost of attendance international students have to bear at Australian National University is 24,450 AUD, approximately. However, the university also provides financial assistance to them in the form of scholarships, grants, awards, etc. to help them bear these expenses. The overall employment rate is 70% and the university takes part in organising career fairs, networking events, etc., to help students get in touch with renowned companies. Australian National University students also get several on-campus facilities such as accommodations, music room, study room, etc. Apart from academics, students can also participate in volunteering, campus events, etc. The alumni network is widespread and has popular names like Geoffrey Nettle (Judge at High Court of Australia), Jane Halton (Finance Secretary), Stan Grant (Political Journalist), etc.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?International students must check the programme pages for special prerequisites before enrolling. However, it is critical to identify the university's English language requirements for admission.Applicants, both domestic and international, must demonstrate that their English language competence fulfils the minimal requirements for admission to ANU.Unless otherwise provided, the most current evidence will be accepted as proof of English language proficiency.Undergraduate StudiesWithin the last four years, you must have completed two years of full-time (or equivalent) secondary (year 12 equivalent) or higher education in English.A study must result in a study sequence or qualification that is acceptable for admission to ANU undergraduate programmes.Throughout any assessable period (for example, term or semester) in the academic year, at least 50% of attempted units/courses must be passed.Programs for Graduate StudentsApplicants interested in pursuing graduate studies must have completed two years of full-time (or equivalent) university study in English within the previous four years.Throughout any assessable period (for example, term or semester) in the academic year, at least 50% of attempted units/courses must be passed.
Placement: Placements at Australian Universities ANU hosts career fairs for students from all fields to meet potential employers. For example, the Australian National University College of Law held a Law Career Fair for law students to gain exposure to local and international corporations as well as non-profit organizations.Overseas in Focus is a job expo for international students interested in working in Australia. The fair features firms such as BOE, Infosys, Google India, Microsoft South Asia, and others.The university's employability tool is ANU Career Hub. It not only lists Australian job openings, but also career resources, services, and appointments. MBA graduates earn an average income of around 90,000-1,00,000 AUD, according to pay scale data.
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.All undergraduate and graduate students are provided with housing at the university.There are both catered and self-catered alternatives available in the residences.Bruce Hal, Graduate House, Fenner Hall, JohnXXIII College, and others are some of the residence halls.Each resident hall has everything you need, including desks, wardrobes, chairs, single beds, mattresses, mattress protectors, pillows, and pillow protectors, as well as centrally heated washing machines and dryers.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.anu.edu.au/study/accommodation/student-residences Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is between 750 and 850 Australian dollars.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.A public study room with a library, a gym, a pool table, vending machines, coin laundry, a secure undercover vehicle park, and covered bicycle storage are all available in student housing.The flats have a community washing room in the basement.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://flatmates.com.au/student-accommodation/canberrahttps://www.student.com/au/canberra

Name: University of Wollongong College
Overview: The University of Wollongong College is an Australian public-research university situated in the coastal city of Wollongong. This university has an enrolment of nearly 32, 000 students, where more than 12, 800 are international students coming from 134 countries. This university is developed into a multi-campus institution across the world. The Wollongong campus of this university offers a wide range of postgraduate and under-graduate courses. These courses are provided across four faculties involving Faculties of Social Sciences and Humanities, Faculty of Engineering and Information Sciences, Faculty of Business and Law and the Faculty of Science, Medicine and Health. Besides teaching and research buildings, this campus comprises conference facilities, indoor sport centres, student residences etc. This institution has different campuses across Australia. The Wollongong campus accepts more than 25, 000 students, offering scholarships to undergraduate, post-graduate and international students. Besides, the Wollongong College extends pathway programs to the University of Wollongong and vocational courses to develop their future. Some of the popular courses offered in this university are business, English language, Medical and Health Sciences, Animation and VFX, Information and Communication technology, Science, Arts, Social Science and Humanities etc. The tuition fee of this program depends on the type of student, program and course. The University of Wollongong College believes in diversity and equity, which further improves innovation and assists in supporting students to achieve their academic goals. Students in this college can explore a wide range of learning methods such as tutorials, practical sessions, lectures in computer and science laboratories. Besides, students can benefit from small-class sizes and quality academic courses. With a high graduate employment rate, students get various job opportunities after completing their courses. As per QS World University Rankings 2021, this university is ranked among the top 200 universities in the world.
Eligibility Overview: English Language Proficiency Scores for International Students whose first language is not English on Official TranscriptsApplicants for postgraduate research must submit two referee reports.The requirements for each course vary based on the course for which you are applying. For admittance into potential programmes, the University uses a pathway-based methodology.In order to be qualified for several postgraduate research programmes, supervisors are required.Doctor of Medicine and Dean's Scholars applications must be completed separately.For other programmes, such as nursing, TAFE must be consulted directly regarding requirements and paperwork to be submitted.Before enrolling, international students must pay the fee stated on their offer letters.

Accommodation: Students interested in applying to the University of Wollongong can live on or off campus. One of the advantages of living on campus is having a room only 5 minutes from the beach.Students can stay for as little as AUD 195 per week and have access to fully equipped rooms.Students have access to free WiFi in all accommodation options.Undergraduate applicants are assigned to undergraduate dormitories, while postgraduate and mature applicants are assigned to postgraduate and mature residences.A fee of AUD 500 is also required as a prepayment of the residential fee.Single rooms in shared 4-5 bedroom complexes, twin sharing bedrooms, fully catered and self-catered rooms, premium studios, family flats, and more options are available. As a result, the fees vary.Campus East, Kooloobong Village, Marketview, Bangalay, Weerona College, Graduate House, and International House are among the residences.Accommodations for groups are also available.Catering facilities vary depending on where you rent and what type of house you choose. Parking is offered on a pay-as-you-go basis; costs vary.If you choose to live off campus, you can contact the Housing Services Coordinator, a university service that assists students in finding off-campus housing.

Located in Wollongong,Australia the university is home to about 12800 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Wollongong College is ranked 185th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 0 undergraduate and 0 postgraduate programs. University of Wollongong College has 0 intakes in . Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Wollongong College include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Wollongong College is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Wollongong College has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Acknowledge Creativity - Perth
Overview: The institute Acknowledge Creativity is situated in the heart of Perth, Australia. It imparts innovative tools, knowledge, and training to business students on leadership, pricing, and pitching. The diploma course has 8 units, and domestic students can avail of every single one. The detailed subjects of these units are marketing & PR, purpose & values, budget & business operations, idea generation & innovation, managing growth, and understanding finance & cultural communications. The entire program and evaluation modules are designed to help students become successful business entrepreneurs. This institute has three wings Perth, Melbourne, and Sydney. All three are equipped to provide learning facilities by industry experts. It helps the students learn from traditional and contemporary teaching models and uses various problem-solving techniques to facilitate a culture of collaboration and creativity amongst its student population. The fee structure for domestic students is $2,250 per unit and for international students ranges between $2,250 to $10,000 per unit. The amount varies based on different streams; diploma certificates, graduate programmes, etc. They also provide a loan through FEE-HELP portal that assists eligible students in paying their tuition fees. Each subject has a high bracket to take a loan under this scheme. The higher limit of the loan is based on the final tuition fee value of each student. This institution has a good rating given by alumni and industry experts. Therefore, it can be an ideal place to nurture your entrepreneurial instinct and stay ahead of the curve.

Name: IIBIT Adelaide
Overview: The Institute of Business Information Technology, Adelaide, was founded in 1999 and focused primarily on education and vocational training. IIBIT offers to account, Business Management, Information Technology, Marketing, Disability Support, and individual support courses.IIBIT is affiliated with Rockwell International Schools, Federation University, and William Light Institute. Additionally, IIBIT also runs an English Academy that helps prepare for IELTS. Although the institution has a presence all around Australia, its primary campuses are in Adelaide and Sydney.The location of IIBIT Adelaide is ideal. Located in the heart of the city, IIBIT is a short distance away from the beach, cricket grounds, malls, cafes, and other incredible sights. The campus has a student-friendly environment, with a 24*7 library, IT assistance, student lounge, first aid, quiet room, and student recreational facilities.In terms of academic facilities and standards, IIBIT has plenty to offer. The environment is very learner-friendly, as are the facilities. The quality of teaching and staff assistance is very high. All staff are highly qualified and offer a highly supportive environment. IIBIT offers an orientation before the commencement of its programs, counseling services, English language assistance, and accommodation facilities. Scholarships are available for greater student convenience. Ray Adams is among the most notable alums of the college.With an excellent infrastructure and small batch sizes for more personal attention to students, IIBIT equips every student with what they need to succeed. The college also provides services to those who struggle with English by conducting extra classes and giving them individual support. Student mentors and counseling services are other attractive opportunities for students to engage with peers and professionals for assistance.
Eligibility Overview: IIBIT has eligibility requirements based on the course. Bachelor’s courses require you to have completed an international equivalent of Australian Year 12. IELTS competence of 5.0 overall band score (minimum 5.0 on writing) or equivalent, or successful completion of General English Upper-Intermediate, are prerequisites for admission to the EAP program. Some courses accept IELTS band 6.0 with no band less than 5.5.English Language Proficiency  IIBIT teaches all its courses in English. Therefore, you must provide proof of your proficiency in the language. The following tests are accepted at IIBIT

Placement: Professional Year Program (PY) For ICT/Computing Graduates from Australian Universities, the Academy IT Professional Year Program (PY) is offered on behalf of and delivered in collaboration with the Australian Computer Society (ACS). It provides practical employment skills and industry-recognized training to further enhance Graduates' Career Opportunities within an Australian Workplace Environment. International ICT graduates from Australian tertiary institutions might improve their professional opportunities by participating in the Professional Year Program offered by ACS. PYear, a realistic route from college to employment, ensures that graduates are prepared for the workforce.
Accommodation: Students can choose from various housing alternatives, including rent, sharing, and homestay. To save money, most international students prefer to share rented housing. The IIBIT staff helps students find housing. Settling-in Support: Although there is plenty of available housing, the beginning of each term is hectic. Students should request housing help at least six weeks before their arrival date. Please get in touch with studentservices@iibit.edu.au for more information. International students are advised to choose homestay living, which involves placement with an Australian family that offers housing and meals. Home stay housing in Adelaide typically costs between $70 and $300 per week. To make the appropriate preparations, IIBIT maintains a list of real estate brokers and hosts. Requests for this service must be submitted by students at least six weeks in advance. Accommodation for students is available off-campus. IIBIT assists international students seeking rental lodging or homestays, provided requests are received at least six weeks before arrival. Approximate rent ranges from USD 200 – USD 300 per week.

Name: University of Tasmania
Overview: Founded in 1890, the University of Tasmania is a public research educational institute in Hobart, Tasmania, Australia. The three main campuses in Launceston, Hobart, and Burnie offer 150 undergraduate and 120 postgraduate courses with research programs in Geology, Analytical Chemistry, Ecology, Agriculture, etc. Divided into five faculties- College of Arts, Law, and Education; College of Sciences and Engineering; Tasmanian School of Business and Economics; College of Health and Medicine; and University College, there are more than 34,000 students in the university. Eligible candidates can apply three months before the semester with minimum marks in IELTS (6.5), PTE (50), TOEFL (72) for undergraduate and graduate programs with a tuition fee of AUD 29,950- AUD 34,950 and AUD 30,950- AUD 37,000, respectively. With a 25% reduction in tuition fee through Tasmanian International Scholarships, the university also provides department-wise scholarships up to 50% of the tuition fee. Art Library, Law Library, Clinal Library, Music Library, Morris Miller Library, Cradle Coast Campus Library, and Launceston Campus Library are integrated as a single library system of the university for the students. Students can join over 130 clubs and societies related to spiritual faith, residential, culture, and community building. Along with sports facilities in cricket, hockey, soccer, rowing, volleyball, students also get health support, security protocols, counselling, and career guidance. Around 450 studio rooms are available in Hobart Apartments with a weekly rate of AUD 270. Christ College, University Apartments, and John Fisher College have 570 rooms with single, twin, and flat type rooms at an average cost of AUD 240 and a security deposit of AUD 500. Short-term and off-campus accommodation is also available for AUD 600-800 per week. Career Connect Development Center at the University of Tasmania ensures real-life working opportunities for students that benefits during placements with annual packages of up to USD 160,000 along with a chance of getting internships.
Eligibility Overview: For international students, UTAS has country-specific prerequisites. The requirements for each course and programme differ. To be considered for an offer, Indian students must obtain the needed admission grade, complete the minimum English language requirements, and meet other subject-specific prerequisites for the chosen programme.Requirements for Foundation CoursesStudents who do not meet the academic criteria for their undergraduate major should enroll in the UTAS Foundation Studies Program. Applicants must have a B grade in CBSE/CISCE English and a 10+1 in CBSE/CISCE or All India State Board Mathematics to be considered (provision results are accepted). Students must take UTAS Access -English Level 5 if they do not satisfy the minimal English proficiency criteria.Requirements for UndergraduatesStudents must apply with an All India Senior School Certificate with a minimum of 65 percent in the best of four core topics in order to be admitted to the first year of an undergraduate programme (including English, but excluding Physical and Health Education, and General Studies). Students must meet a minimum admission score based on the Australian Tertiary Admission Rank for most undergraduate courses (ATAR).*The TIS minimum is 75 percent or 10 points greater than the needed ATAR (whichever is higher)The following Indian boards of education recognize pass certificates:Senior School Certificate in India (AISSC)Certificate of Indian Schooling (ISC)Secondary Education Central Board (CBSE)Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, Gujarat, Maharashtra, Delhi, Madhya Pradesh, and West Bengal have their own state boards.Requirements for MastersA qualification comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree from a recognized institution is required for admission to most postgraduate courses at UTAS. In addition to the English language requirements, applicants must complete subject-specific criteria.Requirements for PG ResearchApplicants must have a bachelor's degree comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree with a minimum of Lower Second Class Honours and an IELTS score of 6.5 with no band below 6.0. PhD programmes typically demand the equivalent of an Australian bachelor's degree with Upper Second Class Honours or better, as well as an IELTS score of 6.5 with no band below 6.0. Admission to the Professional Doctorate is decided by the Dean of Graduate Research. Visit the Graduate Research site for further information.
Placement: The first step toward starting your chosen career is to understand your professional responsibilities. The University of Tasmania and our partners have a responsibility to guarantee the safety of their students, employees, and patients/clients. To participate in PEP, you must meet a variety of legal and regulatory conditions.PEP allows you to apply concepts in a real-world context, perhaps as early as your first year.For More:https://www.utas.edu.au/health/professional-experience-placement

Many support services and lifestyle options are available in the communities.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.utas.edu.au/uni-life/accommodation Off-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is 600 to 800 AUD.Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also available.All basic services such as power, water, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.The kitchen has a contemporary feel to it and plenty of storage.A double bed, desk, desk chair, and wardrobe are included in the bedrooms.Off-campus housing linkhttps://flatmates.com.au/hobarthttps://au.easyroommate.com/tasmania/hobart-share-accommodation

Name: Southern Cross University
Overview: Southern Cross University (SCU), ranked in the top 100 young universities globally, is an Australian public university founded in 1994. Having campuses at Lismore and Coffs Harbour in northern New South Wales and the southern end of the Gold Coast in Queensland, the university operates the National Marine Science Centre, The Hotel School Sydney and The Hotel School Melbourne. Comprising six schools, two colleges and nine research centres, it offers 83 undergraduate programs, 80 graduate programs, and 20 other courses full-time, part-time, and online. Arts, Nursing, Midwifery, Psychology, Speech Pathology, Education, Information Technology, Law, Tourism, Business and Management, Social Sciences, Economics, Clinical and Preclinical Health are some popular courses at SCU. The admissions at Southern Cross University happen thrice a year, where international students apply online or through an agent. The minimum score required for undergraduates in IELTS is 6.0 and 6.5 overall for postgraduates, along with previous academic records and transcripts. The scores of TOFEL and PTE are also considered, and their cut-offs vary depending upon the program. On-campus accommodation in residential colleges like SCU Village Lismore and Coffs Harbour is provided in modern and fully furnished rooms, with facilities like kitchen, lounge, dining area and library. The average tuition fee can vary from 26,800 AUD to 32,000 AUD depending upon the area of study chosen. Southern Cross awards scholarships like the Destination Australia Scholarship worth 15,000 AUD to students to provide financial aid. International students can benefit from the International Advancement Scholarship, Dr Allan Phan Scholarship and Nathan Asher Student Experience Scholarship, all worth 5000 AUD. The placement rate for SCU graduates is high, with 75% undergraduates and 87% postgraduates landing employment. The average salary is 80,506 AUD for undergraduates and 1,10,600 AUD for postgraduates.
Eligibility Overview: Academic criteria specify the minimum academic standards that students must meet in order to be considered for a particular course. Students who do not speak English as their first language must additionally complete the University's English language requirements.Admission requirements for undergraduatesThe needed entry score for undergraduate degrees is based on the Australian Year 12 qualification, as determined by the Australian Tertiary Admissions Rank (ATAR). Each course is assigned an ATAR, which is an estimated score for programme enrollment based on the preceding academic year. This score is listed in the Academic Score by Country section.
Accommodation: At the Lismore and Coffs Harbour campuses, four residential colleges offer a variety of on-campus housing alternatives. The apartments are contemporary and fully furnished, with a kitchen, living room, dining room, and bathroom.Coffs Harbour SCU VillageCampus Living Villages, in collaboration with SCU, manages SCU Village in Coffs Harbour. Life on-campus is full with movie nights and themed events, as well as study clubs and cooking workshops.for more information click on this link-https://www.scu.edu.au/current-students/services-and-support/accommodation/

Name: Mercury Colleges - Adelaide
Overview: Mercury Colleges Adelaide, established in 1960, is located at 68 Grenfell St. in Adelaide. It offers courses on English, business, leadership and management, project management, ageing support and communicating services, and marketing and communication. The English programs of Mercury Colleges include English for Academic Purposes, IELTS preparation course and General English Course. In comparison, the Business Programs have two courses, including Certificate III in business and Certificate IV in business. Additionally, for project management programs, there are Certificate IV in Project Management Practice and Diploma of Project Management. Apart from these courses, Mercury Colleges Adelaide also offers Marketing and Communication programs which include courses like Certificate IV in Marketing and Communication, Diploma of Marketing and Communication, Advanced Diploma of Marketing and Communication. Finally, in Ageing Support and Community Services Programs, it offers courses on Diploma of Community Services, Certificate III in Individual Support and Certificate IV in Ageing Support. Mercury Colleges Adelaide welcomes students from North and South America, the Middle East, South and East Asia and Europe. Countries include Mexico, Argentina, Chile, Peru, Brazil, Columbia, Venezuela, Jordan, Pakistan, Nepal, India, Bangladesh, Malaysia, Japan, Thailand, Singapore, Korea, Taiwan, Philippines, Indonesia, Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, Estonia, Poland, Hungary, Lithuania, Slovakia, Greece, Czech Republic, Spain and Italy. The fee structure of Mercury College depends on the course. For example, the total course fee of an English language course varies between $3,480 and $13,920. Whereas, for business programs, the course fee is $8,000 irrespective of the course. Similarly, for the Leadership and Management program and marketing courses, the total fee is $10,000, regardless of the course. But, for courses on Aged Care, the total fee varies from $8,000 to $20,000, whereas the fee structure for project management courses ranges from $6,000 to $10,000. Mercury Colleges Adelaide provides a variety of courses for students all around the world. Apart from studies, Mercury College also provides facilities like free Wi-Fi, computers in classrooms, and kitchens on each floor.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Cairns
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) has been operating since 1967 as a university of repute in Australia. The first campus under this university is Rockhampton. Presently, it has 25+ campuses. Out of those, Central Queensland University (CQU) Cairns is relatively new. Central Queensland University (CQU) Cairns campus offers an online, on-campus and mixed-mode of studies. It has a strong infrastructure, excellent faculties, and good amenities. To get the student hit the corporate world as soon as they graduate, they maintain a good network with the community and corporate industry. Information technology, business, accounting, science, arts, media, engineering, healthcare, agriculture, environment, etc are Central Queensland University (CQU) Cairns courses for students. Undergraduate, postgraduate, certificate and diploma programs are available here. They also extend a platform for the research programs. Laboratories and research centres are up-to-date with modern machineries and other facilities. Also, some short courses are there to meet industry needs in the professional field. Apart from the study center, it encourages students in sports, music, and other extracurricular activities. Central Queensland University (CQU) Cairns fees for undergraduate courses is approximately $90,000. It is very competitive among other Australian universities. They provide financial support and incentives to students to support tuition fees. Central Queensland University (CQU) Cairns ranks in the top 10 positions for placement service. The campus placement service has placed students in full-time jobs within 6 months of passing. Every year it organizes award functions, alumni meet, and cultural programs for maintaining good connectivity. It is one of the most sought-after universities in the academic or career wish-list of students across the world. It also supports several initiatives and local organisations such as Cairns Chamber of Commerce, Business Liaison Association, Study Cairns and Regional Development Australia (RDA), and Advance Cairns.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: HousingThe majority of CQUniversity's campuses are in the heart of the city and are easily accessible by public transit. It is recommended that you utilise Google Maps to determine the distance between your long-term accommodation and your campus when looking for long-term housing. The majority of student apartment complexes are within a 5-kilometer radius of your campus. While it is feasible to find shared housing near school, it is usually more expensive. Because it is more cheap, most students choose to live in shared housing 5-10 kilometres from our campuses.COMPLEXES OF STUDENT ACCOMMODATIONIn Rockhampton and Mackay, on-campus student housing is offered. There are several private providers to select from if you are studying at one of our urban campuses and want to live in a student housing complex.Check here for details: https://www.cqu.edu.au/international-students/studying-in-australia/planning-your-arrival/accommodation/long-term-accommodation

Name: Canterbury Language Academy       CRICOS Code: 02534J
Overview: Canterbury Language Academy CRICOS Code: 02534J was founded in 2004 and is one of the leading language schools in Australia. Its campus in Sydney facilitates student for commutation and other amenities. For the last 17 years, they have trained students in English from more than 30 countries. The campus has a formal learning environment and prepares students of all ages. Study materials follow international standards. Students' performance is under monitoring for giving assistance and feedback. Faculties and student support team is helpful and follows multi-cultural work ethics. Students' welfare and faculties are very caring and motivate the students continuously. Canterbury Language Academy CRICOS Code: 02534J trains on general English, advanced English (EAP), and IELTS levels. The general course length is 4-52 weeks, the EAP course length is 10-40 weeks, and the IELTS course length is 10-20 weeks. Canterbury Language Academy CRICOS Code: 02534J ranks among top-notch English teaching institutes in Australia. According to students' experience, it has a 100% satisfaction rate. The progressive curriculum, scientific mode of teaching, and caring approach are most updated. A student needs a minimum score of 5.5 to get admission to this institute. Students of any age can get admission over here. It has a multicultural teaching environment that is adequate for all.

Name: Federation University Australia - Brisbane Campus
Overview: Federation University in Victoria, Australia, is a dual-sector public institution established in 1870. It consists of seven schools (Health, Arts, Business, TAFE etc.) with an enrolment of 11,010 undergraduate, 5,607 postgraduate and 313 research students. A staff of 1,280 members teaches courses such as Philosophy, Landscaping, Human Services and Entrepreneurship, Mental Health etc. There are seven Federation University campuses; SMB, Berwick, Brisbane, Mt Helen, Camp Street, Wimmera and Gippsland. Except for Camp Street, all the campuses have a library that houses many printed/e-resources and study spaces. Over 20 short courses, including higher education courses, are offered by FedUni to help professional development. Moreover, working-age people can apply for one of the apprenticeship and traineeship courses. The Online Learning initiative allows students to pursue engineering, arts, business etc., from home while having access to all campus facilities. Pathway courses like the Diploma of University Studies and the Foundation Access Studies program help prepare students for FedUni degree programs. Students can apply for financial assistance such as scholarships, grants, loans and bursaries; Professional Development Grant, TAFE Scholarships, Elite Athlete Scholarship, OS-HELP loans etc. Students from overseas universities can enrol for one/two-semester courses at Federation University. In contrast, its students can participate in exchanges, study tours, overseas placements etc., through the study abroad program.Accommodation is available on Campus in residential units, apartments, shared/ensuite rooms and more at Peter Lalor Hall, Victoria Street Halls of Residence etc. Students can join one of the many clubs and societies like FedOut, Green Room, BARS and OT Society. They can also play intervarsity, social, community and Campus Comps sports such as netball, basketball and cycling. Fitness amenities on Campus include swimming pools, gyms, the Health and Fitness Centre, courts and fields. Employment records show that FedUni graduates earn a median salary of AUD 56,000.
Eligibility Overview: Country-Specific Requirements for International Students The institution has laid down a few country-specific requirements for students who are not from Australia. Below are the detailed qualifying requirements of some Asian nations for students intending to study at Federation University. India: Completion of All India Senior School Certificate or Indian School Certificate with an average of 60% OR Higher Secondary Certificate (State Board) with an average of 65% English Proficiency Test Scores Requirement for International Students International students whose native language is not English must exhibit English Language Proficiency scores by appearing in IELTS/ TOEFL iBT/PTE/CAE. Even if they don't meet the minimum requirements, applicants can enrol in the EAP programme. The standard prerequisites are:

Placement: In order for students to apply academic theory to real-world work conditions, FedUni routinely evaluates all courses to ensure high industrial applicability. In order to prepare students for the hiring process, the Federation also offers training sessions. Students can obtain employment and work experience with the aid of career mentoring and guidance. Prospects for a work placement: FedUni has strong ties to a variety of industrial partners, providing excellent job opportunities in Australia and recognition for top graduates.Students at FedUni have access to professional development workshops through the Industry Placement Program, with the chance to participate in a scholarship-funded placement with a hosting firm as part of the course.A new Hi-tech area is also being built next to the Gippsland Campus, expanding the scope of the partnership with business and the community, according to industry experts nearby Technology Parks, situated at the Mt Helen and SMB campuses, are home to large organisations.Through industry-integrated learning programmes tailored to each student's degree, Federation University connects students to partners. River City Labs, Arc, STEMPunks, CoderDojo, and Concentrix are a few of the top local business associates.According to the Good Universities Guide 2021, Federation University has the highest full-time employability in Victoria. For the second year in a row, Federation graduates are more likely than other graduates from Victorian universities to get full-time employment and earn more money. Graduates of the university begin with a starting salary of 64,000 AUD.The university has a programme for industry placement (IPP). IPP gives students the chance to improve their skills and knowledge while gaining significant job experience over the course of 26 weeks of full-time instruction.

Name: Federation University - Mount Helen (Ballarat)
Overview: The Federation University came to exist as an amalgamation of the University of Ballarat and the Gippsland Campus of Monash University. With an average student and faculty count of 28,000 and 1,280, respectively, the university provides several courses at undergraduate and postgraduate levels. The university focuses on factors such as innovation, inclusion, and excellence while imparting educational services. The research contributions of the university are evident with SAGE Athena (SWAN) and Women’s Research Network (WREN). Federation University ranking shows its popularity, which currently holds the first position for Australia’s employability skills and teaching quality. The Mount Helen (Ballarat) campus is located about 10 kilometers from the city centre of Ballarat. The campus serves approximately 4,500 students with more than 50 specialized areas of education. The 110 hectares campus offers arts, business, education, healthcare, science, and IT-related subjects. The campus includes updated teaching and research facilities with the help of libraries, studios, and lecture theatres. Federation University also maintains leisure facilities in the Mount Helen campus with a swimming pool, tennis courts, athletics track, gymnasiums, a weight training studio, squash courts, etc. With an average international students count of 5,204, the university has been moderately selective of the new applicants and their acceptance. The university has also contributed to about $230 million in real GDP across Australia. As the name suggests, the Mount Helen (Ballarat) campus of Fed Uni is in Ballarat, a city in the Central Highlands of Victoria, Australia. The industry-relevant courses and personalized teaching facilities enable the students to find employment within six months of graduation. They can also partake in the alumni group for availing latest employment updates.
Eligibility Overview: Each course of study's basic eligibility criteria, which include:Minimum age requirement: Applicants must be 18 years old by the date of issue of the Commencement of Enrolment (CoE).International applicants from countries where English is not the first language must meet the minimal English language requirements. Academic requirements for UG Students :           Academic requirements for PG Students :  The applicant must have earned a minimum stipulated CGPA or grades while completing an Australian bachelor's degree or an abroad equivalent. For admittance to a non-research-based postgraduate study, such as an MBA, many programmes may also require credible job experience.A first-class degree is necessary, as well as relevant job experience and an IELTS score of 6.0. (with no less than 6.0 in any section).

Name: Queensland University of Technology
Overview: The Queensland University of Technology is a public research institution established in 1989 in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia, with more than 52,000 students. The university has two campuses in the Brisbane area- Gardens Point and Kelvin Grove, whereas another campus in Canberra's Deakin. Buildings like Roundhouse Theatre, Exhibition Spaces, Institute of Health and Biomedical Innovation, QUT International College are present in Kelvin Grove Campus. Gardens Point Campus houses the first three out of five faculties in the University- Faculty of Business and Law; Faculty of Science; Faculty of Engineering; Faculty of Creative Industries, Education and Social Justice; Faculty of Health, and QUT Art Museum, Gardens Theatre. Students can target admission in more than 100 undergraduate and graduate courses in Business, Education, Science and Technology, Law and Justice, etc., with an application fee of AUD 100. Eligibility criteria include having minimum marks in IELTS (6), TOEFL (79), PTE (58), and GMAT (550) with an average tuition fee between AUD 31,600 and AUD 40,600. The university deploys around 70 scholarships to students under programs like the QUT Excellence scholarship, International Merit Scholarship, decreasing 50% tuition fee charges. The on-campus accommodation facility is given in residential areas like Cromwell College, Emmanuel College, King's College, Duchesne College with average charges of AUD 250-420. Agent-operated accommodation costs around AUD 150-300 while Student Residential Complex is available at the weekly price of AUD 265-500, including a bed, study desk, shared bathrooms, kitchen, and standard rooms. Additional facilities at the Queensland University of Technology are three library sections- Gardens Point Library, Law Library, Kelvin Grove Library, gymnasium; swimming pool; pharmacy, aquatic center, restaurants, and cafes. Students can join social sporting clubs, including athletics, volleyball, football, cricket, motorsport, etc. The university claims notable placement rates through the online portal QUT Unihub with alumni achieving annual packages of AUD 90,000 to AUD 120,000.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?Students are recognised by Queensland University of Technology (QUT) based on their administrative performance and ability to succeed. International students must have completed Grade 12 to apply for undergraduate programmes, and a graduation degree is required to apply for post-graduate studies. The eligibility requirements differ from one course to the next. Minimum age requirement: Applicants must be at least 18 years old at the time the programme begins.The following is the minimum English language requirement: See the table below for more information:IELTS 6.5-7.0 or higher79-100 on the TOEFLPTE 58 PTE 58 PTE 58CAE 176 and higher

Business, engineering, medicine, law, the arts, social sciences, agriculture, and sciences are just a few of the well-liked courses offered at the Queensland University of Technology. Business courses dropped from #85 in 2020, while computer science courses also saw a drop in their rankings. University Ranking: The Queensland University of Technology, also known as QUT, is one of the top 50 universities in Australia and one of the top 500 worldwide. The Queensland University of Technology is ranked #186 by THE for the year 2021, an improvement of 7 points from the rankings for 2020. The ranking graph also shows a downward trend, which suggests a detrimental effect. The different ranking criteria by THE to rank universities result in average ratings for QUT, including 86.8 for citations, 84.6 for international outlook, and 54.3 for overall performance. QUT is ranked by US News at #197 for 2021, down from #224 in both 2020 and 2019. The ranking graph shows an increasing trend that indicates a turn for the better.Since admissions account for many rankings, 2020 QUT Admissions did not note significant modifications to its admissions standards. Additionally, the courses that were being offered for admission were also offered. In terms of QS rankings, QUT fell from #224 in 2020 rankings to #217 in 2021. The following areas of ranking criteria, which are used to score and rank QUT, received above-average scores: citations per faculty (59/100), employer reputation (44.8/100), international student ratio (43.3/100), academic reputation (42.1/100), etc. Overall, QUT received an average score of 42.1/100.

Name: RMIT University
Overview: The Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, or RMIT University, a public research institute, was established in 1887 in Melbourne, Australia. Melbourne has three RMIT University campuses: Melbourne City, Brunswick, and Bundoora, and two regional sites.With three academic colleges and 19 academic schools, it offers over 350 undergraduate, postgraduate and research degree programs in areas like Design, Fashion, Communication, Engineering etc. Students can prepare for university life through the Pre-university Study program (RMIT Extension, Tertiary Preparation, Foundation studies etc.). The Apprenticeships and Traineeships, Vocational Study program, RMIT Creds and Single courses offer training and professional skills development. RMIT Online is an excellent way to pursue degree programs and professional courses in Brand Experience, Healthcare Design, Developing Blockchain Application etc., from home. Students from abroad can study at RMIT University through the study abroad program, and its students can spend time at the Vietnam and Spain campuses or a partner institute. Financial aids like scholarships, awards, loans, and bursaries are available to students: International Student Emergency Relief Fund, Australia Awards Scholarship, RMIT Ready Bursary, STEM Merit Scholarship etc. S

Name: La Trobe University
Overview: La Trobe University was established in 1964 as a public research university in Victoria, Australia. Over 38,639 students are enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate and research programs across seven disciplines (Science, Health, Business and Commerce etc.) Some courses offered include Sociology, Event Management, Health Policy, Data Science and Law. La Trobe University's short courses in Health, Education and Teaching, Business etc., help develop career skills. Pathways to La Trobe, comprising Foundation Studies or Diploma program and English courses, allow entry into the university. The La Trobe Online campus will enable students to pursue degree programs from home; they can access study materials and interact with professors and fellow students online. Students worldwide can study at La Trobe for a semester or two through the study abroad and exchange program. Students can apply for financial aid such as scholarships, fellowships, awards, loans and bursaries; ELICOS Scholarship, Early Bird Acceptance Grant, Alumni Advantage, La Trobe International Scholarships etc.

Name: Stotts College
Overview: Stotts College is a private institution established in 1883 to offer specialized business training for the first time in Australia. In 2006, the college was registered and accredited to deliver undergraduate programs; in 2017 was accredited to provide the Bachelor of Community Services. The college operates across five campuses; the primary campus is located in Melbourne. Stotts College vocational training in Advanced Diploma of Civil Construction Design, Diploma of Nursing, etc. The college encompasses three functional departments: the higher education department, Vocational, and Victorian Certificate of Education(VCE). They provide numerous courses in the Bachelor of Business, the Advanced Diploma of Business, the Certificate IV in Business Administration, and other programs in welfare service, Tourism, Nursing, midwifery, etc. Stotts College secured a splendid rank of 203 among all the secondary schools in the state of Victoria and held a position among the top 80 universities of the country every year. The college aims to enhance the applicants' academic performance and make them job-ready. The Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency regulates and monitors college operations. It is also checked under the Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority. The Scotts Melbourne campus offers nursing courses where an enrolled nurse works under an experienced registered nurse and acquires skills needed in all health sectors. The college houses over 3000 students from all over the world, providing them with copious opportunities and offering services such as Multiple theory classrooms and resource libraries. The college makes education accessible and convenient by making all the resources available to the applicants.
Eligibility Overview: For First-Year AdmissionYear 12 or its equivalent is required. The age requirement is 18 years old.International students must additionally show that they can communicate in English at an IELTS level of 6.0. (Academic).The student must have documented evidence of having completed an IELTS exam at an official IELTS testing centre or an equivalent recognized English language test within the previous twelve months of the student's proposed start date for the Bachelor programmes, with an overall score of 6 and no single band lower than 5.5.
Placement: Stott's College is dedicated to the objectives and aims of the community work profession and preparing our students for successful employment. When you participate in 'Fieldwork Placement' as part of your university Community Services courses, you will receive work-based training and assessment. This is an organised educational programme that is required by both your course and the professional accrediting organisation, the Australian Community Workers Association (ACWA).Placements give you a one-of-a-kind chance to:By connecting theory to current practice, you can improve your skills.In community services, such as community development, disabilities, youth work, children and family services, mental health, casework, and multicultural services, you will get the opportunity to work in a genuine workplace environment.Learn about the latest industry trends, best practices, and employment opportunities.Create a professional network and a resume.Examine your host agency's job openings.

Name: Australian Institute of Business and Technology (AIBT) - Brisbane
Overview: The Australian Institute of Business and Technology, or AIBT, is one of Australia's best private vocational education institutions. This institute features advanced campuses situated in Sydney, Hobart and Brisbane. It is accredited by the Technical and Further Education institutes TAFE and features over 90 programs. The programs running in this institute take place both online and in class. AIBT’s superior virtual classrooms enable online students to attend recorded or real-time classes worldwide. It has recruited more than 10,000 international students from more than 80 different nations on a global scale.Sydney. AIBT’s partnership with Australian Homestay Network (AHN) facilities aims to provide student accommodation facilities. AHN facilities accommodate more than 50000 international students from over 180 nations. However, students aged below 18 years availing of this facility must provide an adult consent form. The 90 vocational training courses, diploma programs and certifications of AIBT are offered across its six schools. Branson School of Business and Technology, Sheldon School of Hospitality, Bespoke Grammar School of English, Ace Aviation Aerospace Academy, Diana School of Community Services, and Edison School of Tech Sciences. These courses encompass various study areas in sciences, hospitality services, business, and technology. Besides these, students can also enrol on vocational training courses like Community, Cookery, Event Management, Aviation, and Child Services, Travel and Tourism. Candidates applying for Australian Institute of Business and Technology courses should submit the Department of Home Affairs' Pre-enrolment GTE (Genuine Temporary Entrant) form.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at the Australia Institute of Business and TechnologyIn the areas of aviation, business, logistics, information technology, human resources, marketing, management, hospitality, and travel & tourism, AIBT provides over 66 Certificate, Diploma, and Advanced Diploma courses. Name: Federation University - Gippsland
Overview: Situated in the township of Churchill, in the foothills of the Strzelecki Ranges, is the Gippsland Campus of Federation University. Federation University's Gippsland campus is within a convenient driving distance of whitewater rivers, Victoria's Mt Baw Baw ski resort, and coastal parks, including Gippsland Lakes and Wilson's Promontory.Individuals willing to cover the 160-kilometre drive from Melbourne to this campus would take roughly two hours. Alternatively, individuals travelling by fast train would reach within around 90 minutes. The various schools on this campus are the Federation Business School, School of Arts, School of Education, School of Engineering, Information Technology and Physical Sciences, School of Health, School of Science, Psychology, and Sport. Besides this, the campus is home to the Centre for Gippsland Studies, Hexagon Theatre, Gippsland Centre for Arts and Design, the Gippsland Enterprise Centre, etc. Federation University, the most prominent education institute in regional Victoria, boasts a No. 1 rating in student support. Some of the various programs offered at this campus include a Bachelor of Education Studies (Early Childhood and Primary), a Bachelor of Outdoor and Environmental Education, a Graduate Diploma of Education Studies, a Master of Education Studies, and many more. Apart from on-campus study modes, there are off-campus study modes as well. Students at this university can benefit from several options for scholarships, grants, and bursaries. These include scholarships for rural students, early childhood teachers, and several others. These include online learning, distance learning, block mode, and flexible delivery.
Eligibility Overview: Each course of study's basic eligibility criteria, which include:Minimum age requirement: Applicants must be 18 years old by the date of issue of the Commencement of Enrolment (CoE).International applicants from countries where English is not the first language must meet the minimal English language requirements. Academic requirements for UG Students :           Academic requirements for PG Students :  The applicant must have earned a minimum stipulated CGPA or grades while completing an Australian bachelor's degree or an abroad equivalent. For admittance to a non-research-based postgraduate study, such as an MBA, many programmes may also require credible job experience.A first-class degree is necessary, as well as relevant job experience and an IELTS score of 6.0. (with no less than 6.0 in any section).

Name: Mercury Colleges - Hurstville
Overview: Established in 1960, Mercury College Hurstville offers courses on Business, English Course, Aged care, Leadership and Management, Project Management and Marketing. The Hurstville campus is located at a 2-minute walking distance from the Hurstville railway station and a 20-minute walking distance from Sydney Central Railway Station. Mercury College offers a range of courses for its national and international students. Among its Business programs, it provides courses for Certificate III and Certificate IV in business. Apart from the Business courses of Mercury College Hurstville, students can also study English courses like English for Academic Purposes, General English Course, and IELTS preparation course. Additionally, its leadership and Management program offers courses on Advanced Diploma of Leadership and Management and Diploma of Leadership and Management. The institution also provides Project Management programs, including Certificate IV courses in Project Management Practice and a Diploma of Project Management. Besides these courses, there are also courses like Advanced Diploma of Marketing and Communication, Certificate IV in Marketing and Communication, and Diploma of Marketing and Communication. In Ageing Support and Community Services Programs, Mercury Colleges offers courses on Certificate III in Individual Support, Certificate IV in Ageing Support and Diploma of Community Services. Mercury College Hurstville has students from all around the world. It has students from the Middle East, Europe, East and South Asia, North America, and South America. Countries includes Italy, Spain, Czech Republic, Greece, Slovakia, Lithuania, Hungary, Poland, Estonia, Russia, Belarus, Ukraine, Indonesia, Philippines, Korea, Taiwan, Singapore, Thailand, Malaysia, Japan, India, Bangladesh, Nepal, Pakistan, Jordan, Columbia, Venezuela, Brazil, Mexico, Peru, Chile and Argentina. The fee structure of Mercury College Hurstville varies as per course. The maximum course fee is $20,000, whereas the minimum fee is $3,480. Students can also access Mercury College online via Office 365 and Moodle. Furthermore, successful completion of Mercury EAP will meet the English requirement of Torrens University.
