Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Sydney
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) – Sydney is situated in the city's central part, making it easily accessible. The campus boasts more than 3,000 students and modern learning spaces ideal for individual and group study. The university also ensures that the students get the best experience with facilities like the latest presentation and audio-visual equipment, campus library, high-tech multimedia labs, etc. The university aims to provide quality education and research courses to the maximum number of students from more than 140 countries around the globe. Currently, the university has more than 3,884 international students and 753+ faculty members. It also offers A$24 million worth of scholarships to international students to support them financially and meet their requirements while studying here. The courses at the Central Queensland University (CQU) – Sydney are designed in a way that helps students to acquire hands-on, practical learning experiences, from laboratory work to project-based work placements. In terms of employment, the university has bagged five-star ratings and a place among the world's top 2% universities in the latest QS Graduate Employability Rankings.Central Queensland University (CQU) – Sydney also offers an Australia-first Graduate Guarantee program that provides free upskilling. This university has also received excellent ratings for conducting compelling research facilities in 22 categories. Students acquire in-depth knowledge in these areas, from Applied Mathematics to Psychological and Cognitive Sciences, Horticultural Production, etc. More than 200 courses offered by this institution are available online.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Central Queensland University Central Queensland University provides a variety of undergraduate programmes in a variety of subjects. There are both online and on-campus courses offered. Candidates can apply for the position over the internet. All of the courses have the same basic criteria. There are, however, some special prerequisites that vary depending on the course. Admission Requirements: Applicants must submit the following documents at the time of admission:Study for at least 2 years full-time for a secondary or tertiary diploma level qualification or a UG qualification with an overall GPA of 4.0.Transcripts from all previous academic institutions attended.Recommendation LettersAs stated on the website, the minimum competitive rank is required.International students must submit their English Language Competency Test scores to demonstrate their English language proficiency.For some courses, a statement of purpose, portfolio, or CV may be requested.Admissions to Postgraduate Coursework International applicants must have a bachelor's degree comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree from a recognised institution. In the final two terms, a minimum score corresponding to an Australian pass grade average is required.
Placement: University Placements in Central QueenslandThe institution provides students with career and leadership opportunities to help them improve personally and professionally. Skills training seminars and sessions are provided to students in order to prepare them for the workforce. Furthermore, they are taught how to write a professional cv and cover letters, management techniques, work ethics, and a variety of other topics. Regular career fairs, seminars, and workshops are offered to assist students in making connections with industry professionals and obtaining jobs in Australia and throughout the world.Employers and graduates are brought together via the Career Cell. It hosts yearly career fairs.Career Hub is a website that lists job openings in a variety of organisations.With a full-time domestic graduate employment rate of 79.5 percent, the University outperforms the sector average of 72.3 percent.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation On-campus housing is available.On-campus housing is available to Central Queensland University students.The accommodations provide excellent learning assistance in a setting that rewards and celebrates academic and personal success.There are various options to suit different needs, ranging from affordable to brand new, ensuited to shared bathrooms, self-catered to fully-catered options (catering only available in Rockhampton). Stay for the duration of your education, a semester, or for boarding schools.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/student-accommodation Off-Campus Accommodation Off-campus housing is available.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.The typical weekly rent is between 150 and 200 Australian dollars.All basic services such as power, water, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.The majority of the apartments are located within 7 and 10 kilometres from Rockhampton.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://flatmates.com.au/rooms/rockhampton-4700https://www.walkscore.com/apartments/nearby/central-queensland-university-rockhampton-au-qld

Name: Flinders University
Overview: Flinders University in Adelaide, Australia, is a public university established in 1966 and has three campuses; Victoria Square, Bedford Park and Tonsley. With a student enrollment of over 26,000 and a staff of 2,300, the university offers more than 500 undergraduate, research and postgraduate courses across six colleges (17 study areas) such as science and engineering, medicine and public health and business, and government and law. Some methods provided are Disability and Development Education, Paramedic Science, Theological Studies and Aquatic Biology. The Flinders University Library system has five branches: the Central Library, Sturt Library, URRSA, The Adelaide Theological Library, and Gus Fraenkel Medical Library. To help high school students get into the university, it offers different pathways and preparatory programs like uniTEST, Research Project B pathway and School Recommendation Program. Several Honours degree courses are available to students who wish to undertake a year-long specialisation in their undergraduate program. Those who want a flexible program can pursue undergraduate, postgraduate or research programs online; some of the disciplines offered include Business, Information Technology (IT) and Environmental Health. Students can take advantage of the university's 100 partner institutions worldwide and participate in semester exchange and short-term study abroad programs in Norway, Canada, Japan etc. Approximately 550 students live in on-campus housing; Deirdre Jordan Village and University Hall provide single/double rooms and 2-3 bedroom units and dining services. Moreover, short-term accommodation is also available on-campus and private accommodation off-campus. The Flinders University Student Association runs several clubs and societies, such as the Bahai Society, Critical Care Society and Friendship International. Some 23 sports clubs are baseball, lacrosse, volleyball and soccer. Fitness facilities on campus include the Weights Room, Ladies Only Gym, Cardio & Functional Training Room and Strength & Conditioning Room. Flinders University Business and Management postgraduates have been known to earn a median salary of AUD 102,000.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: Completion of a CBSE School certificate with an average of at least 65% in the best four subjects or completion of an ISC School certificate with an average of at least 70% in the best four subjectsEnglish language proficiency test English language proficiency requirements are:

Placement: The Northern Territory has advantages and challenges for healthcare students seeking unique placement opportunities. Placement locations range from rural desert towns to the multi-cultural hubs of Darwin and Alice Springs and from remote clinics and practices to sizable tertiary institutions. The university encourages and assists students in embracing learning opportunities, getting involved in their communities, and improving the general well-being of the populace.  Medical Students  Northern territory Flinders NT arranges for medical students to complete internships at the Royal Darwin Hospital and the Alice Springs Hospital.For a minimum of four weeks and eight weeks, placements are offered for students enrolled in their penultimate or final year of a medical degree. Darwin Placements Every placement for medical students is subject to availability and formal clearance. Darwin may offer opportunities in the following departments: Anesthesia & PerioperativeCardiologyCommunicable Disease ControlEar, Nose & ThroatEmergencyEndocrinology & DiabetesGeneral Medicine (Palmerston Regional Hospital)Geriatrics (Palmerston Regional Hospital)Hematology/Medical OncologyImmunology/RheumatologyIntensive Care UnitMaxillofacial SurgeryOphthalmologyOrthopedic SurgeryPalliative CarePlastic & Reconstructive SurgeryRehabilitation (Palmerston Regional Hospital)Renal MedicineRespiratory MedicineTropical Infectious Diseases  Alice Springs Placements Only domestic students are eligible for medical student placements in Alice Springs and must receive formal approval in addition to being available. At Alice Springs, positions in the following departments can be available: AnesthesiaEmergency MedicineGeneral MedicineGeneral SurgeryObstetrics & Gynecologic (Flinders student only)OphthalmologyOrthopedic SurgeryPediatricsPsychiatryRenal Medicine  Working with children's clearance Once your placement has been officially approved, you must apply to working with children's clearance (Ochre Card).Without having your Ochre Card on hand before the placement start date, you cannot begin a placement in the NT. It is encouraged that you apply for your Ochre Card at least eight weeks before the start of your placement.In the event that eight weeks have passed and you have not gotten your card, you must be proactive in checking in with Safe NT regarding your application. It is important to keep contacting them until you hear back from them.Online Ochre Card applications from foreigners are not accepted. You must fill out a paper application and mail it.  Adelaide The medical college's affiliated teaching hospital and Public Health, Flinders Medical Centre, is permitted to accommodate a small number of visiting students.Final-year medical students can find placements to complete clinical electives for a minimum of four weeks and a maximum of eight weeks.  Nursing and Allied Health students To maximise the results of clinical placements in the Northern Territory, the Remote and Rural Interprofessional Placement Learning NT (RIPPL NT) team offers support and assistance to allied health and nursing students, their universities, and clinical supervisors. All university students and those enrolled in health-related courses are invited to use our services.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation The Flinders University campus is secure, economical, and accessible. You will be a member of a diverse community of students from around Australia and over 30 countries worldwide if you live on campus at Flinders Living. Reasons to choose live on-campus accommodation at Flinders University are: Participate in living and learning situations that respect and value variety as well as other peopleClasses at the Bedford Park and Sturt campuses are accessible by foot, and public transportation is nearbyFree Flinders Sport and Fitness membership and simple access to music venues, libraries, and computer labsA safe and secure setting with round-the-clock access to university security and assistance for students' welfareAffordable housing with free Wi-Fi and all utilities included  Accommodations provided are: University Hall Over 200 students can stay in the hall's fully equipped single rooms, including secure storage, parking, and shared kitchens. You can socialise with other students in the common areas, play areas, pavilions, and gardens, including the central courtyard.  Deirdre Jordan Village Over 350 people can find housing in Deirdre Jordan Village is fully furnished, self-catered flats. It features auto parking, lockable storage, BBQ areas, and landscaped gardens. For individuals who want to foster a strong sense of community, the Village also provides a variety of culturally inclusive activities in the Community Center.  For more information, visit: https://www.flinders.edu.au/living   Off-Campus Accommodation Living off-campus is simple because of Flinders University's excellent location and abundant transportation and lodging alternatives. The university advises against signing any contracts before visiting Australia and inspecting the property if you intend to live in off-campus rental housing.Most students reside in neighbourhoods near the main thoroughfares of South Road, Fiveash Drive, Goodwood Road, or Sturt Road. The Bedford Park site is frequently directly accessible by bus from city housing.Bedford Park, Clovelly Park, Edwardstown, Melrose Park, St. Marys, Mitchell Park, Flagstaff Hill, Panorama, Pasadena, and Sturt are nearby suburbs with easy access to Flinders University's Bedford Park campus and public transportation. Mile End, Plympton, Cumberland Park, Goodwood, and Camden Park are the neighbourhoods between Bedford Park and Victoria Square campus.Private rental housing in the neighbourhood is listed on a free website maintained by Flinders Living. They can also offer guidance on your obligations and rights as a tenant. For more information, visit: https://www.flinders.edu.au/international/living-in-adelaide/accommodation
Course Ranking: According to Times Higher Education, the university's ranking for pursuing PG Engineering and Technology in 2021 ranges from 301 to 400. (THE). Candidates should be aware that topic rankings factor in all relevant factors, such as course content and placements, as part of their process for rating subjects.
University Ranking: Flinders University, a public research university in Adelaide, South Australia, was founded in 1966. The colleges of medicine and the humanities are among the top 10 in Australia, making this university one of the best in the country. Regarding university rankings, the Times Higher Education - University Ranking has placed the Flinders University between positions 251 and 300 for three consecutive years, from 2019 to 2021. This is a rise from its previous position of 301-350 in 2018. Flinders University has considerably improved in QS World University Ranking, which placed it at 423 for 2021. Prior to this, it was placed between positions 551 and 600 for the years 2017 and 2018. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Research, Teaching, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty and Faculty/Student Ratio at 20% each. Flinders University is ranked at 435 by US News & World Report's Global Universities specifically for the US. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). For four years in a row, from 2017 to 2020, ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) - Universities Rankings has placed the university in the top 500. The Shanghai ranking prioritises academic research output and the number of Nobel Prizes staff members have received over reputation among academics and employers when determining the rankings of universities.

Name: Southern Cross University - Sydney Campus
Overview: Southern Cross University (SCU), ranked in the top 100 young universities globally, is an Australian public university founded in 1994. Having campuses at Lismore and Coffs Harbour in northern New South Wales and the southern end of the Gold Coast in Queensland, the university operates the National Marine Science Centre, The Hotel School Sydney and The Hotel School Melbourne. Comprising six schools, two colleges and nine research centres, it offers 83 undergraduate programs, 80 graduate programs, and 20 other courses full-time, part-time, and online. Arts, Nursing, Midwifery, Psychology, Speech Pathology, Education, Information Technology, Law, Tourism, Business and Management, Social Sciences, Economics, Clinical and Preclinical Health are some popular courses at SCU. The admissions at Southern Cross University happen thrice a year, where international students apply online or through an agent. The minimum score required for undergraduates in IELTS is 6.0 and 6.5 overall for postgraduates, along with previous academic records and transcripts. The scores of TOFEL and PTE are also considered, and their cut-offs vary depending upon the program. On-campus accommodation in residential colleges like SCU Village Lismore and Coffs Harbour is provided in modern and fully furnished rooms, with facilities like kitchen, lounge, dining area and library. The average tuition fee can vary from 26,800 AUD to 32,000 AUD depending upon the area of study chosen. Southern Cross awards scholarships like the Destination Australia Scholarship worth 15,000 AUD to students to provide financial aid. International students can benefit from the International Advancement Scholarship, Dr Allan Phan Scholarship and Nathan Asher Student Experience Scholarship, all worth 5000 AUD. The placement rate for SCU graduates is high, with 75% undergraduates and 87% postgraduates landing employment. The average salary is 80,506 AUD for undergraduates and 1,10,600 AUD for postgraduates.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate Admissions at Southern Cross University SCU offers over 90 undergraduate degree programmes, as well as associate degrees and diplomas. Academic scores for undergraduate admission are calculated using the indicative ATAR score, which varies by degree. For popular programmes in the fields of Arts, Science and Environment, Education, Social Sciences, and Community Welfare, an ATAR of 60 is necessary. Engineering and law programmes have slightly higher prerequisites, ranging from 70 to 80.Admission Requirements: To be admitted to undergraduate programmes, you must meet the following requirements:Transcripts from high schoolProof of linguistic competency in EnglishATAR or equivalent is required (usually between 45-85)References from professors and employersApplication for advanced standing (if required)Graduate Admissions at Southern Cross University Southern Cross University provides nearly 50 graduate programmes in diverse fields of study, including master's degrees, diplomas, and graduate certifications. Master of Business Administration, Master of Teaching, Master of Social Work, and Graduate Certificate in Regenerative Agriculture are among the most popular programmes. Graduate admissions requirements differ from programme to programme.Requirements for Admission: The following are the general criteria for all graduate programmes:Online application submitted in its entiretyTranscripts from prior colleges and universitiesBachelor's degree in a related field completedProof of linguistic competency in Englisha mission statementWork experience that is relevant
Placement: Placements at Southern Cross University From the start of their courses, Southern Cross University provides support to its students. SCU's career and employability team hosts a variety of courses and events on skill development themes, as well as internships and industrial tours. Students can also benefit from resume creation and interview preparation courses in order to advance their careers in Australia. The Good University Guide 2021 has given Southern Cross University a 5-star rating for graduation salary.

Name: Carnegie Mellon University - Australia
Overview: Carnegie Mellon University is a private research university in the city center of Adelaide, South Australia. From roots in Pennsylvania in 1900, the Australia campus started in 2006 with programs accredited both in the United States and Australia.Eligibility criteria for students from 20 different countries are based on the scores of standardized tests like GRE (minimum 300), IELTS (minimum 6), TOEFL (minimum 22), and GMAT (minimum 600). The average tuition fee for 12 months and 21 months programs is AUD 78,000 and AUD 94,000, respectively. Students can pursue two master's degrees- Master of Science in Public Policy and Management and Master of Science in Information Technology and Management in either program.Students also attend a semester at Pittsburgh Campus along with additional industry projects and internships. The university provides Academic Merit Scholarships up to 50% of the tuition fee with financial aid of AUD 30,000 under CMU Australia Scholarships to International Students. With high placement records, The graduates from Carnegie Mellon University Australia report packages between AUD 53,000 and AUD 110,000 in firms like Amazon, Google, Microsoft, IBM, Accenture, etc. With accommodation in hostels (AUD 90-150), shared rental (AUD 85-215), and rental (AUD 165-440), the average cost of living in Adelaide is AUD 19,800.

Name: University of South Australia
Overview: The University of South Australia is a public research institute established in 1856 in South Australia. With a student enrollment of over 35,000 and a staff of over 2,800, the university offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and research courses across 35+ study areas. There are six University of South Australia campuses, namely City West, Magill, Mawson Lakes, City East, Mt Gambier, and Whyalla, and several research centers and institutes.Students can opt for courses like Film and Television, Construction Management, Architecture, and Cybersecurity. For those looking for a flexible study program, UniSA Online offers over 70 online degrees in business, criminal justice, and Public Health. Moreover, 250+ 10-week single courses are also a part of the study online initiative. The University of South Australia also offers short courses (some government-subsidized) like Mathematics, Social Media Management, and Pain Sciences to encourage skill development. Students can pursue courses at one of the university's partner institutions through the study abroad program and participate in overseas study tours, exchanges, and placements. UniSA graduates earn a median salary of AUD 62,600.The Asian Experience Travel Grant, Ehrenberg Scholarship, US Federal Student Loan, Laity Morrow Scholarship, etc., are some of the scholarship options available to students.Student accommodation facilities at the University of South Australia include student hostels, residential colleges, student apartments, homestays, and private rentals like StudentRooms, Alexandra Lodge, Lincoln College, Atira, and Urbanest. There are over 100 academic, sports, and cultural clubs and societies for students to join, like Beer Club and ECC Alliance.
Eligibility Overview: UniSA requires overseas applicants to have achieved the Senior Secondary Certificate (10+2) with an average of at least 60% in the best four subjects and an overall IELTS score of 6.5 to demonstrate English proficiency.

THE also rates postgraduate engineering and technology courses in the 201-250 range for 2021, and in the similar range for 2020.
University Ranking: The University of South Australia is ranked among the top 150 universities in Australia and the top 500 worldwide. The ranking graph is also showing a downward trend, which suggests a detrimental effect. Only courses that were also available for 2019 enrollment were offered by the University of South Australia. The University of South Australia received above-average scores in the following categories, with scores of 100/100 for international faculty, 70.4/100 for the ratio of international students, and 45.6/100 for the number of citations per faculty member, among others, contributing to an overall average score of 32.8/100.

Name: Sydney Institute of Business & Technology
Overview: The Sydney Institute of Business and Technology is a private institute that offers an undergraduate diploma as well as a direct track to a bachelor's degree. It is a member of the Navitas Group, which is well-known around the world. The Tertiary Education Quality and Standard Agency for higher education in Australia has authorised and accredited SIBT's programmes.After completing their diploma programme, more than 90% of SIBT graduates went on to pursue a bachelor's degree. SIBT admission benefits students since the institute provides a personalised learning method, supplementary classes, mentoring, and integrated English language help.The Sydney Institute of Business and Technology collaborates with a number of partner universities, including Western Sydney University, and students who successfully complete a SIBT certificate can continue to the second year of a university undergraduate degree. The institute now has around 450 students.

Name: Russo Business School
Overview: Russo Business School is a diverse higher education institution providing companies, professionals and students with unparalleled opportunities through innovative business, leadership and entrepreneurial programs and endeavors. Russo Business School forms part of the Sarina Russo Group, a company respected globally for delivering quality education, training and employment. "We focus on building entrepreneurs from the ground up. I believe that word will spread that this is a very different place for Learning.Sarina Russo founds "The Office" Business Academy, which focuses on secretarial training and offers the industry's most unique point of difference: free student job placement!Sarina Russo founds "The Office" International College, which offers international students English language classes and Study Tour programmes.Sarina Russo, the first female entrepreneur to privately own a Brisbane City high-rise building, moves her activities to entirely owned inner city premises, Sarina Russo Centre - 82 Ann Street.Russo Institute of Technology Australia is founded by Sarina Russo and includes English, Business, Information Technology, and Hotel and Tourism programmes.Sarina Russo has been awarded a tender by the Australian government to own and run 31 "Job Network" offices around Australia as part of Sarina Russo Job Access Australia.. Sarina Russo relocates Sarina Russo Job Access Australia's headquarters to Sarina Russo Plaza, 349 Queen Street, which she recently purchased.Sarina Russo acquired the third high-rise skyscraper in Brisbane City, Sarina Russo River Centre - 100 Eagle Street, to serve as the company's national headquarters.Sarina Russo announces the formation of Sarina Russo Schools | Australia, which includes Russo English | Australia, Russo College | Australia (Pathway to University programmes), Russo School of Hotel and Tourism | Australia, and Russo Institute | Australia, solidifying the company's position as a leading English Language and Pathway to University provider.James is offered the Bridging English Admission Program (BEEP) as a straight entry English qualification programme by Russo English | Australia.

Name: The Illawarra Business College
Overview: The Illawarra Business College is a private training institution that was founded in 1994 and has been providing high quality education to both domestic and international students since then. The college is located at Bankstown, South Wales which is also known as a cosmopolitan suburb. It offers government-accredited courses like Business Administration, Home and Community Care, Leadership and Management, Commercial Cookery and Hospitality, Aged care, etc. In addition to that, students also get several short course options in Computers, Keyboarding, PowerPoint, Processing, Spreadsheets, etc. along with some certificate and diploma courses. The international tuition fees range between $6,500 and $24,250, depending on the programs one opts for. Students get access to specialised training services where hundreds of students work under that and take part in helping others acquire necessary skills to build their career. Apart from that, several campus facilities like comfortable, well-lit classrooms, 24*7 Wi-Fi access, on-site restaurants offering discounts to students, etc. are also available here. In terms of the admission procedure for international students, applicants are required to meet certain admission requirements set by The Illawarra Business College. It strongly emphasizes on English language proficiency and expects the applicant to have an IELTS band score of 5.5, 4.5 with an ELICOS course, etc. to get in. Along with that, international students must keep their passport, visa, international driver’s license, notarized copies of your previous educational qualifications, etc. with them. Students can easily apply online using the college’s own application portal. There are several local events organised by the institution, such as randwick racing carnivals, backstage theatre tours, football, rugby, tennis, squash tournaments, darling harbor festivals, etc. The Illawarra Business College students can also take part in volunteering activities and sports teams apart from keeping themselves busy in studies.

Name: Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) - Federation University - Sydney Campus
Overview: Australian Technical and Management College (ATMC) is a nationally recognised educational institute. It was first founded in the Indian subcontinent. Registered in the Australian state of Victoria, this college has two campuses. One of them is in Sydney. This institution provides a pathway to international students seeking advanced management and business education in Australia and abroad. Australian Technical and Management College Sydney classrooms offer technologically updated teaching and learning resources and equipment. This college is associated with two leading Australian universities specializing in business and information technology - Federation University Australia (Fed) and The University of the Sunshine Coast (USC). In association with these institutes, ATMC provides graduate diplomas, master's degrees in Information Systems and Information Technology, bachelor's degrees, associate degrees, and bachelor's and master's degrees in Accounting and Business. ATMC offers training in several areas, including high-end applications software like Java Enterprise, .NET, Case Tools, etc.Besides this, it also extends training in diverse operating systems like UNIX, Linux, and XP. The laboratories at ATMC contain the latest wireless devices and multimedia workstations, Database management solutions, and high-end HP servers. ATMC offers various scholarship opportunities to students. For instance, international students can receive up to $17K towards their university course fees, and offshore students can receive 20% support. Besides this, Australian Technical Management College is presently involved in an $8 million philanthropic initiative for international students. ATMC offers job placement assistance as well. Through this, students receive complete direction related to mock interviews, resume preparation, etc.

Name: James Cook University - Townsville
Overview: James Cook University – Townsville is a public institution with three affiliated colleges: Saint Mark’s College, Saints Catholic College and John Flynn College. This campus is situated in Townsville Tropical Intelligence and Health Precinct in the Douglas suburb. More than 13,000 students are a part of this James Cook University – Townsville community, where approximately 1,500 students are international. James Cook University – Townsville campus provides courses such asbachelor'ss, Masters, Doctorate Research, Diploma, Graduate Certificate, Graduate Diploma and more. This institution provides undergraduate, online, short-term, post-graduate, and pathway courses. The university has a minimum requirement of 6.0 in IELTS.Townsville also provides financial support to eligible international students through different scholarship programs. Moreover, this university associates with more than 400 employees in various industries to offer significant job opportunities for international students.This university has five stars for skill development, student support, full-time employment, and learner engagement by the Good Universities Guide 2021. Further, this university is positioned among the top 300 universities by the QS World Rankings, U.S. News & World Report and Times Higher Education. This campus provides effective research and teaching facilities and has been positioned under 2% of acknowledged universities for graduate employability, employer satisfaction and academic excellence.
Eligibility Overview: UndergraduateYou must have completed at least 6 months of full-time study at a recognised higher education institution and earned a minimum cumulative GPA of 4.9 out of 7.0, or 65-70 percent average outcomes.You might be able to apply right after high school, but you'll need to produce your high school diploma (or equivalent). These requests will be considered on an individual basis.PostgraduateYou must have earned a bachelor's degree or its equivalent from a recognised institution of higher learning. Additional entrance requirements, if any, can be found in our Study Abroad Guide.Students applying for the Study Abroad Program as postgraduates can only study for one teaching term.English language entry requirementsStudents who do not speak English as their first language must generally verify their proficiency by passing a test such as Academic IELTS, TOEFL, or Pearson (PTE Academic). Other English language tests may be accepted as proof of proficiency in the English language.The chart shows the minimum English language requirement for the Study Abroad Program.If you meet the academic requirements but not the English language requirement, you may be eligible for a package offer to learn English before beginning your primary course of study at JCU.

Name: University of Adelaide College - Melbourne
Overview: The University of Adelaide College is the University of Adelaide's preferred pathway provider, a member of the prestigious Group of Eight universities. For the first time in its 147-year-old history, this university opened an interstate campus in 2020 at Docklands, Melbourne. This institute boasts of possessing five stars plus in QS rating. As per the Times Higher Education and the QS ranking, this university ranked in the top 1% globally. This institute provides Degree Transfer Programs, English Language Programs, Pre-Master's Programs, and Foundation Studies Programs as pathways to postgraduate and undergraduate degrees at the University of Adelaide. University of Adelaide College Melbourne provides flexibility to its students by conducting three intakes every year. Hundreds of students from China, Indonesia, Singapore, Egypt, Oman, South Korea, Hong Kong, Malaysia, India, Vietnam, and others enroll at the University of Adelaide. The University of Adelaide College – Melbourne campus offers several facilities to its students. These include an Academic support centre, Student Support team, Resource centre, Career Central, and many more. University of Adelaide College Melbourne fees for the Foundation Studies Program for all study areas range from $25,000 AUD to $30,000 AUD. Pre-Master's Program (Three Trimesters) is between $40,000 AUD and $45,000 AUD, for Pre-Master's Program Accelerated (Two Trimesters), it ranges between $20,000 AUD and $25,000 AUD for all areas of study. Besides these, students need to pay some additional fees as well. These include enrolment fees ranging between $300 AUD and $400 AUD. This institute boasts over 100 Rhodes Scholars and five Nobel Laureates. The preferred student accommodation provider of the University of Adelaide College is Scape @University of Adelaide. There are several rooms available for students here, and weekly rent includes unlimited internet access, electricity, and water.Noted Alumni of the university are Julia Gillard- First PM of Australia, Robin Warren- Nobel Prize winner, Tim Flannery- Australian of the year, J M Coetzee- Novelist and Linguist etc.

Accommodation: Homestay They will look after you and make you feel at ease while you are living with your homestay family in their home. It's also a fantastic method to practice speaking English outside the classroom.The college does not enter into a contract with the student or the homestay family, instead, it serves as a facilitator for the placement. When it comes to pairing homestay families and students, the institution takes great care, yet things don't always go as planned. Unless there are extenuating circumstances that necessitate you to change your agreement, you must stay with your homestay family for a minimum of four weeks if you are 18 or older. Under the age of 18, you must stay in your homestay for a minimum of six months or until you reach the age of eighteen, whichever comes first. An accommodation placement fee is required for all students who request homestay.  Scape @ University of Adelaide Scape @ University of Adelaide is the preferred student housing provider for the University of Adelaide College. Students will benefit from the community environment and study spaces provided, which are shared with University of Adelaide undergraduate and postgraduate students and are located across the road from the University's main campus and a short walk down Rundle Mall to the University of Adelaide College. Your weekly rent includes electricity, water, and unrestricted internet access. The property is safe and secure, with dedicated onsite personnel available 24 hours a day and swipe card access for all rooms. You'll also have access to various beautiful amenities, such as video gaming rooms, a spectacular rooftop with BBQs, a cinema, and a gym. Scape @ University of Adelaide is mandatory for all students who request it. University Village There are additional student living options available if you're seeking a different studio or shared accommodation. These houses offer low-cost solutions as well as communal facilities for socialising. The Village is a purpose-built student community in Adelaide's central business district, close to China Town and Central Market, and is a 25-minute brisk walk or a short bus ride from our College. UniLodge City Gardens UniLodge City Gardens is new student accommodation in Adelaide, with good facilities and a convenient location. Enjoy different shared facilities such as a gym, laundry rooms, community kitchen and dining area, and a state-of-the-art theatrette while studying and hanging out with your pals. Cafes, restaurants, shopping, entertainment, and the Adelaide Central Markets are all within walking distance. UniLodge City Gardens is a 15-minute walk or a short bus ride from the College. Atira Apartments Waymouth Street, where Atira Shaped by Scape is located, is in the heart of Adelaide, only a short bus ride or a brisk 15-minute walk from the CBD. Enjoy using numerous common facilities such as the gym, laundry rooms, communal kitchen, and dining space to study and hang out with your friends. Close proximity to public transportation, eateries, and shopping malls ensures that you have quick access to all of your daily needs as well as all of Adelaide's wonderful attractions. For more information, visit: https://college.adelaide.edu.au/student-life/accommodation/

Name: Victoria University - Sydney Campus
Overview: Located in the heart of Sydney's central business district, the Victoria University-Sydney Campus is a public university in Australia. It is renowned for being a dual-sector center that imparts both Technical and Further Education (TAFE) and higher education courses. The VU offers significant courses that have global recognition, attracting plenty of international students every year. VU Sydney has also been associated with the Education Centre of Australia (ECA) for over a decade. The students at VU Sydney have a chance to participate in plenty of workshops preparing them for jobs. For instance, an academic writing workshop prepares them for the job market.VU Sydney prepares students for a world of opportunities with its world-class education. As one of the top universities in the world, it prepares its students for a thriving career in current times. With its VU Block Model, the university teaches one unit simultaneously for more focused and improved learning. With more than 240,000 alumni, the alum network comprises 30,000 professionals employed by organizations, including the London Ambulance Service, Facebook, NASA, and Indonesia's Ministry of Finance.
Eligibility Overview: The minimum qualifying standards for each program that applicants from outside Victoria University must meet are as follows: The criteria for undergraduate programs are further separated into two portions, with eligibility for primary education and English proficiency differing for each:Certificates, diplomas, and advanced diplomas are the first three levels of education.Each certificate and diploma course has its own set of requirements (students need to check this on the dedicated course page on the university website) English Language Proficiency: Academic IELTS: a minimum of 5.5 bands overall (no less than 5 in each section)TOEFL: An aggregate score of 55 is required (Listening: 9, Speaking: 16, Reading: 10, Writing: 18)PTE Academic: An total score of 42-49 is required (with no section score less than 40)Advanced (CAE) at the University of Cambridge requires a minimum score of 162 overall (no less than 154 in individual sections)Achieved in VU English-English for Academic Purposes (EAP) (Level 4)
Placement: VU Sydney has more than 4000 industry partnerships that give the students more chances of getting a placement, along with free workshops designed to get them ahead in the workplace. The university is also ranked as one of the best educational institutions in Australia to equip students with employability skills. Average Salary Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) (Architectural Engineering): AUD 74400Master of Business Administration (Global): AUD 115600Bachelor of Business (Accounting): AUD 50000Bachelor of Business (Banking and Finance): AUD 50000Bachelor of Business (Marketing): AUD 50000Bachelor of Engineering (Honours) (Electrical and Electronic Engineering): AUD 65000Master of Project Management: AUD 115000

Name: Murdoch University
Overview: Established in 1973, Murdoch University is a public institute located in Perth, Australia. Over 23,000 students are enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs in 9 study areas, namely, business, engineering, and Teaching. The university has a staff of 1,700 members. Data Science, Asian Studies, Creative Media, Global Security and Extractive Metallurgy are some of the 313 courses offered here. The four Murdoch University campuses are the Perth campus, CBD campus, Mandurah campus and Rockingham campus. Students would find books, journals, articles, e-publications and numerous study spaces at the three libraries; Geoffrey Bolton Library, Mandurah Campus Library and Veterinary Library. On FutureLearn, students can access numerous Murdoch University online courses (some are free) on health, environment, technology etc. Murdoch enabling courses (online and offline) like FlexiTrack, On Track, and K-Track act like pathways for students looking to enroll at the university. Several Honours courses like Communications, Criminology and Law are available for students who wish to pursue a postgraduate program. Students can also opt to study part-time and later on switch to a full-time program. Through the Study Abroad and Exchange Program, students from Murdoch University's Singapore, Dubai and Myanmar campuses or its partner universities can study here. HELP loans, AJ Parker Memorial Scholarship, Academic Excellence Awards, Apiam Animal Health Bursary and Alumni Tuition Fee Discounts are some financial aid options. Murdoch University Villages provides housing to over 800 students in 1-6 bedroom apartments. Students can opt for off-campus housing; there are shared and independent accommodation options in the suburbs. There are over 110 Murdoch Guild clubs (Murdoch Rockers, The Singapore Link, VETSOS etc.) and several sports teams to join like cricket, athletics, badminton and netball. Some fitness facilities on campus include indoor/outdoor courts, the Lower Bush Court sports field, sports oval and The Zone Fitness Centre. According to reports, Murdoch University MBA graduates have earned an average salary of AUD 77,000.

Placement: Student work placements are an extended amount of time spent working on a defined programme under appropriate workplace supervision in the workplace of a host organisation. Students perform unpaid labour to fulfil the criteria of a vocational placement while earning academic credit for their course. Student work placements may also be known as, depending on the discipline: InternshipsPracticumsClinical placements The terms and conditions of the student work placement can be outlined in a workplace business agreement that suitable organisations can sign with Murdoch University. In accordance with our insurance policies, the agreement details the student's insurance coverage. Typically, the terms of the agreement are set for a three-year period. There is no obligation to offer positions at this time.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation Murdoch University Village is home to a thriving community of over 800 students. The village offers a variety of safe residences and recreational amenities such as a beach volleyball court, pool, study rooms, and a student lounge.You can also participate in the Live, Learn, and Grow residential living programme, which will assist you in adjusting to college life. University Village A wide variety of safe residences are available in the village, along with recreational amenities like a beach volleyball court, swimming pool, study lounges, and a student lounge.  Off-Campus Accommodation  Shared or independent accommodation Several types of shared and independent housing options are accessible to you if you want to live off-campus. Consider residing in one of the following suburbs if you want to be close to our Perth campus: Murdoch, Kardinya, Leeming, Coolbellup, Bibra Lake, North Lake, Bull Creek, Winthrop, Bateman, or Willagee. Live with an Australian family You can apply for homestay housing through the Australian Homestay Network if you are travelling to Australia from abroad and want to experience living as a member of an Australian family. Facilities provided are: When you initially get there, your host family will pick you up from the airportInteracting with your host family will help you become more fluent in EnglishWith guidance from local authorities, take advantage of the neighbourhood and cultureAttend social gatherings and meet new folksGain from the assistance and counsel offered by your host family For more information, visit: https://www.murdoch.edu.au/study/international-students/life-in-perth/accommodation
Course Ranking: In terms of course rankings, Murdoch University's PG Business and Economics programme was ranked between 301 and 400 by Times Higher Education (THE) in 2021. In 2019 and 2020, the university was ranked between 401 and 500. For those interested in pursuing PG Engineering and Technology, Times Higher Education (THE) ranked the university between 501 and 600 in 2020 and 2021. Previously, in 2018 and 2019, it received a ranking between 401 and 500.
University Ranking: Perth, Australia's Murdoch University is a public university with a focus on research that was established in 1973. For three years in a row, from 2019 to 2021, the Murdoch University has been ranked by the QS World University Ranking between 551 and 600. As part of their research process, QS World University Rankings places the greatest emphasis on academic reputation (40%) followed by faculty/student ratio and citations per faculty (20%) each. The university was ranked by The Times Higher Education (THE) between 501 and 600 for 2021 and between 401 and 500 for four straight years, from 2017 to 2020. Teaching, research, and citations are each given 30% weight in The Times Higher Education (THE). Lessons from Murdoch University The university is ranked 679 in the US News & World Report's Global Universities for 2021. Prior to this, the university was ranked 637 for 2019 and 2020. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). See FAQs about Murdoch University The university was ranked between 601 and 700 for the two years between 2018 and 2021 by the ARWU Shanghai ranking, which does not take into account an institution's reputation among academics or employers and instead ranks universities based on the calibre of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes their staff has won. Additionally, between 2017 and 2019, between 701 and 800.

Course Description: Murdoch University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Murdoch University was founded in 1973. Located in Perth,Australia the university is home to about 9553 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Murdoch University is ranked 561th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 2 undergraduate and 2 postgraduate programs. Murdoch University has 4 intakes in Feb,Jul,Aug,Sep. Name: University of Newcastle College of International Education
Overview: Newcastle University, founded in 1834, is a world-class university with a global reputation for academic brilliance. Newcastle University is a founding member of the Russell Consortium, a group of 24 UK universities with a strong research focus. The University is one of the most popular in the UK due to its high-quality teaching, strong research profile, and great student assistance.Newcastle University has over 28,000 students, including over 5,400 foreign students from over 115 countries, and is located in the heart of one of the UK's most vibrant student cities. The University has significant collaborations with institutions around the world, including IIT Delhi, IIT Bombay, and IISc Bangalore in India, as well as multinational corporations like Siemens, PwC, and IBM.Newcastle's place in national and international rankings demonstrates a commitment to academic excellence, teaching quality, and student experience. Media Studies, Engineering, Earth Sciences, Linguistics, Pharmacy and Pharmacology, among other subjects, are among the top 10 in the UK (QS World Rankings 2022). (Guardian University Guide 2020).Newcastle students benefit from a diverse range of programmes, as well as a Gold Award from the Teaching Excellence Framework and a ranking in the Top 20 most targeted universities by Times Top 100 Employers. A variety of scholarships, including 50% and 100% tuition fee waivers, are available for high-achieving undergraduate and postgraduate students.
Eligibility Overview: Undergraduate admissions: Students are required to have a minimum GPA of 2.0/4.0 or equivalent. Students should have completed at least one year of full time study at a university or other institution of higher education.

Name: Institute of Health and Management (IHM) - Sydney
Overview: Institute of Health and Management (IHM) was established in 2012 in order to provide higher education courses for nurses. It has 5 campuses across Australia, and one of them is in one of the largest cities in Australia, Sydney. IHM offers online and classroom-based lectures by a faculty consisting of highly trained clinicians. The Sydney campus, located in Central Sydney, can be easily accessed via bus, car and plane. The nursing students at this campus enjoy being placed near the famous golden beaches, Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The campus is surrounded by restaurants that serve Chinese, Indian, Korean and Italian cuisine. Institute of Health and Management (IHM) enrolls 3,000+ students across all its programmes. It has trained over 2,000 nurses. Most courses are online or available on all main campuses. It has three schools, School of Nursing, School of English and Centre of Excellence in Health Career Advancement Programmes. These three schools provide graduate diplomas and certificates in specialized fields like Paediatric nursing, Critical care nursing, Emergency and trauma nursing and many more. Institute of Health and Management (IHM) aims at enhancing the healthcare sector and thus has also launched a student referral programme that encourages students and employees to participate in Nationwide healthcare initiatives. IHM also recognises the financial strain of affording a medical degree. It gives scholarships that either cover the tuition cost or provide partial funding. Additionally, it has a Gateway to Global Nursing programme for all overseas nurses who wish to attain a nursing registration in Australia, U.S., Canada, UK and New Zealand.

Name: Institute of Health and Management (IHM) - Melbourne CBD
Overview: Institute of Health and Management (IHM) - North Melbourne is an institute that specialises in providing quality Nursing education and research opportunities. The institute was established under the Health Careers International (HCI) group and is a sister organisation to the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA). The institute offers premium postgraduate degrees for Nurses under the expertise of various nursing academics. IHM is ideal for aspirants seeking a lucrative career in the medical field and has ties with several universities globally, keeping updates on the healthcare management industry. IHM has trained over 2,000 nurses to get the basic foundation of nursing and employment and settlement in Australia. Besides providing dedicated nursing education, the institute offers World-class, fully equipped simulation labs. Students get the convenience of educator-led sessions and 24 hours online support from highly-skilled facilitators. IHM has four campuses spanning over Melbourne CBD, North Melbourne, Perth, Sydney. IHM has ties with NCAP encompassing the Gateway to Global Nursing program, helping nurses register in English-speaking countries like Canada, New Zealand etc. Furthermore, the Institute of Health and Management (IHM) ranked in the top 25 higher education institutions to provide quality education. In addition, IHM has launched the student referral program encouraging students and employees to participate in Nationwide initiatives and enhance students associated with the Health industry. The sole aim of the institute is to contribute heavily to Australia's health sector.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Sydney
Overview: Established in 1946, Institute of Health and Nursing Australia Sydney is providing healthcare training and helping students to acquire necessary knowledge and skills to build a career in nursing, health, and community services. The Sydney campus is located at Argyle Street, Parramatta, New South Wales, Australia. It is serving more than 14,000 students and providing them with research opportunities to help them excel in the healthcare sector. International students find this location ideal because of its impressive education system, friendly warmth and high standards of living. The institution has partnered with several renowned universities and education providers to offer pathway programs. It welcomes international students and also helps them in various ways, from finding the right agent to filling out visa applications. Institute of Health and Nursing Australia Sydney mainly focuses on practical learning, which is why it has collaborated with industry partners and professionals to offer internationally recognised courses. These further assists students acquire more practical knowledge and in-person experiences that help them to build their career. From Diploma of Practice Management to Certificate IV in Leadership and Management, Certificate IV in Disability, etc., students get numerous course options to study. The annual cost of education is around AUD 7,988 which further exceeds up to around AUD 29,028 after including the cost of living. However, Institute of Health and Nursing Australia Sydney students also get various perks, from internship opportunities to accommodation facilities, conditional offer letters, etc.

Name: The University of Queensland
Overview: Founded in 1909, The University of Queensland in Australia is one of six sandstone universities and a public research institute. It is known primarily for three programs; Doctor of Philosophy, Bachelor of Engineering and Bachelor of Arts, a student enrollment of over 55,305 (35,051 undergraduates and 19,939 postgraduates.). The university comprises six faculties (Science, Medicine, Business, Economics and Law etc.) and eight institutes (Global Change Institute, Queensland Brain Institute etc.) with a staff of 7,208 members. Some of the courses taught include Drama, Earth Science, Australian Studies, Agribusiness and Veterinary Science. There are three campuses, namely St. Lucia, Gatton and Herston, and several research sites. Housing over 2.17 million books, 158,000 journals and approximately 100,000 computers, The University of Queensland library system consists of over ten branches, including the Central Library, Fryer Library, Law Library and more. Students can opt for Professional Doctorate programs and Higher Degree by Research programs. The UQ College initiative prepares students for life at the university, and there are several Summer semester courses to choose from. The Study, Abroad and Exchanges program allows students from other universities to study at UQ for a semester or two. Different financial aid options are available such as Google PhD Fellowships, Sleath String Performance Prize, Science International Scholarship, Barbara Hebden Music Bursary etc. Eleven residential colleges (with dining services) like Kings College, Grace College and Emmanuel College provide accommodation on campus; there are standard, deluxe, suite, shared and other rooms. Students can choose to join one of the 220 clubs and societies like VESA UQ, One for the World and UQ Menzies or play sports like netball, tennis, badminton and boxing. Sports facilities on campus include the Aquatic Centre, Old Gym, Fitness Centre, courts and fields. UQ bachelors degree graduates have been known to earn an average starting salary of AUD 52,000- AUD 58,000.
Eligibility Overview: Minimum 7.0 in IELTS (clinical projects), with 7.0 in each sub-band.IELTS (all other disciplines): 6.5 overall, with 6.0 in each subband.Minimum 570 on the TOEFL (paper-based), 5.0 on the TWE (written), and 54 on reading and listening.TOEFL (internet-based): Minimum score of 87, with 21 points in writing, 19 points in reading, hearing, and speaking.PTE (Pearson Test of English): All sub-bands received a total score of 64, and all sub-bands received a score of 60.CES: 176 overall, with 169 in each of the sub-bandsStudents from Gujarat, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Karnataka who have completed XII grade from the CBSE, ICSE Board, or State Boards of Gujarat, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Karnataka may be able to meet the ESL criteria if they have received the university's minimum English grades. For further information, go to the university's website.

Course Ranking: Queensland University is renowned for its business programmes, and over the past five years, it has enhanced its standing among academics and educators. This can also be examined in terms of ranks. In 2018, QS Global MBA ranked it between 111 and 120th; in 2021, it was ranked at number 99. Similar improvements have been made in its Times Higher Education PG Business and Economics rankings, which have gone from 76th in 2018 to 41st in 2021. Major ranking services have decreased Queensland's standing for engineering programmes.It was ranked 60th in 2017 by QS Engineering and Technology, however in 2020 it will be ranked 76th. Additionally, its standing has dropped from 73rd in 2018 to 88th in 2021. The same is true of its computer programmes; THE's PG Computers rankings fell from 101 to 125 in 2018 to 126 to 150 in 2021. Queensland, however, gives students a lifetime learning experience with a student-faculty ratio of 13:1. Candidates who wish to study in Australia but still have reservations about admittance are encouraged to read this and get the solutions to their questions.
University Ranking: Leading public research university The University of Queensland, sometimes known as Queensland University, is headquartered in Brisbane, Queensland, Australia. It is renowned for upholding strict standards for both research and instruction. It is included among the top 100 universities in the world by all the major ranking services. Additionally, it has improved its standing on the world stage. It was placed 46th for the current year and 51st in 2017 by QS (Top Universities). Additionally, it has improved its position in US News and World Report rankings.It held the 42nd position in 2018 and the 36th position in 2021. Queensland has been ranked second nationally by the Australian Research Council, a research management project of the Australian Rudd administration. Queensland is a founding member of the prestigious Universitas 21 global network, the highly regarded Group of Eight in Australia, and the edX, a renowned online education platform founded by MIT and Harvard. Despite having a 40% acceptance rate, it is quite tough to get into Queensland, and only applicants with top academic standing will succeed.

Course Description: The University of Queensland is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. The University of Queensland was founded in 1909. Located in Brisbane,Australia the university is home to about 21000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.The University of Queensland is ranked 50th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 2 undergraduate and 6 postgraduate programs. The University of Queensland has 9 intakes in Feb, Jul, Aug,Mar, Oct,Jul, Nov,Jan, Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 1 years.The average yearly tuition fee of The University of Queensland is around 8,477 AUD-31,920 AUD.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by The University of Queensland include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to The University of Queensland is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.The University of Queensland has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: Melbourne Institute of Technology
Overview: Melbourne Institute of Technology, located in Melbourne, Australia, offers undergraduate, postgraduate, and certificate programs in various streams. The college also offers online degree programs for distance education. MIT understands students' struggles and has a learning center to help them score better in their exams. You may also register for the buddy program, where a senior will assist you through your hardships. Melbourne Institute of Technology offers scholarships and work-study. It proposes various types of funding to the students. The university offers workshops to prepare students with industry experience and provide exposure for their careers. It has a Career Planning Service team for students to build a CV or find a job after completing the degree, part-time job, or internship.The faculty and staff at MIT are taught to develop strong relationships with the students to encourage active conversation and joint learning between the two sides. Thanks to the well-chosen curriculum, students are prepared for employment the moment they graduate.
Eligibility Overview: International students must apply as early as possible, ideally 3-6 months before the commencement of the program. Intake is in Trimester 1 (Mid-March), Trimester 2 (Mid-July), and Trimester 3 (Mid-November).  While applying for graduate and undergraduate programs, the application process at Melbourne Institute of Technology is similar for all international students. Students can use online and offline modes. Students can apply by downloading application forms. There is an option to apply through Federation University Australia. The prerequisites for admission at the Melbourne Institute of Technology include successfully completing Year 12 or equivalent grades. It is also inclusive of completing successfully units 3 and units 4 of English as a second language or mathematics, mathematical methods or specialist mathematics. English Language Proficiency Since English is the language of instruction, students are required to submit proof of their proficiency. The requirements at MIT are course specific and are as given below.   Learn more about the IELTS score for Australia.

Melbourne Institute of Technology also allows international students to work while studying. Working hours are 40 hours a fortnight during the course and full-time during vacations. The career development center at MIT is responsible for your overall development. The career center ensures you're constantly upgrading your skills and conforming to the demands of the commercial world.

Living with a family can help students from other countries improve their communication skills in English and understand Australian culture better.

University Ranking: Melbourne Institute of Technology (MIT) is one of the leading universities in Australia. It is a top higher education and vocational training provider, offering various courses and qualifications. The university has a long-standing reputation for excellence in teaching and research and is recognised as one of the top universities in Australia. MIT has consistently been ranked in the top 10 universities in Australia and is currently ranked 8 in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings. It is also ranked in the top 5 universities in Victoria and one of the country's leading universities. The university strongly focuses on providing quality education and training and has an excellent record of producing highly employable graduates. It is well known for its innovative and creative approach to teaching and learning and its commitment to providing students with the best possible learning experience. MIT is also well known for its research capabilities. It has several world-class research centres, and several prestigious awards have recognised its research. The university is also a leader in technology and has developed several innovative technologies and products. MIT is also highly regarded for its commitment to social responsibility. The university has several initiatives to support the local community and promote diversity and inclusion. It is also committed to sustainability and has implemented several initiatives to reduce its environmental impact. Overall, the Melbourne Institute of Technology is one of the top universities in Australia and is highly regarded for its commitment to providing quality education and training. It is an excellent choice for students looking to pursue higher education and vocational training. Its strong reputation for excellence in teaching and research makes it a perfect choice for those looking to further their studies.

Name: Macquarie University
Overview: Located in Sydney, Australia, Macquarie University is a public research institute founded in 1964. More than 40,000 students are enrolled in undergraduate and postgraduate courses across four faculties concerning arts, engineering, business and health, taught by 2,000 staff members. The university has conferred around 9,281 degrees, and some of the courses offered here include Actuarial Studies, Chiropractic Science, Teaching, Social Science, Medicine and Indigenous Education. Double degree programs involving combinations like science, law and business are available. The Diploma, Standard Foundation and Intensive programs help students prepare for their undergraduate degrees. Students who wish to work on their English can avail the English language courses offered by the university. Several Master of Research, MPhil and PhD courses are available at the postgraduate level. Through the study abroad program, students worldwide get the opportunity to spend a semester/year at Macquarie University. Furthermore, the exchange program comprising the PACE program and The Global Leadership Program enables students to participate in language classes, extracurricular courses and practical programs at partner institutes worldwide. Financial aid is available as scholarships, grants, loans and bursaries like Asia Society Scholarships, Short Term Study Abroad, Global MBA Loyalty Scheme and New Colombo Plan Mobility Grant. Macquarie University MBA graduates have been known to earn an average salary of AUD 130,000.
Eligibility Overview: International students must get one or more of the following credentials in order to apply for an undergraduate programme:A recognised senior secondary school diploma or university admissions test (Australian equivalent)A foundational course at a recognised universityA two- or three-year diploma, advanced diploma, or associate degree that is recognisedA minimum of one year of study toward a university degree at an accredited institution Academic Requirements by Nation Indian applicants must meet certain (minimum) requirements in order to be admitted to Macquarie University, including language competency and school/college grades. The following criteria are followed by Macquarie for undergraduate admissions: All India Senior School Certificate (AISSC): CBSE should base scores on the average of the top four academic subjects. The Indian Higher Secondary Certificate (HSSC): The average of all subjects will be used to compute state board scores. Indian School Certificate (ISC):  Scores will be computed using the average of the top three academic electives in addition to English. Following are the minimum passing marks for group A (percentage) and group B (point system) in postgraduate programmes: Group A: 50% (second class), while WAM is between 50% and 60%. Group B: Grade C or 5.0(Pass) while WAM ranges from 5.0 to 6.0  English Language Proficiency

University Ranking: Macquarie Institution is a Sydney, Australia-based public research university that was established in 1964. In terms of Macquarie University rankings, the university has been placed between 201 and 300 by ARWU Shanghai Ranking for three years in a row, from 2012 to 2020. The ARWU Shanghai ranking chooses to rank universities by taking into account the calibre of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes their staff has won as part of their ranking methodology rather than taking into account an institution's reputation among academics or employers.For the year 2023, the university is ranked #195 in the world by QS World University Rankings and #175 in the world by Times Higher Education. While Times Higher Education (THE) accords equal weight to Teaching, Research, and Citations at 30% each, QS places the greatest emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Faculty/Student Ratio and Citations per Faculty at 20% each. We can observe that this ranking for both ranking providers is an improvement over its prior ranking. Check out the Macquarie University Admissions 2023 page.The university was ranked at #207 for 2022 by US News & World Report, which specifically uses global research reputation, regional research reputation, and the number of publications cited (12.5% each) among other ranking parameters, which is also a significant increase from its previous position of #217 in 2021.Macquarie University Ranking

Name: Stotts College - Sydney
Overview: Mr Sydney Stott established the Stotts College in 1883, aiming to become a pioneer in education and academics. The college received its accreditation from the Australian Community Workers Association (ACWA) and has extended its services to include high school and graduate courses. With more than 3000 students, Stotts College has been a pioneer in Australian academics for the past 138 years. It currently offers services across three significant departments, including the Higher Education (Bachelor Degree) program, Vocational (Diploma) program and VCE (Victorian Certificate of Education). The USP of the college is in its quality of education from the tutors. Some of the popular areas of study in undergraduate and vocational training courses include Business studies, Healthcare, Civil construction, Accounting, Tourism and hospitality, Social work etc. In addition, the students here have the opportunity to indulge in facilities such as technical laboratories, libraries and resources, residential halls, central Wi-Fi, student kitchen services and others. The Melbourne campus can be considered as the central campus. The conveyance benefits and accommodations have popularized this campus. The current acceptance rate of the college shows its less selective nature, which has enabled it to accommodate more than 391 international students at present. Stotts College ranking is currently at 203rd place among all the secondary schools in Victoria. The classes here maintain a standard student-faculty ratio to keep small class sizes. The tuition fees set for international students is between $50,000 and $55,000, which can be burdensome for most students. The placement facilities offered here include weekly work placement seminars. It helps the students learn the details of the employability requirements and skills, including tips for creating resumes, internship programs, interviews, work etiquettes, customer handling and various others. This way, students receive employment quickly in their careers.
Eligibility Overview: IN ORDER TO ENTER FIRST YEAR Year 12 or its equivalent is required. The age requirement is 18 years old.International students must additionally show that they can communicate in English at an IELTS level of 6.0. (Academic).Completion of an IELTS 6.0 exam at an official IELTS testing centre or an equivalent recognised English language test within the previous twelve months of the student's proposed start date for the Bachelor programmes, with an overall score of 6 and no single band lower than 5.5 (see policy – International Student Admission Policy).
Accommodation: Off-Campus AccommodationAccommodationSydney offers a wide variety of accommodation to suit students in either share houses or private residences that can hold an entire family. Choose from apartment living in the cosmopolitan inner city, or a spacious house or unit with a garden in the picturesque suburbs. It’s a city renowned for its high quality, safe student accommodation in a range of settings. For Off-Campus Accommodation https://www.stotts.edu.au/student-services/living-information-sydney/

Name: The University of Western Australia
Overview: The University of Western Australia is the oldest research lead university in Australia. Established in 1911, the university has two campuses in Swan River, Perth, and UWA Albany, located in Albany's Old Post Office Building. The Perth campus has a mix of heritage architecture and contemporary structures containing teaching, research facilities, lecture-based performance theatres, studios, subject-specific laboratories, and tutorial spaces. UWA provides high-tech academics on its Albany campus, including the UWA Albany centre, excellence in natural resource management, and rural clinical school. The university offers more than 290 bachelor's and master's programs through six faculties and schools. The programs are offered in agriculture, environment & biological sciences, architecture, design & planning, business & commerce, education, engineering, humanities & social sciences, and law. The most popular programs are offered in arts, biomedical sciences, business, science, and philosophy. Research institutes at the university include Ocean Institute, Center for Software Practice, and Center for Energy and Minerals. The average fee for a bachelor's degree is around AUD 42,540 and AUD 47,696 for a master's degree. The average cost of living is around AUD 8,662 per annum. The institution offers financial aid, including university-funded scholarships and loans for international students to study in Australia. The University of Western Australia is ranked among the top universities for graduate employment, research, and academic facilities. Pre-placement programs and career centre workshops are provided for students during the course duration for jobs and internships.
Eligibility Overview: Minimum RequirementsA Year 11 qualification or equivalent is the minimum academic prerequisite for entry to the WAUFP. The programme is for overseas students who speak English as a second language and whose academic performance in their native country does not qualify them for direct admittance into a Western Australian institution.Check for more details: https://www.uwa.edu.au/study/international-students/courses-and-entry-requirements#:~:text=The%20minimum%20academic%20requirement%20for,into%20a%20Western%20Australian%20university.
Placement: Nil
