Name: Stanley College - Mirrabooka
Overview:
In 2008, Stanley International College Pty. Ltd. or Stanley College was founded as a Registered Training Organization. Later in 2019, Stanley College got registered with the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA) as an approved Higher Education Provider. Additionally, it is also registered with the Commonwealth Register of Institutions and Courses for Overseas Students (CRICOS) to offer Bachelor of Business {CRICOS Course Code: 0100538} degree to international students in Australia on a student visa. 
Stanley College provides English Courses, Vocational Courses, and Professional Year programs. This college offers degrees in General English for students looking to improve their English language skills. Additionally, Vocational courses are available in Hospitality, Business and Leadership, Health, Early Childhood Education, Cookery and others. Other than these, professional year courses are Accounting Professional Year Program and Australian Computer Society Professional Year Program. 
The tuition fee for Stanley College – Mirrabooka depends as per course. For example, the Australian Computer Society Professional Year Program has a tuition fee of $11,000, and has an application fee of $230. This course is 32 weeks in duration, and an additional 12 weeks is needed for the ICT internship.   
Stanley College has partnered with Perth Convention and Exhibition Centre, Chamber of Commerce and Industry, WA, Novotel Hotels and Resorts, CISWA, Mercure Hotels, Government of Western Australia Department of Training and Workforce Development, etc. Stanley College offers various activities for its students. While studying at Stanley College, students can perform activities like Cycling, Surfing, Rock Climbing and others. 
Stanley College - Mirrabooka provides opportunities for international students to study in Australia. With its courses in various disciplines, students can choose their preferable courses per their requirements. The duration of the courses also varies with the program.

Name: Charles Sturt University
Overview: Charles Sturt University is a public university established in 1989 in New South Wales, Australia. It has three faculties, namely Arts and Education, Business, Justice and Behavioural Sciences, and Science which are further divided into schools and centres. More than 43,697 students (of which 10,623 are international students) are enrolled in undergraduate (85+), postgraduate and research programs. Some of the courses taught here are Viticulture, Speech Pathology, Applied Finance, Criminal Justice and Gerontology. There are six Charles Sturt University campuses; Dubbo, Albury-Wodonga, Orange, Bathurst and Wagga Wagga, and several specialist campuses and study centres. Multiple printed and online resources can be found at the six campus libraries and the three study centre libraries. The university offers over 250 online courses across undergraduate and postgraduate programs in Social Work, Business Administration and Medical Laboratory Science. To help students acquire professional skills, it provides several short online courses such as micro-credentials and single subjects. Moreover, those who wish to experience university-level academics can opt for the free online Open Pathways courses. Students from other universities can study at Charles Sturt University through the Cross-institutional learning program online or offline. The study abroad program allows students to participate in short-term programs, exchanges with 50+ partners worldwide, global internships, work placements, volunteer work and more. Financial assistance is available to students in loans, grants, bursaries, awards and scholarships like HELP loans, Emergency Equity Grant, Australian Government Scholarships, CAL Scholarship etc. Traditional and modern student accommodation is provided on six campuses, at Macquarie Village, Traditional Diggings, Spring Creek Village etc. Residential options include en-suite, shared, single rooms, cottages, apartments and more. Students can join several clubs and societies and participate in competitive/social sports such as rugby, hockey and netball. According to placement reports, Charles Sturt University graduates earn an average starting salary of AUD 67,100.
Eligibility Overview: For Undergraduate Students :Completion of the All India Senior School Certificates, where awarded by CBSE and metro state boards. Name: Imagine Education Australia - Ashmore
Overview: Image Education is a private institute imparting English language training to students since 2005. It offers vocational programs and short courses to prepare students according to international industry standards through short duration courses. It has four campuses in Australia; Imagine Education Australia Ashmore is the most renowned one for its exclusive infrastructure and faculties. English is the backbone for success in any career; therefore, good command of this language is essential. Imagine education endeavors to bridge this gap and create a world-class learning environment for higher school students aspiring to kick-start their careers in the corporate world. It has a state-of-art classroom, advent technologies, and a proper learning environment with white-board technology. They are compliant under National Training Packages and VET Quality Framework. Imagine Education Australia Ashmore courses are commercial cooking, automotive, hospitality, etc. It has laboratories, kitchens, classrooms, workshops with technology, equipment, and internet facilities to accomplish the training and learning process. Imagine Education Australia Ashmore tuition fee is AUD 8,115, cost of living is AUD 21,041, and there is no application fee. The overall yearly cost is AUD 29,156, which is highly affordable and competitive among peer colleges in Australia. They provide accommodation and internships during the course. Moreover, some scholarship schemes are there to support students' financial needs. Among the total number of courses, 46% are in business, management, and economics. 37% of courses are for English language training for higher school students, 6% are in Engineering and technology, and 6% are in other subjects. For an exclusive infrastructure, training, and placement structure, many students worldwide take admission here.

Name: Western Sydney University
Overview: Western Sydney University, formerly known as the University of Western Sydney, was founded in 1989 by the merger of two universities. The multi-campus university ranks among the top public universities in Australia. Penrith, Blacktown, Campbelltown, Parramatta, Hawkesbury and Bankstown are the campuses providing academic, residential and recreational facilities covering 1713.5 ha. The university offers over 400 undergraduate and postgraduate programs across 16 different subjects. Law, Medicine, Social Sciences, Psychology, Humanities and Business are top-rated courses while Civil Engineering, Nursing, Agricultural Sciences, Ecology, Sociology, Education and Tourism are highly ranked. Online programs and a wide range of pathway programs are also present for students at different levels. The admissions at Western Sydney University are selective, merit-based and sent on the official website or through an agent. The scores of IELTS, TOEFL and PTE, are taken into account along with Academic Transcripts, Award Certificates, Supplementary Documents Information and LORs if required. The average undergraduate tuition fee amounts to 27,662 AUD, while the living expenses per year can vary from 19,713 AUD - 24,878 AUD, for which around 32 scholarships, ranging from 5,019 - 9,893 AUD, are awarded. International students are offered merit-based scholarships like Western Sydney International Scholarships and Vice-Chancellor's Academic Excellence Scholarships to provide financial aid. On-campus accommodation with facilities like student lounge with communal kitchen, TV lounge, computer and study rooms, BBQ area, free internet and well-equipped libraries at 160 to 320 AUD per week is provided in self-catered, fully furnished rooms. Western Sydney also has 270 clubs and organizations to help in the overall development of students. Almost 83.4% of undergraduates and 91.5% postgraduates are offered jobs within four months of graduation with an average salary of 89,000 AUD. Some career-specific programs such as Career Mentoring, Women in Science and Engineering and Career-Launch programs are organized at Western Sydney University to ensure part-time and full-time employment opportunities for students.
Eligibility Overview: To be considered for admission to WSU Australia, an applicant must meet the minimal academic and English language criteria. The university also has a minimum age restriction, requiring that the applicant be at least 18 years old when applying. International applicants under this age limit must meet particular conditions in order to be considered for admission. International students must meet the same requirements as Australian citizens. The qualifications listed below are simply the minimal requirements for admission and do not guarantee a spot at the university. Special or higher entry criteria, as well as necessary job experience, may apply to some courses. Course-specific criteria can be found in this guidebook.For each course, the university has country-specific prerequisites, which are as follows for Indian aspirants:University Foundation Studies (three semesters)Year 11 completed successfully with an overall grade of:50 percent CBSE50 percent ISC65 percent of state boardsUniversity Foundation Studies (two semesters)Year 11 completed successfully with an overall grade of:60 percent CBSE60 percent ISC75 percent of state boardsDiploma (three semesters)Completion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with a (best four) average score:50 percent CBSE50 percent ISC55 percent of state boardsDiploma (two semesters)Completion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with a (best four) average score:55 percent CBSE55 percent ISC65 percent of state boardsa bachelor's degreeCompletion of the Higher Secondary Certificate with a (best four) average score:60 percent CBSE60 percent ISC70 percent of state boardsa master's degreeCompletion of a recognised Bachelor's degree that is comparable to an Australian degree
Placement: Through supporting placements and work-integrated learning activities, the Placements Hub provides leadership and coordination of a university-wide approach to the operationalization and administration of partnership pedagogy. Curriculum is aligned with legislative and accreditation frameworks, university regulations, and administrative activities through the Hub.For More:https://www.westernsydney.edu.au/placements_hub

The Business & Economics course maintained its ranking in 2021 as well. If we look at Western University's list of engineering programmes according to THE, the PG Engineering & Technology course has held onto its place from the previous year. The course was in the 301-400th position in 2021 and 2022. The university's Psychology programme is ranked in the top 200 by the Times Higher Education for 2022. The Psychology course falls between #176 and 200 in 2022. In addition, according to the Times Higher Education rankings for 2022, courses in the arts and humanities, life sciences, education, and social science are among the top 250. These programmes are all ranked between 201 and 250 in 2022.
University Ranking: Western Sydney University is known around the world for its capabilities in research and teaching innovations. This is the reason why every year, students from over 70 different nations choose to study abroad here. Western Sydney University is one of the top 250 universities in the world, per the Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2022. Western Sydney University's THE rating for 2022 is 201-250. If we compare the current rankings to those from the previous two years, the university's standing in THE rankings has improved. Western Sydney University was ranked between 251 and 300th in the Times Higher Education rankings for the years 2020 and 2021. View Admissions at Western Sydney University In 2022, Western Sydney University's QS ranking was 494; in 2023, it was ranked between 501 and 510. Employer reputation, academic reputation, faculty to student ratio, international student ratio, citations per faculty and international faculty ratio are the factors used to produce the QS World University Rankings. Western Sydney is ranked 247 globally in 2022 according to U.S. News & World Report. US News uses a variety of indicators, including publications, books, conferences, and regional and global research reputation, to determine the rankings of the world's universities.

Name: Federation University - Berwick
Overview: The Berwick campus of Federation University is situated 40 kilometers southeast of Melbourne's city center. It is accessible through an outstanding rail network. The Wurundjeri and Boon Wurrung peoples are this region's traditional custodians. This university's multi-level complex featuring modern architecturally-engineered buildings is surrounded by spacious grounds with internal courtyards and landscaped gardens. Students can also take advantage of the various nearby facilities at the Berwick Village Centre. The Federation University Berwick campus comprises several schools. These include School of Arts, School of Education, Federation Business School, School of Health, School of Science, Psychology and Sport, School of Engineering, Information Technology and Physical Sciences. Besides this, the campus houses the Aboriginal Education Centre, Centre for Learning Innovation and Professional Practice (CLIPP), Nursing labs, PC Laboratories, Student Lounge, Science Labs, and many more. Students can benefit from the ASK (Academic Skills and Knowledge) program that supports their study skills development. The ASK team comprises experienced student leaders. They assist the students by answering every question they have during their undergraduate degree, from finding a booklist to referencing. Students, staff and community members of this campus get to avail themselves of an array of accommodation options through Fedliving. These are available for long, short, and medium-term stays with flexible options. The various broad, cross-disciplinary research priority areas of this institute are Society and the environment, Virtual, digital and computational environments, and Health and wellbeing. Research at Federation University received ratings at or above world standard in 80% of the submitted FoR (Fields of Research).
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate: Completion of the Indian School Certificate or the All India Senior School Certificate with a 60 per cent averageOR65 per cent on average for the Higher Secondary Certificate (State Board) Postgraduate: The applicant must have earned an Australian bachelor's degree or an abroad equivalent with a minimum stipulated CGPA or grades in order to apply for admission to a postgraduate course (coursework). For admission to a non-research-based postgraduate school, such as an MBA, some programmes may also require verifiable job experience:It's necessary to have a top-notch degree and related professional experience, andIELTS 6.0 (with no less than 6.0 in any section) Research programme: Aspirants must have a suitable master's degree and a compelling research proposal in order to be admitted to postgraduate research programmes. To demonstrate the ability to conduct PhD-level research, the candidate must have met the requirements for a master's degree, which must include a dissertation. English Requirements:

Placement: Various organisations assign students to on-campus placements. A professional development programme called the Career Accelerate Program (CAP) helps students improve their employability and skills. All FedUni students have access to CAP, a requirement of the Industry Placement Program. A job can be posted on the university's electronic job board by a company registered with the CareerHub system. Employers may publishPart-time or temporary jobsJobs in the discipline for graduates and students According to the 2018 Graduate Outcomes Survey, 89.5 per cent of undergraduates were employed, with 78.3 per cent of Federation University's undergraduates having full-time jobs, which is higher than the 72.9 per cent national average. In the 2018 Employer Satisfaction Survey, the university scored 91 per cent, placing it first among all Australian universities for employability satisfaction. According to reports, most students continue to live and work in the areas where they attended school, boosting the local economy. Graduates from postgraduate programmes work in the regions to 63%.
Accommodation: Various lodging alternatives are available in residences spread out throughout Ballarat, including flexible catering, units, houses, and apartments that are both on and off-campusEach Peter Lalor apartment has a kitchen/common space, two bathrooms, and one study bedroom, and it can house between 10 and 12 students. Single bedrooms with shared bathrooms are available in Peter Lalor Hall. Residents of Peter Lalor can easily stroll to their lessonsOn the Mt. Helen Campus, you may find Bella Guerin Hall. Bella Guerin Hall consists of independent, two-story structures that can each house 11 students and share a kitchen, living room, dining area, and two bathroomsJemacra Place is ideally situated near public transportation and a commercial centre with a grocery, chemist, butcher, and post office. It is only a short distance from the Mt Helen Campus. This student community's five- and six-bedroom residences include a paved outside space with a pergola, landscaped gardens, two bathrooms, a fully equipped kitchen, living, dining, and laundry facilitiesCamp Street is located in the centre of Ballarat, close to dining establishments, nightclubs, retail centres, and movie theatres. The flats have four-bedroom units with fully equipped kitchens, communal areas, and ensuite studio rooms with kitchenettes. The University's lecture halls, studios, and galleries are placed above the apartments and ensuite roomsSix students can stay in spacious bed/study suites at the Victoria Street House, a sizable historic home. The occupants can access a well-equipped self-catering kitchen, dining area, roomy TV room, and laundry facilities. Additionally, a sizable self-catering kitchen is available. Twelve students can stay in spacious single rooms with bathrooms at the Victoria Street Hotel

Name: The University of Newcastle
Overview: The University of Newcastle is a public university in New South Wales, Australia. The university was founded in 1965 as Newcastle University. It is well known for pioneering changes in the medical education system in Australia, introducing a problem-based approach and the Undergraduate Medical and Health Services Admission Test (UMAT), which has now been adopted across the country. The university has five faculties offering certificate programs and undergraduate, graduate and doctoral degrees. The top courses at the University of Newcastle include Bachelor of Medical Science, Masters in Cyber Security and Masters of Business Administration (MBA).The university's main campus is spread across 346 acres of land in Callaghan, Newcastle. It is the largest campus and home to all the university's primary faculties, offices, and student administration centres. The university also has an international campus located in Singapore. The university's diverse and active student community aids in holistic development throughout the course. There are over 100 registered student organizations and clubs, providing students with an opportunity to interact and collaborate with fellow students outside of academics. The university also conducts innovative events and activities throughout the year, such as Band Camp and Student Engagement Awards, to promote student welfare on campus. The average cost of tuition per annum varies between AUD 29,500 and 39,000 depending on the program chosen and the duration.
Eligibility Overview: Minimum GPA requirementsStudents must have a minimum GPA of 2.0/4.0 or comparable to be considered for undergraduate admission. Students must have completed one year of full-time study at a university or other higher education institution.Students must have obtained a bachelor's degree in a suitable discipline to be considered for postgraduate admission.Gap year admissions: Students must submit a completed high school transcript, which will be evaluated on an individual basis.  English requirements

Name: Victoria University
Overview: Located in Melbourne, Victoria, Victoria University is a public research and dual-sector tertiary institution founded in 1916. Approximately 40,000 students are enrolled in training, vocational education and degree courses across six colleges. The university comprises VU College, Victoria University Business School, School for the Visitor Economy, First Year College and School for Transport Systems & Civic Infrastructure. Some courses offered include Youth Work, Sports Management, Psychological Studies, Nursing and Business Administration. Through Victoria University Online, students can pursue numerous undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma and certificate courses from home. Pathway courses (Law, Business, Education, Arts etc.) allow students to transition between different levels, as do the 13-week foundation courses. Some of the university's short courses (for skill development) include professional and personal development courses, job-ready courses and single units of study. Scholarships, grants, bursaries, awards and loans are available as financial aid like the Higher Education Loan Program, VU Alumni Discount, Australia Awards fellowships, Indigenous Commonwealth scholarships etc.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?The following are the minimal program-specific eligibility requirements that overseas applicants must achieve before applying to Victoria University:Eligibility Requirements for Undergraduates —The criteria for undergraduate programmes are further separated into two portions, with eligibility for basic education and English proficiency differing for each:Certificates, diplomas, and advanced diplomas are the first three levels of education.Basic Instruction:Each certificate and diploma course has its own set of requirements (students need to check this on the dedicated course page on the university website)Proficiency in English (either):Academic IELTS: a minimum of 5.5 bands overall (no less than 5 in each section)TOEFL: An aggregate score of 55 is required (Listening: 9, Speaking: 16, Reading: 10, Writing: 18)PTE Academic: An total score of 42-49 is required (with no section score less than 40)Advanced (CAE) at the University of Cambridge requires a minimum score of 162 overall (no less than 154 in individual section)Achieved in VU English - English for Academic Purposes (EAP) (Level 4)Bachelor's Degrees Basic Instruction:Grade 12 in relevant discipline equivalent to an Australian Year 12 certificateProficiency in English (either):Academic IELTS: Minimum of 6 bands overall (no less than 6 in each section)TOEFL: An aggregate score of 67 is required (Listening: 12, Speaking: 18, Reading: 15, Writing: 21)PTE Academic: A minimum total score of 50-67 is required (with no section score less than 50)CAE: Minimum total score of 169 (no less than 169 in individual section) Achieved VU English – EAP (Level 5)

Course Description: Victoria University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Victoria University was founded in 1916. Located in Melbourne - Aus,Australia the university is home to about 14000 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Victoria University is ranked 701th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 6 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. Victoria University has 5 intakes in Feb,May,Jul,Oct,Jan. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Victoria University is around AUD 30400 - 35600 Approx.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Victoria University include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Victoria University is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Victoria University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of New South Wales
Overview: Founded in 1949, the University Of New South Wales is an open research public university in Kensington, New South Wales, Australia. Earlier known as the New South Wales University of Technology, the university has two colleges in Newcastle and Wollongong. With more than 64,000 students, the University Of New South Wales has six faculties, UNSW Faculty of Arts, Design & Architecture; UNSW Faculty of Business; UNSW Faculty of Engineering; UNSW Faculty of Law & Justice; UNSW Faculty of Medicine & Health; UNSW Faculty of Science. Eligibility criteria for admission in 284 postgraduates, 142 undergraduates, and doctoral degree courses are based on IELTS, TOEFL, PTE, and GMAT.The 94 acres of the main campus contain several research buildings. Several facilities like theatre and music venues, fitness centers, medical assistance, pharmacy, restaurants, pools, shops, etc., are provided to students. University Of New South Wales claims a placement rate of 94.3%, with the average package of graduates between AUD 120,000 and AUD 160,000. The residential accommodation options at the university are 11 colleges and four halls. Each residential block facilitates students through the internet, laundry, catering, study area, and parking services. With an admission fee of AUD 125, students can apply in 3 terms (November, March, and July) with the per-credit tuition fee of AUD 935 and AUD 735 for undergraduate and postgraduate courses, respectively. The enrolled students can get financial aid up to AUD 10,000 under UNSW Business School Scholarship, UNSW Art and Design International Scholarship, and University International Postgraduate Award.

Placement: Internal Internships and Work Placements Complete an internship to improve your professional skills and obtain real-world experience. An internship is a fantastic approach to getting professional experience and confidence in the workplace. In some cases, you can acquire real industry exposure, which can improve your employability greatly. The following programmes have been approved for inclusion on your Australian Higher Education Graduation Statement as eligible for recognition (AHEGS). Construction Management and Property Work Experience Program In the construction management and property management industries, producing work-ready graduates is critical. Graduates who are ready to work will improve the program's reputation and position in the construction and property industries. Internships, cadetship programmes, and other work experience activities related to the sector are encouraged for Construction Management and Property Program students. Students will acquire real work experience, allowing them to put their classroom learning into practice and learn independently from business techniques and culture. To participate, students must meet the following requirementsInterested students can apply at any time by sending an email to the programme coordinatorPlease note that this opportunity is exclusively open to Construction Management and Property Program undergraduate students Graduate Advantage Program The Graduate Advantage Program (GAP) collaborates with some of Australia's most prestigious firms to provide students with an intensive and one-of-a-kind professional development programme designed to offer you the "graduate advantage" and set you apart from the competition. GAP will assist participants in the development of personal and professional skills, as well as provide a better understanding of the corporate world and increase their employability. To participate, students must meet the following requirementsBe in their final year of studiesBe Australian citizens or Permanent Residents in AustraliaWAM with a CR average or aboveShould be pursuing a degree through the UNSW Business School, the Faculty of Engineering, Science, Law, or the Faculty of Arts and Social SciencesBe available from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. for the full weekCompletion of online questionnaires, interviews, curriculum vitae, and a copy of your academic transcript are all required Industry Training Internship, UNSW Co-op Program Prior to graduation, students can participate in Industry Training Experience (ITE) placements to earn degree-relevant employment experience. Each ITE placement is a unique learning opportunity that enhances academic courses. Scholars are expected to follow professional performance, attire, and business hours during ITE, as well as complete relevant duties and obligations. To participate, students must meet the following requirements A limited number of 3-6 month internship postings are available from time to time at the Co-op office, with the goal of developing professional and management skills to aid in the successful and effective transition to graduate employment. Applicants must have a credit WAM to be considered. Please keep in mind that these internships are only accessible in a few Co-op Program fields of study. A direct application to the UNSW Co-op Program office is required.  Internships, Arc @ UNSW Through the Arc Internship Program, you can acquire hands-on industry experience in your chosen field of study as an Arc member. The Arc Internship Program can help you obtain practical skills that will look great on your resume and help you gain a competitive advantage once you graduate from university. To participate, students must meet the following requirements: For the following year's intake, applications open in October and close in November.Interviews: Start in NovemberStart Dates: Interns will go through an induction session in January before starting their internship in February  UNSW Co-NNECTIONS Co-NNECTIONS is a one-of-a-kind professional development programme at UNSW that aims to improve the educational and career outcomes of students from all walks of life.Participants participate in a variety of professional development events designed to gradually increase confidence and skills while establishing a community of like-minded peers over the course of two semesters. A leadership camp, alumni mentoring, industry training, and for some, a paid professional internship are all possibilities. To participate, students must meet the following requirements Equity students who have completed at least two terms of study are eligible for the programme. During the third term, students will be recruited for the next intake.  UNSW Student Industry Placements   Employers can take advantage of the Diploma of Professional Practice (DPP) work placement programme by bringing a UNSW student's excitement, energy, and entrepreneurial spirit to their workplace. At the same time, create opportunities for recent graduates to learn new skills in the job. The Diploma of Professional Practice Employers are seeking graduates that are job-ready in today's increasingly competitive job market. UNSW students can earn a Diploma of Professional Practice (DPP) to help them build the skills they need to stand out in the crowd. You are assisting UNSW students in gaining a better grasp of the workplace and getting a head start in their careers by hosting a student industrial placement.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation It's all about community, convenience, independence, and comfort when you live on campus. It's also a matter of decision. They have something for everyone, and you'll be surrounded by a network of knowledgeable and helpful advisors. More than that, they foster a sense of community that promotes the development of new friendships and experiences that are necessary for a successful university experience.University can be intimidating, particularly for first-year students. When you choose to live on campus, you have access to a vibrant community of peers and residents, as well as a vast network of talented and supportive advisors who are there to assist you whenever you need it. Autonomous option Colombo House Colombo House is a hybrid option that allows you to cook and clean your own meals while still being a part of a vibrant college community. Educational option Fig Tree Hall Fig Tree Hall is a strong and distinct family-like environment centred on the values of respect and inclusion among its large and diverse student body. continue to be a member of a vibrant collegiate community. Community option International House For 170 coeducational inhabitants, the College offers a home away from home. A living tradition of scholarship & support The Kensington Colleges Being a part of The Kensington Colleges, which are made up of three collegiate communities: Basser, Goldstein, and Philip Baxter, is like being a part of UNSW's rich heritage. Convenient option UNSW Hall UNSW Hall is an oldie but a goodie that offers excellent value. It's a building with a long and illustrious past, as well as a community with a bright future. For more information, visit: https://accommodation.unsw.edu.au/colleges  USNW Apartments UNSW apartments, whether on or off-campus, provide undergraduates and postgraduates, as well as couples and families with children, an independent, self-sufficient way of life. The city centre, Sydney's gorgeous beaches and turquoise waters, Centennial Park, Sydney Airport, major commercial areas, and bus routes are all within easy reach of UNSW's independent living housing.  Flatmate option Barker Street The Barker Street Apartments are located on the UNSW campus, and while most of the homes are shared five-bedroom apartments, there are some possibilities for couples and families. Options for students with families High Street High Street Apartments, across the road from UNSW, are for couples and families with children, allowing you to blend family life with studies. Abode of convenience University Terraces The University Terraces are attractive, cheap, modern, and conveniently located on campus in the heart of UNSW, providing the best in independent living. Hall option Jacaranda Hall Jacaranda Hall is a residence hall for students that aims to create a safe and comfortable living environment. For more information, visit: https://accommodation.unsw.edu.au/apartments  For general enquiries, visit: https://accommodation.unsw.edu.au/

Name: Algonquin College - Perth
Overview: Established in 1967, Algonquin College was developed during the establishment of Ontario’s College system. It has a partnership with some reputed organisations and universities such as Carleton University, Shopify and the University of Ottawa. The college has three campuses, and one of them is situated in Eastern Ontario, between Ottawa and Kingston. The institution provides several undergraduate and post-graduate degree programs. The academic structure of this institution comprises a comprehensive range of subjects classified into various faculties. Algonquin College courses include different programs varying from Health Community to Business. Among the different Algonquin College courses, some of the popular ones include- IT, Nursing, Tourism Management etc. The college offers scholarships and awards for meritorious students, recognising their skills. This college offers approximately 357 college programmes on different campuses along with advanced diplomas, diplomas and certificates. Moreover, this college provides 19 apprenticeship programs and nearly 27 full-time online programs. With an employment rate of 97%, the students of this college are generally employed by some of the top Canadian organisations.

Name: Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - Victoria (Mildura)
Overview:
Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) falls under a registered training organisation (RTO) and it is located at 113 Burgundy Street, Heidelberg, Victoria, Australia. The Melbourne campus boasts training programs in various areas of study, for instance, Allied Health and Community Services courses, Leadership and Management, Business, etc. The college is now associated with the automotive industry and the first workshop was established in Melbourne. 
The Victoria (Melbourne) campus of Education Training & Employment Australia welcomes Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students, including those who are from different cultural backgrounds, and have diverse work and life experiences. The application process involves applying via its official website; however, international students are required to follow certain instructions in this regard. They have to go through some English language tests like PTE, TOEFL, CAE, etc., and the minimum IELTS score should be 5.5. 
The approximate annual cost of education while studying in this college is AUD 4,000. There are several funding options provided by the local state Government which can help students finance this. The department of Education Training & Employment Australia boasts qualified faculty members who provide high-quality training to instil the required skills students need.  
Furthermore, students also get access to library and accommodation facilities, registered automotive workshops, fully equipped clinical labs, etc.

Name: Academy of Information Technology (AIT) - Melbourne
Overview: Academy of Information Technology (AIT) Melbourne is a creative technology educator offering higher education and vocational training in animation, gaming, 3D designs, filmmaking, and IT App design. The institute offers bachelor's degree and diploma certificates to cater to a larger segment of students. It has an award-winning campus and state-of-the-art technological resources to provide world-class education to students across the world, both virtually and on campus. Melbourne campus has been operational since 2015 and offers customised learning, standard equipment, and industry-approved academic resources. It also employs a wide network of professional experts and trainers to provide students with a more fulfilling course experience. They also have competitive scholarships and loans for students who would require external funding. The college aims to transform creative minds into sought-after industry leaders and has one of the highest records in churning out many creative artists and industry stalwarts to meet the increasing demand for dynamic and upcoming sectors like game and application development. They train the students to make compelling content and conceptualise documentaries, branded content, and corporate videos on the digital platform. The main focus is on interactive media, art and design. Academy of Information Technology bridges the gap between the industry and the prospective professionals by balancing the supply-demand system of manpower in the sphere of digital media art platforms

Name: Stotts College - Melbourne
Overview: Mr. Sydney Stott established the Stotts College in 1883, aiming to become a pioneer in education and academics. The college received its accreditation from the Australian Community Workers Association (ACWA) and has extended its services to include high school and graduate courses. With more than 3000 students, Stotts College has been a pioneer in Australian academics for the past 138 years. It currently offers services across three significant departments, including the Higher Education (Bachelor Degree) program, Vocational (Diploma) program and VCE (Victorian Certificate of Education). The USP of the college is in its quality of education from the tutors. Some of the popular areas of study in undergraduate and vocational training courses include Business studies, Healthcare, Civil construction, Accounting, Tourism and hospitality, Social work etc. In addition, the students here have the opportunity to indulge in facilities such as technical laboratories, libraries and resources, residential halls, central Wi-Fi, student kitchen services and others. The Melbourne campus can be considered as the central campus. The conveyance benefits and accommodations have popularised this campus. The current acceptance rate of the college shows its less selective nature, which has enabled it to accommodate more than 391 international students at present. Stotts College ranking is currently at 203rd place among all the secondary schools in Victoria. The classes here maintain a standard student-faculty ratio to keep small class sizes. The tuition fees set for international students is between $50,000 and $55,000, which can be burdensome for most students. The placement facilities offered here include weekly work placement seminars. It helps the students learn the details of the employability requirements and skills, including tips for creating resumes, internship programs, interviews, work etiquettes, customer handling and various others. This way, students receive employment quickly in their careers.
Eligibility Overview: IN ORDER TO ENTER FIRST YEARYear 12 or its equivalent is required. The age requirement is 18 years old.International students must additionally show that they can communicate in English at an IELTS level of 6.0. (Academic).Completion of an IELTS 6.0 exam at an official IELTS testing centre or an equivalent recognised English language test within the previous twelve months of the student's proposed start date for the Bachelor programmes, with an overall score of 6 and no single band lower than 5.5 (see policy – International Student Admission Policy).Applying for Credit Transfer: You may be qualified for some credit exemptions if you have completed prior tertiary courses. Please contact us for more details.
Accommodation: Melbourne has a wide range of student housing options, including sharing homes and private residences that may accommodate a complete family. Choose from a trendy inner-city apartment or a big house or unit with a garden in the scenic outskirts. It's a city known for providing high-quality, safe student housing in a variety of situations.Another alternative is Acknowledge Education's tailored Homestay service, which will assist you in settling into your new city as fast and easily as possible — we have over 100 host families on our database who have been thoroughly vetted and registered by our Homestay Officer.for more information click on this link-https://www.stotts.edu.au/student-services/living-information-melbourne/

Name: International Centre for EAP at Cape Breton University Campus
Overview: The International Centre for EAP (ICEAP) is a language centre providing English for Academic Preparation to international students willing to enter university but lacking necessary English proficiency. It is present in three locations, including one at the Cape Breton University (CBU) campus in Sydney, Nova Scotia, Canada. Individuals studying at the International Centre for EAP Cape Breton University Campus would experience university life on this CBU campus. ICEAP extends courses in 8-week sessions throughout the year. It provides an intensive program that is supplemented by group and individual tutorials and Conversation Partner Program. This institute also offers 8 different instruction levels curated to meet individual student requirements. The class sizes at ICEAP are small, comprising around 15 to 16 students. For EAP levels, it is up to a maximum of 20. Students of the International Centre for EAP also receive a cultural and academic orientation. ICEAP is the organizer of “LET’S TALK” (Learn English Towards Success Talk - the Only Affordable Private Talk Program in Canada. This program enables one to talk with native speakers daily constantly. Apart from the daily normal ESL English training courses of 5 hours, “LET’S TALK” offers English learners a private talk and activity session with native speakers. This is of two hours duration per day for five days in a week and is accompanied by several Canadian style outdoor activities. Students completing the EAP Program are successful on the ICEAP exit examination. Besides this, those meeting university admission requirements for their programs get accepted by ICEAP partners for university studies. This is subject to program enrolment maximum numbers.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Nil

Name: Griffith University
Overview: Griffith University in Queensland, Australia, is a public research institute established in 1971. Four academic groups, namely Arts Education and Law, Griffith Health, Griffith Business School and Griffith Sciences, offer over 200 courses. Students can pursue undergraduate and postgraduate degree programs in study areas like Education, Criminology and Law, Visual and Creative Arts and Science and Environment. It offers online-only degree programs, accelerated online degrees and flexible degrees. Through FutureLearn, the university provides several free Massive Open Online Courses too. Students can also opt for double degree programs to gain two qualifications and acquire skills. Furthermore, the online and on-campus job-ready certificates (Climate Change Adaptation, Professional Accounting, Case Management etc.) allow students to boost their employability. The study abroad program allows students to spend a week to a year in one of the university's nine partner institutions worldwide. Students can apply for financial aid like scholarships, loans, grants and awards; Griffith Futures Scholarship, Publication Assistance Scholarship Scheme, Alan Lane Award for Composition, Robert S. Alva Memorial Award etc. Griffith University MBA graduates earn a median salary of AUD 60,000- AUD 81,000.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet in order to be considered for admission: An overall grade average of 65% in the best  4 academic subjectsEnglish language proficiency requirements English language proficiency requirements:       Note: Some degrees may require higher levels of English or only accept specific English language tests.

Placement: Placements, as part of a course or degree programme, provide you with the opportunity to put your profession's skills to the test and get real-world experience. You will learn the following skills by engaging in placements: A better knowledge of how professionals work in different situations;The ability to translate information from theoretical concepts to practical applications;The ability to enable autonomous learning effectively;The ability to organise, plan, and manage one's work environment Students with disabilities As stated in the Students with Disabilities Policy, the University is committed to expanding and improving opportunities for people with disabilities. "Students with disabilities shall have access to all of the University's academic courses," according to section 6.0, "unless the Academic Committee receives appropriate expert advice during the accreditation of a particular programme that the curriculum could not be adapted to provide students with particular disabilities the opportunity to meet the educational objectives of the course." Students with disabilities, injuries, or medical issues are provided with appropriate and reasonable support at Griffith University. Students are encouraged to contact Student Disability and Accessibility to lessen the impact of their disabilities, injuries, or medical conditions on their education. Adjustments must be made in a reasonable manner. Documentation of the precise impairment, injury, or health condition, as well as the potential functional implications of this condition in the tertiary education environment across all learning activities, is required for Student Disability and Accessibility. These activities include, but are not limited to, assessments, work-integrated learning/placement, and other course-related activities.  Overseas placements An overseas placement allows you to immerse yourself in a foreign country, lifestyle, and people while also allowing you to practice your profession's abilities and get practical experience in a different area of the world.More than anything else, studying abroad allows you to discover new talents and abilities, overcome new obstacles, and solve new issues. You will be confronted with situations that are completely foreign to you, and you will learn to adapt and respond appropriately.
Accommodation: On-Campus Accommodation You'll be near lectures, labs, libraries, and other university resources if you live on campus. You'll have a vibrant social life and lay strong foundations for your future while creating memories and making lifetime friends, all while living in a beautiful bushland location with walking trails. The usefulness of staying on-campus are: You'll be close to your lectures and Uni services if you live near themHundreds of organised social events, study assistance, and pastoral support and care available 24 hours a day, 7 days a weekEasy access to public transportation, near proximity to major shopping malls, and proximity to Brisbane's CBDMake new friends from other cultures and backgroundsSecurity on campus, 24 hours a day, ensures a safe and secure environment Facilities and Services  Common areas: You can read, study, watch TV, and relax in the multipurpose common spaces. There are additional culinary facilities in the common rooms, as well as outside grilling places.Internet & phone: Griffith has internet connectivity in its libraries and computer labs, as well as Wi-Fi on campus. All Nathan residents have access to free Wi-Fi, which is provided by a third-party supplier.Laundry facilities: You can use the complimentary laundry facilities, which include front-loading washing machines and clothes dryers. All you have to do is bring your own detergent.Parking: Parking on campus necessitates the purchase of a parking permit or the payment of a casual parking fee. A small number of off-street parking spaces are available to Nathan residents. A Trimester or Annual parking permit is required to enter this car park and all General parking zones on campus.Gym: You will receive a discount on a premium gym membership if you live on campus.Residential support and management: To guarantee that all residential college members have someone to contact at all times, they are provided with 24-hour pastoral care.Security: On-site security is available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week to assist with inquiries and ensure campus safety.Food: There are a number of food establishments on Nathan campus that provide a variety of cuisines, including Vietnamese, Indian, pizza, sandwiches, and more. The Shops website has information about food places, including opening hours and sample menus. For more information, visit: https://www.griffith.edu.au/accommodation/on-campus  Homestays Homestays provide international students studying at Griffith with a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to live with an Australian family. Students may immerse themselves in Australian culture while improving their English, while host families meet people, and learn about diverse cultures through meeting people from all across the world.  Australian Homestay Network provides homestay housing for Griffith University students on the Gold Coast and in Brisbane. For more information, visit: https://www.griffith.edu.au/accommodation/homestay-partners  Off-Campus Accommodation Across its five campuses, Griffith University has formed relationships with a variety of off-campus housing companies. The partners were chosen based on a number of variables, including proximity, pricing, and amenities. You can be close to your selected college and have access to public transportation by staying at a preferred partner. Some of the attractions are only a 5-minute walk away. You may not realise it, but if you are studying at Nathan or Mt Gravatt, you may live in the inner city or on the South Bank and take public transportation to your campus.  Some of the partners have offered students discounted pricing on certain room types, which can only be obtained by submitting an application through Griffith University's accommodation website. To get savings on some websites, you'll need to enter a promotion code. You will not be eligible for the lower prices if you apply directly to the hotel provider. The resident/student and the accommodation partner are the parties to all accommodation agreements.  The partners are:  BrisbaneGenesis 1Scape South BankScape TribuneStudent One Elizabeth StreetUnilodge Park CentralUniresortGold CoastMetro on CentralUniversity SquareUniversity VillageLoganUniCentral Griffith For more information, visit: https://www.griffith.edu.au/accommodation/preferred-partners  For general enquiries, visit: https://www.griffith.edu.au/accommodation
Course Ranking: In terms of business course rankings, the PG Business and Economics course is ranked at positions #101–125 in 2022 by the Times Higher Education. Since 2020, this course has held the same position. In 2022, the PG Engineering & Technology programme will be ranked between #151 and #175. For three years—2019, 2021, and 2022—this course has constantly held the same position. The PG Engineering & Technology rating fell to positions 176–200 in 2020. The Computer Science course at Griffith University is ranked between positions #151 and 175 according to the latest data.
University Ranking: A number of respected ranking systems routinely place Griffith University in the top 2% of universities worldwide. The Times Higher Education World University Rankings, U.S. News & World Report, QS World University Rankings, and Academic Ranking of World Universities all place it in the top 300 universities in the world. When it comes to Griffith University's ranking, it is now listed between positions 201-250 in the Times Higher Education World University Rankings for 2022. Since 2020, the university has maintained a ranking in the range of 201-250 in THE rankings. The university is now ranked 251-300th in THE rankings for the year 2023, albeit its standing has fallen. THE evaluates institutions based on factors like teaching, research, citations, global perspective, and industrial results. According to the U.S. News & World Report's list of the finest worldwide universities, Griffith University is ranked at position 201 globally. According to the QS rankings, Griffith University is ranked #290 in 2022 and #300 in 2023. The QS World University Ranking is based on factors including academic reputation, faculty to student ratio, employer reputation, number of publications per faculty member, and the proportion of international students and professors. The QS ranking of Griffith University has increased this year. The university was ranked #320 in 2020 and #303 in 2021, respectively.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Mackay
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) is a renowned Australian public university located in central Queensland. It is the one and only university with different campuses present in every mainland state. It got its university status in 1992, and is now considered one of the largest universities situated in regional Australia. Students from more than 140 countries across the world are offered outstanding educational facilities. Besides having campuses across different parts of the world, this university offers nearly 300 under-graduate and post-graduate programs along with a certificate, research and short-term programs. Some of the Central Queensland University (CQU) subjects include accounting and law, apprenticeships, performing and visual arts, IT and digital media, environment, science, psychology, community services, education and humanities, trades and training, social work etc. Apart from these, it provides quality learning through its six schools. Also, this educational institution actively works to accomplish research objectives in collaboration with national, international and different research networks. According to the QS World Rankings in 2020, Central Queensland University (CQU) ranked in the top 2% for the employment of graduate students. Moreover, this institution is ranked within the range of 551-600 as per QS ranking. This university provides graduate and undergraduate courses through online and offline modes. It extends various research opportunities for the students and initiates several programs with the students' business, community, and government.This institution is widely known for its 22 different research categories in the areas of Business, Health, Education, and Psychology. The Mackay campus of this institution includes Trades Training Centre and offers academic and vocational courses. Students can enjoy different facilities such as 24-hour computer labs, library, training restaurants, lecture theatres, nursing laboratory, student accommodation, bookshop, refectory, performance theatre, video-conference rooms etc. In Mackay residential college, on-site accommodation is provided for the students. The Trade training center caters to 1500 students undergoing apprenticeship programs in electrical, furnishing, carpentry, heavy automotive training etc.

Name: Bond University - Robina
Overview: Bond University is a private university that started operating in 1989 in Robina, Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia. The university has four faculty buildings—Faculties of Business, Law, Health Sciences and Medicine, and Society and Design—that house 4,500 students on 212 hectares. The Bond University campus has first-class infrastructure like the Balnaves Foundation Multimedia Learning Center, the John and Alison Kearney Law Library, the Legal Skills Center, and many more. Candidates can apply for intakes during January, May, and September in more than 60 undergraduate programs in Arts, Business Law, Communication, and Journalism; 30 postgraduate courses in Accounting, Business, Finance, and Architecture; and 70 master's degree programs in Communication, Arts, English, etc. The graduates from Bond University get an average annual package of AUD 70,000–190,000 in fields like financial services, accounting, human resources, marketing, and sales.The on-campus accommodation buildings like North Tower, South Tower, Accommodation Center, and The Halls (A & B Block) at Bond University average costs of AUD 3,000 (Single rooms with shared washrooms), AUD 3,900 (Single rooms-Ensuite), AUD 2,450 (Shared twin rooms), AUD 3,450 (Flats). The accommodation costs include housing, laundry, kitchenette, and security services. Additional facilities at Bond University include a sports center for aerobics, yoga, rugby, football, and swimming with health services, seminar theaters, and an artificial lake. There are student clubs in sports, culture, education, and religious societies as well. Undergraduate and graduate programs' average tuition fees are AUD 20,000–22,000 and AUD 21,000–23,000, respectively. Bond University provides financial support to students up to 50% of tuition fees under 37 scholarship programs like Excellence Scholarship, International Stand Out Scholarship, and International UG Excellence Scholarship.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic and English language proficiency score requirements: Admissions to the undergraduate programme Admission to a bachelor's degree programme is typically determined by high school academic performance and English language proficiency. As a result, international students should have the following: Secondary school studies are equivalent to Year 12 in Australia from any country.At least OP5, i.e. an ATAR of 91.00 or an IB score of 33. Admissions for postgraduates In most situations, a bachelor's degree from a recognised university is required for admission to postgraduate coursework programmes; however, considerable job experience in a related industry may meet the entry requirements in some cases. For some programmes, test scores such as the GRE or GMAT may be required. Research-based higher education (HDR) To be admitted to a research programme, an applicant must have completed the following requirements: A bachelor's degree with Class I or II Honours, a master's degree with Class I or II Honours, or a master's degree with ClassA postgraduate degree that includes a large amount of research, orHave a track record of considerable research experience that is considered to be on par with a bachelor's degree with Class I or Class II Honours. English Proficiency Score Requirements International students should submit one of the following English language proficiency test scores:

Name: Academy of Information Technology (AIT) - Sydney
Overview: Academy of Information Technology (AIT) Sydney is a part of Redhill Education Group, offering higher education in art and technology. It started operation in 2015 in animation, gaming, 3D designs, filmmaking, and IT App design. The institute’s main focus is on interactive media, art and design.AIT is one of the pioneers in offering a course on motion capture technology and mobile application development. The most updated markerless Motion Capture technology is only on their Sydney campus.  Classroom-based, online, and virtual training programs have opened the educational gateway to domestic and international students. Bridging companies with deserving candidates, they have seamlessly balanced the art and design industry. Academy of Information Technology (AIT) Sydney fees structure is in the higher bracket; however, they arrange for grants, scholarships, and educational loans to support students. The selection procedure and admission are seamless processes based on the student's credibility. Academy of Information Technology (AIT) Sydney ranks among the best art colleges in Australia for its world-class training program and setup. Academy of Information Technology in Sydney and Melbourne connects the corporates with the students in balancing the supply-demand system of human resources in the digital media art platform. The award-winning campus, technical lab, evaluation system, classroom training, study materials, and assignments meet the industry requirement. Academy of Information Technology (AIT) Sydney has over 5,000 students to date who got recruited by multinational companies across the world. All the alumni are bringing a new dimension to the art and design industry.

Name: Central Queensland University (CQU) - Townsville
Overview: Central Queensland University (CQU) at Townsville is a dual-sector university in Rockhampton, Australia. The University offers 300 undergraduate and postgraduate programs in the fields of Health, Humanities and Education, Business, Psychology, Performing and Visual Arts, Accounting and Law and others. Central Queensland University’s world rank in QS World University Ranking is 601-650. The University offers Bachelor’s, Master’s, Associate, Graduate Certificates, Graduate Diploma, Advanced Diploma and Doctoral degrees. The University also provides several non-academic facilities that include a gym, sport center, free laundry, 24x7 Wifi etc. The University maintains a student to faculty ratio of 13:1. In addition, it also managed to generate a high research output. They offer their international students annual grants and scholarships with an additional 25% off on tuition fees. There are various clubs to encourage the extracurricular activities of students which include Dance programs, Sports and games, Photography, Board games, Video games etc. The University has a full-time domestic graduate employment rate of 79.5 %. Therefore, with a premium education system, they managed to secure a ranking among the 2% of the top Universities globally for graduate employability rate. Central Queensland University is the largest regional university in Australia with over 20 campus locations nationally. Among those, the Townsville campus offers a range of 300 vocational, higher education and research courses. The campus provides an optimum choice to the students from Australia and from more than 140 countries around the world. They welcome over 30,000 students to provide education and are recognized as one of the largest regional universities in Australia.

Name: Torrens University
Overview: Torrens University is a multi-campus institution in Australia, founded in 2013. It has 25,325 students pursuing over 300 undergraduate, postgraduate, and research programs. Some of the popular courses offered by the university include branded fashion design, learning and teaching, culinary management, and commerce. Torrens University has six campuses in Sydney, two in Brisbane, two in Melbourne, one in Adelaide, and one in the Blue Mountains; some are the Ultimo, Gotha, and Wakefield Street campuses. The extensive Torrens University Library collection houses ebooks, articles, journals, videos, and other resources. More than 18,000 students worldwide are enrolled in Torrens University's online courses, such as 3D Design Animation, Beauty and Aesthetics, and Special Education. Short courses like micro-credentials, Massive Open Online Courses, single subjects, and certificate programs are available. Moreover, students can opt to pursue a double degree, wherein they can combine two courses. 95% of Torrens University students can find employment within a year of graduating.The student accommodation types are residential colleges, private rentals, share houses, homestays, and student hostels on the Blue Mountains campus. Their sportspeople, cultural and recreational clubs, and several fitness facilities like gyms, swimming pools, courts, fields, etc., are available for students to join. Students can apply for financial aid like scholarships, loans, grants, awards, fee-help loans, alumni scholarships, Creative Technology scholarships, and Indigenous Student scholarships.

Name: James Cook University - Cairns
Overview: Founded in 1970 James Cook University, James Cook University is a public institution in Queensland, Australia. It is the second oldest university in Queensland and one of the finest research and teaching institutions. The main campuses of this institution are located in Cairns and Townsville, and the one in the Singapore city-state. James Cook University – Cairns's primary research fields include mathematical sciences, agricultural and veterinary sciences, environmental sciences, earth sciences, technology, medical health sciences, biological sciences, and more. This Cairns campus of this university provides a comprehensive range of facilities and services for this university. Studying at this university's Cairns campus can help students connect with peers and top-notch experts, pursue courses in top-class facilities and learn from experts in their respective fields. Studying at James Cook University: Cairns allows students to be well-equipped with top-grade knowledge and job-oriented skills to flourish in their chosen career path. As per QS World University Ranking, James Cook University holds 462nd position in the current year, and according to the Times Higher Education, it is within 201-250. As per the Academic Ranking of World Universities, this institution ranks in the top 300 universities worldwide. Students can also explore field trips and practical placements to have real-world experiences. Besides, students can also enjoy different facilities such as developing personality and skills for employment, small class sizes, connecting with professional networks, and global leaders in marine sciences, tropical ecology, biodiversity, and research. Moreover, international students can avail more than 300 programs from this university. Students can explore different study programs from various pathway programs through higher research degrees in various disciplines such as health studies, medicine, arts, social sciences, business, pharmacy, business, occupational therapy, psychology, biomedical sciences, information technology, etc.
Eligibility Overview: UndergraduateStudents must have completed at least 6 months of full-time study at a recognized higher education institution and earned a minimum cumulative GPA of 4.9 out of 7.0, or 65-70 percent average outcomes.Students might be able to apply right after high school, but you'll need to produce your high school diploma (or equivalent). These requests will be considered on an individual basis.PostgraduateStudents must have earned a bachelor's degree or its equivalent from a recognized institution of higher learning. Additional entrance requirements, if any, can be found in our Study Abroad Guide.Students applying for the Study Abroad Program as postgraduates can only study for one teaching term.English language entry requirementsStudents who do not speak English as their first language must generally verify their proficiency by passing a test such as Academic IELTS, TOEFL, or Pearson (PTE Academic). Other English language tests may be accepted as proof of proficiency in the English language.The chart shows the minimum English language requirement for the Study Abroad Program.If you meet the academic requirements but not the English language requirement, you may be eligible for a package offer to learn English before beginning your primary course of study at JCU.

Name: Swinburne University of Technology
Overview: Swinburne University of Technology, Melbourne, Victoria, was established in 1908, and gained university status in 1992. The university has three domestic campuses at Hawthorn, Croydon and Wantirna and one international campus in Sarawak, Malaysia. The university is accredited by the Association to Advance Collegiate School of Business (AACSB). The institute offers tertiary for higher education as well as Pathways and Vocational Education (PAVE). The university offers a wide range of study area under various schools: Arts and Humanities; Aviation; Built Environment and Architecture; Business; Design; Education; Engineering; Health; Law; Nursing; Psychology; Science; Film and Television; Games and Animation; Information Technology; Media and Communication; Trades and Apprenticeship. The average tuition cost for an undergraduate course is 18,844 AUD per year and for a postgraduate course would be 25,635 AUD per year. On an average the tuition would cost around 27,000 - 40,000 AUD per year. The top courses offered at the university are B.A. Politics and International Relations; B.Eng. Software Engineering; Bachelor of Accounting; Master Construction and Infrastructure Management; Masters of Engineering in Advanced Manufacturing. The institute provides a plethora of scholarship opportunities to avail offered by the university in partnership with other organisations as financial aid to the deserving candidates. The accommodation facilities are available on-campus as well as off-campus. The cost of living (including food, electricity, transportation and others) could be 560 AUD (approx.) per week. The university has a good employment rate with average salary of graduates and alumni is 65,974 AUD, and these are the highest recruited course graduates in- MBA -1,15,000 AUD; Bachelor of Science - 99,000 AUD. The other amenities are special features of the individual campuses, from sports centers to libraries and book shops, security and safety.

Name: International College of Management Sydney
Overview: The International College of Management, Sydney (ICMS) is a higher education institution that offers diplomas and advanced degrees. ICMS provides certificates and degrees in a wide range of business, hospitality, and international tourism-related subjects.The main ICMS campus is located on St Patrick's Estate on Sydney Harbour's North Head. It is housed in the old seminary known as "Manly Castle." In 2012, ICMS was one of the first six private universities to be accepted into the Universities Admissions Centre. The exterior shots of Gatsby's mansion in the 2013 film adaption of The Great Gatsby were shot on the ICMS campus.ICMS has been recognized as a critical contribution to the Northern Beaches economy, ranking top among Australian institutions in graduate employability in the event management and hospitality management sectors in 2018. Following the COVID-19 pandemic, ICMS increased scholarships and bursaries for domestic students after losing a substantial number of its students who had previously been foreign.
Eligibility Overview: Academic Requirements: Undergraduate:Successful completion of an All India Senior School Certificate or an Indian School Certificate with an overall grade point average of at least 60% in the best four subjects excluding local language; or a Senior Secondary Certificate (State Boards) with an average score of at least 70% in the best four subjects excluding local language. Postgraduate:Obtaining a bachelor's degree from an Australian higher education institution or an international equivalentORSuccessful completion of a three-year or longer abroad higher education degree (AQF Level 6 or equivalent) with a minimum credit grade averageORAt least two award or non-award subjects (at AQF Level 8 or above) from an Australian higher education institution or abroad equivalent English Requirements:

Placement: Your internship or professional placement will be factored into your overall grade. All ICMS Bachelor's and Master's degrees include two semesters of professional standing. These recognised Work Integrated Learning (WIL) subjects lead to academic credit if completed. The ICMS WIL team usually organises professional placements in cooperation with you, the student. Professional placements can give you valuable work experience, networking opportunities, and exposure to your chosen field while also allowing you to travel. It's feasible that your professional placement will take you across state lines - or perhaps internationally. The ICMS collaborates with a vast number of businesses. These industry professionals can help you develop your qualifications and ensure they are in line with industry best practices by sharing their knowledge and experience.An industry placement is included in Work Integrated Learning (WIL) disciplines, providing you with the unique chance to: By taking these courses, prepare for a future profession in your chosen field of studyMake a positive first impression on the industryWorking in a professional workplace is a rewarding experienceMake solid professional and career connectionsDemonstrate and improve real-world employment abilitiesTo help you make the most significant professional decisions, look into different positions and industries

Name: Coder Academy - North Sydney
Overview: Coder Academy is a private education college extending an array of part-time courses, short workshops, online tutorials, school programs, and coding boot camps in three Australian locations, including North Sydney, since 2015. It is the only accredited coding boot camp in Australia. The boot camp courses at Coder Academy Sydney have CRICOS approval. The Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency (TEQSA) have accredited the Undergraduate Certificate courses in Programming and Data Analysis of this institute. Coder Academy courses compress qualifications having a 2 years duration or more to shorter periods ranging 6 or 10 months. And for this, they do not compromise with the learning outcomes. Coder Academy covers various areas, including Database Systems, Information Systems, Discrete Mathematics, Programming I, Programming II, etc. Students can opt for various courses at this institute, including Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp, Undergrad Certificate in Programming, Web Development Bootcamp (Accelerated), Undergrad Certificate in Data Analysis, Web Development Bootcamp (Standard). The two delivery options for the Web Dev Bootcamp, namely Standard and Accelerated, are of varying durations. The Accelerated Web Development Bootcamp is for 6 months, and the Standard one is for 10 months. The intakes at these boot camps take place in February and August though these dates are subject to change. This academy’s Code, Cloud & Cyber Bootcamp is the first of its kind in Australia. Students gain a Diploma of Information Technology through this boot camp. Apart from this, they can also undertake the AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner Exam. Coder Academy offers lucrative placement opportunities, with 80% of its graduates receiving employment within three months. Furthermore, more than 50% of graduates get hired from industry placements. Some of the industry partners of Coder Academy include Dropbox, Vodafone, GorillaStack, PLYCODE, station FIVE, lifeiQ, Pozible, and many others. The Course Report has also consistently voted this academy as the best Coding Bootcamp in Australia.
