Name: Murdoch University - Perth
Overview: Established in 1976, Murdoch University has five campuses worldwide – Perth, Rockingham, Singapore, Dubai, Mandurah, and Myanmar. The University's Perth campus is one of the largest campuses in Australia. According to Excellence in Research Australia (2018), 81% of this University's research met world standards and above. Students need a minimum score of 6.0 in IELTS to be eligible for admission. Additionally, a GPA of 2.5+ is also necessary for most courses.The University houses 23,000+ students. The Launchpad in this University allows students to build, learn and develop entrepreneurial and other prospective skills. It features cutting-edge screen technology, 3D printers, a kitchen etc. Besides, the Perth Campus houses a vet clinic, veterinary hospital, working farm etc. It invests over $2.5 million+ in scholarships annually to fund students' education. Murdoch University Perth fees vary with courses, the units students have enrolled in, and their citizenship. Students may also need to bear the cost of buying textbooks, services and amnesty fees, field trips, accommodation etc. According to the Good Universities Guide 2020, it received a 5-star rating in terms of students' academic experience, quality of the teaching, student-to-staff ratio, the support provided to students etc. According to the International Student Barometer, approximately 91% of international students were satisfied with their educational experience. Students who do not qualify to apply to this University and are keen to build their skills can opt for multiple pathways such as OnTrack, FlexiTrack etc. Students can access the 'myMurdoch Career' portal online to find employment opportunities.
Eligibility Overview: The eligibility criteria a student must meet to be considered for admission are: A 2.5 or higher undergraduate degree is necessary for UG, with a 65 per cent overall average in all units of studyA 2.5 or higher undergraduate degree with a 65 per cent average in all courses of study is necessary for PGEnglish language proficiency test  English language requirements, IELTS: 6.0 or higher
Placement: Work Placements The university collaborates with businesses and community organisations to provide students with appropriate placements that fulfil their academic goals. Companies then collaborate with students to provide an agreed-upon job experience and proper supervision.Student work placements are an extended amount of time spent in a host organisation's work environment, working on a structured programme under appropriate workplace supervision. Students work for academic credit and are unpaid to fulfil the requirements of vocational placement. Student work placements are known by a variety of names depending on the discipline: internshipspracticumsclinical placements Murdoch University and suitable organisations can enter into a workplace business agreement that sets the terms and conditions of the student work placement. The agreement details the student's insurance coverage under our plans. The terms of the contract are typically set for three years. During this time, there is no responsibility to provide placements.Students enrol in a qualifying unit and apply for a specific placement to engage in student work placements.
Accommodation: Murdoch University Village is home to a thriving community of over 800 students. The village offers a variety of safe residences and recreational amenities such as a beach volleyball court, pool, study rooms, and a student lounge. You can also participate in the Live, Learn, and Grow residential living programme, which will assist you in adjusting to college life. Off-Campus Accommodation Shared or independent accommodation If you wish to live away from school, there are a few options; you can choose from various shared and independent housing options. Consider Murdoch, Kardinya, Leeming, Coolbellup, Bibra Lake, North Lake, Bull Creek, Winthrop, Bateman, or Willagee if you want to be close to our Perth campus.The Murdoch Guild, a student organisation, has a student accommodation directory that can assist you in finding shared or independent housing. Stay with a family from Australia If you're visiting Australia from another country and want to live with an Australian family, you can apply for a homestay through the Australian Homestay Network. You will be able to: When you initially arrive, your host family will pick you up from the airportInteracting with your host family will help you develop your English language abilitiesWith the help of local specialists, you can appreciate the local community and cultureAttend social activities and meet new individualsBenefit from the help and guidance of your host family  For more information, visit: https://www.murdoch.edu.au/study/international-students/life-in-perth/accommodation

Name: Kaplan Business School - Brisbane
Overview: Kaplan Business School - Brisbane is situated in the middle of the center of Brisbane City. This institution is one of the flagship campuses that provide exclusive opportunities for the students to engage and interact with the community. This campus consists of spacious lounges, a courtyard, and a licensed café. Kaplan Business School – Brisbane is a universally acknowledged higher education provider that includes graduate and postgraduate courses in disciplines such as tourism, digital management, business, marketing, entrepreneurship, analytics, project management, etc. This institution is supervised by an academic board, executive senior leadership team, and corporate board. Apart from UG and PG courses, students can explore various certificates, graduate diplomas, and certificate programs. At this college, one can choose to study MBA or postgraduate Business Analytics subjects online at their convenience. There are several courses that students can explore, such as Bachelor of Business, Diploma of Business, Bachelor of Business in Management, Graduate Certificate in Business Analytics, Master of Business Analytics in Extension, Master of Accounting, etc. The small class sizes allow lecturers to provide individual support and interact with their peers. This school achieved the International Education Award by the AFR Higher Education Awards. 2020. Moreover, the Brisbane campus holds the first position across the world for student support. Kaplan Business School has also been recognized and acknowledged in several National and International Awards. Per the Quality Indicators for Learning and Teaching (QILT), Kaplan Business School has received higher ratings than any other public university in Australia. Besides, Kaplan Business School – Brisbane has associated and collaborated with various reputed organizations that offer students an opportunity to improve their skills and join internships.
Eligibility Overview: Diploma equivalent academic requirementCompletion of the Indian Higher Secondary School Certificate (State Boards) with a 55 percent overall average in four core courses.Completed the CBSE All India School Certificate (CBSE) with a 55 percent overall in four core courses.Completion of the Indian School Certificate (ISC) with a 55 percent average in four core subjects.Bachelor's degree equivalent academic requirementCompletion of the Indian Higher Secondary School Certificate (State Boards) with a 60 percent overall average in four core courses.Successful completion of the CBSE All India School Certificate with a 60 percent overall average in four core courses.Completion of the Indian School Certificate (ISC) with a 60 percent average in four core subjects.POSTGRADUATE COURSEGraduate Certificate and Graduate DiplomaAn Advanced Diploma/Associate Degree (or AQF Level 6 equivalent course) plus completion of a Postgraduate Qualifying Program (or equivalent);A Diploma (or AQF Level 5 equivalent course) plus evidence of a minimum of two years relevant industry experience plus completion of a Postgraduate Qualifying Program (or equivalent).
Placement: Kaplan Business School is well-known for its graduate and undergraduate programmes, which provide students with good job opportunities. The institution also provides mock interviews, career planning workshops, resume writing, and other services to the students. Some of the institute's campuses are well-known for offering international students with hands-on and industrial experience, as well as professional internships that lead to job prospects for international students in Australia. The school is also known for offering both domestic and international students with global employment prospects. The majority of international corporations are located near the Sydney campus. In addition, the Kaplan Business School boasts a 100% graduate employment rate. The Kaplan Business School is a dream destination for overseas students seeking business education because of its large global reach. The school also has international ties with a variety of nations. The majority of the well-organized international students work part-time while attending Kaplan Business Institution, and the school also provides them with global employment prospects.

Name: James Cook University - Brisbane
Overview: The James Cook University - Brisbane is a university located in Brisbane, Australia. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. The popular courses are Allied Health and Pharmacy, biomedical science, business law and finance, marine science, medical and dentistry, nursing, pathway and preparation, sports and exercise science, teaching and education, tourism, veterinary and animal science.The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. The estimated average tuition and fees, excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student, is around $14,740. James Cook University - Brisbane offers students scholarships, work-study, and various funding. International Student Scholarships from the JCU Vice-Chancellor offer up to $40,000 per year for the programme's bare minimum. International students enrolled in eligible programmes with a weighted average mark (WAM) of 85% or higher are only invited to apply for this grant.Read more details about James Cook University - Brisbane on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.

Name: Edith Cowan University
Overview: Edith Cowan University (ECU), established in 1991, is named after the first woman elected to an Australian Parliament. The public university in Perth, Western Australia, ranks among the top 2.5% of universities in the world. Joondalup campus, Mount Lawley campus and Southwest campus are the three campuses having 30,000 students. Bunbury campus happens to be the largest campus of ECU outside the metropolitan area. There are 219 full-time, 205 part-time and 125 online courses in 119 undergraduate and 113 postgraduate programs in arts, Humanities, Business, Law, Education, Medical Sciences, Engineering, Nursing and Midwifery. Edwin Cowan has one of the best Engineering Schools in the nation, and the Nursing program here is the largest in Western Australia. Western Australian Academy of Performing Arts offers courses in fields like music, jazz, dance and design. The admission takes place twice a year, and course-specific requirements, academic transcripts, work experience, if any, resume and the scores of TOEFL, IELTS, PTE are submitted with no application fee. The average tuition fee ranges from 14,450 AUD to 20,025 AUD per semester depending upon the program. Financial aid in the form of need-based scholarships like ECU Excellence Scholarship worth 20,000 AUD and merit-based scholarships like ECU Vice-Chancellor's Aboriginal Scholarship and ECU South West Campus Scholarship are awarded. On-campus accommodation at the ECU Village in single and shared rooms with self-catering facilities is provided in all three campuses. International students find rooms in Joondalup at 195 - 320 AUD while the rent is 170- 240 AUD for Mount Lawley. Wi-Fi, computer labs, open-access libraries, barbecue area, coin-operated laundry system, outdoor courtyards, parking, lounge and TV are some amenities available. The employment rate of nearly 63%, accompanied by a moderate acceptance rate, helps graduates of Edith Cowan land with well-paid jobs having an average package of 60,000 AUD.
Eligibility Overview: International Admission RequirementsStudents must have an IELTS score of 6.5, with no band below 6.5; a TOEFL (IBT) score of 84, with no score below 17; a PTE-A score of 64, with no communicative ability below 58; or an OET score of B in all components. Based on assessment, a maximum of two test sittings in a six-month period may be accepted. Check here: https://www.edithcowancollege.edu.au/admissions-requirements#:~:text=Students%20must%20have%20an%20IELTS,be%20accepted%20based%20on%20assessment.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing At ECUCampus Living Villages, the University's on-campus housing provider, operates on all three campuses. The ECU Village website also offers an off-campus housing referral service. On-Campus HousingStudent accommodation provider Campus Living Villages manages student villages on the Joondalup, Mount Lawley, and South West campuses. The villages are made up of single and multi-room units with shared self-catering facilities and offer a modern, welcoming atmosphere. There are a number of apartment styles to fit a variety of budgets, including recently developed units.Check here: https://www.ecu.edu.au/about-ecu/campus-facilities/accommodation
Course Ranking: When it comes to taking business courses, Edith Cowan University (ECU) has received a Times Higher Education ranking for its PG Business and Economics programme that ranges from 301 to 400. Previously, in 2019 and 2020, it was ranked between 401 and 500. Times Higher Education has listed the university between 151 and 175 for the two years, 2020 and 2021, for those pursuing PG Engineering and Technology (THE).
University Ranking: Times Higher Education (THE) - University Ranking has placed Edith Cowan University (ECU) in the top 500 of all universities worldwide for the last two years. Its previous rating of 501 and 600 for three years in a row, from 2017 to 2019, has been improved. Teaching, research, and citations are each given 30% weight in The Times Higher Education (THE). According to US News & World Report's Global Universities, the university is ranked 591 in the US for 2021. Additionally, this is an improvement over its previous placements. In addition to other rating factors, the US News & World Report bases their rankings on the number of publications cited, global research reputation, and regional research reputation (12.5% each). For two years in a row, in 2020 and 2021, QS World University Ranking, one of the top ranking services, placed the university between 651 and 700. Its previous position between 751 and 800 in 2018 and 2019 has improved. The university's 2020 ranking from ARWU (Shanghai Ranking) - Universities Rankings ranges from 601 to 700. The Shanghai ranking does not take into account an institution's reputation among academics or employers, preferring instead to rank universities by considering the level of academic research they produce and the number of Nobel Prizes their staff has won. Whereas QS places the maximum emphasis on Academic Reputation (40%) followed by Citations per Faculty at 20% and Faculty/Student Ratio each.

Course Description: Edith Cowan University is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Edith Cowan University was founded in 1991. Located in Joondalup,Australia the university is home to about 4500 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Edith Cowan University is ranked 601th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 7 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. Edith Cowan University has 6 intakes in Feb,Jun,Oct,Nov,Sep,Jul. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Edith Cowan University is around 24200.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Edith Cowan University include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Edith Cowan University is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Edith Cowan University has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: University of Divinity
Overview: Previously called the Melbourne University of Divinity when it was established, with amendments in the acts, it eventually became the University of Divinity, Highbury Grove, Australia, constituted in 1910 by an Act of Parliament. It received approval to function as a university in 2012. It is highly dedicated to addressing the issues of the contemporary world through critical engagement with Christian theological traditions. The libraries at the various campuses have student access and borrowing rights to the vast collection of books.The university of divinity offers awards in Theology, Philosophy, Counselling and Ministry. It is the only university in Australia with specialisation listed on the national registrar of higher education providers maintained by TEQSA. The university has a wide area of study programs. It offers a diploma in Theology, three programs for advanced diploma or associate degree, three courses for a bachelor's degree, 19 graduate certificates of graduate diploma, ten programs for master's degree, and three doctoral degree courses. It also offers courses in religious studies, like Certificate of Divinity; Diploma in Theology; Counselling and Ministry; Certificate in Ageing; Certificate in Children and Family Ministry; Education; Certificate in Leadership; Research Methodology; Spirituality; Certificate in Teaching Meditation; Pastoral Care; Professional Supervision; Philosophy and other combinations of studies. The approximate undergraduate fee is 9,264 AUD. Students can study full-time, part-time or opt for online courses. In the student experience survey, the university recorded the highest student satisfaction out of every student university. Scholarships are awarded based on the need-based criteria.
Eligibility Overview: English Language Proficiency Requirements 1 All applicants for admission, both domestic and overseas, must be assessed to ensure their English language proficiency is sufficient for admission to a course of study in accordance with the rules and thresholds set out in Schedule A to this Policy. 2 The English competency of an applicant may be determined either by an English language test approved by the University or by evidence that the applicant has lived and functioned for a substantial part of his or her life in an English-speaking context.3 Where an applicant has completed several measures of English proficiency only the most recent measure will be considered.4 A course advisor may request that an applicant undergo an English test in addition to any requirement of this Policy if such a test is required to determine whether or not to recommend the applicant for admission.To be eligible for admission to a course of study an applicant must: a) meet the minimum academic standards set out in the Regulation and Determinations applicable to that course b) satisfy the English language proficiency requirements of this Policy and any further language requirements specific to admission to that course c) demonstrate capacity to complete the course successfully d) agree to abide by the University of Divinity Code of Conduct e) have attained 18 years of age.

Name: Holmes Institute
Overview: Holmes Institute (founded in 1963) is an Australian private institution having campuses in Melbourne, Brisbane, Sydney, the Gold Coast, and Cairns. The institution offers vocational education, training, and secondary and higher education in Business, Information Systems, Fashion Business, Accounting, Marketing, Hospitality, and English language courses for students pursuing further education in Australia.Admissions are available throughout the year, subject to availability. Candidates interested in studying at Holmes Institute must first obtain the application form from the university's official website and submit it by mail. After accepting the offer, an AUD 250 enrolling fee is required to confirm the seat. To enroll in the institution's programs, prospective students must be at least eighteen years old. A solid academic record, an SOP, a LOR, and a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 are required. However, course-specific criteria vary, and candidates are advised to research their selected degree before beginning their application thoroughly.After graduating from Holmes Institute, Melbourne, students may readily find employment options around Australia and the globe. The institution offers career counseling, training, networking opportunities with industry professionals, and skill development courses and seminars. The priority of Holmes is to provide students with the ability to think for themselves and fend for themselves.
Eligibility Overview: Students interested in studying at Holmes Institute may pick from business, accounting, marketing, information systems, fashion business, hospitality, and commercial cooking courses. Candidates applying for any course must be at least 18 years old. A Care Provider selection form must be completed if you are in the age group between 16 and 18. Students need to meet the following requirements to get admission to Holmes institute. Completion of English (Language or Mode of Instruction) studies, such as Year 12 at an Australian high school or an Australian Diploma or higher certificate;Successful studies at an equivalent level at a recognized Australian educational institution, with at least a 50% pass rate in a recent semester of study;An English test score utilizing one of Holmes' authorized English language tests:System for International English Language Testing (IELTS)Pearson English Test (PTE)English as a Foreign Language Exam (TOEFL)A Cambridge English diplomaThe Holmes English Placement Test was passed with flying colors.  English Proficiency Test Score RequirementsNon-native candidates must show English proficiency by one of the widely approved examinations. Name: Laneway International College - Sydney
Overview: Laneway International College is an Australian institution that was established to challenge traditional classroom-based education. The college is located in Australia’s most famous cities, Sydney and Melbourne. It focuses on training and delivering knowledge about real-world problems through innovative teaching methods to motivate graduates to think like innovators and entrepreneurs. The faculty consists of business coaches, experienced technical experts, entrepreneurs who teach through their personal expertise in the fields of business. Laneway International College- Sydney is located in the city’s Business Hub, next to an aesthetic Wynyard Park. The campus is within 5 minutes of the famous Sydney Opera House, Museum of Contemporary Art and Sydney Harbour Bridge. Its placement in the Hub allows the students to get educated around Sydney’s most prominent businesses like Tank Stream Labs, Stone and Chalk, Fishburners, and The Studio. It also opens up many internships, jobs, networking and peer-to-peer learning opportunities for the students. Laneway International College provides various Diplomas, Advanced diplomas, Graduate Diplomas and Certificate IV in the field of Marketing, Leadership, Project Management, Entrepreneurship, Cyber Security, and Web Development. To enhance the learning experience, the college arranges many informative and interactive workshops taken by renowned business experts. To live in Sydney, which is among the 10 most expensive cities in the world, can be costly. The college recognizes that and gives VET Student Loans to eligible students. Unfortunately, this is a government loan offered to students from Australia and New Zealand only.
Eligibility Overview: Each course's entry requirements are described in the related training and assessment plans, as well as on each course's main page on the College website and other marketing collateral.At the start of the course, you must be at least 18 years old.International students must show that they have an IELTS score of 5.5 or higher.
Placement: The procedure by which non-trainee learners gain practical experience in the workplace in order to demonstrate their competency is known as work placement. Learners are not paid for their employment, but they are expected to follow all work standards, such as working hours, wearing a uniform, adhering to work health and safety regulations, and working under the supervision of a sufficiently competent workplace member.1. Laneway Education (the College) recognises the importance of work placement in contextualising learners' learning experiences.2. The College recognises that work placement allows for the assessment of a learner's capacity to apply skills and knowledge in a real-world setting.3. Some of the College's courses include mandatory workplace assessments as part of the competency units.4. The College guarantees that workplace supervisors and other workplace professionals who play a role in the learning and assessment of its learners are consulted and given pertinent information.5. We also make sure that learners are informed of what is expected of them during their work placement, if one is required as part of their degree.

Name: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) - Perth
Overview: Institute of Health and Nursing Australia (IHNA) is a Registered Training Organisation (RTO) incorporated in 2007. It is approved by ASQA (Australian Skills Quality Authority) for offering career-focused training and education in the areas of healthcare and nursing. The education and training programs extended by this institute are based on AQF (Australian Qualifications Framework). This premier nursing and health institute is present at several locations, including Perth. It offers courses in Early Childhood Education, Nursing, Health Management, and Community Services, including Aged and Disability Care. Besides Edu Systems and the Institute of Health and Management (IHM), IHNA is one of the firms that belong to HCI (Health Careers International). Some of the university partners of the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia include Flinders University, University of Southern Queensland, Western Sydney University, Murdoch University, Charles Darwin University (CDU) Australia. The various courses offered at this institute include Certificate IV in Ageing Support, Diploma of Practice Management, Certificate III in Early Childhood Education and Care, Diploma of Community Services (Case Management), Diploma of Mental Health, Certificate III in Health Administration, Infection Control Skill Set (Food Handling) and many more. Along with providing mock interviews, CV writing workshops, and career counselling sessions to students, IHNA boasts of more than 200 placement partners. It is also a member of the Australian Council for Private Education and Training (ACPET). IHNA delivers quality education to more than 14000 students hailing from over 50 nations. Students studying at the Institute of Health and Nursing Australia Perth will find the Public Transport System of Perth easy for navigating as it is segregated into travel ‘zones’. Moreover, international students can benefit from a substantial 40% discount on all public transportations throughout Western Australia.
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Nil

Name: CQ University
Overview: Situated in Central Queensland, CQ University Australia is a public university established in 1967. It is the only university in Australia that has its campus in every state. The main campus is located in Norman Gardens at Rockhampton. The University was established as Queensland Institute of Technology (QIT) in Capricornia. But, later in 1994, it was changed to CQ University. It also has campuses in Brisbane, Bundaberg, Cairns, Mackay, Townsville, Gladstone, Melbourne, Sydney, Emerald, Noosa, Adelaide, etc. Other than that, the CQ University also has various study centers across the country. It enrolls around 30,000 students every year. Hence, it is considered among the largest universities in provincial Australia. International students from over 140 countries across the world arrive to pursue higher education at the CQ University. It offers training and education for postgraduate, undergraduate, and Ph.D. or research degrees as well. CQ University also offers short-term degree programmes and certificate programmes. It also offers online education programmes with experienced professors for students across the globe. The CQ University offers various courses on subjects such as law, education, training, trades, health, science, performing, and visual art. It also includes business, management, psychology, science, environment, IT, computer science, mathematics, humanities, medicine, technology and engineering, and many others. It also provides assistance to find affordable living for students. Various sports grounds, gyms, and student clubs are also important attractions for the students. It also provides an efficient hostel with hygienic and clean rooms, healthy meals, and other facilities. The total average cost for courses and hostel fees is around 9000 USD per year. Hence, the estimated cost of living can reach around 15000 USD per year. Various notable alumni such as Julian Assange, Wayne Blair, etc. received their higher education from this college.
Eligibility Overview: What are the requirements for participation?The following are the requirements for admission to Central Queensland University's various programmes:DiplomaCompletion of AQF Certificate IV or high school equivalent to Australian class 12A minimum of 55% in four academic courses is required by CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards.All other bulletin boards: A minimum of 60% in four academic disciplines is required.BachelorsClass 12 in Australia is equivalent to high school.A minimum of 60% in four academic courses is required by CBSE, ISC, West Bengal, and Maharashtra boards.All other bulletin boards: A minimum of 65 percent in four academic subjects is required.Admissions to Postgraduate CourseworkInternational applicants must have a bachelor's degree comparable to an Australian bachelor's degree from a recognised institution. In the final two terms, a minimum score corresponding to an Australian pass grade average is required.Language Proficiency in EnglishInternational applicants must demonstrate English language proficiency, and they can do so by submitting either of the following exam scores:IELTS Academic 6.5 overall, with a minimum of 6.0 in each sectionTOEFL iBT 79, with a minimum of 21 in each groupPTE Academic 62, with a minimum of 54 in each groupCAE/CPE 176, with a minimum of 169 in each band
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.On-campus housing is available to Central Queensland University students.The accommodations provide excellent learning assistance in a setting that rewards and celebrates academic and personal success.There are various options to suit different needs, ranging from affordable to brand new, ensuited to shared bathrooms, self-catered to fully-catered options (catering only available in Rockhampton). Stay for the duration of your education, a semester, or for boarding schools.On-campus housing information can be found here.https://www.cqu.edu.au/student-life/services-and-facilities/student-accommodationOff-campus housing is available.Studio apartments, three-bedroom apartments, four-bedroom apartments, and communal apartments are among the residential types.The typical weekly rent is between 150 and 200 Australian dollars.All basic services such as power, water, and unrestricted internet access are included in the fee for the student homes.The majority of the apartments are located within 7 and 10 kilometres from Rockhampton.Off-campus housing information can be found here.https://flatmates.com.au/rooms/rockhampton-4700https://www.walkscore.com/apartments/nearby/central-queensland-university-rockhampton-au-qld

Name: Kaplan Business School
Overview: Kaplan Business School is an independent higher education institution based in Australia. The Master of Business Administration is its flagship programme and the fastest-growing degree (MBA)According to Department of Education data, Kaplan Business School has 4,289 students enrolled in 2019, with almost two-thirds in postgraduate degrees, making it Australia's second-largest non-university business schoolWith 2,134 students, it surpassed the University of New South Wales, Southern Cross University, Torrens University, and Deakin University to become Australia's third most popular MBA programme in 2019.it was named a finalist in the NSW International Student Awards in both 2020 and 2021, and Kaplan was the only non-university provider among the 36 finalists for an award in the Australian Financial Review Higher Education Awards in 2020.

Course Description: Kaplan Business School is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. Kaplan Business School was founded in 2008. Located in Adelaide,Australia the university is home to about 1106 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.Kaplan Business School is ranked 11299th in Top Universities by Webometrics - World. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 1 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. Kaplan Business School has 4 intakes in Nov,Mar,Jul,Sep. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of Kaplan Business School is around 30,000 AUD to 45,000 AUD.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by Kaplan Business School include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to Kaplan Business School is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.Kaplan Business School has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: IIBIT Sydney
Overview: IIBIT, Institute of Business Information Technology, is located in Sydney, Australia, and offers a wide range of courses ranging from Bachelor's, Diploma, and Masters. Being one of Australia's progressive institutions, IIBIT has established a vibrant, career-focused educational community and is dedicated to bringing a change to the world. IIBIT's mission is to deliver an education where each student can receive individual attention. They aim to make every individual on the campus feel supported, validated and encouraged to keep pushing forward. The faculty has a collective experience of 35 years in Australia and India. IIBIT has partnered with Rockwell International Schools in India to provide education to students; this institution also collaborated with The William Light Institute to provide students with professional courses that will enhance their skills and knowledge.Various demo and live classes are also conducted for students by industry professionals frequently. Language support, extra classes, and other services help students catch up. Most of the courses at IIBIT Sydney range from 18,000 to 20,000 Australian dollars, which makes it relatively affordable for students. They also have an option to 'fast-track' your course, which means that IIBIT allows you to finish a few 3-year courses in just one year, thereby bringing the cost of studying abroad down by a lot. Furthermore, multiple internships are provided for students to gain real-time experience.
Eligibility Overview: IIBIT Sydney is welcoming of students from all over the world. The requirements to get into IIBIT are general and achievable.  Undergraduate Programs: Applicants must be at least 18 years of age at the time of the proposed commencement of their University studies.Successful completion of Australian Year 12, or overseas qualification equivalent Postgraduate Programs: Successful completion of a recognized 3-year Australian bachelor's degree or overseas equivalentThough the requirements differ from course to course, students must have a graduation in a relevant subject from a recognized institution. A minimum percentage is also set for some postgraduate programs. For other programs, work experience may also be required. English Language Requirements The minimum requirements are as follows:
Eli Table:
Exam

Score


 

IELTSAn overall score of 6.0, with no band less than 6.0
TOEFL (iBT) An overall score of 79-80 with a minimum of 19 in all sections
PTE

A score of 50 with no band less than 42
Placement: The academic education you receive at IIBIT will be used in the real world during a professional internship, allowing you to develop new skills and expand your industry network. University is happy to have placed all of their ACS candidates into a professional internship related to ICT, ensuring that each hosting company knows how to best support you in achieving your professional development goals. It organizes and manages internship arrangements through its numerous connections and contacts with South Australian-based organizations.
Accommodation: There are several types of accommodation in IIBIT Sydney, including shared, rental, and homestay. Most students prefer shared accommodation to cut costs, and many also choose homestay. Although it is simple to find housing, the start of each semester is a busy period. Should international students choose homestay living, they will be placed with an Australian family offering accommodation and meals. It costs between AUD$70 and AUD$300 a week to stay in an Adelaide homestay. IIBIT maintains a list of real estate brokers and hosts to facilitate the necessary arrangements. Requests for this service must be submitted by students at least six weeks in advance. Contact the university at studentservices@iibit.edu.au for further details. Off-Campus Accommodation:You may choose studio flats, 3-bedroom, 4-bedroom, shared apartments, and homestays.The typical weekly rent is between 200 and 400 Australian dollarsThese accommodations come in individual keyed rooms, fully furnished with a desk, quality mattresses, TV, free wifi, and enough off-road parkingFor more, visit student.com, a website that provides student-friendly accommodation suggestions around Australia.

Name: Stotts College - Brisbane
Overview: Established in 1883, Stotts College is a private college situated in Australia. The primary campus of this college is located in Melbourne, while the other campuses are situated in Perth and Sydney. This college has three major departments, namely Higher Education (Bachelor Degree), Victorian Certificate of Education (VCE) and Vocational (Diploma). Each campus of this college offers vocational training and higher education. Moreover, this college provides effective training in community services, while Perth and Melbourne offer additional training associated with accounting and business. This college significantly makes education accessible and convenient with a wide range of services and facilities. The facilities, services include multi-theory classrooms, high-end projectors, printing services etc. The academic staff provide excellent teaching and necessary student services, counselling, involving academic and first language counselling. In addition, this institution prepares students with necessary training for employment and ensures their employment in management, accounting and student services. This college has FEE-HELP status and VET students’ loans to assist students in pursuing their studies. Stott’s secondary institution holds a ranking of 203rd among all the secondary schools in Victoria state. Besides, this college qualified for Victorian Skills First Funding for Certificate and Diploma courses for eligible students. Stotts College efficiently meets quality standards in its facilities, administrative, marketing and financial management. This college’s operations are supervised by the Tertiary Education Quality and Standards Agency, Victorian Registration and Qualifications Authority, the Australian Skills and Quality Agency. Some of the higher education courses of this college include Bachelor of Community Services, Bachelor of Business, Diploma of Practical Accounting, Bachelor of Social Work. Moreover, some of the vocational courses include Diploma of Nursing, Advanced Diploma of Business, Diploma of Community Services etc.
Eligibility Overview: Year 12 or equivalent completed. The age requirement is 18 years old.International students must additionally show that they can communicate in English at an IELTS level of 6.0. (Academic).The student must have documented evidence of having completed an IELTS exam at an official IELTS testing centre or an equivalent recognised English language test within the previous twelve months of the student's proposed start date for the Bachelor programmes, with an overall score of 6 and no single band lower than 5.5.
Accommodation: Melbourne has a wide range of student housing options, including sharing homes and private residences that may accommodate a complete family. Choose from a trendy inner-city apartment or a big house or unit with a garden in the scenic outskirts. It's a city known for providing high-quality, safe student housing in a variety of situations.For more visit:-http://www.stotts.edu.au/student-services/homestay/

Name: Charles Sturt University - Port Macquarie
Overview: The three-level Charles Sturt University (CSU) campus at Port Macquarie is situated at Innes Lake, roughly five kilometres from the city centre at Port Macquarie. CSU has recently finished Stage 1 of this multimillion-dollar campus. Incorporating outdoor and indoor teaching spaces, this campus combines natural colours and materials to compliment the Mid-North Coast surroundings. This institute campus location is convenient, based opposite the Lake Innes shopping complex that houses ANZ Bank, Coles, Co-op Book Shops, a dental and medical centre, a chemist, and several food outlets. Students can pursue courses in law, psychology, health, enviro science, teaching, business, and IT at Charles Sturt University Port Macquarie. Some of the facilities that students can use include medical radiation science labs and the Food, Soil, and Water Testing Centre. Besides this, there is a complete range of on-campus support services, a library and learning commons, and the First Nations Student Center named Ngarralbaa.The various clubs on this campus include the medical radiation science students club, nursing students club, physiotherapy students association, and paramedicine students club. Besides these, there are clubs for netball, football, and Christian students. The Port Macquarie campus offers accommodation facilities to students in apartments and Hastings Village. It houses three- and five-bedroom apartments, all featuring a bathroom, lounge, and a communal kitchen. Students also get a lounge and a large communal kitchen.
Eligibility Overview: Entry Requirements Language requirements in EnglishInternational students must provide documentation that they meet our English Language Proficiency (ELP) criteria in most courses. This can be accomplished by:Demonstrating that you have completed a suitable level of English studyWithin the recent two years, you have acquired an Academic IELTS with:A minimum total score of 6 is required.No Individual score less than 5.5.        3. Attaining a qualification that Charles Sturt considers to be equivalent to Academic IELTS (and its required marks).
Placement: Nil
Accommodation: Housing At PortHastings is a small settlement in England.You can live in a close-knit community with a large shared kitchen and lounge in their villages. Choose between a room with or without an en-suite bathroom. Starting at $206 per week.ApartmentsThree- and five-bedroom apartments are available in their newest lodging buildings. A shared kitchen, bathroom, and lounge are available to anyone. Starting at $227 per week.Also, All first-year students are guaranteed a room.All fees are included, including utilities, 24/7 security, parking, laundry, residential support, and maintenance. There are no more bills to be concerned about.There is no requirement for a bond.Rooms are fully furnished.Wi-Fi is provided at no additional cost.

Name: Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - Victoria (Geelong)
Overview:
Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - Victoria (Geelong) is a private institute and an Australian Registered Training Organisation (RTO) that extends Nationally Accredited courses aimed at developing industry-related skills and knowledge to boost students' employability. It has campuses in Melbourne, Mildura, Geelong, Canning Vale, Adelaide, and Bankstown. 
It provides courses on Cookery, Automotive, Community Services, Nursing, Leadership and Management, Business, Health and Allied Services, Accounting and Early Childhood Education. Some popular Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA)  qualifications at Education Training & Employment Australia - Victoria (Geelong) are AUR30320 Certificate III in Automotive Electrical Technology, HLT37215 Certificate III in Pathology Collection, CHC40313 Certificate IV in Child, Youth and Family Intervention, BSB42015 Certificate IV in Leadership and Management, HLT64115 Advanced Diploma of Nursing (Mental Health), BSB30115 Certificate III in Business, and others.
The fee structure at Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - Victoria (Geelong) depends on a course and whether a student is an international or domestic candidate. For instance, for the HLT64115 Advanced Diploma of Nursing (Mental Health), the total cost payable is between $9,000 to $9,700 for international candidates. Additionally, for domestic students pursuing this qualification, the fee for service is $8,000, and the resource fee is $400. 
Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) has kept an English benchmark for every course meant for international candidates. This requirement for studying at ETEA is to have a minimum of the equivalent of IELTS 5.5. ETEA acknowledges the fact that some candidates might have undertaken other forms of English study that will demonstrate their suitability for studying at this institute. There are some options to demonstrate equivalence to this institute’s English requirements. For instance, the IELTS requirement for Certificate I is 4.0, whereas, for Certificate IV, it is 5.5.

Name: University of the Sunshine Coast
Overview: University of Sunshine Coast (USC) in Queensland, Australia, is a public institute. The main campus is situated in Sippy Downs on the Sunshine Coast, Queensland, with a network of 12 other campus locations across the coastal South East Queensland, which gives students the flexibility to choose their study location.Candidates require a minimum IELTS score of 6.0 and 6.5 in undergraduate and graduate courses, respectively.The degree course MBA costs about $26,417 AUD, and the MIM degree costs on an average, $23,580 AUD; BE/B.TECH costs an average of $19,680 AUD - $25,531 AUD, and BBA degrees would cost about $20,566 AUD. The school has 70 partner institutions that provide placements or internships overseas. They also provide a tertiary preparation pathway (TPP) for the students to experience university life before starting on a full degree.
Eligibility Overview: To be eligible for admission to your desired courses, you must meet the below-mentioned academic requirements: Be at least 17 years old, or have finished Year 12 or an equivalent programmeMeet the degree's English language requirements (if English is not your first language)Have fulfilled any degree-related subject prerequisitesBe eligible for an ATAR or selection rank equal to or higher than the degree's minimal selection requirementSome programs have additional entry requirements English language requirements: Candidates must submit proof of the following academic and English language proficiency requirements:
Eli Table:

Placement: Every year, the university places around 2000 nursing, midwifery, and allied health students. This is done in collaboration with Sunshine Coast Health Institute (SCHI) partners and other educational institutions (EPs). The student will need to speak with the education provider in order to apply for a placement. Direct requests from students are not accepted by the university. Before your first day of placement, the student must complete the Student Minimum Pre-Placement Requirements form and bring it with them.
Accommodation: There are many other options for accommodation close to the USC campus, like the student village, shared houses or places of your own. The university also offers scholarships and bursaries to the students. The campus has other amenities like an art gallery, fitness center, swimming pool, 2000-capacity indoor stadium, multi-faith prayer hall, and indoor and outdoor courts. The students' enrolment strength is at 17,842.Off-Campus Accommodation Whether you want to live in a student village, share a house, or find your place, there is a range of possibilities close to USC's campuses. The university does not offer or review information about student housing or operate as an agent in the distribution of that data. It is up to you to decide whether the housing options are appropriate. For more information, visit: https://www.usc.edu.au/current-students/student-support/accommodation-and-housing

Name: Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) - South Australia (Adelaide)
Overview:
Education Training & Employment Australia (ETEA) is a private institution having campuses in Sydney, Adelaide, Melbourne, and Perth. It is an Australian Registered Training Organisation (RTO) that offers Nationally Accredited courses. 
This institute features over 25 qualifications on its scope specialising in several areas. For more than two decades, this college has been extending programs ranging from certificate III to diploma level. Some of the areas from which students can choose their desired course to pursue at Education Training & Employment Australia South Australia (Adelaide) are Cookery, Automotive, Nursing, Leadership and Management, Community, Business, Childhood Education, Accounting, etc. The various qualifications students can acquire from Education Training & Employment Australia are SIT20416 Certificate II in Kitchen Operations, AUR30316 Certificate III in Automotive Electrical Technology, HLT54115 Diploma of Nursing, BSB60215 Advanced Diploma of Business, and others. The institute accepts applications from  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students, individuals from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and those having diverse work, academic, and life experiences.
The Education Training & Employment Australia tuition cost on an annual basis is somewhat in the range of $3500 to $4500. The Adelaide campus of Education Training & Employment Australia boasts six classrooms, a student lounge, individual study nooks, fully equipped clinical labs, etc. Students also get access to Wi-Fi facilities, an IT station, kitchen facilities, etc.
There is an English benchmark at ETEA for each course for international candidates. These students must possess a minimum of the equivalent of IELTS 5.5. In order to get in, international students must meet all the admission requirements, where having an IELTS score of 5.5 is a must. Besides this, students completing an IRON course with ETEA is considered equivalent to IELTS 5.5 at this institute. Some other language tests accepted by Education Training & Employment Australia South Australia (Adelaide) include PTE, OET, CAE and TOEFL.

Name: University of Canberra
Overview: Established in 1967, the University of Canberra is a public institute in Canberra, Australia, with six faculties: Health, Science and Technology, Arts and Design, Business, Government and Law, and Education. It offers over 200 undergraduate, postgraduate and research programs in disciplines like Design Strategies, Politics and International Relations, Sport Management and Journalism. Besides Canberra, the University of Canberra has campuses in Melbourne, Sydney and Queensland. The library, located in Building 8, houses numerous collections, books, journals, articles, archives and e-publications that students can access. There are different research centers and institutes on campus like the Institute for Applied Ecology, Centre for Sustainable Communities and The News and Media Research Centre. Australian and international students can enroll in UC College and pursue English language and other courses to prepare for a degree program. Data Analytics Fundamentals, Digital Marketing Strategy and Salesforce Administrator are some of the short UC Pro courses which allow students to get job-ready. Through the University of Canberra's virtual campus, students get to attend online classes, interact with professors and peers, access academic resources and more. Furthermore, the university's study abroad program allows students to spend a semester or two at one of its 50 partner institutions worldwide, participate in exchanges, study tours, international internships and short programs. Financial aid options available to the students include scholarships, bursaries, loans and grants like HECS-HELP loans, Canberra Indigenous Scholarship, Lorna May Award, Real Futures Grant etc. With over 2,500 beds, the University of Canberra provides student accommodation in studios, apartments, and unsuited /shared rooms at residences like Cooper Lodge, UC Lodge, Campus West and others. Students can find accommodation by renting a house or an apartment, living with flat mates or through the Australian Homestay Network. There are over 70 clubs engaged in academic, political, sports, cultural and other activities. Fitness facilities on campus include the Sport and Fitness Centre, courts and ovals. Graduates earn an average annual salary of AUD 59,000 to AUD 82,330.
Eligibility Overview: Course and country-specific eligibility conditions apply. The following are the prerequisites for Indian aspirins:Undergraduate AdmissionsGrade 12 completion from any of the following recognised educational boards is necessary, as are the following minimal qualifications:The Indian School Certificate Examination Council (CISCE)Average of at least 65 percent in English and the highest three elective coursesHigher Secondary Certificate in India (state board)Average grades in all academic subjects (0.7 or higher)Secondary Education Central Board (CBSE)A total percentage of at least 65 percent from the four finest externally assessed participantsSenior School Certificate in India (AISSCE)In the best four externally examined subjects, where A1=5 | A2=4.5 | B1=3.5 | B2=3 | C1=2 | C2=1.5 | D1 = 1 | D2 = 0.5Admissions to PGEven if you have not completed your undergraduate degree, you may be qualified for certain postgraduate courses. If you have the following non-tertiary qualifications plus paid work experience or professional memberships, the institution will accept your qualifications as equal to a bachelor's degree for postgraduate admission. Among them are:Having a professional membership or an advanced diploma or associate degree, as well as 4 years of full-time paid managerial or professional work experience.Obtaining a diploma along with eight years of full-time paid administrative or professional experience.A professional membership plus ten years of full-time paid administrative or professional work experience or membership.
Placement: Your Year 1 Semester 1 programme may include placements in the faculties of health and education.If this is the case, you must adhere to the placement guidelines outlined below. Make sure you can meet all of the placement requirements before applying for a course.For More:https://www.canberra.edu.au/future-student-information/placement-requirements
Accommodation: On-Campus AccommodationOn-campus housing is available.All overseas students at the University of Canberra are guaranteed on-campus housing.From twelve-bed dormitories to one-bedroom flats, UC provides a variety of self-catered choices.With a variety of room styles, UC offers four halls: UC Lodge, Cooper Lodge, Weeden Lodge, and the University of Canberra Village.Beds, a dining table with chairs, a television, a study desk, a bookshelf, and a chair are all included in the room.On-campus housing can be found here.https://www.canberra.edu.au/future-students/life-at-uc/accommodationOff-Campus AccommodationOff-campus housing is available.The typical monthly rent is between 750 and 850 Australian dollars.Studio flats, 3 bedroom apartments, 4 bedroom apartments, and shared apartments are also available.A public study room with a library, a gym, a pool table, vending machines, coin laundry, a secure undercover vehicle park, and covered bicycle storage are all available in student housing.The flats have a community washing room in the basement.Off-campus housing linkhttps://flatmates.com.au/student-accommodation/canberrahttps://www.student.com/au/canberra
Course Ranking: Students at University of Canberra have access to a wide range of courses, including those in management, arts & humanities, engineering, social sciences, education, and more. College of Canberra THE has placed courses like PG Business & Economics in the 2021 ranking range of 201-350. The University of Canberra has not ranked or generally acknowledged the courses.
University Ranking: One of the top 50 universities in Australia and one of the top 500 worldwide is University of Canberra. Additionally, University of Canberra has been ranked higher than 500 universities worldwide by US News & World Report. The University of Canberra is ranked #184 for the year 2021 in THE rankings. The rank was #193 in 2020; as a result, the rankings have fallen for 2021, and the ranking graph has moved upward, signifying a change for the better. The University of Canberra is ranked #456 among all universities worldwide by QS for the year 2021. Additionally, the ranks have fallen from #484 in 2020 to #456 in 2021, indicating yet another increasing trend in the ranking graph. The University of Canberra got 85.1 for the percentage of international students, 49.2 for the number of citations per faculty member, and 20.6 for academic reputation, which is below average according to QS's primary ranking criteria. The University of Canberra is ranked 604th for the year 2021 by US News & World Report, the lowest among all major organisations. Rankings are mostly based on University of Canberra admissions, then on the courses it offers and the demand for the available majors.

Course Description: University of Canberra is one of the world's most well-known institutions for higher education. University of Canberra was founded in 1967. Located in Canberra,Australia the university is home to about 3770 international students, promoting inclusivity and diversity. The university is globally recognised for its high-quality education and research output.University of Canberra is ranked 511th in Top Universities by QS Rankings. The university offers bachelor's, master's and doctoral degrees in various disciplines. Courses range from Business, Humanities, Engineering, and others. The university offers around 3 undergraduate and 1 postgraduate programs. University of Canberra has 3 intakes in Feb,Aug, Jul. The duration of bachelor’s degree courses is usually 3 years and master’s degree courses is 2 years.The average yearly tuition fee of University of Canberra is around $20,544 AUD.For financial assistance, students can avail of many scholarships and grants. Some of the prominent scholarships provided by University of Canberra include Architecture, Design and Planning Dean's International Merit Scholarship,Cox Architecture Scholarship,A G Whitlam International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship,Ontario Graduate Scholarships Ogs Western University .The sprawling university campus includes outstanding buildings, state-of-the-art research libraries, laboratory spaces, centres, clubs, hostels and other facilities for students and staff.Another important factor attracting international students to University of Canberra is the post-study work opportunities in Australia. The students are mentored to excel in their careers and positively impact society.University of Canberra has admissions requirements like IELTS, TOEFL scores for English proficiency and standardised test scores of exams like the GRE, SAT, GMAT and others. For admission, students must submit letters of recommendation, work experience letters, statements of purpose, school or college transcripts, and valid passports and visas.

Name: James Cook University - Australia
Overview: James Cook University (JCU), the second oldest university in Queensland, Australia, has campuses in Cairns, Townsville, in the City-State of Singapore and Brisbane, and study centres in Mount Isa, Mackay, Thursday Island and Rockhampton. The public university was established in 1970 and is one of the top 30 young universities globally. 49 undergraduate and 68 postgraduate programs are offered under six colleges and 32 fields of study. Art, Business Management, Engineering, Law, Biomedical Sciences, and Dental Surgery are highly ranked courses. The university is also known for Astronomy, Medical and Wildlife Sciences. JCU's Marine biology ranks 1st globally and has even contributed to developing a viable vaccine for malaria. International students' admission process occurs twice yearly through the university's portal or via an agent. Around 72.9% of graduates find full-time employment with an average salary of 47,680 AUD, with Business Management and Engineering having the highest salary packages.On-campus accommodation is available on the Townsville campus with five residential halls and the Cairns campus with one self-catered residential hall, John Grey Hall, and one off-campus, fully-catered student lodge. Well-furnished single, double, and triple occupancy rooms are provided, starting from 120 AUD per week. The average undergraduate tuition fee is 26,160 AUD, whereas that for postgraduate programs is 34,667 AUD. All students are eligible for scholarships at the time of admission based on their academic achievements. JCU International Excellence Scholarship, JCU International Merit Stipend, JCU College Pathway and Australia Award Scholarship are some of them.
Eligibility Overview: A well completed application formAll certified academic transcripts and certificates attesting to previous academic achievements, if in a language other than English.Scores on English language tests, such as the IELTS, are a good example.It's a good idea to have an updated CV with the most recent educational qualifications.When applying to James Cook University, international students from countries where English is not the primary language must provide confirmation of English ability. The following are the tests that the university accepts:

Placement: JCU's Career and Employability Center assists students with career preparation and offers a variety of work possibilities, including MBA positions in Australia.Through CareerHub, students can look for full-time and part-time jobs, as well as internships. It also has listings for future professional events, workshops, and employers.Volunteering programmes allow students to gain work experience and improve their employability skills. Volunteering can help a student boost his or her chances of being employed during on-campus interviews. They can volunteer on-campus or off-campus, including internationally.During the second year of their studies, students should also apply for an internship programme. Internships are listed on several internship job portals throughout the year. They should also have an Australian Work Visa in that scenario.Top-Paying Jobs for James Cook University Graduates include:

Accommodation: Domestic and international students wishing to study in Australia can stay on campus at JCU University in Townsville and Cairns. International students will find a safe and secure atmosphere on the campuses, as well as a variety of living options.George Roberts Hall, Rotary International House, University Hall, Saint Catholic College, and The John Flynn College all offer housing at JCU Townsville.John Grey Hall and Cairns Student Lodge are the residence halls at JCU Cairns (just across the street from Smithfield Campus).Single-board rooms at JCU on-campus dormitories include a study desk and chair, a bed, Wi-Fi, air conditioning, a fan, a wardrobe, and a Secure Swipe Lock System.Common facilities at residence halls include common rooms, computer labs and printers, TV rooms, Study areas, Kitchenettes, Laundry, outdoor seating, and other amenities.Security, three meals each day, daily cleaning, and maintenance are all available in the on-campus homes.Off-campus student housing is also available in Australia. The University assists students in locating residential choices such as homestays, community living, shared accommodation, or a private residence near JCU.

Name: The University of Adelaide
Overview: The The University of Adelaide is a university located in Adelaide, Australia. Students are offered undergraduate, postgraduate and certificate programs in various streams and online degree programmes for distance education students. It provides education in multiple fields of study, such as Business. The main campus of The University of Adelaide is located in Adelaide. The university offers over 20 undergraduate programs and 15 postgraduate programs. The average cost of attendance for international and domestic students may differ for different courses. Estimated average tuition and fees excluding miscellaneous expenditure for an international student is around INR 29,68,804. The University of Adelaide offers scholarships, work-study, and various funding to the students. In addition, the university has a Career Planning Service team that helps the students build a CV and find a job, whether after completion of a degree, part-time job, summer job, or internship. Read more details about The University of Adelaide on Leap Scholar, and find the right course for your aspirations.
Eligibility Overview: The following approved English language tests are preferred by the University:Academic Test IELTS (International English Language Testing System)Pearson Test of English - Academic CAE - internet-based and paper-based TOEFL - TOEFL - TOEFL - TOEFL - TOEFL - TOEFL - TO (Cambridge English: Advanced).In some situations, however, the University may accept other forms of proof of English proficiency.The majority of language exams and qualifications that meet the University's minimal English requirements have a two-year validity period prior to the start date.Before being admitted to the University of Adelaide, students who do not have the required level of English must successfully finish an intensive English language programme. Academic English (PEP Pathway) is an appropriate English language programme offered by the University's English Language Centre in Adelaide. For prospective students who have obtained offers to the University of Adelaide conditional on English competence, the PEP Method provides an alternate entry pathway. Students are awarded direct admittance into the University after successfully completing the PEP Pathway at the appropriate level. For further information, see the PEP route entry requirements.
Accommodation: The University of Adelaide offers a dedicated Accommodation Service to students and their families, as well as our network of trusted school counsellors and foreign education agents.for more information click on this link-https://www.adelaide.edu.au/accommodation/
